job_description:
Overview
Description:
The Business Analyst is a key member of the Global ERP Program, and will help ensure that the SME’s configure and implement the Global single ERP solution (‘Nexus’) across the Waterlogic group and, in parallel, will lead the documentation of all configuration & set-up and document all necessary Business process flows.
The role will also support the Global Nexus Team in the testing and implementation of the overall global solution, this will involve document and achieving Business sign-off of all functional / operational business processes, support the creating of the Test Scripts / Test Cases, along with acceptance criteria to support UAT execution and sign-off.
Additionally, the Business Analyst will support the Functional / Operational SME’s in co-creating or updating the Global training material / collateral and supporting End User Training, as well as assisting the Functional SME’s during UAT, Go-Live and Post Go-live support.
This role will involve ownership, establishing rigor and governance on all templates, To-Be’ business processes and training materials, while supporting the global roll out of Nexus (within your agreed workstream(s) and responsibilities. Firstly, with the US & UK implementation expected to complete in 2019, following which the implementation will continue across other territories, with an emphasis on implementing Nexus into their larger markets (Australia & Germany) first, followed by other countries across the globe. National and Global travel will be required. (up to 50%)
Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Create & manage all US Process (Visio Flows) and To-Be’ Business / Functional Processes.Document the US system configuration and Set-upInstall a Global ERP solution and a single standard way of workingEffective RAID Management (Risk & Issue tracking process - identification and resolution)Effective Management of Business / Functional SME’s assigned to your workstream(s)Manage all System Administration documentation and templates
Qualifications
Experience:
5+ years of successful business analyst experienceERP Implementation and/or Service industry experience preferred

Quench USA, Inc. is a provider of filtered water systems, including bottleless water coolers, ice machines, sparkling water dispensers, and coffee brewers to approximately 40,000 institutional and commercial customers, including more than half of the Fortune 500. Headquartered in King of Prussia, PA, Quench has sales and service operations across the U.S. Quench is a subsidiary of AquaVenture Holdings (NYSE:WAAS), a multi-national provider of Water-as-a-Service™ solutions that provide reliable, cost-effective, and sustainable clean drinking and process water.
We are seeking a Business Analyst. The role requires strong analytical and communication skills. A successful candidate understands basic business KPIs, is able to learn service metrics, and has awareness of relational databases and SQL. A strong working knowledge of Excel (including Power Pivot, VBA, and Macros) is a must. This allows a successful Business Analyst to publish deliverables on time, and within design guidelines.
Essential Functions
Quickly and effectively create useful data deliverables as directed on a daily basis
Retain data in an organized fashion
Document parameters, data tool purposes, potential opportunities for improvement and next steps as needed
Compile large amounts of data in preparation for analysis.
Provide reliable, clear and concise reporting as needed.
Troubleshoot reporting inquiries
Establish and monitor standards for all reports, included update by request from audience and routine audit
Establish and evaluate goals for all field service operations employees
Manage and direct activities in order to meet goals and deadlines
Communicate clearly and effectively at all levels
Maintain daily focus on organization
Take thorough and detailed notes during meetings (planned or impromptu)
Maintain regular and reliable attendance
Qualifications
Education / Experience:
1-3 Years of data manipulation in a professional environment
Strong business acumen
Routine reporting experience
BA in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Intelligence, or Business Logistics
Working knowledge of data related applications (Excel a must)
General:
Strong organizational skills,
Strong analytical skills – can translate complex problems into work-able solutions
Working knowledge of relational databases (SQL basics a plus)
Visual design skills
Ability to both work independently and to work as part of a team
Commitment to meet deadlines
Ability to organize, analyze, and present data
Able to quickly grasp business terms and capture in a form that gains user acceptance and be translated into testable technical solution
Salesforce reporting a plus


At Quench, there are plenty of opportunities for people who:
Communicate; collaborate; share ideas, successes and failures equally
Are dependable, committed, energetic and up-beat
Look to solve problems, go the extra mile, are team players
We call this “Quenchiness” - it’s rewarded openly and tangibly. We work hard while having fun every chance we get.
Quench offers competitive salary and benefits, performance bonuses, and incentive awards. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

The Meditech Business Analyst will be part of a team responsible for all aspects of IS project governance, assessment, management and control. The Meditech Business Analyst will contribute to varying tasks, performing duties associated with eliciting and developing high-level business requirements for IS Systems. The Analyst will work with stakeholders and system users to document requirements, and develop related documentation (including System Implementation Packages (SIPs), Meditech and Network applications). The Analyst will also be responsible for administration/logistics associated with system requirements/implementation, meetings, including developing agendas and presentations. In many cases, the Analyst will assist the customer with retroactively developing system documentation for existing systems to satisfy audit/compliance requirements.
Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates MediTech and Network business systems and user needs.
Conducts needs analysis, documents requirements, and revises existing system logic as necessary.
Develops and Facilitates system testing.
Creates and updates system documentation including desktop manuals
Researches and documents requirements, evaluates scenarios, and executes changes needed to respond to requirements.
Identifies test scenarios, develops test scripts, and creates expected results for use in test cycles.
Summarizes and communicates testing outcomes in meaningful ways.
Acts as liaison among clients, operations, and technical staff.
Collaborates with clients and other technical teams as assigned.
Analyze and evaluate existing or proposed business systems and processes to identify and implement improvements and opportunities to meet business unit objectives in large to enterprise wide processes.
Create user stories/use cases, process & data flows and scenarios in order to clearly communicate a set of functional requirements.
Provide input and support the development of business and functional specifications. Document to ensure business requirements are adequately reflected in development documents.
Conduct workshops with multiple stakeholders from communication, technology, business and vendor teams. Concisely document their outcome. Gather data and business system requirements via phone, E-mail, Web and onsite requirements gathering sessions.
Resolve business problems for internal and external customers by utilizing problem solving and analytical skills and documenting the "why" and "what" of the business problem.
Understand industry trends and educate the users in those changes and suggests applicability to solve business problems. Draw on experience from various industries.

Job Requirements
Minimum Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, MIS, or BCIS preferred.
High School graduate or equivalent required with 3+ years of experience in IS Business Analyst or equivalent and project management, preferably healthcare.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Minimum Experience/Skills:
Able to perform basic mathematical calculations
Agile experience, exceptional communication skills (written and oral), and a broad range of IT knowledge/experience is required. Flexibility is a must, as well as the ability to work in a collaborative team environment.

Physical Demands:
Lifts, positions, pushes up to 20 pounds
Considerable sitting, reaching, stooping, bending, kneeling, crouching
Touch, auditory and visual perception and acuity
Adequate vocal pitch and volume of voice
Manual dexterity and mobility
Ability to move quickly

Vision Requirements:
Ability to adjust vision sufficiently to perform duties

Working Conditions:
Subject to varying and unpredictable situations
Subject to irregular hours
Ability to Multi Task is essential

The Business Analyst position with our Project Management & Business Process department is responsible for analyzing and modeling all our current and future business processes. This includes assisting in the development of consistent business continuity documentation, creating current and future state business process models, and completing business requirement management activities. The Business Analyst works closely with all project stakeholders and team members in the development of functional requirements for projects. The incumbent is also responsible for working with each functional area to conduct process mapping workshops and propose recommendations for increasing efficiency through process changes and automation.
Responsibilities
The primary functions of the Business Analyst are:
Provide templates, support and guidance to all groups during the development of business continuity documentation
Identify, analyze, and document all current state business processes
Analyze current business processes and needs and propose effective solutions to address those needs and improve efficiencies
Facilitate the development of business requirements and process models through interviews, document analysis, workshops and other tools during project planning activities
Ensure alignment and define success measures for projects in relation to the current corporate goals and strategies
Assist in the development of project plans and milestones
Manage business requirements and change requests during project execution
Work with data analysts to report on project outcomes and results
Develop and maintain a working knowledge of all company operations
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or a related field is required
5+ years of experience analyzing and documenting business processes and requirements
Travel
N/A
Skill Sets
Content Knowledge and Skills:
Level 3 CBAP Certification Required
Scrum Product Owner Certification Preferred
Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Visio and Outlook
Exceptional communication skills (written and oral) are required

At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.

NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Business Analyst to join our team in Groton, Connecticut (US-CT), United States (US).

NTT DATA is seeking an experienced and passionate Senior Business Analyst to help grow our Business Analysis Practice in North America. In this role, the Senior Business Analyst is responsible for working with stakeholders and subject matter experts to elicit, analyze, document, communicate, and manage requirements and business analysis artifacts throughout the solution development lifecycle.

The preferred candidate will have a solid work history of delivering superior business analysis and consulting services in life science and/or other industries. The candidate should be capable of seeing ideas from concept through to implementation and applying a formal business analysis methodology based on industry best practices to accomplish the task. The position requires an individual with exceptional communications skills (verbal and written), superior facilitation and presentation skills, and strong analytical capabilities. An understanding of the IIBA’s Guide to the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge and CCBA or CBAP certification is preferred.

In this role the Senior Business Analyst will be required to:

Uncover the goals, needs, and opportunities for improvement
Discover, document and analyze business processes at varying levels of detail
Elicit requirements from a diverse set of business and technical stakeholders
Analyze and document requirements using graphic and text based techniques (activity diagrams, use cases, user stories, etc…) to create requirements deliverables
Manage, communicate, and represent requirements throughout the life of a project
Evaluate a solutions ability to meet the needs of the business and deliver value.
Analyze the impact of technical and non-technical changes across an enterprise
Collaborate with a business analysts working across various projects to ensure requirements quality and avoid missed requirements
Mentor and manage junior business analysts

This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Please note, 1099 or corp-2-corp contractors or the equivalent will NOT be considered. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package that starts from your first day of employment.

About NTT DATA Services

NTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.

Conduct day-to-day operations using existing procedures. Examine, assess, and document business operations and procedures of the business unit. Key Job Functions

Assess business operations and processes of assigned office or business unit to identify inefficiencies in procedures, information flows and handoffs, decisions, communications pathways and ways in which systems supporting these can be enhanced.
Participate in meetings and projects with client staff, project managers, and developers to automate, upgrade, or expand applications that accomplish business operations.
Create, design, and format process flows, and other information needed to describe required system changes for development, QA, and other units; serve on project team accomplishing these functions.
Provide support to production operations by executing transactions using documented procedures. Track production problems and troubleshoot them to sustain the application.
Develop queries, analyses, or reports from applications for operations or management staff of assigned business unit(s), or develop specifications for such queries or analyses to be performed by others.
Serve as team, project, or business lead for new or modified business processes.

QUALIFICATIONS

Education
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent required

Minimum Experience

Minimum 6 years of related experience


Specialized Knowledge & Skills

Detail oriented with the ability to create, document and/or follow process flows, business requirements, procedures, test plans, use cases and other documents.
Good communications skills both verbal and written
Good project and time management skills
Mortgage Industry experience is preferred
Experience processing FRBNY wire transfers and/or experience processing structured finance payments is preferred
Excellent analytical skills and proven ability to analyze data
Technical and reporting skills and experience with data query tools is a plus
Must be able to work independently and with cross functional teams to deliver results
Must be highly self-driven, self-organized

Employment

$60 an hourContractA California based company is looking for a Business Analyst with following skills:Duration: 6+months with a possibility of an extensionEXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIRED · Demonstrated ability to quickly familiarize with new business processes;· Three (3) years of operational assessment and gap analysis experience;· Minimum of five (5) years of business process analysis experience in a relevant technical field;· Working knowledge of industry accepted business analysis methodologies, standards, procedures and practices;· Effective communication skills in both verbal and written form to all levels of management; and· Possess the ability to communicate effectively, succinctly and accurately in English.EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DESIRED · Experience with Microsoft Team Foundation Server (TFS).· Past experience on projects working with elections systems including voter registration, voting or election night reporting.PROJECT OVERVIEWIn March of 2018, the U.S. Election Assistance Commission (EAC) awarded grant funds to the Nevada Secretary of State (SOS). The purpose of the grant award is to "improve the administration of elections for Federal office, including to enhance technology and make election security improvements" as the Chief State Election Office deems appropriate.The SOS has identified an initial list of known enhancements and improvements needed to systems owned by the SOS that are appropriate for this grant. However, the scope encompasses partner agencies and vendors including the seventeen county elections officials and their vendors for voter registration and voting systems. Within the first year, the SOS plans to engage in activities that will identify many more ideas for enhancements and improvements to systems for voter registration, vote casting and tallying, and election night reporting.The intent of the SOS is to bring on a project team of MSA consultants that can focus their attention on first understanding and documenting the business processes within the scope of the grant. Next the project team will work with stakeholders and the Grant Steering Committee to develop and prioritize a list of enhancements that qualify within the terms of the grant. The MSA team will own this list of enhancements and will elicit and document requirements detailing what is needed to achieve each enhancement. The MSA team will then manage the process to address each enhancement. Some enhancements may be achieved with the simple submission of tickets while others may require a project to properly address. In either case, the MSA team will manage and track the enhancement until complete including testing, communications, validating work and training appropriate stakeholders as necessary.SCOPE OF WORK· Consultants must perform all activities to the agreed upon project plan/schedule. Work must be completed according to the specifications and standards set by the State.· Develop and maintain operational familiarity with election systems and processes within the scope of the grant;· Engage in activities designed to develop ideas for a list of Ideas for Security and Technology Enhancements:· Interview subject matter experts within the SOS, partner agencies, other stakeholders and the Advisory Committee;· Attend training opportunities, conferences, Tabletop Exercises (TTXs);· Review audits and consultation reports;· Review industry best-practices; and· Network with colleagues from other states and jurisdictions.· Conduct meetings with stakeholders and subject matter experts documenting all outcomes in terms of action items, decisions made, and new ideas identified;Job Type: ContractSalary: $60.00 /hourExperience:Business Analyst: 5 years (Preferred)Work authorization:United States (Required)

Job Description
Come help Amazon grow! The North American Talent Acquisition Analytics team builds reporting and analytics tools for our teams to understand the health of their recruiting operations and measure the output of their talent attraction efforts. In addition to standard reporting, we leverage big data to help our leaders focus their efforts in ways that will engage their associates.

In this role, you will help develop the analytics function to support demand planning, workforce optimization, and measuring KPIs. This role requires an individual with a passion for efficiency, a drive to apply advanced analytics (reporting, optimization, simulation, forecasting) to talent acquisition operations, and the ability to thoroughly understand the needs of the customer. The successful candidate is one who thrives on understanding recruiting processes, its data sources, and answering challenging business questions to improve the effectiveness of recruiting operations.

We are now recruiting for an exceptional Business Analyst. The ideal candidate will be:
A Well-Rounded Athlete –Like a true athlete, you understand that we succeed or fail as a team. You are always ready to step up beyond your core responsibilities and go the extra mile for the project and your team. You nimbly overcome barriers to deliver the best products more quickly than expected.
A Skilled Communicator – You excel when interacting with business and technical partners whether you are chatting, sending a written message, or conducting a presentation.

A Trusted Advisor – You work closely with stakeholders to define key business needs and deliver on commitments. You enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.

An Inventor at Heart – You innovate on behalf of your customer by proactively implementing improvements, enhancements, and customizations. Your customers marvel at your creative solutions to challenges they had not yet identified.

Fearless – You are drawn to take on the hardest problems, navigate ambiguity, and battle skepticism. You never settle in the face of overwhelming obstacles.

Department Marketing Statement:
Do enjoy working in a highly collaborative, problem-solving environment? Are you a PeopleSoft professional who can leverage technology to build productive processes? We are a spirited and positive team in search for a PeopleSoft HCM Business Analyst who can support us in challenging the status quo and provide operational excellence as we prepare for our 9.2 Upgrade
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Education
Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science/Engineering or Information Systems Management.
Or In lieu of Bachelor’s Degree, an additional four (4) years of experience in systems analysis and programming in a web application environment or similar work on applications in a PeopleSoft environment. In this case, must have a total of ten (10) years of experience.
Experience
Six (6) years of experience in systems analysis and programming in a web application environment or similar work on applications in a PeopleSoft environment. Must include four (4) years of functional experience in an integrated Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system is required.
Certification/Licensure
None
Medical Group:
Satisfactorily complete the medical examination for this position, if required. The incumbent must be able to perform the essential functions of this position either with or without reasonable accommodations.
SUMMARY
This position is responsible for the oversight and support of the PeopleSoft Human Capital Management System to include but not limited to: core HR, Talent Acquisition Management (TAM), Candidate Gateway, Base Benefits, Employee & Manager Self Service, and eProfile and ensure that supporting processes and interfaces are meeting the business expectations.
This is a functional and professional position that provides planning, development, implementation, documentation and support for the organization's PeopleSoft Human Capital Management systems applications. The incumbent is responsible for defining functional business processes and translating them into system requirements. Communicating these requirements to customer management and Information Technology (IT) management.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Troubleshoots problems and provides production support for all applicable PeopleSoft modules. Identifies issues and recommends possible solutions for system improvements through the unit testing process.
Ensures the availability and provision of standard reports. Assists users in the development and implementation of all ad-hoc special reporting requirements. Develops user impact analysis of all system changes, improvements or upgrades.
Acts as subject matter expert and works directly with Payroll, Human Resources and internal IT development to support the WMATA custom reports.
Works with Payroll and HR on employee data issues and monitors incorrect data on the job record. Assists Payroll to run reconciliation queries and reports to support each pay cycle.
Coordinates meetings with customers, technical team, quality assurance and training groups to ensure understanding of the specifications.
Works closely with end users to identify system-related training needs and assists in the development and implementation of training solutions.
OTHER FUNCTIONS
Supports the HR Reporting and Analytics team with ad hoc or urgent reporting requests and the HR Shared Services team with HCM production support and process improvement.
Provides functional and data training to peers and customers.
Provides expertise and research opportunities to leverage new technology solutions and industry practices.
The essential duties listed are not intended to limit specific duties and responsibilities of any particular position. Nor is it intended to limit in any way the right of managers and supervisors to assign, direct and control the work of employees under their supervision.
Evaluation Criteria:
Consideration will be given to applicants whose resumes demonstrate the required education and experience. Applicants should include all relevant education and work experience.
Evaluation criteria may include one or more of the following:
Personal Interview
Skills Assessments
Verification of education and experience
Criminal Background Check
Credit history report for positions with fiduciary responsibilities
Successful completion of a medical examination including a drug and alcohol screening
Review of a current Motor Vehicle Report

Given the growth that Efficio is going through, we are looking for Business Analysts (BAs) to provide support to project teams working on consulting assignments.

Business Analysts roles are targeted at graduate entry level candidates and are the first step into management consulting.

Although based out of our New York office, our BAs will be on client site up to 4 days a week and therefore need to be flexible to travel.


Working under the guidance of an experienced consultant, their key role is to collect, analyse and synthesise data from a variety of sources. The insights and understandings from their analysis provide important inputs to the project team's recommendations and solutions.


BAs also provide input to client presentations, and work with other team members on day-to-day delivery of projects - for example, they may assist with developing and issuing RFPs and evaluating proposals from suppliers. They interact with clients and their suppliers as needed.


BAs are typically involved in client facing projects at client sites from day one, so they need to be able to learn fast and get up to speed quickly and work effectively under pressure. They must be able to work independently, while also being team players who are willing to contribute wherever needed to ensure the success of the project. The ability to prioritise their work effectively in the face of sometimes competing demands is also essential.


BAs are expected to challenge existing ways of doing things and suggest new ideas. However, they are also expected to be able to justify their conclusions and recommendations with relevant experience and rigorous, fact-based analysis.


Efficio has a collaborative, supportive culture where performance is recognised and success is celebrated. BAs are supported to continually develop their skills and expertise through a comprehensive training and development programme including formal training (through the Efficio Academy), on-the-job training, and coaching and mentoring from experienced consultants and Efficio executives. The opportunities and support that come from a role as an Efficio BA make it an unmatched springboard into a top-tier consulting career.

Essential RequirementsAn exemplary academic background; preferably with a top degree in Engineering, Science, Business, or Economics


Must have the right to work in the USA

Desirable RequirementsStrong analytical skills and problem solving ability


Ability to isolate key issues and draw sound conclusions


Proficiency in the use of Excel and PowerPoint


Proactive, inquiring approach


Strong communicator with the ability to influence stakeholders

You'll work with leaders across many teams teams: Merchandising, Planning, Product, Marketing, Operations, Finance, Customer Experience, etc. to identify business processes that can be optimized. You'll scope, "sell," and complete analyses (with help from the rest of the team) in order to drive revenue growth.

You will work on the Data Products and Insights team, along with Data Scientists, Analysts, and Engineers. You'll complement the current team by bringing a consulting/strategy background, complete with expert communication and presentation skills.

What you'll do…


Identify and scope high impact projects that directly affect topline business growth
Think critically about business questions and the data/tools available to answer them
Perform analysis ranging from understanding entire business units and user journeys to deep dives into specific product experiments and feature launches
Understand the decisions being made by other teams, and how to use data to better inform them
Analyze customer transactional data, web browsing behavior, and marketing data

You…


Are equipped with 2+ years of experience in an analytic and strategic role (management consulting and/or corporate strategy experience strongly preferred)
Have 1+ year of experience using SQL (strongly preferred)
Have the ability to use data to optimize performance and inform future strategies
Are business savvy, have a knack for intuiting the value potential of a project, and the means to find data in support (or rebuttal) of your hypothesis
Have strong quantitative and qualitative analysis skills, and are well versed in financial analysis metrics (ROI, margin, etc.)
Can build a slick spreadsheet model without touching your mouse, and whip up comprehensible slides in short order
Are positive and love working collaboratively with people
Communicate effectively (verbal & written) and are able to sell ideas and clearly explain findings

We…


Work hard because we love what we're building, but also believe in balance
Are located in the Flatiron District in the heart of Manhattan
Are a collaborative & close-knit team
Are an environment that values honesty, transparency and empathy
Host random acts of team-wide fun including bar nights, Camp Bonobos, and Ninjapalooza
Are excited to hear from you

Customer Value
The mission of the Customer Value team is to identify and chase new opportunities founded in our customer data to deliver value across our Consumer, Advertising and Professional Information Businesses. We analyze the customer lifecycle, partner with business and technology stakeholders, and identify innovative data questions that nobody else is answering. These questions transcend business unit boundaries and transform the ways we deliver value to our customers. We launch new ways of collecting data and ensure that we optimize it to supercharge revenue across our business.
Responsibilities
Execute the Customer Value strategy to deliver data-driven revenue growth across our Consumer, Advertising and Professional Information Businesses.
Work with editorial, product and marketing teams to identify new opportunities to collect customer data within our content strategy.
Analyze customer data to identify opportunities to maximize value (product upsell / cross sell / new proposition development).
Work with advertising to define new propositions, formats and custom audiences grounded in our customer data.

Undergraduate or Graduate Students with a Major in Business, Marketing, Engineering or related major.
Strong analytical, strategic and creative problem solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for a complex organization.
An understanding of tools and techniques used in marketing/sales.

Organized with meticulous execution abilities to turn around projects at short notice.
Dedication to the customer and a curiosity about consumer behavior and preferences.
A healthy skepticism of the status quo
We're looking for candidates who are working towards a bachelor's degree with at least one year of school completed.

Business Analysts spearhead Labatt’s many continual improvement efforts by identifying problems and opportunities, making detailed assessments through interviews and quantitative analyses, working with internal software developers to codify robust, standardized processes and tools, and finally by working with business people to drive cultural and procedural changes. Business Analysts at Labatt follow our own specialized change management methodology that gains its inspiration from the tenets of Lean and Six Sigma as well as the philosophies of Demming and Drucker. By interfacing extensively with executives, operational managers, employees, engineers, vendors, and customers, Analysts are truly poised to gain dramatic insight into the food industry at large, and more importantly, into Labatt’s highly differentiated poise within the industry.

-Manage software development processes using Lean Startup and Agile methodologies-Aid in crafting and executing strategic initiatives-Solve some of the industry’s and our company’s hardest problems-Communicate excellently, assessing problems both abstractly and concretely-Analyze, and help the organization digest, large sources of data with untapped potential-Set individual and team goals and demonstrate the resourcefulness to achieve them-Hold yourself and your teammates accountable to achieving robust success-Live by a philosophy of genchi genbutsu-Learn continuously, through training, mentoring, and a strong culture of high-level reading
Your direct manager is a corporate-level executive in one functional area of the business. Analysts who succeed at Labatt will settle for nothing less than the best, and have demonstrated this disciplined, accountable focus time and again in previous experiences, whether academically or at the workplace. A competitive undergraduate degree with outstanding marks is required. The Analyst position demands core values that constitute our company culture, including: a strong focus on excellence, hard work, integrity, teamwork, and customer-orientation.

JOB SUMMARY
Under the general direction of a Business Solutions Manager or Team Lead, the Business Analyst acts as a liaison between technology and business lines for the creation and specification of business requirements regarding new business solutions or enhancements to existing business solutions. Facilitates business requirements explanation and analysis as well as documenting outcomes. Models business processes and extracts business rules from those processes. Identifies, specifies and documents functional test cases. Facilitates the definition and approach to vendor selection, assessment methodology and demonstration sessions. Prepares communication as necessary for technology and business lines.
Operates in full compliance with internal policies and procedures as well as applicable regulations and laws, including but not limited to Bank Secrecy Act/Anti-Money Laundering requirements. Responsible to report any procedure or process that doesn’t meet regulatory requirements including fraud, whether suspected or confirmed, to management. This reporting can be done directly to any member of management, including Human Resources or Corporate Security, or can be reported through Associated’s anonymous Ethics Hotline.
KEY RESULT AREAS
Documenting business requirements
Requirements management
Business process identification
Requirements gathering
Facilitation
Use case modeling & analysis
Vendor solution analysis
Process & work flow analysis
Requirements workshops
Estimation
JOB ACCOUNTABILITIES
Facilitate business requirements explanation and analysis and document outcomes.

Develop effective and efficient user interview questionaires and workshop agendas.

Complete business and functional and nonfunctional requirement documents.

Model business processes and extract business rules from those processes.

Proactively participate in User Acceptance Testing projects. Develop User Acceptance Testing scenarios and scripts.

Identify, specify and document functional test cases.

Identify and document use cases and use case diagrams. Create use cases/use stories/scenario design/use case diagrams.

Facilitate the definition and approach to vendor selection and assessment methodology. Facilitate vendor demonstration sessions.

Produce artifacts (work products and deliverables) required by the SDLC process and business requirements management methodology.

QUALIFICATIONS:
Required Education: Associate's Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience

Preferred Education: Bachelor's Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience Financial services industry

Required Experience: 3-5 years of Information Technology, financial or related functional industry experience

Preferred Experience: 5 plus years of Information Technology or financial industry experience with support of finance applications

Preferred Experience: Knowldge of Project Development Life Cycle Methodology

About the Position
The Golden State Warriors are looking for a dynamic and passionate Business Analyst to join our growing Business Analytics and Strategy team. In this role, you will be a partner and support the Warriors Ticketing, Suites, and Youth Basketball departments. You will have chance to create and handle analytics and forecasting efforts related to events, working cross functionally across business teams and integrate and analyze a variety of data types and sources to provide important insights. This position will allow you to explore new ways to ensure the best-in-class fan experience, drive business growth, and use data to identify and implement process improvements.

This is an excellent opportunity to share your expertise and improve your craft, while learning more about this growing and exciting sports and entertainment organization that values your initiative, creativity and work towards results.

This is a full-time position and is based in Oakland, CA.

Key Responsibilities
Analyze all data related to: Ticketing (primary and secondary markets, pricing, inventory), Suites,Youth Basketball
Build reports and presentations to internal business partners
Forecasting future results and working with business partners to develop and recommend dedicated plans of action

Craft and develop business acumen to help achieve financial fan engagement/satisfaction goals

Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics and Finance or similar quantitative discipline; post-graduate degree preferred
3+ years of Analytics experience, preferably related to commerce and/or sales performance in particular
Working experience with SQL, Excel, Tableau and extensive experience analyzing new data sources and technologies
Highly motivated with clear communication skills explaining complex concepts
Have real passion for intellectual curiosity and ability to ask appropriate questions

Position Summary
The Associate Business Analyst provides analytic support for the National Accounts Department with strong attention to detail. Working with the Business Analyst, National Accounts this person will analyze data to discover and interpret trends, patterns, and relationships, work cross-functionally to establish instrumentation and reporting standards and create dashboards and reports to communicate actionable data.

The idea candidate will have the ability to demonstrate discretion and initiative and be a self-starter with excellent written and verbal communication as well as interpersonal skills. The ability to work independently as well as work collaboratively toward a common goal is a must.

Responsibilities
Responsibilities
35% - Generate dashboards and various sales reports utilizing internal and external software.
35% - Support the National Accounts Department with various projects, including but not limited to, analyzing data for opportunities to improve customer product mix, Item Data Management, JDA Space Planning Planogram management, pricing, analysis, and assistance with maintaining new and existing SKUs via customer portals and forms.
15% - Prepare and maintain a variety of spreadsheets and documents such as rebates, correspondence, memos, presentations, forms, contracts, and budgets.
10% - Perform a variety of administrative functions such as event planning, scheduling meetings, submitting invoices and expense reports, coordinating special projects and travel, and providing general administrative office support, including but not limited to, customer literature requests, and maintaining email and mailing distribution lists.
5% - Process customer discrepancies and disputes, including but not limited to, pricing, deductions, and audits, by coordinating with the Branches, Customers, and/or Online Submission Portals.

Qualifications
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited four-year college or university preferred
2 years experience in sales data analysis and reporting
Math: Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as weighted averages, turns, discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry.
Language: Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.
Reasoning: Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.
Computer Skills: Excellent proficiency in Microsoft software environment including Word, Outlook and PowerPoint. Advanced proficiency in MS Excel including queries, tables, pivot tables, vlookups, formulas, linking spreadsheets and basic chart usage.
Communication: Excellent communication skills; written and verbal, proof reading, professional phone demeanor.
Discretion: Ability to work with sensitive information and maintain confidentiality.
Time Management: Work with limited supervision. Report generation without the need for management reminders. Ability to manage multiple priorities.

Travel is not required for this position

This full-time, exempt position is located in Pleasanton, CA
Relocation
Relocation will not be considered for this position.

Description:
At Vatica Health we are on a Mission to improve the quality of healthcare and keep populations healthy at a lower cost. We innovate and deliver scalable, end-to-end technology solutions and value-add clinical services that enable Providers, Payers and Patients to THRIVE in the new world of value-based care. We are a fast growing, early stage, small company solving today’s most complex problems with a talented team of disruptors, inventors and change agents who are not satisfied with the status quo and crave to make a difference. We are a ‘Powered Health’ portfolio company supported by a network of resources, experience and industry connections.

The Problem: The shift to value-based care is challenging. Providers lack the infrastructure, expertise, technology, services, payer-alignment and patient-engagement to effectively improve the cost and quality of care.

Our Solution: Vatica Health pioneered the delivery of the industry’s first Provider-centric, Risk Adjustment and Quality (PRAQTM) solution that measures and improves care quality and performance to accelerate the transition to value-based care. We build and deliver innovative technology and services that measurably improve care quality and outcomes, payer and provider financial performance and overall population health.

Working at Vatica Health – Do You Have What It Takes?

We are seeking smart, hands-on, driven, collaborative team players with a thirst for learning and new experiences. You have an entrepreneurial spirit and a passion for producing amazing work that measurably impacts our industry. You seek an opportunity to work with industry experts to support your continual learning and customize your own career track. Our work environment is virtual – no cubes, walls or doors. We leverage state-of-the-art technology to communicate, collaborate and get work done - fast. We focus on results, not inputs. We are flexible, fun and focused. If this sounds like an environment that you would thrive in – we want to talk to you!

Junior Product Owner Role Description

As a Junior Product Owner at Vatica Health you study and understand what functionality our customers and users require from our software to excel in their job responsibilities. You are the expert in our product, embedded business and clinical processes and supporting data structure. You create clear and complete user requirements that are easily understood by our developers and deliver high value to our users.

This is an entry level position focused on building tactical and operational skills required to advance within the product management career ladder.

Your Responsibilities

Understand Company and product vision and strategy
Develop and maintain deep knowledge of the Customer and each user’s job responsibilities related to use of our software,
Gather and define requirements in comprehensive and discrete Agile User Stories and Epics within Jira
Work collaboratively with the Product Development team, to create, groom and maintain the product backlog for multiple Scrum teams onshore and offshore
Contribute to and lead Joint Application Design (JAD) sessions
Function as a liaison between internal and external stakeholders to ensure requirements are complete, clearly defined and understood
Participate in daily scrum standups, reviews and retrospectives
Validate that software functionality developed meets the requirements during sprint reviews
Build and share subject matter expertise about our products and business
Define product integration and interoperability requirements to enable the exchange of information with Provider, Health Plan and Consumer software applications
Assumes Business Analyst, Product Owner and other responsibilities as required.

Requirements:
Required Experience

Experience working as a Business Analyst or Product Owner designing and developing commercial, cloud-based software solutions (2+ years). (Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) Certification a plus)
Agile software development experience (1+ years)

Desired Experience

Experience working for a commercial healthcare software product vendor - specifically physician practice EMR software and/or health plan quality or risk adjustment software
Comfortable working remotely as part of a virtual team Experience with current health IT interoperability standards and integration methods including HL7 messaging, C-CDA and direct integration using an integration appliance such as Mirth Connect.
Experience with working with offshore and onshore teams and the challenges that entails

Required Knowledge and Skills

Product Management – experienced and skilled in the discipline of product management in a commercial software company (Pragmatic Marketing training and certification a plus)
Entrepreneurial spirit – thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic, high-intellect environment with minimal structure and frequent change
Communication – effectively communicates with and aligns different parties including customers, partners, a peer network of stakeholders, senior executives, technical resources as well as partner staff in other countries
Problem Solving – rapidly assimilates information from a variety of internal and external sources, formulates workable solutions and makes high quality decisions with limited time and data
Self-starter and Quick Learner – takes initiative to take on new responsibilities and build new skills and knowledge as needed to grow our company and serve our clients
Time Management – effectively manages time and priorities to complete most important assignments on time
Quality – extremely high attention to detail, passion for continuous improvement and operational excellence and commitment to deliver the most amazing products
Flexibility and Focus – comfortable working remotely and unsupervised as part of a geographically distributed global and culturally diverse team. Weekend and evening work will occasionally be required.
Sense of Humor – ability to work hard and have fun at the same time.

Software Packages


Proficient in Microsoft Office – Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Project, Visio, Skype
Proficient in Agile software automation tools such as Atlassian JIRA Software

Education Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, engineering, business, health informatics, marketing or a related discipline
Advanced degree in business management (MBA), marketing or planning is a plus.

This individual level contributor is primarily responsible for serving as a liaison between users and IT, defining business processes, and participating as a technical contributor on project teams.


Essential Responsibilities:

Completes work assignments by applying up-to-date knowledge in subject area to meet deadlines; following procedures and policies, and applying data and resources to support projects or initiatives; collaborating with others, often cross-functionally, to solve business problems; supporting the completion of priorities, deadlines, and expectations; communicating progress and information; identifying and recommending ways to address improvement opportunities when possible; and escalating issues or risks as appropriate.

Pursues self-development and effective relationships with others by sharing resources, information, and knowledge with coworkers and customers; listening, responding to, and seeking performance feedback; acknowledging strengths and weaknesses; assessing and responding to the needs of others; and adapting to and learning from change, difficulties, and feedback.

Develops requirements for process or system solutions within assigned business domain(s) by interfacing stakeholders and appropriate IT teams (for example, Solutions Delivery, Infrastructure, Enterprise Architecture).

Develops an understanding of and executes requirements gathering methodologies to identify business, functional, and non-functional requirements (for example, SMART) within designated business domain.

Assists in the development and documentation of comprehensive business cases to assess the costs, benefits, ROI, and Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) of proposed solutions.

Supports the evolution of applications, systems, and/or processes to a desired future state by building and leveraging an up to date understanding of how current processes impact business operations for assigned domain(s).

Maps current state against future state processes.

Identifies the impact of requirements on upstream and downstream solution components.

Provides recommendations to team or department leadership on how to integrate requirements with current systems and business processes for assigned domain(s).

Identifies value gaps and opportunities for process enhancements or efficiencies.

Supports solution design by researching how to help translate requirements into workable business solutions.

Identifies and recommends additional data and/or services needed to address key business issues related to process or solutions design.

Supports the evaluation of third-party vendors as directed.

Recommends regional and/or national process improvements which align with sustainable best practices, and the strategic and tactical goals of the business.

Supports continuous process improvement by participating in the development, implementation, and maintenance of standardized tools, templates, and processes across assigned business domain(s).

Job Description
At Amazon, we’re working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. We are looking for a highly quantitative Business Analyst to join our Social Responsibility (SR) team.

As a business analyst in Social Responsibility, you will lead efforts to help teams across Amazon understand how SR and customer obsession overlap. This involves determining the potential business case for initiatives, understanding supplier behavior, and communicating insights to relevant teams.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about mastering complex datasets for models/reports development, identifying process outliers that highlight operational savings, and building data visualizations. They have experience making data-driven decisions that drive change across teams within a large organization. They are intellectually curious, highly self-directed, exhibit a strong attention to detail, are well-organized, can manage multiple projects simultaneously and deliver results in a fast-paced and ambiguous environment. They will turn research into actionable business intelligence that presents recommendations for senior leaders and socialize these findings to teams across Amazon. This role will set up and lead reporting for the organization and present results to senior management.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree from accredited institution.
5+ years of experience in a business analyst, data analyst, or statistical analyst role (3+ years with a Master’s or 1+ with a Ph.D.)
Proficiency with SQL (e.g., multi table joins, table creation, and data validation) and Microsoft Excel.
Experience with basic statistical techniques (e.g. hypothesis testing, linear regression)
Ability to dive deeply into data integrity issues.
Ability to learn new business and data analysis techniques independently.
Ability to use SQL to develop complex queries for ad hoc analysis requests
Proficiency with Tableau.
Excellent communication skills
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Business, Engineering, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Finance or related field.
Demonstrated writing skills at a level suitable for presentation to executives.
Familiarity with advanced statistics, modeling, market segmentation, or machine learning tools
Experience with Redshift
History of engaging with cross-functional teams for implementation of project/program requirements.
History of conducting root cause analysis and implementing fixes.
Experience communicating with senior management as well as with colleagues from technical and non-technical backgrounds.
Experience influencing teams across a large organization

Job Description:
Job Summary

As a member of the Stop Loss & Heath Finance Reporting and Analysis Team, you will drive the successful development and delivery of accurate and timely reporting supporting senior management decision making. In addition, you will act as a key finance contact supporting data and reporting related projects. This role requires an individual with a proven track record of delivering professional work products with a strong attention to detail. We are looking for a self-starter who is inquisitive and has a strong sense of ownership and continuous-improvement mind-set

Key Responsibilities
Develop and deliver daily and monthly reporting, along with ad hoc analysis to support our business partners.
Develop end user tools/reporting that can be leveraged for analysis.
Work within the team, partnering with IT to establish a new reporting/data environment.
Identify opportunities for process improvement, articulating the rational for the change and impact.
Identify and escalate issues while proposing options towards resolution.
Participate in ad-hoc projects, as requested.
Position Competencies:
Problem Solving: Solid logic, problem solving and analytical skills required. Ability to see the big picture and account for multiple variables in your execution.
Accountability: Works independently and is able to complete assigned tasks under general supervision. Demonstrated ability to produce quality work product with attention to detail.
Communication: Communicates effectively with others and can clearly and concisely express opinions, conclusions and recommendations. Frequently interacts with internal peers and with all levels of the organization, including senior leaders.
Qualifications
3 to 7 years of experience in a reporting or data analysis role, utilizing large amounts of disparate data to deliver value added reporting/analysis to customers
Highly organized and detail oriented. Capable of effectively prioritizing concurrent deliverables and deadlines
Demonstrated ability to work in deadline oriented environment managing multiple priorities
Technical knowledge / skills:
Proficiency in Microsoft suite of tools including Excel, Word and Power Point
Comfort in assembling/manipulating large amounts of data for use in analysis/reporting
Experience developing reporting that supports management decision making
Familiarity with SSRS or similar SQL based applications a plus

Job Description

We are hiring a Senior Business Analyst to join the Campaign Framework project team, which is part of the Data Sciences practice at Publicis Media. Campaign Framework is the centralized platform that operationalizes and automates global media buying across Publicis Media. Leveraging globally defined master data values and governance processes, the platform enforces clean data entry and automates trafficking with local buying and billing systems.
In this role, you will interface with key agency stakeholders and users to gather requirements, document processes and understand core problems. You will work alongside the UX team, product managers and engineers to inform the development of Campaign Framework. There will be a focus on understanding and communicating the intricacies of platforms in the digital media space. This role will report directly to the Product Director.
To succeed in this role, you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be able to explain complex concepts in digital media. This is an exciting opportunity that will have a direct impact on the development of Campaign Framework and a clear path to grow into a product manager function over time.
Responsibilities:
Perform requirements analysis with stakeholders, users, and systemsConduct market research against 3rd party platforms and competitive productsManage meetings to gather critical information from various stakeholdersConduct interviews to uncover pain points in operational workflows and empathize with usersDocument and effectively communicate your insights to cross-functional team members and managementBuild artifacts including flowcharts, competitive matrices, and wireframesPrioritize initiatives based on business needs and roadmap

Qualifications

5 years of experience in digital media preferred2 years of experience in an analytical roleDemonstrated knowledge of planning/buying processes and workflows; experience as a planner, buyer and/or ad ops at an agency is a plusExceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skillsExperience consulting with clients to uncover pain points and transfer learnings into actionable requirementsExperience testing hypothesis with dummy data and limited resourcesSolid knowledge of core platforms in media space, such as: Prisma, DCM, Sizmek, Flashtalking, Innovid, AdWords, Facebook, TTD
Advanced skills:
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft excelQualitative and quantitative analysis, and experience with relevant tools and practices to support analysisExcellent planning, organizational, and time management skillsDiagramming software and Flowchart Maker tool suitesWireframing skills and relevant software a plus

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

ClickTime’s mission is to help drive performance for companies worldwide - and as a Business Analyst at ClickTime, you’ll be the standard bearer of that mission. Working with every team at the company, you’ll ask and answer broad questions about company performance that will not only illuminate how we are doing, but where we need to go. The Sr. Business Analyst will partner across the organization to deliver analysis, business insights, ROI analysis and reporting. The Sr. Business Analyst will serve as a main point of contact for analysis, data, and reporting requests and will collaborate cross-functionally to help drive company strategies. The position reports to the VP of FP&A and will collaborate with senior leadership across the company.

Essential Functions:
Partner cross functionally to establish performance standards and ensure action plans are in place to achieve desired results
Ensure appropriate performance metrics and dashboards are in place and are supported with analysis and business insights
Partner cross functionally to identify opportunities and solve through high level analytics and action plans
Demonstrate strong intellectual curiosity to identify leading indicators and correlations to drive predictive modeling and improved analytics to drive business initiatives
Analyze data for breaks, inconsistencies, exceptions and communicate both internally and externally
Work with other finance team members to ensure all business logic is reflected correctly in all reporting, analyses, and models
Support and track strategic initiatives through analysis, reporting and data requests

Job Description
Are you passionate about mobile marketing and creating the future of multi-channel messaging? Do you thrive on diving deep to answer the questions that drive a multi-billion dollar business? The world-wide Outbound Marketing Team connects with customers with personalized marketing via email and push notifications, building technology and providing expertise throughout the company to merchandise and increase engagement with Amazon’s products and brands. The team's mission is for customers to feel the same curiosity and delight to see a communication from Amazon as they feel to see an Amazon box on their doorstep.

The Outbound Marketing Team seeks a talented and experienced Business Analyst to advance this mission. You will be responsible for defining the metrics, analyzing the performance, and making recommendations that improve the impact of these multi-billion dollar channels. This role will work directly with teams across Outbound Marketing Analytics and Engineering to build and enhance the tools and dashboards needed to manage the business on a weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual basis. You will also work with Marketing and Product Teams in Outbound Marketing and across Amazon to develop a prioritized learning agenda and testing methodology. As we learn, you will be challenged to continuously improve and innovate how we report and design tests, so that we can refine and increase the efficacy and efficiency of these channels both separately and as part of a multi-channel customer journey. You will be presenting your reports and ideas regularly to a variety of audiences including cross-functional teams and senior leadership.

This role requires someone who is flexible, creative, biased for action, detail-oriented, analytical, and comfortable leading and working with multiple teams. We are seeking someone with demonstrated history of successful analytics program ownership and data-based insights generation, innate curiosity about customer behavior, and facility with complex data sets. This successful candidate will also be someone who is very comfortable challenging decisions and the status quo when they disagree, respectfully but with conviction.
Basic Qualifications
5+ years in an Analytics role, preferably in Marketing or Advertising.Experience developing metrics, methodologies, and dashboards relevant to B2C and B2B audience analysis, acquisition, commerce, retention, and/or lifetime value.Experience leading cross-functional projects with product, engineering, and/or marketing.Experience in A/B or multivariate testing and statistics.Strong Excel and ability to write or edit basic SQL queries.Excellent writing skills and comfortable presenting to senior leadership.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with market-leading CRM and push notification systems.Advanced Excel and SQL ability.MBA or Master's degree.

Even Financial is a Venture Backed (VC) early-stage fintech company founded in 2015 that is disrupting the way brands, financial services providers, and consumers transact and monetize with online financial services products in personal loans, credit cards, savings accounts and mortgages.
Even Financial is a New York based, venture backed, technology company that drives new account openings for financial institutions (FIs) and incremental revenue for marketers. Through our programmatic and machine learning platform, single-end point API and distributed network of over 150+ partners, Even makes it easy for FIs to engage and convert the right consumers via contextually relevant marketing partners. Founded in 2015 by Phillip Rosen with a strong executive team and outstanding investors, Even is at an exciting inflection point - with significant financing, scaling volumes and revenue, launching additional financial services across our network.

We seek a Business Analyst to support Sales, Account Management and our Partners with data, analysis and strategy to drive key decisions and growth. Our ideal candidate must have practical vs academic experience, be very self-motivated and posses a demonstrated entrepreneurial spirit.

In this role you will:

Use Excel & SQL to produce analysis of company and customer performance
Perform industry research and analysis to inform key business decisions
Produce reports and dashboards using BI tools such as Mode Analytics and Tableau
Actively listen to partners and colleagues to understand business priorities in order to match data and analysis appropriately
Be data driven
Support all recommendations and conclusions with substantial research and data

Requirements:

3+ years of practical work experience using Excel & SQL in a Business Analyst or related role
3+ years using BI tools such as Mode Analytics and Tableau
3+ years of practical work experience using statistics and statistical analysis
3+ years producing visualizations of data to clearly communicate ideas
Interest or experience in a programming language such as Python or R

Company funded life insurance

NYHRC gym membership at a discounted rate of $25 per month

InternshipWHAT YOU’LL DO
As a Business Analyst Intern for Cisco you will develop creative solutions for real business challenges. You will collaborate on multi-functional projects to identify areas for improvement. You will analyze internal processes, data, and problems and identify benefits from enabling new capabilities. Ultimately you will improve how Cisco operates and how we work together.

WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH
At Cisco you will find a diverse group of people tackling business issues. We work with multi-functional teams to facilitate new business models and process improvements. Cisco employs the best so you will be surrounded by others as ambitious and dedicated as yourself.

WHO YOU ARE
You are pursuing a bachelor’s or master's degree in Business, Management, Finance, Math, Accounting, Information Systems or related field
You have a minimum of a 3.0 GPA or equivalent
You have excellent analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills
You have a high level of customer focus and service excellence as you seek practical and creative solutions
You have strong collaboration skills with internal/external customers and multi-functional teams
You have superb communication skills, “can do” attitude and a great teammate in global environment
You have effective time-management skills and the ability to prioritize work assignments

WHY CISCO
At Cisco, each person brings their own unique talents to work as a team and make a difference.

Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people.

We connect everything – people, process, data and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better.
We innovate everywhere - from launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more – from Smart Cities to your everyday devices.
We benefit everyone - we do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities.

Colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco

#univanalystjobs #Engineering #Finance #GBS #ISG #IT #Sales #Services #SupplyChain #STO #Security @WeAreCisco

The Company and the Role:
Lehigh Hanson is one of the largest construction materials companies in North America with more than 550 active operations in the U.S. and Canada. Our core activities include the production and distribution of cement and aggregates, the two essential raw materials in concrete. Lehigh Hanson companies also produce ready-mixed concrete, asphalt and other concrete products.

Lehigh Hanson is part of the HeidelbergCement Group, a global leader in aggregates, cement, concrete, and other downstream activities. The Group employs over 60,000 people at more than 3,000 locations in 60 countries.

Lehigh Hanson is seeking a qualified and proven IT Senior Business Analyst (Sr. BA). As part of the Project Management Office, the Sr. BA develops expertise in several business areas and is primarily responsible for translating business requirements into functional specifications and ensuring projects deliver on the objectives and benefits.

This position will reside at the corporate office in Irving, Texas.

This position is perfect for a proven Business Analyst who would like to align themselves with a progressive and growing company to enhance their skills and career. While working in a fast paced, performance culture, you will begin your career with a proven leader in the cement and construction materials supply.

Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Female / Veteran / Disabled

What you’ll get to do:

Involved in requirements gathering and analysis to identify problems and suggest solutions using a systematic, multi-step approach.
Work cross-functionally to solve problems and recommend changes to technology solutions and/or business processes.
Collaborate within the project team and other external departments to lead the assessment and selection of technology solutions and vendors, including the documentation and management of proposal requests.
Understand project objectives and benefits, documents the business case and project charter, including scope, resources and initial budget. Share technical and administrative knowledge to others.
Drive project success via formal requirements definition, solution design facilitation, and work with business and technical teams to build detailed test scripts.
Leverage several project management methodologies (Waterfall, Agile, Scrum, and Hybrid) to ensure predictable project success.
Lead small projects and/or system enhancements.
Provide support to junior staff.
Perform other job-related duties as assigned.

Who we are looking for:

Minimally requires education and/or experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s degree.
Minimum 6-8 years of experience in an information technology environment.
Minimum 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst.
An energetic passion for continuous improvement.
Strong analytical ability
Experience working in IT and cross-functional project teams.
Knowledge of prevalent IT and project management methodologies, system development lifecycles and best practices.
Prefer Business Analyst or Project Management certification.
Prefer industry knowledge of construction materials business processes.
Excellent communication and organization skills, verbally and written.

Our corporate office supports the Lehigh Hanson plants in North America and offers a competitive benefits package that includes a 401(k) savings plan with company match, tuition reimbursement, and employee purchase program. Amenities include an on-site deli, free covered parking, and free fitness center.

No search firms please.

The Business Analyst is technically adept and highly interpersonal with limited experience and is responsible for requirements development and management. The BA will assist other BA's with moderate to complex projects or may individually handle assignments. Safelite will be unlike any place you've ever worked. (This won't be just the daily grind!) You'll join caring and passionate teams that collaborate to make a difference, deliver extraordinary results and bring unexpected happiness. Every day. Your effort, heart and creative ideas will be valued and rewarded. And we care about your well-being. So, we'll strive to give you what you need to be happy at work and at home.

Essential Activities:

Provides assistance to the department by maintaining metrics, monitoring budgets, developing communications, and gaining increased familiarity with business areas.
Defines and Scopes Business Projects
Defines and documents project scopes. Gains good understanding of project reasoning, goals, and objectives. Analyses business initiative prior to determining solutions. Names and defines people, systems, departments, and outside vendors who will be involved in projects. Gains information necessary to prioritize and begin requirements gathering by defining and documenting project viewpoints, assumptions, and possible business risks. Produces a descriptive business process and organized system for maintaining project information.
Researches & Gathers Requirements
Gathers detailed requirements to thoroughly define projects by instinctively knowing and asking the 'right' questions to the 'right' people. Defines the difference between business need and software functionality. Assess project type, involved individuals, and volume of required information through a variety of vehicles and ensures that critical issues are adequately addressed.
Analyzes, Documents, & Communicates Requirements
Organizes requirements into business, functional, and technical categories. Utilizes consistent documentation format which may include textual descriptions, diagrams, and other graphical displays to clearly communicate and organize requirements in a manner understandable to technical individuals. Determines level of detail appropriate for project. Maintains current understanding of business and technical jargon and determines the most appropriate method of communication. Prepares and facilitates presentations to all associate and management levels.
Identifies & Verify's Solutions
Works closely with IT experts to identify solutions to design solutions. Assists in the design and testing of technical solutions, works with vendors to review and discuss products, writes or participates in the writing of RFI's and RFP's.
Reviews proposed designs for usability and to assure requirements are satisfied.
Reviews solutions and determines if original project objectives are met. Oversees technical and user testing. Documents and reports variances from original requirements. May assist in correcting variances.
Supports IT Audit Process
Assists in the annual audit process by ensuring independent auditors are provided with requested materials.
Prepares Written Procedures
Becomes product expert by way of researching, testing, and familiarizing self with new products and/or systems. Prepares and implements detailed, organized, and user-friendly written procedures for product and/or system end users. May develop and conduct end-user training programs utilizing a variety of training vehicles.
Facilitates inter-departmental enterprise change meetings. Determines and documents recent changes, updates test directors, and prepares and provides written reports to appropriate management.
Improves business processes. Observes various business processes and identifies and recommends opportunities for improvement.
Support procurement of new products or systems by conducting extensive product research and preparing detailed written reports to management.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Requirements:

Bachelors degree in MIS, CIS, technical communications or related field required.
Two to four years business, IT, or related experience required.
Knowledge of: IT, general business operations; process mapping, technical and business jargon; project management practices; interviewing & facilitation techniques; basic software design and development; basic understanding of system design; and project scope documentation techniques.
Ability to: exercise sound judgment; demonstrate flexibility and initiative; coordinate multiple activities and tasks; solve problems; display objectivity; collect and analyze data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions; maintain confidentiality; maintain accurate and complete work records; clearly document project scopes using business terminology; categorize requirements; understand basic system development methodologies; utilize appropriate modeling techniques; facilitate meetings; conduct informal presentations; write in a clear manner; understand business problems; calculate basic cost estimates; build business cases for implementation; and apply test principles.
Skill in: verbal and written communication; interviewing; operating office equipment; operating a personal computer and job related software; planning, scheduling, and organizing work priorities; maintaining good business relations; collaborating; working with detailed data; conflict resolution; identifying and implementing best practices; performing mathematical calculations; bringing multiple groups together to agree on project scopes and build consensus; fact-finding and asking the right questions; effective listening; note taking and documentation; and analyzing data.
