Job Description
At Amazon.com we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. In Seller Support we are building and operating exceptional solutions to provide world class support to Sellers on Amazon's Marketplace business, which exceeds 45% of the total Amazon.com platform sales and growing. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history as a Business Analyst for the Seller Experience team based in Seattle.

Are you data savvy, business focused, with a desire to use your analytical prowess to help others understand Seller needs and drive change through rigorous data analysis?

The successful candidate will be highly analytical, an expert with SQL and Excel, experienced with significance testing and A/B experimentation, resourceful, customer focused, team oriented, and have an ability to work independently under time constraints to meet deadlines.

In this role you will:
Be an important member of a team that improves the experience of selling on Amazon by eliminating defects, proactively identifying and resolving selling issues, and discovering seller insights.
These objectives by diving deep into Amazon’s data lake to reveal trends, support machine-learning based automation, poll sellers and analyze how sentiments predict behaviors, perform cohort analysis, and run experiments to test hypotheses and to quantify impacts.
Work closely with product managers, SDEs, Technical Product Managers, data engineers, process engineers and senior management to define and build reporting and analytic solutions that allow us to make data-based product and business decisions that make it easier to sell on Amazon.
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.
Analyze and solve business problems with focus on understanding root causes and discovering forward-looking opportunities.
Rigorously examine metrics and design new metrics that provide guidance about the state of the business.
Communicate complex analyses and insights to stakeholders and business leaders, both verbally and in writing.
Create and maintain tools and reports which support Senior leadership and various teams throughout the organization.

Amazon.com is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.
Basic Qualifications
BS/BA in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, quantitative Social Sciences or related field.
3+ years of experience of writing SQL queries.
Advanced excel skills (pivot, macros, v-lookup etc.)
Experience with A/B testing and statistical significance testing.
Proven analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases.
Strong communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills with the ability to translate complex analysis into actionable recommendations.
Preferred Qualifications
Advanced degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, quantitative Social Sciences or related field
Advanced analytical and quantitative skills with demonstrated ability in using data and metrics to identify root causes
Proficiency in a statistical software such as R, Stata, SAS, SPSS, or Minitab
Experience with predictive analytics, data mining, and data visualization
Experience with survey research
Experience working with wide variety of business data sources

Pacific Coast Companies, Inc. is a dedicated team of professionals that provide a comprehensive range of business services and support to the Pacific Coast Building Products family of companies and their customers.

Summary

The Business Process Analyst II works with business teams to derive the business requirements that will become technology requirements to provide a comprehensive business solution. The Business Analyst II actively listens, feeds back information creatively, and aligns business and technical teams to an understandable set of detailed solution requirements.



Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Executes necessary investigation, analysis, and evaluation to determine project feasibility; helps to develop project cost and benefit estimates to establish project worth including the development of alternative considerations leading to recommendations for new systems or equipment installations, or change to existing ones
Notifies stakeholders and the appropriate people on the implications of existing IT systems that can be applied to a problem; develops and/or evaluates previously refined data and programs and select from a range of alternatives to determine the appropriate action to be taken
Receives only general supervision; carries out routine duties independently; uses appreciable originality on system assignments; discusses or seeks approval on complex matters
Helps predict resource needs for analysts, programmers, user personnel, consultants, equipment, etc.
Develops or helps in the development of work plans, task sequencing, and the extent to which tasks may be performed concurrently; develops time schedules, conversion, and test procedures for all aspects of system, from manual handling through computer processing; suggests plans for user and resource management approvals; develops project plans and schedules
Suggests IT equipment needed for solution of the problem; modifies systems designs to take maximum advantage of existing equipment resources
Specifies the number and kinds of records, files and/or documents to be used; examines charts and/or diagrams of the problem to be programmed and defines system requirements in terms of equipment capabilities
Plans independently the full range of programming actions needed to achieve desired end results on complex problems; analyzes and suggests system development tasks; checks, instructs, assigns work, and otherwise functionally directs lower level people; performs programming activities as required
Maintains contact within the IT organization, with systems and programming personnel, with IT managers, at all organizational levels, and with technology vendors; keeps up periodic contact with internal customers using IT services and executives in charge of the key business units using IT services
Aids in the development and implementation of major systems structures which will provide a solid foundation for well written and reliable application programs



Qualifications

Education/Experience: Bachelor’s degree (B.A.) in computer science, information technology, or related field from four-year college or university; and three (3) years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. A Master's in Business Administration (M.B.A.) or similar master’s degree is preferred.
Language Ability: Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or government regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, customers, co-workers and vendors.
Reasoning Ability: Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form.
Computer Skills: Must be able to operate a personal computer and other various standard office machines and equipment necessary to complete duties. Must have a working knowledge of Microsoft Office Applications, including Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of SAP software system preferred, but not required.
Additional Industry Experience: Preferred business experience working on e-commerce and digital strategies and solutions, and experience with the business intelligence/data analytics.
Certificates/Licenses: Valid driver’s license required.




We offer unlimited potential for motivated professionals, great compensation, and full benefits including 401(k), Profit Sharing Retirement plan, dental insurance, medical insurance, disability benefits, pre-tax accounts for health care, reimbursement for health club costs, life insurance, vision-care plan, and wellness programs.
We are an equal opportunity employer and promote a drug free workplace

PGIM Fixed Income is a global asset manager offering active solutions across all fixed income markets. The company has offices in Newark, New Jersey, London, Tokyo and Singapore. As of March 31, 2018, the firm has $717 billion of assets under management including $300 billion in institutional assets, $124 billion in retail assets, and $293 billion in proprietary assets. Nearly 600 institutional asset owners have entrusted PGIM Fixed Income with their assets.

Group Overview/Responsibilities:

The Business Analysis Group is responsible for supporting various initiatives across PIM Fixed Income with an emphasis on understanding the project(s) requirements from the business perspective and to ensure those requirements are translated into the appropriate functional deliverables. This role liaises with IT and Business Stakeholders in supporting project implementation, documenting and validating system requirements, identifying and recommending solutions for improving existing processes and technology needs that will enable the Business Stakeholders to achieve their goal(s). The group supports the following business areas: Portfolio Management and Analysis, Operations, Compliance, Client Services and Credit Research and Performance Reporting. The group leads/participates in 1) Technology projects 2) Infrastructure upgrades 3) Process Improvements 4) Strategic Business Initiatives. The size and scope of projects may vary from small, tactical requests to large, strategic implementations, technical or non-technical efforts. The team is also responsible for providing general production support for the firm’s systems and processes across the various user groups.
Qualifications
Undergraduate (B.S.) degree in Finance, Economics, Business, or Information Systems is preferred.
Minimum of 4+ years experience in the financial services industry, particularly fixed income is required.
Solid understanding of various Fixed Income instruments and their analytics, characteristics and benchmarks especially Derivatives is a must.
Practical experience with one or more skill sets: business analysis, quality assurance testing, project management, investment reporting, or other analytical experience in a complex business / systems environment is required.
Hands-on experience conducting and leading requirements gathering sessions and translating business requirements into functional specifications for development.
Experience in executing QA efforts from requirements inception to production release, including well rounded testing skills with some understanding of Functional, System, User Acceptance and Regression Testing.
Proven ability to solve problems based on analyzing, conceptualizing and synthesizing of complex data.
Strong analytical skill and ability to make independent decisions and develop creative solutions to meet business needs.
Possesses strong communication and interpersonal skills and comfortable working with all levels of an organization’s technology and business departments.
Demonstrated desire and ability to learn quickly and connect the dots, as well as to work with minimal guidance and supervision.
Must be a self-starter, resourceful; and possess very strong organizational, task management and prioritization skills.
Proficient with MS Excel, MS Word, MS Visio and PowerPoint.
Hands-on experience in data manipulation and writing SQL queries.
Basic understanding of the System Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
Hands-on experience with any investment / trading system is a plus.

About Next Street
Where teamwork and entrepreneurship meet
Next Street was founded in 2005 with the belief that small businesses and nonprofits are the engines of inclusive growth in underserved markets. Serving as trusted advisor to some of the country’s most dynamic organizations, we are a mission-driven consulting firm bringing strategic and financial expertise to revitalize communities, grow businesses, and create jobs. Our work includes directly serving small businesses and nonprofits to help them grow, as well as advising public and private institutions at a systems level to drive sustainable and equitable development solutions in communities across the US.
We look for professionals who aim to combine their diverse backgrounds and experiences with a passion for mission, offering our team members an unparalleled opportunity to work at the intersection of doing well and doing good. Next Street is a for-profit ‘business for good’ and a certified B Corporation with offices in Boston, New York City, and Chicago.
About the Position: Business Analyst
A junior level position, the Business Analyst will play a supporting role in developing and improving Next Street’s internal business infrastructure in partnership with Corporate and firm leadership. The Business Analyst will report to our Finance & Operations Manager, with significant day-to-day collaboration across other members of our Corporate team. Your work will include supporting multiple dimensions of firm operations, examples include working in Salesforce, data reporting/analytics and technology solutions. As a small firm, we offer significant opportunity to stretch and we are seeking candidates with an entrepreneurial drive, a collaborative spirit, and an appetite to contribute in building the firm.
Your work:
Partner across members of the Corporate team to learn, manage, and improve Next Street’s overall business systems technology infrastructure, including:
Researching technology platforms and identifying new or creative ways to streamline aspects of the firm’s internal business operations
Managing the design and implementation, ongoing maintenance, and continuous improvement efforts
 Leading day-to-day project management and coordination for upgrades or changes on software platforms
Overseeing and enforcing systems/data policies and controls
Work with Corporate and firm leadership on the ongoing development and production of reporting/analytics solutions, with the goals of:
Driving real-time knowledge and decision-making
Streamlining existing reporting tools in use
Strategically automating dashboards and increasing functionalities
Support the Finance & Operations Manager specifically with the day-to-day financial and operational management functions of the firm, such as:
Improving and streamlining the firm’s processes and procedures
Managing and maintaining key financial and operational analytics
Assist with additional strategic or special project initiatives as needed


We are looking for someone with:
Bachelors Degree in Business Administration or Finance
2+ years of experience working in a professional environment, preferably in a business or finance role
Experience in Quickbooks or Salesforce
Outstanding written and oral communication skills
Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel
Deep interest in Next Street's mission and work
Excellent planning, prioritization, and organizational skills, including the ability to effectively manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
A passion for continuous improvement and exploration of new solutions or technologies
Strong attention to detail and a problem-solving mindset
A desire to build a business and an appetite to take entrepreneurial initiative
A demonstrated capacity for collaboration and teamwork at all levels of tenure
A willingness to challenge and be challenged, regardless of seniority


Want to learn more?
To apply, please submit your resume on this page and stay tuned for a request for additional information. We'll ask you for a few more details about your interest then. Top candidates will be invited to interview directly with the Next Street team.
If offered an interview, you'll connect by phone with members of the Next Street hiring team. As you proceed, you'll be invited to present to our team on a relevant business challenge. The final stage will have you connect us with professional references.
Next Street is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, or Vietnam era, or other eligible veteran status, or any other protected factor

Job Description:

ICAM - Treasury Application Provisioning & Compliance Work Program
Business Analyst - Terms of Reference

Responsibilities:
Play key role in the implementation of the Identity and Access Management (ICAM) work program, integrating in-house systems and third party applications for provisioning, de-provisioning and access certification using Sail Point tool.
Interface with the business clients to understand and document business needs and requirements relating to the development and maintenance of the ICAM work program.
Strong experience with Sail Point tool and experience in IAM implementation for onboarding, provisioning and de-provisioning and Certification of financial applications.
Identify business requirements by working primarily with the major stakeholders and lead the collection, analysis, documentation and coordination of the ICAM business and compliance requirements.
Create and assign tickets to the development team for production support and provide requirements for enhancements or configuration changes.
Work with the ICAM team architect and development team for detailed walkthrough, documentation of ICAM functional requirements, process flows and test use cases to ensure functional, business and compliance requirements are met.
For new applications, collaborate with business and IT stakeholders (PMO, OIS, EA) to determine if solutions currently exist (internally or externally) or whether new solutions are feasible to meet ICAM requirements.
Tracking and project co-ordination for Treasury deliverables.
Design, review test cases and obtain UAT sign-off for new Treasury applications on-boarding and work-flows and certifications and provide support to the business client, answering client questions and training new users.
Document and manage issues and actions for Treasury applications and projects related to applications and authorization work-flows.
Act as a liaison between stakeholders, service manager, technical lead and IT support teams (network, information security, service desk, web, infrastructure, DBA).
Specific Requirements:
Master’s degree in Computer Science or Finance, with a minimum of 5 years relevant technical and business work experience.
3-year experience with Identity and Access Management (IAM) domain with superior understanding of Identity Management concepts, identity management including provisioning, de-provisioning and Certification, RBAC model; understanding of business controls, gap analysis, compliance and audit requirements.
Ability to understand Identity and Access Management platforms, key concepts cloud infrastructure and access controls for cloud based applications.
Superior verbal and written communication skills to translate business needs and ability to convey business requirements and technical needs in a clear, concise, and effective manner.
Ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in continually changing and fast paced environment; strong self-starter that can work independently as needed
Prior working experience with financial systems.

Come Play!
Since its founding in 2002, Big Fish has been the world’s largest producer and distributor of casual games, with titles which continuously land us at the top of app store charts. Today, we’re bounding into the mid-core space, exploring new and exciting forms of gameplay, and producing more fun than ever! Big Fish is home to six individual studios, each with its own unique style of game-play. Together, we’re united under a common goal: to produce and develop the very best in mobile gaming and bring fun and entertainment to our millions of customers across the globe!
Tired of playing the wrong kinds of “games”? Join the Pond!

The Mission
We're looking for you, a curious Business Analyst who is passionate about fraud and finding trends and interesting anomalies in data. As the Business Analyst, you will work to perform daily duties that include weekly/monthly reporting to manage and maximize business profitability, solving business problems by extracting and analyzing data and reporting of fraud activity relating to several Big Fish Games products.

Responsibilities:
Provides management with weekly and monthly reporting to manage and maximize business profitability while maintaining open communications with management, creating and updating routine reporting, and providing summary recaps along with key findings.
Communicate and share recommendations and relevant information with management; and iterate analyses based on different business scenarios or assumptions.
Apply advanced SQL skills (writing high quality code) to solve business problems by extracting and analyzing data, and troubleshooting reporting or database issues
Designs and performs complex analysis to determine resolutions that clarify and address operational and business concerns; generating results using new or existing tools (for example, MySQL, Aginity/Netezza, Excel, function-specific tools)
Develops analytic tools for management and assists in report development and design.
Analyzes monthly variances and creates variance reporting for management.
Assist in documenting and/or reviewing and updating existing business procedures.
Assists with routine and ad-hoc projects, providing timely and accurate analysis and/or reporting from various data sources.
Carries out responsibilities in accordance with the Company’s policies, objectives, and applicable government laws and regulations
Participate in special projects or as back up support as assigned by management.
Supports company mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity

Requirements
Work is very detailed and requires a high level of accuracy
Must have paramount problem solving and collaborative abilities
Advanced SQL and Excel skills - SQL experience working with Aginity/Netezza a plus
Must be flexible and comfortable in an extremely fast paced dynamic environment
Strong organizational skills, time management, attention to detail and a strong self-starter
Ability to meet deadlines
Ability to work in an environment with daily changes
Ability to be self-motivated and quickly learn new procedures
Must be able to adjust to multiple demands and shifting priorities
Must be proactive in identifying potential concerns
Advanced data validation and troubleshooting skills

Be the next Big Fish in the Pond!

job_description:
About Meredith Corporation:
Meredith Corporation (NYSE: MDP; meredith.com) has been committed to service journalism for 115 years. Today, Meredith uses multiple distribution platforms — including broadcast television, print, digital, mobile and video — to provide consumers with content they desire and to deliver the messages of its advertising and marketing partners.

Meredith's National Media Group reaches nearly 200 million unduplicated American consumers every month, including 85 percent of U.S. Millennial women. Meredith is a leader in creating content across media platforms and life stages in key consumer interest areas such as celebrity, food, lifestyle, home, parenting, beauty, fashion, news and sports. Meredith also features robust brand licensing activities including more than 3,000 SKUs of branded products at 5,000 Walmart stores across the U.S. and at walmart.com., as well as innovative business-to-business marketing solutions provided by Meredith Xcelerated Marketing.

Meredith's Local Media Group includes 17 television stations reaching more than 11 percent of U.S. households. Meredith's portfolio is concentrated in large, fast-growing markets, with seven stations in the nation's Top 25 and 13 in Top 50 markets. Meredith's stations produce 700 hours of local news and entertainment content each week, and operate leading local digital destinations.

Salesforce Business Analyst

Des Moines, IA

The Salesforce Business Analyst reviews, analyzes and evaluates complex processes, systems and user needs for planned projects involving Saleforce CRM and other sales tools. This position documents business requirements and needs and generates associated business solutions that accomplish Meredith's needs. The Salesforce Business Analyst assists the IT staff in understanding the operational needs for both automated and manual solutions to business processes. In addition, this position acts as the functional subject matter expert and technical support lead within the department and division.

Essential Job Functions

Weight %

Accountabilities, Actions and Expected Measurable Results

40%


Collaborates with business users to gather all requirements to prepare business specifications. Translates requirements into business functionality.
Documents workflows and results of business analysis and obtains sign-off from users on specifications.

Communicates the business strategies, goals, and needs to the application development team and serves as business interface to manage expectations.
Designs and executes test plans to ensure business requirements and functional specifications meet objectives.
Understands business processes and workflows and identifies necessary changes to these. Recommends solution improvements to the business.
Documents and communicates procedures and usage recommendations to ensure adoption.

Evaluates and understands applications that can be used to improve business process and workflow.
Complete assigned project deliverables according to project plan and expected quality.

Colaborates with Salesforce developers on complex business solutions.
Leads meetings for purposes of presentations, reviews, approvals, etc.
Understands the long-term business objectives and suggests strategies to meet those objectives. Introduces innovation to business processes through technology if appropriate.
Collaborates with the business to create vision and prioritize business objectives.

30%


Provides application support and technical resolutions to system issues.
Communicates to stakeholders regarding functional procedures
Monitors Corporate objectives to understand the business drivers.
Provides guidance and knowledge transfer to other team members.

100%

$57 - $66 an hourContractBusiness analysis has emerged as a core best business practice in the 21st century. As the vital link between an organization?s information technology capabilities and its business objectives, skilled Business Analysts contribute to the ability of an institution to meet its performance management goals (increase efficiency, increase effectiveness, reduced work cycle time, increasing employee productivity, etc.).

In today?s complex business environment, an organization?s adaptability, agility, and ability to manage constant change through innovation can be keys to success. Traditional methods will no longer lead to reaching objectives under current economic conditions. Proactive business analysis enable innovative organizations to achieve goals through projects that translate customer needs into new products, services, and profits. Business Analysts make it all happen more efficiently and effectively.

Business Analysts help units implement informational technology solutions in a cost-effective way by determining the requirements of business processes, tasks, reports and analytical models; evaluating those requirements against current enterprise solutions; translating those requirements with no current enterprise solution to technical developers; and, communicating progress clearly to all stakeholders, facilitators and partners. The Business Analyst serves as a subject matter expert on the business process, tasks, and the use of data and business intelligence applications among operational units and college and department users. That subject matter expertise is developed by ongoing interactions with stakeholders to understand their needs, and collaborating with other advancement data stakeholders.

Communicate requirements for the implementation of new functionality and provide workshop and written material that explains system functionality. ? Serve as a liaison between the Financial Management System project and City agencies, ensuring agency concerns and issues are handled professionally and expediently.? Identify and communicate agency concerns and issues to the Team Leader and determine how they should be addressed for follow up conversations.? Plan, track, and report status of agency readiness for the deployment of accounting, budgeting, and procurement functionalities.? Work extensively with agency primary contacts to provide overall assistance to agencies in areas such as agency readiness planning, issue resolution, and communicating system functionality enhancements.? Provide post-deployment support, including assisting the FISA Call Center with answering, logging, and following up on calls.? Write announcements and other agency communications.? Perform other special assignments as needed including: providing assistance, direction, and follow up activities for oversight and line agencies in completing functions for business events conducted throughout the year.? Perform administrative tasks as needed? Work closely with internal business teams to create/develop documentation for End users to explain the functionality, workflow and business rules? Proactively identify, manage and resolve issues & risksNOTE: Occasional travel to agencies within the 5 NYC boroughs is required during business hours.

Minimum Qual Requirements

1. A master's degree in computer science from an accredited college and three years of progressively more responsible, full-time, satisfactory experience using information technology in computer applications programming, systems programming, computer systems development, data telecommunications, database administration, planning of data/information processing, user services, or area networks at least 18 months of this experience must have been in an administrative, managerial or executive capacity in the areas of computer applications programming, systems programming, computer systems development, data telecommunications, data base administration, or planning of data processing or in the supervision of staff performing these duties; or 2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and four years of experience as described in "1" above; or 3. A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a State's department of education or recognized accrediting organization and six years of experience as described in "1" above; or 4. A satisfactory combination of education and experience equivalent to "1", "2" or "3" above. However, all candidates must have at least a four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a State's department of education or recognized accrediting organization and must possess at least three years of experience as described in "1" above, including the 18 months of administrative, managerial, executive or supervisory experience as described in "1" above. Qualification Requirements (continued) NOTE: The following types of experience are not acceptable: superficial use of preprogrammed software without complex programming, design, implementation or management of the product; use of word processing packages; use of a hand held calculator; primarily the entering or updating of data in a system; the operation of data processing hardware or consoles.

Preferred Skills

? Superb written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to translate IT/financial systems functionality into simple yet effective communications for end users.? Demonstrated proficiency with MS Excel, Microsoft Word and PowerPoint.? Ability to coordinate activities from end-ta-end with periodic guidance and input from management and/or teammates.? Ability to multitask, prioritize, quickly and independently resolve problems, while under tight deadlines and while maintaining a positive and professional working relationship with all project participants.? Basic knowledge of project planning, managing, organizing and status reporting.? Ability to speak in front of a user group and clearly describe how business functions and exception process / usage scenarios are executed from within the FISA Financial System software? Knowledge of some or all of the following: FMS Accounting, VENDEX, IFA, Payee Information Portal (PIP)? Understanding of Process flows, Use Cases, Scenarios, tasks and workflow? Understanding or programming interfaces to pass data between applications ? Experience conducting presentations for audiences of at minimum 50 people,? Experience in a writing, communication position, or training position for an Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system implementation? Demonstrated experience with Completed SDLC implementations in a communication and/or training position within the prior years for a large system implementation (ERP implementation preferred),

Additional Information

P528

To Apply

External applicants please visit https://a127-jobs.nyc.gov/ to apply to Job ID #329633. Current NYC employees may apply via Employee Self Service (ESS). While all complete applications will be given consideration, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted by FISA-OPA. FISA/OPA IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER.

Hours/Shift

Monday - Friday, 9am to 5pm

Residency Requirement

New York City Residency is not required for this position.

Analyze and optimize product, inbound, packaging and shipping costs and apply this knowledge to influence future product roadmap, merchandising and sourcing decisions.

GENERAL PURPOSE:
As a member of the Business Information team, the Business Analyst will play an important business facing role. In this role, he/she will work directly with our business partners gathering data/reporting requirements, working with our IT partners in determining the best solution and supporting the testing and delivery process. The Business Analyst will also support the full BI Request Management process and will follow the requests from submission to delivery.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Information Management –

Gain a solid understanding of the business reports and tools.
Develop an understanding of the strengths/limitations of the various tools and technologies available. Suggest alternate methods of data presentation.

Gather and document business requirements for report and data requests.
Leverage the available reporting tools; confirm the data integrity via thorough testing.
Lead creation and review of all test-related deliverables including test approach, test scenarios, test cases/conditions, scripts and results.

Routinely manage user acceptance testing for moderately complex projects and obtain sign-off from the business.

Develop training materials and job aides to support reporting rollouts.

Identify and mitigate any project related risks.
Relationship Management –

Develop partnerships acting as a liaison between the technical and business teams to understand, troubleshoot, interpret and provide guidance on reporting and data needs.

Facilitate meetings; issue tracking/resolution, escalation etc. as you follow a report/data request from submission through to delivery.

Lead training classes, collect user feedback, and support the users as needed.

Lead post deployment validation as instructed by project leadership or management.

COMPETENCIES:
Analysis and Judgment
Results Driven
Business Acumen
Interpersonal Effectiveness
Communication
Technical Competence with data gathering
Customer Service
Presentation and training abilities

QUALIFICATIONS AND SPECIAL SKILLS REQUIRED:
Bachelor’s degree with a concentration in Business, Economics, Finance or Computer Science, or an equivalent diploma
3 years of retail experience in the business, business support or equivalent work experience
Commensurate level of working business knowledge preferred
Hands on experience with BI tools (i.e. MicroStrategy, Microsoft SSAS, etc.)
High degree of proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Experience with merchandise planning processes and tools is a plus
Visio skills is a plus
Ability to understand and apply instructions or suggest alternate proven methods to move projects forward
Ability to follow established practices, policies and procedures
Ability to build and maintain stable working relationships
Strong communication skills
Strong analytical skills
Able to create simple to complex analytical solutions
Ability to take an abstract analytical problem and break it down into actionable tasks

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/ADA:
Job requires ability to work in an office environment, primarily on a computer.
The job also requires sitting, standing, walking, talking on the telephone, attending in-person meetings, typing, and working with paper/files, etc.
Job occasionally requires bending, kneeling, reaching, and lifting up to 10 pounds.
May also require occasional driving and/or traveling overnight for business functions or site visits.
Vision requirements: Ability to see information in print and/or electronically.
Consistent timeliness and regular attendance.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:

None

Our mission is simple. We make business travel less complicated for travelers, less costly for employers and more profitable for service providers. Using our industry-leading software solutions, employees book travel and car service and report those expenses faster and more easily than ever before. Corporations control costs more effectively. Travel management companies deliver more engaging customer experiences. Car service operators benefit from new efficiencies and widen their customer reach. In other words, everybody wins. We've helped thousands of forward-thinking companies modernize their systems, improve travel management and save money. Deem is backed by leading venture capital funds as well as corporate and private equity investors. The company is headquartered in San Francisco, CA and has an office in Bangalore, India.
As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible designing and defining industry-leading solutions. You will be working with customers, product management, sales, marketing and support to define new features and products. We are looking for a driven, highly organized and analytical Business Analyst that can help us to build our next generation customer experience. This role offers the opportunity to make a significant impact on the future success of Deem.
Responsibilities
Facilitate process to capture and document business requirements. Analyze requirements; construct workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; write specifications.
Eliciting requirements with business owner, requirements organization, translating and simplifying requirements, communication.
Improves business processes and systems by studying current practices; designing modifications (process / workflows / user interface).
Develop an understanding of the data sources used in our business to explain limitations and propose viable solutions based on the requirements
Perform data analysis, discover and present insights to leadership on core business questions
Recommends controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures.
Provides references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation; providing help desk support; training users.
Prepares technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.
Assisting with the development of business cases.
 Qualifications
CBAP Certification desired
Min Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.
Proven history of working in a technology company
Detail oriented, analytical and inquisitive
Ability to work independently and with others
Extremely organized with strong time-management skills
Experience with Sabre, Travelport, Apollo.

Advises and recommends areas of program planning, business requirements management, budget execution and program coordination.
Prepares needs assessment. Validates resource requirements and develops cost estimate models.
Conducts and coordinates financial, product, market, operational, and related research to support strategic and business planning within the various departments and programs of the client group.
Interprets, evaluates, and interrelates research data, and develops integrated business analyses and projections for incorporation into strategic decision-making.
Plans and coordinates the development of primary and secondary market research studies in support of strategic planning and specific marketing initiatives, as required, and presents findings of studies to client committees.
Provides consultative, advisory, technical, and staff support, as appropriate.
Ability to use survey and market research methodologies, systems, and techniques.
Experience Level: BA or BS required plus minimum 3+ years of direct relevant experience.

Education, Certificates, Licenses: BS or BA required.

Knowledge: Advanced self-management skills for coordinating numerous, simultaneous engagements. Requires excellent communication and analytical skills. Extensive knowledge of industry standards and internal PacificSource benefits, policy and processes a plus. Responsible for accurate and reliable maintenance, documentation, and testing of internal systems. Highly familiar with MS Windows IT environments. Advanced MS Office Skills required. Requires strong math skills, including percentages, ratios, statistics, graphing and spreadsheet skills. Experience working in teams with other systems analysts, programmers, users, and managers. Excellent interpersonal skills for working with internal and external customers. Ability to clearly communicate in person and over the phone and is able to request and exchange information in a pleasant, respectful, and professional manner. Requires ability to define and prioritize problems and manage workload without direct supervision.

Veterinary Emergency Group is hiring a Business Analyst reporting directly to the President. This analyst will be involved in every strategic aspect of the business and have significant opportunity for growth. High performers will be able to choose their future path with us.
This role is a blend of multiple roles: Business Analyst, Financial Analyst, Business Development, Assistant, Operations and Marketing – but the common thread is you’ll be incredibly important to our company. We have a start-up culture: casual attire, dog-friendly, coffee/tea & endless snacks, flexible hours, team outings, annual bonuses, medical, dental and vision benefits, 401K with company match, an unlimited vacation policy, true work/life balance, weekly groceries, and so much more.

At Emerson, we are innovators and problem-solvers, focused on a common purpose: leaving our world in a better place than we found it. Each and every day, our foundational values—integrity, safety and quality, supporting our people, customer focus, continuous improvement, collaboration and innovation—inform every decision we make and empower our employees to keep reaching higher. As a global technology and engineering leader, we provide groundbreaking solutions for customers in industrial, commercial, and residential markets. Our Emerson Automation Solutions business helps process, hybrid, and discrete manufacturers maximize production and protect personnel and the environment while optimizing their energy and operating costs. Our Emerson Commercial & Residential Solutions business helps ensure human comfort and health, protect food quality and safety, advance energy efficiency and create sustainable infrastructure.

$80,000 - $120,000 a yearThe StoryFarmers and growers around the world are faced with constant challenges when it comes to farming, they are at the whim of market prices and weather changes, which is becoming increasingly more unpredictable and volatile. Until today, there hasn’t been any existing tools that bring the financial focus to the forefront, and connect that with actual performance and an accounting system to enable farmers and growers to better “weather the storm”.Who is Figured?Figured is a New Zealand born SaaS taking the Fintech world by storm by changing the course of the Agricultural industry. Figured started as a simple idea to keep ahead of the financial state of a farm and has grown into an award winning tech platform. The concept of Figured is about the farmer, accountant, consultant, and lenders collaborating in real time on the same set of farm data to gain insight into the financial performance of the farm. Together we have launched Magnify and building a stellar team to lead this product to the US market.Reporting to the Senior Vice President (USA), the Product Manager will play a critical role acting as the link between our Product Management and Development teams, key stakeholders and the wider business. Job Description
WHO ARE WE:

Vivint Smart Home is the leading provider of smart home services in North America. Vivint delivers an integrated smart home system with in-home consultation, professional installation and support delivered by its Smart Home Pros, as well as 24-7 customer care and monitoring. Dedicated to redefining the home experience with intelligent products and services, Vivint serves more than one million customers throughout the U.S. and Canada. Vivint is the largest tech employer in Utah, a certified Great Place to Work, and one of Fast Company’s World’s 50 Most Innovative Companies for 2017.

Our mission is to redefine the home experience through intelligently designed products and services delivered to every home by people who care.

WHAT WE STAND FOR:
Honesty and Integrity Come First
Do the right thing
Customer Obsession is Our Advantage
A relentless passion to serve the customer
Innovation is Essential
Today’s innovation is tomorrow’s lifeblood
We Win Together
Individuals win games: teams win championships
Exceptional is Expected
Talk is cheap: create value, not just motion
We Give Back
Helping people is core to our DNA
PERKS/BENEFITS:
Free catered lunch/snacks/drinks; new menu daily
Paid holidays and flexible paid time off
Employee pricing on smart home products
Casual dress code
Gym located at the Provo location
Health clinic located at the Provo location
Medical/dental/vision/life coverage
401(k) Plan & Matching
THE ROLE: Business Analyst
Join Vivint’s Business Analytics function supporting the call center senior leadership. The team focuses on solving Vivint’s highest priority and most impactful call center business problems including customer acquisition, customer retention, and operational challenges. If you enjoy using SQL, math, statistical tools, or Tableau to solve problems, you will fit right in. We will invest in you and help you think like a consultant to drive answers and action.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Work with business leaders to prioritize their highest value questions
Create answers and drive action by using Tableau, Excel, and PowerPoint to share insights
Write SQL efficiently to handle big data (we have five call center sites and receive millions of calls each year)
Lead cross functional teams in structuring and solving open ended problems
Present recommendations and strategies to multiple levels of the organization (front line agents to C-suite leaders)
Implement recommended solutions
REQUIRED SKILLS:
Experience with Tableau and SQL, or willing to study and learn these, since they will be your daily tools
Highly analytical with strong, demonstrated problem solving and critical thinking capabilities
Ability to influence and lead those that do not directly report to you
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree preferred
Ability to communicate (written and oral) clearly and concisely at all levels of the organization
“Owner’s” attitude, including a willingness to tackle problems through to solutions
Ability to work both independently and across functions
Successful track record of thriving in a fast paced, flexible environment
Ability to dynamically meet business needs (change is the norm)
Strong team player who places the best interests of the organization above personal objectives
Strong results-orientation

Detailed Description and Job Requirements
Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization*s financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.

Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Operations Spares Planner/Program Manager
Essential Functions and Duties
The Global Spares Inventory Planning (GSIP) group is responsible for assuring the availability of spare parts and upgrade kits for regional depots in North America, Europe, and Asia. Planning methods rely on both the analysis of historical consumption and the technical expertise of new product evaluation, executed through the SAP Enterprise Resource Planning system and an integrated commercial multi-echelon planning application. The Product-Based Planning group within GSIP is responsible for assuring the availability of spare parts to achieve several key objectives:
Meet all spares deliverables for each PDR Phase Review:
Successfully support start-up schedules for all NPI (New Product Introduction) tools
Holding PG/NPT accountable for PDR deliverables
Deliver spares material to meet E&O and Asset performance goals.
Analysis of inventory and service level data for KPI objectives, and associated root-cause and corrective action in coordination with Regional Operations.


Within the Product-Based Planning group, the current opening is for an Operations Spares Planner to ensure correct sparing decisions for NPI tools at the direction of Lam's Global Product Group.
Qualifications
BA/BS Operations/Materials Management or equivalent (APICS CPIM/CSCP preferred)
10 years of experience in an MRP-based Planning (ERP/MRP planning is a must - SAP experience strongly preferred)
Experience in service/spare parts planning is strongly preferred
Experienced in NPI/PDR deployments/implementations (Including ECR/ECO knowledge is preferred)
Advanced level proficiency in MS Excel and Access
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills supporting the ability to solve complex cross-functional issues with multi-dimensional, conflicting needs.
Excellent written and oral communication skills; ability to create and deliver presentations at peer and/or director level
Semiconductor capital equipment product knowledge and relevant experience in the semiconductor industry is a plus
Demonstrated ability to influence constructively across functions and organization levels

job_description:
Our mission as a leading investment management firm is to help our clients achieve their long-term financial goals. We believe our associates are the key to this mission and we are always looking for talented individuals who share our commitment to our client’s success.

If you’re looking for challenging work experiences and the ability to learn in a collaborative culture, we invite you to explore the opportunities available at T. Rowe Price.


PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE POSITION

The Retirement Plan Services (RPS) reporting Business Analyst supports all RPS business units through plan and participant data analysis and reporting across the RPS line of business (Omni, TRAC and I/O). Report types are ad-hoc, recurring, and project-related to support T. Rowe Price’s presence in the retirement industry and provides internal clients financial and service-specific information. The analyst ensures data and report consistency and enforces policies for all published data. Acts as primary liaison between the business user of data and the GBS&T team for day-to-day troubleshooting and on new product initiatives. Mines data and performs ongoing analysis in search of trends and data anomalies. Plays a major role in any infrastructure reporting projects.

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES

On a daily basis, analyzes assigned report requests, contacts requestor to clarify and understand desired output. Based on analysis, determines if a solution already exists, or proceeds with report documentation and develops report. Performs and leads efforts for data mining in response to specific questions and in support of RPS initiatives. Uses basic oral and written communication skills to make technical and non-technical material understandable. Insures reports are verified, formatted adhering to General Manager Group standards, delivered and posted on the discovery site as applicable.

Participates in projects, as assigned. Investigates and recommends solutions for reporting and system enhancements for more effective utilization. Participates in documenting business and functional requirements, and designs report mock-ups. Creates appropriate project documentation (i.e. glossary, testing strategy, progress reports, etc.) Plan, lead and participate in meetings in order to liaise with GBS&T and business units on various initiatives.

Expands data and reporting capabilities by integrating new data into the Cross Plan Reporting environment. Identifies gaps, documents need, defines data and participates in the development effort. Creates and document test plans and executes testing on all new data and resulting reports to insure a high level of quality.

Act as a subject matter expert (SME) on data projects managed outside of the Cross Plan Reporting environment, but utilizing RPS data.

QUALIFICATIONS

Required

College degree and 1 year of related work experience, or
Associate degree and 3 years related work experience, or
High School diploma/equivalent and 5 years related work experience
Retirement Plan Industry knowledge
Detail oriented and accurate
Independent thinker
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel and Word
Proficient in creating and executing SQL statements on Oracle, DB2 and SQL Servers platforms
Proven ability to form and foster strong positive business relationships
Ability to work in a team environment, draws conclusions, and initiates results
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with ability to interact with all levels of the organization
Responsive to client needs
Ability to multi-task, prioritize and make decisions

Preferred

4 year college degree in Business or Technology major with 4 years related work experience
Understanding of Database Management concepts
Use of Report Writing tool, such as Business Objects
Use of coding languages such as VBA
Experience with testing strategies, test cases and execution
In depth OMNI specific data knowledge

SemanticBits is looking for a Business Analyst capable of thriving on a scrum-based agile software development team; to help understand what users need and document those needs in the form of implementable and testable user stories. You will be part of a highly talented, dynamic development team that will be using a set of modern technologies (AngularJS, Node.js, RoR, MongoDB, ElasticSearch etc.), human-centered design, and DevOps approaches.
SemanticBits is a leading company specializing in the design and development of digital health services, and the work we do is just as unique as the culture we’ve created. We develop cutting-edge solutions to complex problems for commercial, academic, and government organizations. The systems we develop are used in finding cures for deadly diseases, improving the quality of healthcare delivered to millions of people, and revolutionizing the healthcare industry on a nationwide scale. There is a meaningful connection between our work and the real people who benefit from it; and, as such, we create an environment in which new ideas and innovative strategies are encouraged. We are an established company with the mindset of a startup and we feel confident that we offer an employment experience unlike any other and that we set our employees up for professional
success every day.

Conduct user research, draft user stories and meet with users to validate and enhance them
Create wireframes for the user stories and review them with users and gather feedback

Breakdown the roadmap into epics and group user stories under them
Work with the Scrum Master, customers and developers to write user stories which are independent, negotiable, valuable, estimable, small and testable
Responsible for ensuring user stories include validation criteria which reasonably covers all areas necessary for complete testing of the new functionality
Act as an interface and customer advocate to ensure customer, stakeholder and user needs are being addressed
Collaborate with and support developers during their design and development efforts to provide support for their analysis of the story
Provide additional support and guidance to clients during the implementation phase to include development of training resources
Participate as a member of the Development team
Validate that product deliveries meet customer requirements and drive product demos
Represent the customer and users during backlog grooming sessions and internal demos
Improve and expand knowledge and skill sets with regard to current trends and changes in software development industry and be up to date with latest design trends
Proactively contribute to the quality of the product by seeking and proposing new or alternative approaches to address the requirements
Participate in Sprint Planning, Sprint Reviews, Scrum Meetings and other agile activities

About the Company
Lincoln Financial Group, a Fortune 250 company with over 10,000 employees, provides advice and solutions that help empower Americans to take charge of their financial lives with confidence. Our core business areas — Life Insurance, Annuities, Retirement Plan Services and Group Protection — focus on supporting, preserving and enhancing over 17 million customer’s lifestyles and retirement outcomes.
Headquartered in Radnor, Pennsylvania, Lincoln Financial Group is the marketing name for Lincoln National Corporation (NYSE: LNC) and its affiliates. The company had $253 billion in assets under management as of December 31, 2017.
Ranked one of the Best Large Employers in America by Forbes magazine, Lincoln Financial Group makes a serious investment in our employees’ futures through a broad range of wealth accumulation and protection plans, health and wellness programs, and career development resources designed to help each individual reach their personal and professional goals.

The Role
This Sr Analyst, Business Systems Analysis represents Annuity Valuation as the areas' business systems expert on various IT initiatives that impact the Annuity business. Directs the development and maintenance of data feeds from the administrative and compensations systems to the Annuity valuation systems. Ensures the Annuity Valuation is prepared to meet regulatory requirements associated with the development of new products and the maintenance of in-force business, and ensures the quality and integrity of data feeds to the Annuity valuation systems.
RESPONSIBILITIES .
Coordinates the definition and analysis of valuation data extract requirements for systems and process designs.
Serves as liaison between valuation unit, Project Management Office, and IT vendors providing system development (such as DXC, CTS, Ensono).
Develops testing and/or auditing procedures to ensure ongoing data integrity.
Oversees testing activities from a valuation perspective to ensure timely, quality testing of all system changes impacting the valuation process.
Gathers data and performs analysis to evaluate the impact of product development initiatives on valuation extracts.
Identifies system enhancements required to meet the changing business and regulatory environment.
Provides direction, analysis, and decision making support for the successful resolution of valuation issues on projects.
Manages, tracks, and communicates the status of projects (including achievements, issues, and so on) to upper management, project participants and/or other stake holders.
Facilitates the resolution of complex business issues by identifying an alternative course of action based on business needs and regulatory requirements.
Negotiates and manages project priorities through coordination of resources with Project Leaders of Project Management Office and/or vendors.
Coordinates and manages the submission of valuation related Fast Tracks.
Maintains a broad knowledge base of the Insurance and Financial Services Industry.
Maintains expertise in various annuity markets, products and systems.
Updates and maintains, for SOX, appropriate SDLC documentation for ServiceNow incident tickets, fast tracks, independent projects, and release initiatives and monthly reconciliations.
Updates and maintains various admin system tables and/or files for Annuity Valuation processes.
Coordinates and manages the submission of valuation related incident tickets through ServiceNow and monitors progress.
Availability to work evenings and weekends, as needed, during month-ends and during critical periods in a project’s life cycle.
Participates in strategic development projects that vary in complexity including the business aspect of analysis, design and development efforts, and testing and implementation efforts.
Carries out duties in compliance with all state and federal regulations and guidelines. Complies with all company and site policies and procedures.
No relocation, minimal travel
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
Specific and in-depth product (existing and new products) and administrative systems knowledge.
3-5 years of diverse systems and business experience.
2+ years of annuities experience or equivalent desired.
Ability to effective manage data extracts, data control and calculate liability for the business for financial set asides. #LI-AY1

If you are seeking a role that offers you the opportunity to work with Federal clients through critical issues, consider a career in Deloitte’s Federal Technology practice.

Work you’ll do

As a Project Delivery Sr. Analyst in the Technology group you will:
Support Implementation and Operations Management best practices
Lead and support tasks on engagements related but not limited to Systems Implementation, Operations & Maintenance, Helpdesk Operations and Software Application Development & Maintenance
Create and/or support project deliverables
Perform analysis and diagnose client issues while demonstrating an understanding of the client environment and overall project scope
The Team

Transparency, innovation, collaboration, sustainability: these are the hallmark issues shaping Federal government initiatives today. Deloitte’s Federal practice is passionate about making an impact with lasting change. Carrying out missions in the Federal practice requires fresh thinking and a creative approach. We collaborate with teams from across our organization in order to bring the full breadth of Deloitte, its commercial and public sector expertise, to best support our clients. Our aspiration is to be the premier integrated solutions provider in helping to transform the Federal marketplace.

Our Technology team works with clients to help them develop custom software solutions, manage their applications and databases, and provide strategic recommendations to help them optimize their businesses’ operations, processes, and performance.

Qualifications

Required:
Typically has 3 or more years of consulting and/or industry experience
Ability to learn IBM mainframe Language Code (ALC)
Ability to read and understand (at a high level) application program code
Ability to explain technical implementation details to non-technical person in business terms
Ability to work independently, under general guidance
Ability to lead project deliverables through to completion
Experience working in a team environment
Professional oral and written communication skills
Relevant software or application skills to complete job successfully
Problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment
Ability to obtain and maintain the required clearance for this role
Experience or knowledge in reverse engineering documentation activities to include:
Analyzing the structure of IBM Assembler language programs to capture business logic and functionality executed in mission critical programs
Create Call Graphs to depict hierarchical structure of blocks of code, and shared subroutines

Preferred:
Prior professional services or federal consulting experience
Bachelor’s Degree
Background in programming and software development
Previous experience or knowledge in IBM Assembler Language (ALC) coding techniques
Previous knowledge or experience in tax processing processes
How you’ll grow
At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

Benefits
At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.

Deloitte’s culture
Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives.

Corporate citizenship
Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on the world.

Recruiter tips
We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you’re applying to. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.

McDonald’s, one of the most recognized brands in the world, is seeking a skilled and experienced Business analyst to modernize back office. The USIT back office actively leads multiple initiatives to retire ISP (Current back office applications platform) and migrate to modern back office platform.

A successful candidate will be required to manage requirements , review and provide feedback to design and lead/support various testing for multiple cross functional back office projects from conception to completion, partnering with multiple stakeholders including business partners, vendors, and internal team members.

This role requires experience with requirements gathering and partnering successfully with business stakeholders and internal team members on delivering solutions per their requirements. This position reports to Senior Project Manager.

Responsibilities

The Senior Business Analyst responsibilities include (but not limited to):


Develops and maintains a thorough understanding of the needs of the business group from the business and technical perspective.
Works closely with US IT Business requirements team and other business partners to capture business requirements and see them through implementation.

Assist in prioritizing the requests with the business and technology team project leads or managers.
Support the business by becoming the Subject Matter Expert for the applications. Co-ordinate with other IT and business groups.
Interfacing with the other I/T and business groups as needed.
Responsible in performing analysis, design, test plan creation, building and execution of test scenarios/scripts, as well as the manage User acceptance test.
Responsible for creating/updating documents required as part of the system development lifecycle (business & functional requirements, functional test scripts, Use Case and process documents).
Assist in documenting the project plans including the communication, training, and deployment.
Manage and Co-ordinate User Acceptance testing process.
Assist with application production support issues when necessary. Provide business process and technical direction to the support team when needed.

SUMMARY:
The Business Intelligence Analyst works to identify business intelligence, reporting and data analysis needed to support the Company’s service delivery model and present results to its clients. The BI Analyst engages with the Company’s executive team, business operations and client services teams to build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to identify and address critical issues and provide data that is accurate, reliable and easy to consume.
PRIMARY DUTIES:
Collects, interprets and translates business needs into data requirements from stakeholders.
Designs, builds, tests and delivers comprehensive data analysis and reports for stakeholders
Collaborates with operational and executive leadership to define and deliver Key Performance Indicators and other trending metrics needed to operate the business
Designs, builds, tests and delivers a variety of operational and client reports, dashboards, alerts and ad hoc reporting
Accesses, extracts, utilizes and merges data from different sources, formats, platforms and systems
Exercises leadership and independent judgement, providing recommendations to business partners to identify and solve problems
Independently identifies patterns and trends and provide new insights to the business
Creates new structures for capturing data
Presents complex data to non-technical end-users in a clear and concise manner through reporting visualization tools
Identifies and executes opportunities to automate data projects
Manages a backlog of projects, establishes priorities and multi-tasks
Writes and maintains documentation of reporting requirements or other reusable knowledge assets
Performs data scrubbing techniques to ensure data accuracy; including parsing, data transformation, duplicate elimination and statistical modeling
Maintains and/or update business intelligence tools, databases, dashboards, systems or methods with updated requirements and new data sets
Researches, evaluates and interfaces with developers and technology vendors


EEEENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITES:
To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:
Analytical - Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data.
Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem solving situations; Uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics.
Interpersonal Skills - Focuses on solving conflict, not blaming; Maintains confidentiality; Listens to others without interrupting; Keeps emotions under control; Remains open to others' ideas and tries new things.
Oral Communication - Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions; Demonstrates group presentation skills; Participates in meetings.
Written Communication - Writes clearly and informatively; Edits work for spelling and grammar; Varies writing style to meet needs; Presents numerical data effectively; Able to read and interpret written information.
Teamwork - Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views; Gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit
Ethics - Treats people with respect; Keeps commitments; Works with integrity and ethically; Upholds organizational values.
Motivation - Demonstrates persistence and overcomes obstacles; Measures self against standard of excellence; Takes calculated risks to accomplish goals.
Professionalism - Approaches others in a tactful manner; Reacts well under pressure; Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; Accepts responsibility for own actions; Follows through on commitments.
Adaptability - Adapts to changes in the work environment; Manages competing demands; Changes approach or method to best fit the situation; Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.
Initiative - Volunteers readily; Undertakes self-development activities; Seeks increased responsibilities; Takes independent actions and calculated risks; Looks for and takes advantage of opportunities; Asks for and offers help when needed.
Innovation - Displays original thinking and creativity; Meets challenges with resourcefulness; Generates suggestions for improving work; Develops innovative approaches and ideas; Presents ideas and information in a manner that gets others' attention


QUALIFICATIONS:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor’s degree or higher in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Systems or related field, with 3-5 years professional experience in BI Analysis including data analysis, report writing and/or development experience.


COMPUTER SKILLS:

Advanced proficiency with Structured Query Language (SQL), ableau, Cognos or MS Power BI. Proficiency in project management applications strongly desired.

Loeb Enterprises is a New York based business development lab and private investor, focused on cultivating opportunities in emerging media and consumer marketing. Loeb Enterprises, led by entrepreneur and highly successful CEO Michael Loeb, maintains a team of world-class operators, direct marketing executives and technologists that apply themselves to a select number of strategically important businesses each year. These companies vary by stage—from pure start-ups to mature businesses in need of reinvention—but are alike in that they leverage Loeb’s proven blend of business vision and operational skills toward superior value creation.
The analytics team works across a diverse range of businesses to help determine and implement a data-driven strategy. In some cases, this could mean establishing and tracking financial KPIs. In others, it could mean segmenting and optimizing marketing campaigns. In others still, it may involve building data pipelines and implementing advanced statistical algorithms. We are a highly collaborative team that enjoys turning data into insights and ultimately business value.

The position will focus on helping very early-stage companies develop an initial strategy and assisting to maintain existing reports for more mature ones. It is a position with lots of exposure to multiple industries and lots of opportunity for growth.

Develop visualizations and dashboards for a broad range of end users
Present strategic insights and actionable recommendations
Ensure data and analytics projects meet client objectives
Define and evaluate KPIs across various campaigns and tests
Create predictive models to forecast patterns in consumer behavior
Coordinate with various teams to develop BI systems and minimize complexity
Use SQL queries to dig deep into data
Verify data accuracy and find outliers
Organize, maintain, and enhance reporting systems

Strong work ethic
Intellectual curiosity
Data analysis
Data visualization
Tableau, Power BI, Excel
SQL and data warehouse concepts
Python would be a plus
