Job Summary
Positions within this family explore and profile data, draw business inferences, complete analysis and clearly articulate findings for a target audience. This position performs accountabilities under general supervision. Position is an intermediate level role, requiring solid previous experience in Descriptive Analytics. Position accountable for performing core tasks of Descriptive Analytics (the exploration and investigation of past business performance). This job may lead others. Definition of General Supervision: incumbents are told what to do, but not how to do it. Incumbents have some discretion on work accountabilities.

Marketing Description
Travelers Risk Control has an exciting opportunity within Business Intelligence & Analytics for a Manager, Business Performance Analytics. Our Business Performance Analytics team is responsible for completing in-depth analysis to guide data-driven business decisions within Travelers Business Insurance. This position requires a candidate with a strong analytical mindset, problem solving skills, technical acumen, and the ability to logically maneuver through ambiguous business problems that may not have a clear solution. A successful candidate will be an excellent team-player, as this position requires significant partnership with Risk Control leadership, Underwriting leadership, Actuarial, and Business Intelligence & Analytics groups across the Enterprise. This position does not manage, but future management opportunities may be available for motivated, effective, and capable staff.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities
Applies descriptive analytics to analyze data and validate assumptions, understand and may articulate results to a narrow audience.
Identifies, selects and extracts relevant data from various internal and external sources.
Manipulates raw data sets into information fit for analysis independently.
Monitors data to recognize patterns and analyzes trends independently.
Presents analysis and recommendations to business partners.
Develops reporting to monitor business critical results and transitions to appropriate area for continuing production (i.e. information development and or data management).
Provides required analysis, partnering with business analyst and managers.
Contributes to completing reasonability and validation tests using general business knowledge
Leads and participate in the peer review process.
Utilizes standardized peer review best practices.
Utilizes established best practices around Descriptive Analytics. May provide input into best practices.
May provide guidance to others on assignments.
Manages assigned projects independently.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelors degree or equivalent education and 3 years analytics experience or 4 years analytics experience.

Education, Work Experience & Knowledge
Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, finance, computer science, statistics, MIS or equivalent experience preferred.
Typically has a minimum of 4-6 years of experience in Descriptive Analytics or related field.
4+ years working successfully with Microsoft office products and software/programming applications specific to business supported.
General knowledge of Descriptive Analytic practices and processes.
General knowledge of Insurance products/concepts required.
Previous experience influencing others preferred.
General knowledge of the main features of the collection of data and the relationship of data elements to each other.
General Knowledge: Possesses sufficient knowledge to perform most work in normal situations.
Job Specific & Technical Skills & Competencies
General understanding of the business functions, processes, and overall business strategies of businesses supported.
Demonstrated intermediate analytic and diagnostic skills.
Demonstrated intermediate interpersonal skills.
Demonstrated intermediate communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Demonstrated ability to influence others.
Intermediate project management skills.
Demonstrated ability to see results to completion.
Intermediate business acumen.
Intermediate Computer Skills in Excel, database programming language and related applications.
Intermediate problem solving and decision making skills.
Ability to interact effectively with others across functions.
Ability to think strategically.
Ability to consider others ideas seriously and accept feedback.
Builds and maintains credibility with others.
Definition of Intermediate skill/competency level: demonstrates solid knowledge and ability; can apply the competency with minimal or no guidance, in the full range of typical situations.
Requires guidance handling novel or more complex situations.
Preferred Qualifications
Excellent organizational, communication, and presentations skills – The ability logically convey complex analysis to a less-technical audience
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel (i.e. Pivot tables) and Powerpoint
Intermediate programming experience preferred (SQL, SAS, Python, R, etc)
General understanding and experience with data visualization preferred (i.e. Qlikview)
Physical Requirements
Requires extended periods of computer use Requires extended periods of sitting.

Strong use of concepts: Understands a situation or problem by putting the pieces together, seeing the larger picture. This includes identifying patterns or connections between situations that are not obviously related, identifying key or underlying issues in complex situations, using creative conceptual, inductive reasoning to apply existing concepts to define innovative ideas. More intuitive than rational approach of situations or problems by first trying to find the abstract meaning of things rather than the concrete nature.
Analytical capability: Able to break down complex problems into simple manageable units, develops solutions for each unit, and integrates them back into the whole. Can absorb ideas quickly and apply them pragmatically.
Adaptability: Able to adjust to new environments, work effectively in varied situations and function in changing circumstances with a minimum of confusion or loss of productivity.
Results oriented: Setting goals and priorities that maximize the use of resources available to consistently deliver quality results.

Callisto Media was inspired by a single, transformational idea: harness the power of big data to produce timely content that enables consumers to lead richer, healthier, more fulfilled lives.

With deep roots in technology and publishing, Callisto Media harnesses the disruptive power of Big Data, creating unparalleled insights into consumer demand and the science of content. Our titles uniquely serve the needs of the reader, enjoy consistent profitability, and delve into the long tail of opportunity.

We have an enterprising, collaborative culture and are backed by leading Silicon Valley venture capitalists. We use proprietary technology to identify and meet consumer demand by delivering timely content in sync with the market. We’re an intellectually curious team made up of driven analysts, editors, designers, marketers, and engineers based in the Bay Area and New York City who are aggressively expanding the breadth and depth of our portfolio in cooking, specialty diet, health and wellness, mind, body and spirit, parenting, kids, business and more.

Reporting to the Chief Product Officer and based in our headquarters in Emeryville, CA the New Business Analyst will be responsible for conducting market research and managing projects that are related to new product and/or channel development.

We are looking for a very bright, intellectually curious, highly self-motivated, and extremely organized individual that thrives on investigative research and analysis and getting things done.
Does this describe you?
You have exceptional problem-solving skills and are able to break big unknowns down into actionable pieces and steps and investigate accordingly.
You can write clearly and persuasively and outline arguments in ways that all stakeholders can easily understand.
You are comfortable cold emailing and cold calling people to gather information and generate potential partnerships.
You are a skilled presenter and can put together documents and presentations that explain your findings on complex things simply.
You have a reasonable eye for design; your documents and presentations have a high level of fit and finish.
You love personally managing projects with multiple internal and external stakeholders from idea to completion.
You are comfortable working on tight deadlines and have an inclination toward quickly solving problems.
No task is too small – you’re eager to pitch in across the full spectrum from data entry to managing relationships with potential partners.
Join us! We are a team where data drives our decisions. Where culture matters. We put our customers first and they embody our core values. We’re entrepreneurial and focused in our approach. We challenge each employee to experiment and drive results while feeling empowered to do their best work each and every day.

Callisto Media offers a competitive salary, full benefits, 401k, stock options, for full-time employees, as well as a friendly working environment. This is a full-time, onsite position.

Capable of dealing effectively as a liaison between client and systems communities. Strong working knowledge of functions and workflow in the supported business area. Understanding of the systems and transactions supporting the business functions. Solid working knowledge of systems design processes, methodology, business process flow and testing tools. Knowledge with analytical testing utility tools. Works independently and serves as a resource on departmental projects. Current with technological trends and advances.

-Problem Solving Skills - performs basic assessments of routine situations, following the correct steps and using tools to make straight-forward decisions. Seeks guidance when necessary.

Contribute. Grow. Lead...with OxyChem. Looking for a challenge? Desire to achieve your true potential? OxyChem is a growing, action-oriented, safety driven chemical manufacturing company continually striving to be the best in the business while staying focused on environmental protection. The secret to our success has and will continue to be our people.

Occidental Chemical Corporation (OxyChem) is a leading North American manufacturer of polyvinyl chloride (PVC) resins, chlorine and caustic soda – key building blocks for a variety of indispensable products such as plastics, pharmaceuticals and water treatment chemicals. Other OxyChem products include caustic potash, chlorinated organics, sodium silicates, chlorinated isocyanurates and calcium chloride. For every product it makes, OxyChem’s market position is No. 1 or No. 2 in the U.S.

Provide financial/accounting expertise to OxyChem business teams including effective analysis regarding short and long term performance forecasts and actual performance results

Coordinate with accounting and cross-functional departments on financial closings, plans and projects
Provide routine and ad-hoc financial support to management and business teams as required for product line profitability, product integration impact, asset optimization and other value-added analysis

5-10 years of professional financial/accounting experience required

Strong verbal and written communication skills
Prioritization, organization and timely decision making skills

We are a nonprofit that launches careers for military veterans and underserved young adults through consultancy positions with our client companies. We place individuals looking to launch their careers where they learn and grow with our client. Our consultants are provided with a mentor to ensure they are maturing and becoming successful, professional employees.
After a candidate applies, WOS will work to match that candidate's skill set with the requirements of a current, or future, position. We then work on the candidate's behalf to place them with one of our partners as a consultant.
All of our positions are full-time, entry level opportunities. Individuals will receive an hourly wage in addition to our benefits package.

Job Description
New Selling Partners are the lifeblood of the Amazon Marketplace, and we are currently expanding the number and types of programs that we offer these partners to ensure that their business is successful on Amazon. As such, we are seeking an experienced Business Analyst who can work with our Sales and Marketing teams to uncover insights that will allow us to accelerate performance and optimize productivity.

In this role, you'll create systems and tracking mechanisms that draw from a wealth of quantitative and qualitative data to measure our performance against our goals and to develop insights on how we can improve performance. These insights will play a key role in making decisions on how we expand or contract programs and how these programs are adopted at scale worldwide. You will also help us create new ideas for how to better serve our Selling Partners and work with teams to test ideas (and scale successful ones).

The ideal candidate will be a naturally inquisitive self-starter who can dig deep into data to make connections that others might miss. You'll translate those connections into actions that can be taken to drive our business, and you'll use your strong communication skills to confidently influence all levels of the organization...and you'll be comfortable working within a team of business partners who view you as the indispensable resource who can help them with their data needs.
Basic Qualifications
4+ years of experience as a Business/Financial Analyst, BI Engineer or Systems Analyst preferably in an internet-based company with large, complex data sources
Proficient in multiple flavors of SQL, (e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redshift)
Experience in data visualization platforms (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Quicksight)
Ability to take complex business problems and translate them into clear and accurate results
Proven analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause/ analyses
Ability to prioritize multiple concurrent projects while still delivering timely and accurate results
Demonstrated ability to work effectively with Data Engineers and BI Engineers to mine the right data sources efficiently and accurately
Strong verbal and written communications skills at an executive level that enable you to explain complex insights with clarity and precision
Bachelor's degree in Data Analytics, Quantitative Analysis, or Statistics
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working with both business and operations teams with deep experience on existing systems and data sources
Master’s degree, MBA or equivalent experience in Data Analytics, Quantitative Analysis, or Statistics

ConsenSys is a venture production studio and the leading technology firm in blockchain globally. We deliver products, solutions and platforms built using blockchain technology to transform how business is done in complex network of buyers, suppliers and consumers.

Our teams are busy at work building the future of identity, financial markets, commerce, the music industry, security, and infrastructure, and more. To accomplish this we've built out a flat organizational structure which we call the ConsenSys Mesh: a network of individuals & teams working autonomously and towards the same goal. Our mission is to use these decentralized solutions to fundamentally reshape the economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet. If you are someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us.

About Viant at ConsenSys:
Viant is a blockchain-based platform for modeling business processes, tracking assets and building supply chains of the future. Leveraging cryptographic security and smart contracts, Viant provides organizations verifiable insights as assets are managed and propagated through the entire supply chain.

About the role:
The business analyst will play an integral part in supporting the successful outcomes of all activities, including but not limited to business development presentations, client deliverables, business planning, fundraising decks, and training material. This person will be responsible for translating a set of business needs/requirements and transforming them into high fidelity deliverables.

This role does not come neatly packaged or defined. You should expect it to change during your time at ConsenSys, to evolve as our organization evolves. What does that mean for you? We think that means you will have an opportunity to create an exciting role with plenty of growth potential over time.

When we interview you, we will be looking for people with high levels of emotional intelligence who are also intellectually curious, always professional, dynamic in conversation, charismatic, and persuasive. You must be able to ask specific yet articulate questions, quickly synthesize insights from patterns in conversation, and reflect back the key points from a conversation in order to get alignment, commitments, and lay out next steps.

Ability to travel 10-25+% may be required. Varies by location and team.

Requirements


1 - 5 years of experience as either as an analyst/associate in management consultant, investment banking or a similar role at a software company, preferably with supply chain technology or fin-tech experience.
BA/BS in related field or equivalent
Capable of managing multiple projects at once, effective at working with multiple stakeholders (both internal and external)
Extremely detail-oriented, self-directed, proactive, and accountable to meeting deadlines
Proficient at conducting market research, compiling / modeling data, and citing sources.
Proficient with producing the following deliverables and very conversant in both prose (doc) and storyboarding (slide) formats, with a particular emphasis on client management.
Startup/tech company experience a plus
Interest and up to date with the blockchain

Here are some of the perks of being part of a unique organization like ConsenSys:


The forefront of a revolution. At ConsenSys we fundamentally believe that a next generation of technologies presents the opportunity to create a more just and equitable society.
A dynamic startup environment. ConsenSys is a thought leader in the blockchain space and we are absorbing a significant portion of the mindshare. This is both exciting and challenging, as we learn to scale our organization while adhering to the principles of decentralization.
Continuous learning. You'll be constantly exposed to new languages, frameworks and ideas from your peers and as you work on different projects -- challenging you to stay at the top of your game.
Deep technical challenges. This entire ecosystem is about 10 years old. Ethereum itself is still a toddler. There is much work to be done before these platforms can scale to the order of millions or billions of users. ConsenSys is building the technology platforms that can get us to those next thresholds of scale.

Click here ( http://bit.ly/2J0PwfB ) for the latest updates from ConsenSys.

Description

JOB OVERVIEW:

This position is responsible for analyzing business performance to support/develop or test the strategic initiatives of customer management, product/business development, productivity optimization, and sales. They must possess excellent interpersonal skills and work well under tight time constraints.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Information Acquisition – compiles information necessary to review and report on performance of the division, vendors or customers using the Data Warehouse, Operating Systems, External Resources and/or other Resources as required
Analysis, Reporting & Recommendations – uses database programs spreadsheets, and other statistical and presentation software to analyze acquired information evaluating the performance of customers, developing pricing strategies, establishing performance patterns. Some of the analysis may be periodic in nature (e.g., weekly, monthly, quarterly) and others may be ad hoc – develops reports and presentations to communicate results and recommends business tactics and strategies based on findings.
RFP Submissions/Contracts – Review and submission of RFPs. Use of database for tracking and follow-up procedures. Working with Legal, Upper Management and Merchandise group troubleshooting issues and preparing documentation related to specific RFP requirements.
Departmental Documentation – prepares and maintains updated documentation on department procedures.

Participates in special projects and performs other duties as required.

SKILLS:


Exceptional understanding of the job and ability to apply knowledge and skills to complete a wide range of complex tasks. Complete tasks in creative and effective ways. Complete assignments and facilitate the work activities of others; may coordinate work beyond own area. Apply acquired knowledge of procedures and external regulations. May provide back-up process support for the Supervisor.

COMPLEXITY:


Consistently work on complex and unique assignments requiring independent action and a high degree of initiative to resolve issues. Make recommendations for new procedures. Analyze more complex technical or non-technical problems and suggest solutions where precedent may not exist.

SUPERVISION:


Work under minimal supervision and may act independently to determine methods and procedures on new assignments. Often act as a facilitator and team leader and may provide informal feedback. Provide training as needed.

Bachelor’s degree strongly preferred.

We are creating a national, digitally-integrated network of behavioral health providers that lets them focus on providing great care, while we provide the rest. This network, combined with a variety of software offerings, generates the data and capability needed to serve the consumers, employers and health systems looking to access high-quality behavioral health care.

Our therapist network continues to grow and requires a dedicated teammate to lead business intelligence and data analytics efforts.

The work will vary from day-to-day but the consistent theme is that you will work across SonderMind as the key point of contact for all business intelligence, data aggregation and analytics activities. You will be expected to:

Successfully conduct ad-hoc and regular reporting data requests
Set-up process to handle analytics requests from the whole SonderMind team
Be the expert on all key SonderMind data sources

Demonstrated ability to exercise extreme ownership of your workstreams, to follow through and make sure they're taken care of, and to ensure issues are escalated appropriately will be disproportionately valued in the interview process.

This is a ground-floor opportunity to grow with a venture capital-backed company with plans to become a national force for changing this important segment of healthcare. Our team is made up of experienced healthcare, technology and product professionals who work very hard and thrive in a fast-paced environment that is constantly changing. As an early team member, we will expect you to demonstrate a willingness to take risks and never act as a cog in the wheel.

Gotta Have This:

Demonstrated experience in collecting, organizing and analyzing key business performance metrics, to include developing actionable management reports
Demonstrated excellence in large-scale Excel analytics and modeling (e.g., pivot tables, H and Vlookups, large embedded IF statements, cell and range naming)
Ability to create dashboards and reports that communicate results to all members of the SonderMind team.
General understanding of statistics and a willingness to learn how to conduct such analyses (confidence intervals, probabilities, etc.)
Bachelor degree with a major or area of focus in STEM coursework.
At least 2 years of post-undergrad work experience.

Nice to Have This:

Experience in healthcare and/or fast-growing technology organizations
Experience with financial analysis
Strong SQL skills, coupled with experience using business intelligence tools and raw data sets.

Benefits
Experience and Career Growth. You will be part of the core team as the company enters a major growth phase. We always look to promote first from within and everyone on the team is taking on multiple roles. We don’t know how to say “that isn’t my job.”

Startup Environment. From our location directly across from Union Station, to an office with a Stormtrooper greeting people entering the office, to brick walls covered by whiteboards, things are changing and improving EVERY SINGLE DAY.

Health, Vision, Dental and 401k. Excellent employee benefits.

Therapy Benefits. Of course, we encourage our team to engage in proactively maintaining strong behavioral health and offer all employees access to SonderMind therapists.

How to Apply
Please apply with your resume and cover letter, providing an example that demonstrates why you would be an outstanding match for this role.

SonderMind Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.

$60,000 - $85,000 a yearPiper Companies is looking for a Software Business Analyst for a direct hire opportunity in Baltimore, MD to work within our clients fast-paced, mature agile team. Our client provides the platforms and systems that support more than 30 of the world’s leading privately-owned media and supplement companies. The Business Analyst will assist with all phases of the software development life cycle including gathering and translating business requirements into functional development specifications, following development tasks to completion, and investigating ways to optimize current functionality and processes.

Create design mocks using wireframe and prototyping software

Serve as a resource for engineering and quality assurance; clarifying requirements throughout the software development life cycle

Create and distribute release notes to customers and internal stakeholders
Work closely with the Product Manager to document product vision and roadmap
Support internal staff by communicating and training new functionality prior to releases
Work with Quality Assurance to record and/or review test plans, test scenarios, and test cases results in preparation for regression testing and product validation


Qualifications for the Software Business Analyst include:
BS in Information Technology, Computer Science, Software Engineering or related
2+ years of previous experience in software development business analysis
Previous experience in related software development life cycle activities or support
A fundamental understanding of Agile software development


Compensation and Benefits for the Software Business Analyst include:
Salary: $60,000-85,000 a year

About FedEx Supply Chain
FedEx Supply Chain, a subsidiary of FedEx Corp. (NYSE: FDX), is a leader in the third-party logistics industry offering a diverse service portfolio that enables commerce for businesses. With a proven track record of innovation and operational excellence, FedEx Supply Chain takes a consultative approach to optimize logistics processes, implement innovative technology and drive continuous improvement. By leveraging best practices and the world-renowned FedEx network, FedEx Supply Chain delivers leading solutions that provide flexibility, enable scalability and improve cost-effectiveness for customers. Through more than 11,000 employees, 130 operations and 35 million square feet of warehouse space, FedEx Supply Chain manages nearly 150 million packages and processes 358 million returns each year. For more information, go to supplychain.fedex.com.

We Have….
A strong FedEx brand consistently ranked among the world’s most admired and trusted employers.
A top notch leadership team with the experience needed to grow and develop your career.
An open mind for new ideas and creative methods.
A strong compensation and benefits package, including health, vision, dental, 401k with a strong match and much more!

General Summary….
The Business Analyst IV will be responsible for performing tasks involved in providing support and implementing business critical production environments utilizing best of breed Warehouse Management Systems along with interface systems exchanging high volume transactions between internal and external applications

This position will be responsible for…..
Hands on configuration of Manhattan WMOS WMS systems.
Participate in all phases of implementation and production support of applications and components in multi-technology, business-critical systems.
Gather requirements and design the most accurate and efficient solution possible.
Analyzing and reengineering repetitive failed processes to drive out risk
Work closely with development team to ensure that all have an accurate understanding of the solution to limit rework to the minimum.
Maintain understanding of interface specifications and configuration options.
Document requirements and solutions according to the business SDLC process.
Work with Implementation and program management teams to transition new customer and development projects into normal day to day activities.
Establish and maintain strong working relationships with co-workers, the business community, external customers, consultants, contractors, and vendors.
Stay up-to-date on current and future warehouse execution technologies, capabilities and trends.
Follow change control methodology in day-to-day activities.
Work to establish, maintain, and update strategy (methodology, processes, standards, tools, services) used in implementing supply chain systems.
Travel for projects as required
Follow corporate vision, mission and values in daily activities. Follow the highest ethical standards in all activities undertaken.
Provides for 24/7/365 coverage as needed using on call rotation in support of operations under time constraints and pressure situations.
Provide training to team members as needed.

You might be a great fit if….
Education/Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business, Engineering or related field preferred and 8-10 years of relevant experience.
In lieu of degree, high school diploma or GED and at least 10 years of relevant experience.
Requires 6 years of experience supporting or implementing Manhattan WMOS WMS systems.
Must be able to display ability to logically work through problems to create solutions so business operations contractual service level agreements are maintained.
Ability to work well in distributed teams with effective communication skills to ensure their tasks and ideas are effectively understood. This includes but is not limited to proactively providing status updates, identifying areas and opportunities for improvement, and escalation of problems and issues to managers.
Good Communication Skills with high degree of verbal and written proficiency both technical and operational and a professional attitude.
Knowledge of enterprise hardware platforms such as UNIX and/or Linux servers and Oracle relational databases is a plus.
Outgoing, action oriented self-starter who enjoys fast paced dynamic environments who works well individually and in a team.
Strong proficiency in Oracle SQL for application development.
Customer service driven.
Strong team player.

Physical/Cognitive Requirements
With or without accommodation:
Ability to follow policies and procedures.
Ability to read, write and interpret information.
Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide.
Ability to use hands to finger, handle, or feel.
Ability to sit/walk/stand for up to 8 hours per day.
Must possess visual acuity, i.e., close, distance, and color vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.

ADA – FedEx Supply Chain will make reasonable accommodations in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990. Reasonable accommodations are available for qualified individuals with disabilities throughout the subsequent application process.

Fed Ex Supply Chain is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Job Description:
Cohen & Company offers a full range of accounting, tax and consulting services to clients based throughout the United States. The firm serves dynamic, privately held companies and their owners as well as the investment industry, including public and private funds. Recognized as one of the top accounting firms in the country, Cohen & Company is rooted in technical excellence and is driven every day to listen, engage and deliver sustainable value. The firm was founded in 1977 and has more than 600 associates throughout Illinois, Maryland, Michigan, New York, Ohio, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin. What makes us different is our culture built on energy, discipline, results and — most importantly — personal commitment to our clients.

We are excited for the future and our continued growth! Our Information Technology team is seeking a talented individual in the role of Business Analyst. This position will reside in our Cleveland, Ohio office with some travel to other office locations (less than 10%).

The Business Analyst will be a member of the Information Technology team working in a team oriented environment supporting each of the firm’s business lines. The Business Analyst will work with key business stakeholders analyzing, eliciting, validating, and documenting business requirements, processes, and policies. The Business Analyst will serve as the bridge between business stakeholders and the technology team communicating requested changes to processes, policies, and information systems. In addition, the Business Analyst will be involved in creation of related training materials.

Responsibilities
Collaborate with key business stakeholders to gather information relating to business processes and needed improvements
Provide basic technology and business best practice guidance related to initiatives
Create consistent documentation appropriate for all key stakeholders (business and technical)
Resolve questions or issues relating to initiatives in order to present carefully reviewed requirements to key stakeholders for approval and implementation
Create and provide training to end-users as appropriate
Develop and work with QA to maintain testing plans
Assist in creation of policy and procedural documentation
Work to maintain and improve the firm’s business work flow and data flow processes and documentation
Facilitation and project management assistance for in-progress initiatives
Required Experience:
Core Competencies
Systems analysis, design, and development understanding
MS/SQL knowledge
Understanding of systems integration
Project management experience, ability to work with internal customers
Strong communication skills
Web, Internet, and technology savvy
Education and Experience Requirements
Bachelor of Science Degree
3+ years of IT Business Analyst, consulting or project management experience
CCBA, CBAP, IIBA Agile Analysis Certifications a plus
Qualifications
Keen sense of creative thinking, attention to detail and problem solving
Strong oral and written communications skills that demonstrate a professional demeanor and the ability to interact with others with discretion and tact; able to adapt style and tone to effectively engage the audience
Good collaboration skills, applied successfully across the organization
Knowledge of the professional services industry preferred
Experience in an Agile environment preferred
High level of proficiency with Microsoft Windows and Office Suite
Advanced skills with project management, diagramming, and data analysis tools. Analytical mindset.
Strong knowledge of software design, web, and multimedia applications
Ability to prioritize in a fast-paced environment
Organized and experienced at successfully multi-tasking
Self-motivated with the ability to complete projects in a timely manner
Accomplished at making complex concepts easily understood and remembered
Customer service orientation
Learn more about Cohen & Company at www.cohencpa.com and www.cohencpa.jobs.
We are an equal opportunity employer.
Keyword: Business Analyst
From: Cohen & Company

Job Description
We are looking for a Business Analyst to join the Prime Now Whole Foods Market and 3P team. Our vision is to enable Prime customers to be able to get ultra fast delivery and pickup of groceries from stores they love, driving incremental growth and frequency with Whole Foods and amazon. This Business Analyst will leverage deep dives and metrics to identify key drivers of the business and help establish the definition and reporting of input metrics that drive the business. You will be responsible for diving deep into financial and operational performance, and working with cross functional teams across business, operations, finance, and external partners. This is a highly visible role with direct, ongoing impact to the Whole Foods business on Prime Now.

The ideal candidate will be a general athlete and self-starter who is comfortable performing complex analysis and working with large data sets. He/she can quickly understand the key drivers of our performance across functions as we scale (including marketing/merchandising, inventory management, selection, service availability and costs of fulfillment, etc.), identify key differences relative to other Prime Now/Amazon businesses, and identify areas for improvement. The role will involve a wide range of real-world problem-solving situations, and will require the ability to form strong recommendations supported by robust data analysis.

This is an exciting opportunity to support a recently-launched service which will be highly visible to customers and leadership, and will require a significant amount of autonomy and thought leadership. You will be part of a high-functioning, fast-moving team responsible for delivering on strategic goals with direct impact for our customers.

Responsibilities include:
Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards on the key drivers of our business, and across a broad range of metrics.
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Develop think-big ideas in relation to this brand new customer offering and make recommendations for new metrics, techniques, and strategies to improve performance

Successful candidates will demonstrate the following:
Have a passion for sourcing, manipulating, and visualizing data
Present to stakeholders, clearly communicating strategic findings and recommendations
Translate technical concepts into business terms
Work in rapidly changing and complex environment
Deliver key metrics to measure overall performance and provide foundation for continuous improvement
Learn new technologies, processes, and tools
Independently identify and set priorities in an ambiguous, fast-moving environment
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in finance, statistics, mathematics or related field preferred.
2-4 years experience as a Business Analyst, in finance, or in another quantitative field.
Advanced proficiency in Excel or similar analytical tools.
Strong bias for action: ability to work successfully in a dynamic, ambiguous environment.
Excellent interpersonal skills; ability to work successfully with functional teams across the organization.
Ability to display complex quantitative data in a simple, intuitive format and to present findings in a clear and concise manner.
Exceptional attention to detail.
Enthusiasm for developing new ideas and creative solutions.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience utilizing SQL and working with large datasets.

Our Company
At Adobe, we’re changing the world. How? We give people the tools to bring their ideas to life and create content that makes life more fun and work more meaningful. We give businesses and organizations the power to truly engage their customers. We’re the ones behind the gorgeously designed content that streams across your laptop, TV, phone, and tablet every day – and we’re the ones who harness the massive power of big data to help companies move from data to insight to action by delivering content that people crave most.
We’re a company that understands that product innovation comes from people innovation, and that’s why we invest in cultivating leaders throughout the organization. If you’re passionate about leading from where you sit, join us.

Adobe Customer Solutions
Adobe Customer Solutions offers consulting, account management, and training services to customers worldwide. If you are passionate about driving the digital transformation of some of the world’s leading brands, Adobe’s professional services organization is the place for you.

Role Summary
The Business Analyst will provide reporting and analytical support to deliver performance reporting and insights to the ACS Professional Services organization. You will work with the broader Analytics team and ACS business Leadership to support the development of key metrics that provide insights into Adobe Professional Services performance worldwide. You will support company forecasting and planning processes. You will support the development of reports that give insights into past performance, current trajectories, and forecast future performance against all financial and operational KPI’s. You will assist in crafting processes to support ACS growth and scale.

What You’ll Do
Build repeatable, scalable, functional reporting that can be leveraged for operational and strategic decision making.
Assist in growing the business’ usage of Business Intelligence tools to drive efficiency in reporting.
Identify and close gaps in reporting across revenue, bookings, OpEx, and utilization.
Build reports and the supporting analysis for quarterly business reviews.
Work on problems of diverse scope and evaluate identifiable factors for analysis.

Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.

If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age , sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

Job Description
Amazon's Customer Service (CS) department is seeking an experienced business analyst to join the WW CS Consumer Operations Insights and Standards (COINS) team. We are looking for an outstanding business analyst to join us in delivering a new business process improvement platform, which sets a new standard for the speed, quality and customer satisfaction by which we resolve business problems, respond to changes and opportunities and enable people across the company to contribute to process improvement.
As we‘re combining a suite of enabling technologies in the areas of model-driven development, business process management and business intelligence, we’re creating solutions that let business analysts perform the complete cycle of delivering better automated solutions from engaging customers and prioritizing opportunities, through automating and testing the improved solution with little or no involvement of software engineers, to training and tracking the delivered business impact.

This position can be located in any NA CS site (including CPT and SJO) and could require travel up to 20%.
**This role requires a valid visa/work permit**

Key responsibilities
Support and contribute to COINS achieving functional goals.
Analyse metrics, key indicators and other available data sources to discover root causes of process defects.
Works across multiple internal & external teams. May lead virtual teams in completing projects/activities.
Engage directly with our internal customers to find, prioritize, improve and assimilate better business processes.
Scope, document and submit requirements for systems changes, backed up by business case and impact analysis.
Propose simple, scalable and effective ideas and best practices in your domain of expertise.
Analyze and model data, processes and business rules.
Continuously track the realized business value and ongoing customer satisfaction from delivered solutions, be it self-service, automation or customers contacting CS.
Independently performing analysis using tools like SQL, MicroStrategy, Tableau and R.
Basic Qualifications
Basic qualifications
Analytical mindset and ability to see the big picture and influence others.
Degree in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Quantitative Finance or Operational Research, or equivalent professional experience.
3+ years of experience working in Business Analysis, Analytics, Business Intelligence, or a comparable role.
Experience of modelling techniques and methods.
Experience working with databases and SQL in a business environment.
Demonstrated knowledge of MS Excel.
Demonstrated use of analytical packages and query languages such as SQL and R.
Prior experience in design and execution of analytical projects.
Experience working with large scale databases and data warehouses.
Detail-oriented with aptitude for solving unstructured problems.
Strong oral, written and presentation skills combined with the ability to lead group discussions and explain complex solutions.
Ability to work effectively in a multi-task, high volume environment.
Ability to be adaptable and flexible in responding to deadlines and workflow fluctuations.
Preferred Qualifications
Preferred qualifications
Exposure to software development.
Additional language skills could be advantageous but not essential.

Jr. Business Analyst (Engage)

 Outbrain is seeking a highly-motivated Junior Business Analyst ready to make a difference in bringing insights and a broad need for data to the business.
The Business Analytics team supports the global business on both the Amplify (brand and agency campaigns) as well as Engage (publisher).
This is a unique opportunity to build a career in Business Analytics working in a dynamic global technology company and gain visibility of your work across all levels of management.

 For this role, we are committed to finding a highly analytical data analysis expert, who is passionate about Business issues with an ability to communicate findings clearly at any level of the Business.
This is an opportunity to work on cutting-edge innovative analysis, and utilizing data to aid business decisions with business units such as Account Management, Sales, Business Development and Senior Management.

Responsibilities:
Working on deeper insights and analysis to help decide next steps and course of action for both Amplify and Engage customers as well as our Business teams
Conceptualizing, building and automating internal facing dashboards and reports, reflecting the performance and activities of the business against its main KPIs
Working with our international BI teams in New York and Israel to share knowledge, data, insights and best practice.
Working closely with the Account Management teams to create and automate client-facing reports or account reviews

Your first year should look like this:
In your first month, you should find your bearings, do a deep dive into the Outbrain product, data infrastructure, and systems, and start getting experience on the role by supporting and shadowing other analysts
After three months, you will be comfortable with our data infrastructure and have a good knowledge of what piece of data is needed to answer each specific request, and how to access and package this data.
You will also start having a strong understanding of the Business and will be able to work independently on most day to day ad-hoc requests.
After six months, you will be an expert on both the data and business sides of the role.
You will be a go-to person to help analyze Campaign or Business performance and will be owning longer-term projects to help define and give visibility on Business performance.
When you finish up your first year, you be an essential part of the Business Analysis team, having substantially increased and improved the teams output and processes

Requirements:
1 years+ of professional experience as a data/business analyst with a familiarity with typical tools of the trade in analysis and reporting.
Very strong numerical and analytical skills coupled with strong attention to detail
Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills
Strong SQL knowledge; Previous experience using SQL in a professional environment is a must
Python is a major plus
Previous Tableau dashboard building is a plus
Advanced Excel and PowerPoint Skills
An educational background in a quantitative/statistical field.
Ambitious self-starter, able to and enjoys working independently and finding creative solutions to complex problems
Ability to communicate well both with infrastructure and data teams, and business teams or management.
Fast learner & ability to learn new technologies and business matters.
Fluent in English, both spoken and written
Ability to work in the U.S. without sponsorship

About Outbrain
Outbrain is the brains—and technology—behind those recommendations that can be seen throughout online articles, helping people digitally discover the content most interesting to them. Headquartered in New York City, with a global presence across 16 offices, Outbrain was founded to narrate the web. Top publishers—including CNN, Fox News, and ESPN—utilize Outbrain's technology to redefine their digital landscapes, while top marketers utilize the platform to interact with untapped audiences. Outbrain currently serves more than 275 billion monthly recommendations to readers, and is paving the way in native advertising innovations. Interested in discovering what’s next for your career at Outbrain?

Bad Rabbit, Inc. is made up of a growing team of experienced professionals who work together to identify, understand, and develop solutions to our clients’ software needs. We work within the medical research sector, and help to maintain and develop tools to assist research institutions in managing their administration, compliance, research finance, and regulation needs. Some of our clients include The Children’s Hospital of Philadelphia, Arizona State University, Penn State, and Dartmouth College.

Startup culture, without startup stress.Bad Rabbit is a 10-year old, profitable business but we are still a small and growing company. This means you can experience the excitement of being in a fast-growing company, and have plenty of opportunities to grow with us without the crazy hours or instability of a “normal” startup.
Great team. team. Our team is predominately located in the greater NYC, Philadelphia, and Portland, Oregon areas and individuals work from home offices, though this position does require travel up to 25% of the time. As we are small, we can be very selective about the types of people we hire. That means you’re going to get to work with some really smart, passionate, and friendly individuals. You won’t find a dramatic or competitive work environment here; we’ve set up Bad Rabbit to be a non-political, efficient place
where you can expect to be valued and respected for your work ethic and teamwork, no matter which piece of the puzzle you’re working on.
Unique culture. We strive to be fair, transparent, and flat, meaning you won’t wonder what the “higher ups” are discussing behind closed doors. At Bad Rabbit, everyone is treated equally and as key members of the team. We have a unique revenue sharing scheme which rewards everyone’s hard-work and encourages contribution to our future growth.
Amazing work environment. We think if you work hard, you should receive a great salary and generous benefits. We have full health coverage for you, your spouse, and dependents; a great 401K; bonus potential and loads more! We’ll even set you up with a shiny new computer of your choice and a big monitor to go with it. Who doesn’t love that new computer smell?
About You
You are a self-starter and disciplined. Curious and tenacious when it comes to learning and problem solving. A team player also capable of working independently, who can keep an open mind and work with many personality types. You like variety and can multi-task effectively. You are a key member of our team who takes ownership and pride in achieving results and success for our clients.

What You’ll Do

Conduct stakeholder and product owner interviews and requirements workshops to illicit and test new requirements and validate existing requirements

Flexibility & Remote Work
At Bad Rabbit, we pride ourselves on being a forward-thinking employer. Most of our team members work from home and set their own hours. However, this position is client facing so it is expected that the Analyst will need to keep more regular business hours. For this position, working remotely is completely acceptable, but it is mandatory that candidates are based within commuting distance to greater NYC, Philadelphia, or Portland, Oregon as for the first few months it will be important to come into the office for training.

Workday Senior Business Analyst-HUM0001H4
Description

CNA has a newly created opening for a Workday Senior Business Analyst in our new office in downtown Chicago. CNA has recently gone through a Workday implementation and we are adding resources to effectively support HR and the Organization. This role will be part of the HR technology and operations team, and will assist with the day to day configuration and support for our client work streams within Workday. Working closely with our Business Analysis Directors, they will support the configuration of the different IT systems that support HR on a daily basis. Qualified applicants must have Workday application configuration experience, as well as strong Microsoft Excel knowledge as they will be responsible for analyzing large sets of data to identify patterns and resolve issues. We need someone with a strong business analysis and technical background who is able to convey complex terminology to audiences at all levels.

Job Summary

Individual contributor representing a high level of technical knowledge who works with business area technology representatives and others in support of a program or project. Formulates and defines systems scope and objectives based on user needs and an understanding of the business system requirements. Leads project teams or work groups and may be the primary project contact for functional area. Accountable for assignments or projects that are high in priority visibility and/or complexity.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Performs a combination of duties in accordance with departmental guidelines:
Senior technical analyst and process team lead for projects in functional area.
Works collaboratively with stakeholders and plans and conducts working sessions to elicit and review business requirements as approved by senior management.
Develops strategy and implements approach for creation of deliverables and all supporting documentation for the concept and definition phases of the project.
Performs necessary research to fully understand the business issues develop possible solutions and to support development of innovative cost effective solutions and recommends most viable business/technology solutions to management for approval.
Ensures appropriate resources are assigned to project teams manages resources and teams and reviews and provides input on performance of team members as appropriate.
As appropriate oversees design reviews to ensure project/system designs meet business needs.
Acts as technical resource on best practices which may include technology or other business/functional areas.
Continously learning new trends and developments within functional area of expertise and the insurance industry.
May participate in or lead the evaluation of software packages as they relate to the project/functional area.
Reporting Relationship

Typically Director or above.

Skills Knowledge and Abilities
A solid understanding of the insurance industry its products practices and operations.
Proven knowledge of client area's business and systems.
Proven knowledge of the system development life cycle and technology alternatives; understanding of interface design and user centered work methods.
Advanced analytical and problem solving skills with ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects.
Excellent client and interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively with internal and external business partners.
Ability to lead teams on short-term basis and to coach and mentor staff at all levels.
Excellent oral and written communication skills and ability to convey business requirements and technical needs in clear concise and effective manner.
Advanced computer skills including Microsoft Office Suite and other business related software systems which may include solid knowledge of the system/application development life cycle and technological alternatives.
Education and Experience
Bachelor's degree in Business Computer Science Engineering or related discipline or equivalent work experience.
Typically a minimum of seven years experience in business analysis or other related field i.e.accounting finance insurance operations or computer science with prior experience identifying and documenting business requirements.
Project leadership experience desirable.
Applicable certifications preferred.

Are you looking for a new opportunity to use your technical and analytical skills in a blended role? If so, this position may be perfect for you! We are seeking to hire 2 exceptional Technical Business Analysts who will report to the Operations Manager of the Data Center. The ideal candidates will be multi-talented, hands-on contributor who will provide implementation and support services of automated processes for the Episys (Credit Union) clients. Candidates will be the main point of contact for these clients, ensuring success of day to day processing, research, testing and documentation of Episys batch jobs, as well as, setup and support of automation tools such as OpCon and MoveIT. This is not your typical BA position, but a role with emphasis on providing solutions and then implementing through hands-on experience with the system.
About this Team:
The Outlink Credit Union Episys Support Team assist the data center that host the core database (Episys) for clients. This team is made up of 16 employees with the main data center located in Lenexa, KS with additional support staff in Allen, TX, San Diego, CA as well as numerous remote staff throughout the US. Candidates will be required to work on an on-call rotation schedule of one time per quarter.
This role can be worked out of the following locations: San Diego, CA, Allen, TX, Lenexa, KS or 100% Remote.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum 18 months of experience in one of the following prior roles;
IT or Application Support
Technical Analyst
Must be available for scheduled after-hours on-call level 2 support. After-hours on-call shift is from 5pm PT – 4am PT for a 2 week period.
Must be available to work 1 mandatory weekend a year for failover event.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree Preferred.
Data processing or IT experience at a credit union a huge plus.
Knowledge Episys, OpCon or MoveIT a big plus.

More intuitive than rational approach of situations or problems by first trying to find the abstract meaning of things rather than the concrete nature.

At gTech’s Users and Products team (gUP), our mission is to help users get the most out of Google. We represent the voice of Google's users and many of our partners globally, sharing insights with the larger Google organization to enable exceptional customer and product experiences.

gUP builds innovative solutions that take user experience and engagement with Google to the next level, supporting users across products, countries, cultures, incomes, and identities. We advocate for users through partnerships with product areas at Google (and some Alphabet businesses), supporting Google’s consumer products ecosystem and enabling numerous launches for Google’s consumer products each year.

We are committed to building an ever more diverse, equitable, and inclusive gUP, and consider this the foundation upon which individual, team, and user success are built. We're also committed to innovation not only in the content of our work, but in the way we work. Check out this blog post on our Chameleon program.
Our team supports a global organization with strategic and analytical insights to provide better, faster, more efficient services to products across Google.
You are a team-oriented business analyst who will use your strong set of business analytical skills to help craft stories and and insights to help the team make wide-ranging business decisions. Your keen sense for sniffing out inefficiencies and desire for better, simpler data will drive continuous improvements and innovation in our processes and operations.
Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of solution-oriented trusted advisors support millions of customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.
Responsibilities
Ensure that the team manages our finances wisely by creating internal infrastructure for budget management, tracking and reporting.
Provide analytical leadership in how we gather, structure and present key operational data.
Support our cross-functional teammates with understanding and using our key business metrics.
Contribute to and drive monthly, quarterly and annual business planning cycles, drive visibility into resource allocations, budgeting and investment decisions.
Qualifications
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance or similar discipline or equivalent practical experience.
5 years relevant work experience in business analysis for management consulting, investment banking, internet or media industry.
Experience in business strategy and stakeholder management.
Experience in project management, including working with stakeholders on defining and executing projects within budget and timelines.

Preferred qualifications:
Master's or advanced degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience communicating for a variety of audiences.
Strong business analytical skills with experience in spreadsheets software and database query (e.g. SQL-like language); comfort working with disparate data sets to answer business questions and tell a strategic story.
Ability to self-start work in a fast-moving environment, and comfortable dealing with ambiguity.
Excellent problem-solving skills; ability to identify ways to address a complicated problem at various levels of depth.
Solid organizational and project management skills, with the ability to work cross-functionally and manage multiple projects.

Spinvi is seeking a Business Analyst to join our growing team and be part of a top tier organization that values its employees and provides a competitive salary and benefits package. The Business Analyst serve as a technical contributor with expertise in DHA IT cradle to grave processes regarding applications and infrastructure.
Requirements
Support the Development Teams reporting on multiple projects of varying contract type, size, and complexity.
Prepare backup documentation to customer invoice submission
Review monthly, quarterly project performance, and reports
Maintain responsibility for documenting existing operations and practices.
Analyze operations and practices against documented best practices and develop a plan of action and milestones to evolve the best practices.
Act as a member of a team responsible for providing technical guidance for the business implications of the application of various systems.
Ability to gather and analyze data effectively
Ability to apply critical thinking to a wide variety of problems
Ability to comprehend and analyze complex problems
Possession of excellent oral and written communication skills

InternshipPalo Alto Networks® is the next-generation security company, leading a new era in cybersecurity by safely enabling applications and preventing cyber breaches for tens of thousands of organizations worldwide. If you want to make an impact, are motivated, intelligent, creative, and hardworking, then this job is for you!

Our Summer Internship Program provides you:
1:1 mentorship
Fun and engaging events that inspire your intellectual curiosity
The opportunity to expand your knowledge and work on challenging projects
Connections to other interns, recent grads, and employees across the company as well as our leaders.
Palo Alto Networks is looking for a Business Analyst Intern to assist the Professional Services Operations team in coordinating projects related to our Services Portfolio. Our Business Analyst Intern will support the effort to deliver high quality services for our customers with predictability. They bring order to chaos by thinking holistically and working cross functionally to design and improve NPI processes and tools. They are comfortable working with both highly technical and non-technical disciplines to ensure that portfolio inputs and requirements are transformed into appropriate outputs and results. They must have the desire to help build the infrastructure to enable an Enterprise Class service and support organization. We are looking for people who thrive in a fast paced, dynamic environment and can take something from idea to execution with ease. Specifically, within the GCS Ops team, we encourage hands on work and really owning and understanding the systems we support and the business we serve.

Opportunities:
Evolve and document specific components of the PS NPI process flow in alignment with ITIL V3 standards.
Effectively communicate process flow elements and decision gate criteria.
Participate in design reviews and walk-throughs to communicate business requirements and validate proposed solutions.
Assist with meeting facilitation by sending meeting agendas capturing and distributing meeting minutes, and tracking assigned team actions.
Proactively identifies dependencies between teams and ensures all plans align on delivery criteria.

Skills:
The successful applicant should...
Interest in Information Technology Business Administration is required
Experience leading projects is a plus
Experience with cybersecurity technology is a plus
Excellent planning, organization and problem identification skills required
Demonstrated problem solving ability
Ability to work in a collaborative, team-based environment

Requirements – All applicants must be pursuing a 4-year Undergraduate Degree, a 2-year Master’s Degree or a Doctorate degree. You must have authorization to work within the United States.

Learn more about Palo Alto Networks here and check out our fast facts

Part-timeWhat is the opportunity?
The HR Business Analyst will support and partner with Initiatives Manager to implement HR initiatives to lead, enable & support enterprise and CM priorities

What will you do?
 Enable and support Initiative Manager for in-flight and new initiatives. Activities may include:
Collect, coordinate and document stakeholder requirements
Monitor and update project and/or change management plans
Conduct high-level data analysis and draw value-add insights that are aligned platform priorities and People Strategies
Source, develop and distribute tools, templates and materials (communication, presentations, etc.)
Responsible for clearly articulating the strategy/vision for initiatives and working with project teams to translate that into a holistic set of deliverables for which the role will ensure ongoing alignment of delivery to the stated strategy
Lead smaller initiative implementations
Assists in the development and implementation of CM HR initiatives (including but not limited to Talent Management, Performance Management and Year-end Processes including Employee Communications and Promotions)
Develop and create presentations to support MD, US CM HR for IHC and ROC meetings
Contribute to the effectiveness of the HR function and its processes, deliverables, metrics, and benchmarking
Assist the HR Initiatives Associate to provide reporting recommendations that support the Capital Markets businesses
Identify improvements on the workflow/processes and collaborate with team to implement necessary changes.
Process invoices including allocation of expenses and dissemination of invoices
Faciliate and coordinate special programs, such as Health and Wellness events
Prepare agendas and minutes for management team meetings

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
A minimum of 4 years HR or equivalent business experience
Experience working in a fast-paced environment
Strong organization skills and attention to detail with the ability to multi-task effectively
Excellent analytical skills including ability to sort through data quickly.
Strong Excel, PowerPoint and Word skills
Strong verbal and written communications skills
Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills
High level of professionalism with and familiar with working with confidential information
General knowledge of end-to-end project management lifecycle
Familiarity with project management methodologies
Accepts and successfully executes change
Business Knowledge

What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. AkkenCloud is looking for a Business Analyst to work towards the successful implementation of our All-in-One Software as a Service platform for our new customers.

You thrive in a dynamic, deadline driven environment and enjoy interpreting complex business requirements. You will be in a critical position to delivering the highest level of customer happiness acting as a customer advocate to help resolve issues and to improve customer business process.

You perform advanced business process analysis of our new customers
Based on detailed analysis and collaboration, you develop implementation plans
You will use best practices to train customers and address their business problems

You have software implementing experience
You have advanced analytical skills
Your have a consistent track record of timely tasks completion
Your written and verbal communication skills are excellent to present recommendations clearly
You work independently and as part of a group, with a keen focus on collaboration
You have Can Do attitude and ability to improvise when facing unexpected situations

AkkenCloud is a place where you will learn and grow. This is a rare opportunity to join and help define a team in a SaaS startup with great early customer traction.

AkkenCloud embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to establishing a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more versatile we are, the better our work will be.

Google relies on gTech’s Velocity team (gV) to transform and improve people’s lives through big-bet products and services like Search, Google Assistant, and Actions on Google. Our mission is to activate, accelerate, and scale Google’s biggest bets by being trusted advisors to internal and external partners.
Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of solution-oriented trusted advisors support millions of customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.
Responsibilities
Work with non-technical business users to understand their analytical needs, document and prioritize requirements, and to help them effectively use the data and analytical tools that the team has developed.
Design, develop and support data warehouses, dashboards, data pipelines and reporting tools for operational and business impact data. Design and enforce access control for all the data.
Design, develop and project manage complete traditional business intelligence, statistical and other advanced analyses and projects end to end.
Develop visualization based on user needs on Google dashboards or Tableau.
Distill and communicate the essence of your technical work to audiences of all levels and across multiple functional areas while formulating robust, actionable recommendations.
Qualifications
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics) or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience in management consulting, investment banking or project management in a technology/media company.
Experience creating reports with database query (e.g. SQL), statistical and quantitative modeling.
Preferred qualifications:
5 years of experience with managing full implementation lifecycle for delivery of business intelligence and analytics solutions using data integration (ETL) and visualization tools (such as Tableau).
Working with statistical packages (R, SAS, Stata, MATLAB, etc.).
Ability to translate analysis results into business recommendations.
Deep interest and aptitude in data, metrics, analysis and trends and applied knowledge of measurement, statistics and program evaluation
Developed written and verbal communication skills.
