Service Market Logistics (SML) is part of Group Trucks Operations (GTO). We are an organization of approximately 4,000 employees globally in more than 40 locations. Every day, we are delivering world-class operational excellence for our customers, based upon smart logistics solutions. Our job is to develop, manage and optimize the Service Market supply chain for all Volvo Group brands and JV’s. The scope for Service Market Logistics includes Flow Optimization, Inventory Management, Distribution Center operations, Customs & Trade, as well as the development of logistics solutions to ensure the highest possible parts availability, delivery precision and quality everywhere in the world. We strive for an innovative and diverse workplace, exercising the Volvo Group values with high focus on customer success.

SML North America (NA) is a part of SML and has about 1,000 employees across the United States, Canada and Mexico. We operate the Central Distribution Center in Byhalia, MS as well as Regional Distribution Centers across the NA region.

Mission/Purpose of the Position
The Operation Business Analyst position is part of the Supply Planning & Dealer Inventory Management (SP/DIM) organization within SML NA. The SP/DIM organization is responsible for parts availability, backorder recovery, delivery precision and inventory.

The Operational Business Analyst is a member of a team working to ensure SP/DIM North America Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s) and Performance Indicators (PI’s) by performing reporting, analysis and proposal actions for Volvo Trucks, Mack Trucks, VCE and Penta. This position will also be part of, and be responsible for, key activities/projects to further develop the SP/DIM operations in North America. The Operational Business Analyst will monitor and analyze the SP/DIM KPI’s and PI’s, as well as have the opportunity to develop methods and processes for improving and innovating the planning process, reports and tools needed.

Scope & Influence
This position reports to the Director of Supply Planning & DIM and is located in Byhalia, MS.

Essential Functions
Provide follow-up on KPI’s and PI’s to the SP/DIM NA management. Analyze the impact on PI’s and KPI’s and develop proposals on mitigating actions
Generate and follow-up on weekly KPI Dashboards and map major root causes and drive actions to sustain or fill the gap to target KPI
Follow-up and development of life cycle segments together with Theoretical Optimization team
Support SP/DIM NA teams by developing necessary follow-up tools and reports
Support SP/DIM NA teams to create and maintain weekly or monthly communication packages
Act as liaison between Operations and SP/DIM functions in implementing standard reporting across the SP/DIM organization
Participate in continuous improvement activities within SP/DIM and be responsible for needed data mapping and analytics
Work with the process network and Parts Linq maintenance team to secure process development and best practice implementations
Create follow-up activities and reports, on own initiative and on request, within own team
Act according to the Volvo values
Other duties as assigned by Management
Minimum Education and Experience
BA/BS degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Mathematics/Statistics, Business Administration or a related field, or equivalent experience
3 to 5 years of relevant experience preferred
Experience working with logistics in a complex global supply chain
Holistic view and ability to grasp the full supply chain
Broad knowledge of the logistics area
Knowledge of where to find relevant logistics data, how to retrieve it, and how to validate the data in terms of relevance, correctness and completeness
Demonstrated ability to work successfully in a global environment
Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced team environment striving towards operational excellence guided by Volvo’s Values and the Code of Conduct
Necessary Technical/Functional/Language Skills
As all documentation is in English, proficiency in the English language is required
Strong problem solving, research and analytical skills
Ability to apply and analyze large amounts of data for developing projections and estimates
Ability to analyze business processes and develop systems-based solutions that will improve the current state
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to communicate efficiently and effectively within a multi-cultural and international environment
Ability to compile and present findings and possible recommendations to a diverse audience
Ability to manage and prioritize a high volume of detailed tasks
Comfortable learning new technologies
Ability to develop and maintain productive business relationships
Excellent computer skills, (Microsoft Office applications)

$75,000 - $105,000 a yearAbout Finexio:
In 2015, executives from MasterCard and Change Healthcare saw a critical opening for a B2Bcommercial payments execution platform that could service mid- to large-market companies. They envisioned Finexio as a way to execute in this market, unlocking the business value of payables for other efficiency-minded executives. In 2017, Finexio moved to Orlando from Silicon Valley and expanded its operations in 2018 with $4m in Series A funding.
Finexio’s payment technology identifies which suppliers can be paid electronically, then routes those payments without requiring bank account information. Finexio’s proprietary network identifies, delivers, and supports multiple forms of payment, generating revenue and cost savings for AP departments while offering complete visibility and control of the payment process. To learn more, visit Finexio’s website at https://finexio.com.

Summary of Work




This position will function as a business analyst on the ND Health Enterprise Medicaid Management Information System ( MMIS) . Work involves serving as a liaison between business users and information technology in order to elicit, analyze, communicate, and validate requirements for new or changed business processes, policies, and information systems.
Key Requirements/Tasks:
Soft skill requirements include negotiation, facilitation, communication and organization skills. Work requires applying principles, methodologies, standards, and best practices to identify business needs and determine solutions to business problems. Solutions may include software/systems development, process improvement, and/or organizational change.
This position is responsible for leading and oversight of the business analysis support for special projects of the MMIS.
Provide operational expertise in different areas of the Medicaid System.
The Business Analyst must understand system configuration that supports the functions of the MMIS. They must understand the purpose and relationship of system parameters to maximize the MMIS performance and functionality.
Key tasks performed will be to analyze, document, communicate and validate requirements for business software applications. Review of use cases, design documents, change requests, action items, and issues related to assigned functional areas.
Review and provide approval of test cases and test scripts. Participate in test methodology and system training. Participate in the test execution of different areas of the system during User Acceptance Testing.
Review lesson modules and assist with the creation of training manuals. Assist with internal and external training of the system.
The position requires that ability to communicate effectively with a variety of personnel, including Information Technology analysts/developers, Business Administration staff, Vendor SME’s, and Project Management staff.
Must be able to work well with people and effectively communicate business concepts, rules, and requirements. Individual must be a team player that is also able to work independently.
This position requires activities across many work plans. This requires a great deal of organization to handle multiple priorities. Areas of major projects include detail system design specification definition, establishment of test plans, user acceptance testing, organizational readiness, training, and implementation of system/business process changes.
Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Reviewing submitted change requests and providing support to supervisor on if the system is adequate to provide the needed business function or if there truly needs to be a change request submitted. The Business Analyst must understand complex business and system rules to make these determinations and involve subject matter experts from multiple functional areas.
The person in this position will be responsible for finding efficiencies, ensuring that meetings are timely and productive, and keeping the group moving forward.
This person will need to make recommendations to the DHS Business Information Systems Administrator or Lead Business Analyst regarding system and business issues determined during review of deliverables.
This person will need to advise the DHS Business Information Systems Administrator or Lead Business Analyst on impacts that will affect the project and make recommendations on what needs to be included and what can be deferred.
This person must advise supervisors of problems that could affect project time, scope or budget.
Preference will be given to those applicants with medical claims experience.
Regrettably, the Department of Human Services does not offer or provide sponsorships.



Minimum Qualifications




Business Analyst I requires a bachelor’s degree with a major in computer science, computer or management information systems, project management, business administration or a field closely related to those listed; AND three years of work experience involving business analysis activities such as requirements planning and management, elicitation, documentation and solution assessment. Additional work experience as described may substitute for the education requirement on a year-for-year basis.
DHS defines business analysis experience as work involving serving as a liaison between business users and information technology in order to elicit, analyze, communicate, and validate requirements for new or changed business processes, policies, and information systems. Work requires applying principles, methodologies, standards, and best practices to identify business needs and determine solutions to business problems.
Candidates will need to be a team player and have an excellent eye for detail, be analytical and also be able to deal with the abstract, strong communications (both written and verbal), maintain good relationships with all levels of staff, understand the business objective and be able to prioritize work. Specific soft skills include: analysis, creativity, interviewing, presentation, time management and organization.


Application Procedures




Please provide details in the employment history sections of the application form on how your education, experience and skills will qualify you for this position. Supplemental information such as a cover letter and resume may be included, but the initial review and score will be based on the information provided in your online application.
Please fill in all information requested on the application form, such as dates of employment, hours worked per week, credits earned, etc. INCOMPLETE SECTIONS WILL NOT BE GIVEN CREDIT.
The Department’s Human Resource Division staff will score applications against the minimum qualifications and preferences listed on the job announcement and qualifying military service. After the scoring is completed, a certified list of eligible candidates and the applications will be forwarded to the hiring manager for further consideration and possible interview, based on the final scores.
The Department of Human Services does not offer or provide sponsorships. Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States.
All application material must be received on the closing date by 11:59 pm or before the closing date.
A copy of your qualifying degrees transcript and any applicable certifications or licensures must be provided at the time of an interview.
For more information or if you need an accommodation, Please Contact: Tory Brabandt at 701-328-4578

POSITION SUMMARY
Aktana is looking for an experienced Business Analyst to work with our customers to understand their strategic goals, structure analytical frameworks to measure the success of those goals and quantify the ultimate business impact. The overall goal is to deepen our engagement with customers by identifying exactly how our customers are using our product, then using analytics to identify what is working and what isn't. The ideal candidate is somebody with both advanced technical skills and a well-developed business sense that enables them to identify customer needs and communicate analytical results in a non-technical way.

LOCATION
San Francisco, CA

REPORT TO
Director of Consulting Services

RESPONSIBILITIES
Learning about Aktana's product suite and how our customers typically use it to achieve their commercial goals
Structuring, executing and communicating analysis on the impacts our projects have, including:
Working with customers and our customer experience team to understand their strategy and intended outcome of using Aktana
Structuring value frameworks and tracking mechanisms at the beginning of customer deployments
Exploratory analysis of the available data
Communicating and refining the results with customers
Formalizing results where appropriate into anonymized case studies
Building relationships across Aktana's Data Science, Customer Success and Data / Reporting teams, pulling them in as needed for additional support
Providing guidance to our product management and marketing teams, helping us improve our product and market positioning based on hard, analytical evidence
REQUIRED SKILLS/EXPERIENCES
4+ years experience in an analytics-based consulting role, exploring large data sets in order to answer strategic questions for customers (either as an internal analyst or external consultant)
Either advanced SQL experience or extensive familiarity with a data analysis program like Alteryx
Experience in building strategic, impactful, business-driven insights from data (example case studies welcome)
Strong written and verbal communication skills (example presentations welcome)
Customer-facing experience, including managing project requirements and communicating project results
Comfort in working with a high degree of autonomy in a fast-paced, loosely structured startup environment
NICE TO HAVE
Life science commercial strategy experience
Experience with life science-specific data sources (IMS/IQVIA, Symphony, Veeva, etc.)
Experience managing customers across different regions of the world (with different work cultures, time zones, etc.)
STEM degree
ABOUT AKTANA
Committed to customer success and innovation, Aktana is at the forefront of transforming how life sciences companies share information with healthcare providers (HCPs). Our proprietary platform harnesses machine learning algorithms to enable marketing and sales teams to seamlessly coordinate and optimize multichannel engagement with HCPs. Today 10 of the top 20 global biopharmaceutical companies are using Aktana to go to market smarter.

Aktana is growing fast and looking for exceptional talent to join our team. We value hard work, transparency, and collaboration – and we like to have fun too! Headquartered in San Francisco, we have offices around the world, including Philadelphia, New York, London, Barcelona, Tokyo, Osaka, and Shanghai.

Job Description
The Amazon Global Fulfillment Services (AGFS) Marketing team is looking for an exceptional and experienced Business Analyst to drive data analysis and insights that will ensure products listed on Amazon meet the high product quality bar.

In this role you will leverage your advanced SQL skills to construct and implement data pipeline to collect data, clean/organize data to get it ready for analysis and perform structured analysis to glean insights that will identify areas of opportunity and in turn shape the product features and programs we roll out to continue to improve customer experience. You should be self-starter who is highly proficient in SQL, has an extremely high level of customer focus, has a passion for process improvement and is excited by mining large and complex datasets

As you further your career as a data analyst in Amazon Global Fulfillment Services Marketing, you will focus on instrumenting automation of metrics that measure customer experience and identify emerging trends teams need to focus on, analyze Customer and Seller data to identify the root cause of customer issues, and recommend solutions, backed by data, to address customer issues. We are focused on your success and want to build strong leaders. You can expect to leverage your data skills and have full ownership of the projects you work on.

Key Responsibilities Include:
Advanced SQL skills to extract, aggregate and load data from multiple data sources
Work with and synthesize large datasets from multiple data sources
Work with BI team to navigate through the data sources and introduce new metrics to audit performance and identify areas where customer experience is degrading
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Automate reporting with a combination of SQL, Excel, and BI tools like Looker
Deep-dive a variety of ad hoc questions on emerging customer experience trends
Manage and execute entire projects or components of large projects from start to finish including project management, data gathering and manipulation, synthesis and modeling, problem solving, and communication of insights and recommendations
Seek opportunities to inject advanced analytical techniques across the FBA Customer Experience organization

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Engineering or a related field
5+ years of professional experience in data analytics, business analysis or comparable analytics position
Advanced skills in data mining using SQL, ETL, data warehouse as well as Excel
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills and an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.
Ability to structure complex analysis and perform the analysis to drive insights
Proven problem solving skills, project management skills, attention to detail, and exceptional organizational skills
Ability to deal with ambiguity and competing objectives in a fast paced environment
Preferred Qualifications
Masters degree is preferred in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field.
Advanced SQL skills to extract, aggregate, and load data
5+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analysis role.
Experienced in data warehousing, data modeling concept and building new DW tables
Experience with building multi-dimensional data models to serve as a foundation for future analyses
Ability to deal with ambiguity
Understanding of predictive modeling
Understanding of R or Python/another scripting language

Equus Software, a rapidly growing technology company, needs passionate team members who are interested in Business Analysis and building a career within the Global Mobility Industry. If you are interested in a career as a Business Analyst, consider yourself an A-Player and want to work with others like you, come join us!!!
Equus works with a growing list of Global 2000 clients, many in the Fortune 500. Our technology enables our clients to mobilize their workforce globally – which involves moving them from country to country and managing all the important details for their mobile expat employees.
At Equus Software, you can stand out! You will learn all about our award winning software solutions. If you enjoy discovering how technology works in business, and would like to learn how to configure software to make processes more efficient, this may be the opportunity for you.
Equus is a leader in state-of-the-art technology solutions for corporate workforce mobility. Our products are used by over 500 corporations, including many of the Fortune 100. Our experienced staff provides our customers with the best software, services, and support available (www.equusoft.com).
Job purpose
As a Business Analyst at Equus Software, you will be part of either the implementation or client solutions team. The focus of the role is to provide innovative solutions and solve problems to meet the client’s requirements.
Duties and responsibilities
Translates business requirements into solutions
Transitions requirements of a developed solution into a support model
Identifies and documents issues, risks, and opportunities related to requirements
Supports clients in solutions to issues and questions
Resolves issues and provides clear communications to leader or client as appropriate
Clarifies issues, facts, figures, potential causes and effects
Partners with appropriate team members to research and find solutions
Executes quality assurance testing
Seeks out information about both the relocation/global mobility industry and software industries, and applies that knowledge to day to day activities
Contributes to the Equus community - developing competency with Equus products
Participates in the preparation of client webinars, conferences, demos and other presentations to both clients and internal Equus team
Develops strong working relationships with clients and internal teams
Requirements
Qualifications**
Locations: Denver, CO and Plano, TX
Ability to travel: 5%-10%
**Sponsorships are NOT available at this time
E= Essential D= Desirable
Competencies:
Problem Solving/Analysis (E)
Technical Aptitude (E)
Attention to Detail (E)
Time Management (E)
Team Player (E)
Clear Communicator (E)
Multi-tasker (E)
Required Education/Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Information Systems, Engineering or similar fields (E)
Degree earned by May 2018 with an ability to start full-time in June 2018 (E)
Ability to work in Denver, Colorado or Plano, Texas (E)
Internship experience working with external customers (D)
If recent graduate, GPA of 3.5 or above (D)
Additional Eligibility Qualifications:
Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, etc.) (E)
SQL Knowledge (D)
Relationship Building (E)
Business Writing Capability (E)
Knowledge of Global Mobility industry (D)
Benefits
What is Equus?
Equus Software is a market leading Software Company specializing in Global Mobility Software. We provide award-winning service to our portfolio of high-profile global clients. Our team is known for providing creative software solutions to solve our clients’ complex business problems.
What we can offer?
Variety: As part of our team, you will work in a fast paced and challenging environment where no two days will be the same.
Training: You will learn about the world of Global Mobility; and receive training on our in-house project management processes, software configuration and product development, with the guidance of our Client Account Managers, Senior Business Analysts and software development teams.
Knowledge: You will be able to take full advantage of being part of a fast-paced, close-knit community and make full use of the knowledge of the Global Equus Team with direct access to everyone from BA to CEO.
Growth: Equus is winning new clients all the time and there is plenty of room for the right candidate to move up the career ladder as the company grows.
Innovation: One day each quarter, we are given free time to innovate. We can create anything we feel would make our jobs or our clients experience better.
Casual: We have a work hard, play hard culture. We dress casually, have regular team outings and enjoy our Fridays!
Salary: We are offering a competitive starting salary plus an excellent benefit package.
Come have FUN and GROW with Us!

$60,819 - $83,304 a yearJob Summary
The Business Analyst-Public Safety is a full time, classified service, salaried position performing work for the IT Services Department of Shelby County. This position is responsible for the application of technology into the public safety workflows of the County and informing and advising partners on information systems technologies, their functionalities, benefits, risks, and implementation requirements. Work involves design, maintenance, troubleshooting of complex public safety applications and database environment. Work involves providing technical support for multiple public safety user agencies in a dynamic 24 x 7 environment. This position serves as the primary point of contact for trouble resolution for hardware, software, telecom, radio and network problems associated with public safety operations and related support obligations. Duties include procurement, setup, installation, maintenance, troubleshooting and upgrades of personal and mobile computer hardware, radio equipment, software, peripherals, and mobile devices. Position is expected to provide subject matter expertise on a variety of desktop, radio, mobile dispatching applications and refer problems to other technical staff as appropriate. Develop and implement systems, processes and procedures to mitigate the disruption of services during utility outages and any emergency condition. The employee is also responsible for assisting in technical projects and other support as needed.
Qualifications and Requirements
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience.
Five years' experience in a large mission critical support environment.
Three years' experience with public safety applications.
Knowledgeable of law enforcement and public safety dispatch procedures, terminology and protocols.
Ability to work non-standard hours, on call on a continuous basis (24x7). Comprehensive knowledge with security components of Microsoft architecture and their operational/security considerations.
Demonstrated competency in project management in an enterprise environment managing resources to meet goals on multiple projects.

PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS:
Five years' experience in a support role at public safety dispatch center or law enforcement agency.
Hands-on experience with the following technologies; GIS (ESRI), VMware (VCA preferred), VOIP telecom, IP based LMR radio systems,
IP based access control systems, Microsoft SQL Server scripting ability, SAP BusinessObjects BI and/or Crystal Reports, HTML scripting on several in-house applications and Electronic Health Records.
Physical Demands & Work Environment
PHYSICAL DEMANDS
Work consistently requires standing, walking, pulling, bending, lifting, and carrying equipment.

WORK ENVIRONMENT
Work is primarily performed in an office environment but also requires external conditions when cabling or working with telephony/wireless equipment.
Conditions of Job Offer and Employment
WRITTEN AND PERFORMANCE EXAMINATIONS
No written or performance examination will be required for this position. Applicants are screened and certified based on an evaluation of their education, training, experience and other requirements as outlined in this Position Announcement and denoted on their Job Application and responses to the Supplemental Questionnaire.

BACKGROUND CHECK
As part of the pre-employment procedure all new hires are subject to a full background check. Former supervisors, employers, police and FBI files, plus references provided by the candidates shall be checked as a precaution against obtaining undesirable employees. Reference and background checks may or may not be completed prior to an offer of employment, and the information shall be handled as privileged information available to appointing authorities in considering applicants.

PRE-EMPLOYMENT/POST OFFER DRUG SCREEN
Shelby County is committed to providing and maintaining a drug-free work environment. As part of the pre-employment procedures all new hires and promotional candidates promoting from a non-DOT position to a DOT position will be subject to a pre-employment/pre-promotion drug screen. After receiving a conditional offer of employment, applicants are required to pass a drug test conducted at a test site designated by Shelby County.
_____________________
Shelby County, Alabama is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants are considered for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital or veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

job_description:
OtherIf you have a curious sort of disposition, are great at explaining things, and can demonstrate the ability to help customers learn how to apply our cloud based software applications then keep reading!

Grant Street Group continues to anticipate the growth of its SaaS model to our public sector clients. Whether it is tax processing, electronic payments, or internet bond auctions, we have tools to make government work better.

We are looking for talented folks who:

Want to know why things work the way they do.
Excel at explaining things with the right amount of detail.
Are capable communicators with the spoken and written word.
Know how to collaborate within a team environment.
Are dedicated learners with the ability to use software.
Our business analysts come from all sorts of academic, business or technical backgrounds. Their common threads? Strong academic performance, great writers, and the ability to engage others in meaningful, fun, and entertaining conversations. If this sounds like you then we do want to start talking about your future and ours!

Our extraordinary company culture is the foundation of our unmatched customer service — just ask our clients! We reward teamwork, professional excellence, and individual responsibility. Using the best collaboration tools available, we offer a technology-rich work environment that makes it possible for us to support on-site and telecommuting positions tailored to the needs of our employees. If you are passionate about your work, you have entrepreneurial spirit and you want to be on a team of exceptional professionals, then this could be the opportunity you are looking for.
If our description fits who you are, apply today! We’ll take it from there. To learn more about the various aspects of this role, check out our job responsibilities section below.

Apply Now – Business Analyst (Remote)
Business Analyst Job Responsibilities
If you read our business analyst job posting and thought, “That sounds great, but what is this job actually like?”, then keep reading!

The core function of our role as business analysts at Grant Street Group is to be a liaison between our developers and our clients, and this requires us to wear many different hats.

So what do all of these “hats” really mean?
Problem Solving: Every day you work to solve complex problems. When you analyze a calculation, investigate the cause of a bug, or propose a new process you are venturing into unfamiliar territory to find a solution. Our clients and developers rely on your problem solving skills to ensure our software is built and supported effectively.
Client support: When a customer has a question, problem, or suggestion, they come to you! You are known as a subject matter expert and our clients rely on that expertise regularly. Whether the issue is major or minor, you know that Grant Street Group takes Software as a Service literally.
Prioritization: Our software is ever-changing. With that comes the need to prioritize what, when, and how changes are made. Since you’re working with the software and our clients daily, who better to prioritize than you? Business analysts are constantly asking themselves: Does this feature need to be completed before a certain time? What is the impact of this bug? How can other clients benefit from this change? We use a ticketing system to track pieces of work such as functionality requests and bug fixes. We then prioritize them for developers to work on.
Technical Specifications: It’s your job to convey to the developers what changes need to be made. What happens when you click this button? What does the page look like? How is this file transferred to an external system? In this way, you are directly affecting the product and our clients’ experience.
Testing: When a developer completes a change, you get to test it out (in a beta environment) to ensure that it’s working correctly. Does the new behavior match the specification? Does everything else surrounding the change still work correctly?
Implementations: We’re a growing company and adding new clients is an exciting part of that growth! Since you’re a subject matter expert, you coordinate with new clients to configure the software to best fit their needs. Think of yourself as a consultant. What business processes does the client need to accomplish? How can our software fit in with and help that process?
Training: Helping clients learn about how our software works is also part of your role. Whether it’s a new client coming up to speed on how tasks are completed, or an existing client that is incorporating a new feature into their process, you’re a resource for providing the information and tools they need.
Does this sound exciting and overwhelming at the same time? Most of us thought so too. If you haven’t had experience in this area before, know that many of us lacked business analyst experience before we came to Grant Street Group. What we did have was intellectual curiosity and a passion for problem solving. If you’ve already had business analyst experience, that’s great, and we’re excited about the possibility of you continuing on that path with us.
So now that you know what we do, why are you a great fit? You’ve probably spent a large majority of your life asking “Why” and then making sure that you figure out the answer. You love using all parts of your brain equally, and the thought of speaking with a client or learning about a database schema equally intrigues you. You’re the one that people rely on in team projects. You’re always itching to know more and you hold yourself and others to a high standard.
Before you begin the interview process, keep in mind that we have a tendency to pay special attention to those that put in extra effort in their applications. We are radical proponents of the belief that you are more than just a resume. If you’re excited about this opportunity, we can’t wait to get to know you!

This is who we are: honest, direct and always bringing an element of fun into our work. If you’re ready to join the power of fast, keep reading

Business Analyst

Adyen is looking for a Business Analyst to join our US Partnerships team in San Francisco. The ideal candidate is someone who is able to approach complex problems in a structured manner, while converting the results of the analysis into a compelling and actionable story for internal or external stakeholders.

Whether you come from the payments space or not, we need you to be an independent thinker who is curious about how the payments ecosystem works and how that fits in with global commerce.

What you’ll do

Framework Development – Work with our cross-functional data teams to develop scalable and reusable frameworks for analyzing large datasets on the most pressing business questions
Be a Subject Matter Expert – Adyen’s SME for both merchants and internal stakeholders on credit card scheme rules and fee structures. Help our merchants understand and optimize the cost and revenue impacts of interchange and scheme fees.
Data Analysis - Determine the necessary data required to solve a wide variety of business problems; extract required data, perform analysis and draw conclusions and recommendations
Storytelling – Turn the analysis into effective communication and concise, actionable advice
Who you are

Education: At least 3 years of working experience and undergraduate degree
Technical Aptitude: Excellent analytical and modeling skills, with proficiency in tools such as R, Python, Matlab, and database SQL
Global Perspective: Ability to interface seamlessly with a global, multicultural team and the openness to meet with the core team in Amsterdam as needed
Interpersonal skills: Team player with excellent communication skills, and the ability to adjust a message to its audience.
Who we are

Adyen is the payments platform of choice for many of the world’s leading companies, providing a modern end-to-end infrastructure connecting directly to Visa, Mastercard, and consumers' globally preferred payment methods. Adyen delivers frictionless payments across online, mobile, and in-store channels. With offices across the world, Adyen serves customers including Facebook, Uber, Spotify, Casper, Bonobos and L'Oreal.

Job Description
Since 1995, Amazon has focused on being “the world’s most customer centric company.” Our customers are worldwide, and include not just consumers, but also our sellers. World-class retail brands and individual sellers increase their sales and reach new customers by leveraging the power of the Amazon e-commerce platform. Over 2 million sellers offer new, used, and collectible selections to Amazon customers around the world. To meet our sellers’ needs, our smart, diverse, customer-obsessed employees are constantly innovating and building on new ideas.

Fulfillment by Amazon (FBA) is an Amazon service for our sellers. The FBA team partners with sellers and our Amazon fulfillment centers to create a seamless experience for sellers to leverage our world-class facilities. 71% of sellers who use FBA report more than a 20% increase in unit sales after joining FBA. In a very real way, we are changing lives with the work we do. Our FBA employees wake up every day thinking about how to enable our sellers to be successful on our platform. Enabling seller success allows us to provide Amazon customers with unparalleled selection and pricing. FBA is a win for sellers and a win for customers.

The FBA Supply Chain team is seeking a Business Analysts to leverage and drive key insights to identify areas to improve total supply chain costs for Amazon Sellers, Amazon and ultimately Customers. Are you interested in driving improvement ideas for one of Amazon’s largest businesses? Are you experienced with and excited by mining large and complex datasets? The successful candidate will be highly analytical, have an extremely high level of customer focus and a passion for process improvement.

FBA is searching for motivated self-starters who can work in a fast paced, data-driven environment. The successful candidate will be an analytical problem solver, have an extremely high level of customer focus and a passion driving improvements to the Seller Experience.

As you further your career as a Business Analyst in FBA, you will focus on improving driving recommendations for total supply chain improvements . You will analyze sellers’ data, discover and solve real world problems and build metrics and business cases to improve the seller’s experience. We are focused on your success and want to build strong leaders. You can expect to leverage your analytical skills and have full ownership of the projects you work on.

In this role you will:
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable formatPut on your marketing cap to drive adoption of our product for all Sellers worldwide as well as new incremental features of the productMeasure the delivery metrics of FBA key metrics. Propose and implement projects to improve these metricsDriving Seller experience business case recommendations

Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering or a related field3+ years of professional experience in analytics, business analysis or comparable consumer analytics positionAdvanced working knowledge of data mining using SQL, ETL, data warehouse as well as ExcelExcellent communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills and an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.Proven problem solving skills, project management skills, attention to detail, and exceptional organizational skillsAbility to deal with ambiguity and competing objectives in a fast paced environmentBachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field.
Preferred Qualifications
Masters degree is preferredBusiness, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field.4+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analysis role.Ability to deal with ambiguityUnderstanding of data warehousing, data modeling concept and building new DW tables

WPS offers the excitement, opportunity, energy, agility, and collaborative spirit of a startup within a stable, family-owned company that’s been around (and thriving) for over 69 years. We publish educational and psychological assessments that allow helping professionals to accurately screen, diagnose, and treat people in need. A great opportunity to grow your skills and feel good about what you do at work!

This is a full-time position in L.A.’s breezy South Bay, and local candidates are preferred. WPS offers a competitive salary (DOE) and benefits including paid time off, medical, dental, 401(k), and retirement plan. We work hard and take care of business, while mindful of the value of work–life balance. On-site car wash, weekly meditation, exercise boot camp, a lunch lottery, mentorship program and quarterly cultural outings are a few of the reasons why working here is awesome!

We encourage optimism, collaboration, and growth, as well as “building relationships that last.” We’re looking to build such a relationship with the right individual.

About the position…

As a Business Analyst you will define, document, analyze, communicate, and collaborate the business’s needs to ensure that we are developing accurate products and services for both our internal and external customers. This role will live within the Project Management team to liaise between all departments within the company. The successful candidate will also take on the responsibility of documenting and maintaining a process library to provide clear communication across all departments. This role requires strong interpersonal skills and writing skills to ensure clear communication.You will work closely with many members of the WPS team, and provide exceptional support as needed. Your keen skills, positivity, strong work ethic, and collaborative style will help WPS continue to build our strong team.

Your Responsibilities…
Work closely with the business units to define, document, and develop business requirements for our systems using standard templates and natural language.
Proactively communicate and analyze needs to the technical team to develop products for both internal and external customers. Define configuration specifications and business analysis requirements. Communicate key insights and findings to product team.
Drive and challenge business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans.
Develop solution details, such as data requirements, descriptions, use cases, process maps, data sourcing plans, etc. required to embed decision-making model into comprehensive business solutions.
Validate solution details with business users, technology architects, and application designers.
Prepare presentation materials.
Document and maintain all internal support processes within the company.
Define and monitor Key Performance Indicators to measure success.
Perform quality assurance..
Prepare and document material for training purposes as needed

Your Experience…

A minimum of 1-3 years of experience is preferred, though not essential if you work diligently and learn quickly.

The following skills and experience are required:
Bachelor’s Degree (computer science area a plus).
Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills.
Exceptional skills in the areas of organization, prioritization, attention to detail, collaboration, and multi-tasking under tight deadlines.
Proven experience in eliciting requirements and testing.
Basic knowledge in generating process documentation.
Interpersonal style that is professional, confident, easy-going, and positive.
Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office is required, including PowerPoint and Visio.
Familiarity with SDLC a plus.

Our Story

Western Psychological Services (WPS) was established in 1948 in a little pink house in Brentwood, not far from the local VA hospital. Dr. Morse Manson, the company founder, developed a psychological test that would help returning World War II vets adjust to civilian life. This was the first of many psychological and educational assessments that WPS would publish over subsequent decades. Today these assessments are used by helping professionals throughout the world to evaluate, diagnose, and treat people in need—especially children and teens who have developmental, social, or behavioral challenges. WPS is known world-wide for our industry-leading autism assessments.

That’s the first part of the story: WPS is a stable, successful, family-owned company, 80+ employees strong, engaged in work that you can feel good about doing. This is a place where you can build a career—many of our employees stick around for 10, 20, or even 30+ years.

Our Latest Chapter

The second part of our story starts with Jeff Manson, grandson of the founder (and now president of WPS), who’s making a big investment in the company’s future. He’s nurturing a transformative company culture that encourages innovation, creativity, transparency, and collaboration. And, as part of his commitment to a more open work environment, he moved the company a new home in Torrance, with plenty of elbow room, state-of-the-art equipment, and lots of amenities. The idea is that employees who are happy, empowered, acknowledged, and listened to will better serve the customer and the bottom line. It seems to be working—WPS continues to do well year after year!

www.wpspublish.com

WPS is an equal-opportunity employer.

Overview
Guidepoint’s Engineering team thrives on problem solving and creating happier users. As Guidepoint works to achieve its mission of making individuals, businesses, and the world smarter through personalized knowledge-sharing solutions, the engineering team is taking on challenges to improve our internal CRM system and create new products to optimize the seamless delivery of our services.

The Business Analyst will support Guidepoint’s growth by gathering business and product requirements from internal stakeholders, analyzing data to validate business opportunity, and delivering software requirements to quality assurance and engineering teams for implementation. The ideal candidate will be highly analytical with proven experience delivering results.

What You'll Do
Analyze and solve business problems at their root, stepping back to understand the broader context.
Use data mining and other analytical techniques to validate and measure business opportunity.
Manage and execute entire projects from start to finish including project management, requirements gathering, system analysis, problem solving, and communication of insights and recommendations.
Define workflows, use cases, and detailed business logic
Identify, vet and manage third party software providers, including API integration
Work daily with QA and Engineering to guide them from product/feature development through to launch
Assist Product Managers with roll out planning and launch of new solutions to market including use facing documentation
What You Have
3+ years of experience in Business/Systems Analysis, or equivalent experience such as Consulting, Finance, or Operations
Detailed understanding of software development processes including the ability to assess feasibility without consulting Engineers
Advanced Excel skills required, using large-scale, complex datasets
Basic SQL or programming knowledge is a plus
Proven ability to solve complex business challenges
Demonstrated ability to operate both strategically and tactically in a high-energy, fast-paced environment
Knowledge of data visualization and exploration tools (Looker, Tableau, etc.)
What We Have:

Competitive compensation
Free snacks and beverages
Excellent medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your dependents
401(k) match, life insurance, commuter benefits, corporate gym rates, paid time-off and parental leave plans
Friday happy hour and “Summer Fridays”

Work involves some problem solving with assistance and guidance in understanding and applying company and department policies and procedures. Conduct quantitative research to identify opportunities for improvement in all operational aspects of the business.

Detailed Description and Job Requirements
Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization*s financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.

Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures.

Work involves some problem solving with assistance and guidance in understanding and applying company policies and procedures. Attention to detail critical. Ability to collect, organize, and display data in spreadsheet format. Follow-through skills necessary to get information from internal and third parties and have data errors/omissions corrected. Relationship management skills strongly desired. Strong written and verbal communication skills to interact with management and possible clients desired. 0 - 2 years relevant work experience.

Job Description:
Works collaboratively with clients and stakeholders - both external and internal to the company - to research and elicit, analyze, validate and document business requirements, and to ensure that those requirements clearly reflect true business needs, correctly representing all stakeholders. Translates business needs into system/ application requirements and project components to help determine solutions to business problems. Assists team members in producing functional requirements for tool development. Proactively identifies and manages changes to requirements and identify risks for the company’s clients. Effectively manages client’s expectations. Applies industry and information technology expertise to support proposals, feasibility studies, implementations and new business development.

Responsibilities:
Formulate and define system scope and objectives using knowledge of information technology and industry knowledge/ requirements.
Act as a liaison between client and technical solutions/ support groups, using strong communication skills to elicit, document, analyze and validate business processes, systems, and solution requirements.
Research, identify, and specify solutions to problems.
Support and conduct visualization, user experience and configuration elements of solution design.
Document requirements specifications using high-maturity methods, processes and tools.
Support requirements management and change management processes.
Support aspects of the business cycle, including proposals, feasibility studies, and implementations.
Consider the business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment.

Education and Experience Required:
Typically a Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline or equivalent experience.
Minimum of 2 years of related experience or a Master's degree and up to two years of experience.

Knowledge and Skills:
2 or more years experience.
Essential: requirements determination using structured techniques for documentation, analysis, evaluation/ validation; decomposition of high- level information into details; abstracting low- level information; distinguishing requests vs needs; distinguishing requirements vs. solutions; classifying/ prioritizing requirements; requirements change management and traceability; identifying risks; applying creativity to solving complex problems; building relationships and working collaboratively; effective verbal/ written communication; experience in an industry domain.
Specialized: developing structured user manuals and training; business rules modeling; develop and executing acceptance test plans.

The Business Analyst will be helping the Project Management team implement world-class problem management practices into the organization.

EXPECTATIONS

Respond to internal and external customer support tickets and track issues to completion.
Assist cross functional teams with problem resolution and provide consultative services and guidance.
Be proactive, identify trends and report root causes of issues as appropriate.
Conduct data mining and analysis to identify process gaps via SQL queries.
Act as a liaison between the sales resources, business, and development teams to research data issues and define business rules.
Create written and graphic documentation to capture Business and Functional Requirements, including Use Case and Visio Diagram, as necessary.
Assist in the development and execution of process improvements to reflect new business requirements.

REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS

EDUCATION: BA/BS in Computer Science or a related field preferable.
EXPERIENCE: 1-5 years of experience in a web/online environment (internet/startup or Consulting preferred).
Understanding of enterprise software product life cycle, principles and process.
Working knowledge of SQL syntax for analysis of data
Strong computer skills; proficient in Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, Word and Outlook.
Able to quickly assess situations, define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions.
Ability to take action in solving problems while exhibiting judgment and a realistic understanding of issues; ability to use reason, even when dealing with emotional topics.
Proactive and able to independently review and summarize release requirements and quickly become an expert on the feature areas.
Able to identify, isolate and document defects with a high level of attention to detail.
Able to collaborate with stakeholders to identify needs through application design sessions.
Ensure that customer issues are resolved and root causes identified.
Able to quickly learn new technologies and interact effectively with all levels of management with tact and professionalism.

Job Description
Amazon is looking for a smart, motivated, and driven Business Analyst to focus on improving the Amazon customer experience, from the unique advantage within Customer Service. You will analyze multiple types of data to discover and solve real world problems. We do this every day with ingenuity and simplicity, leveraging impactful data and analytics to amplify the opportunities on behalf of the Amazon customer. This position requires high judgment, focus on speed and accuracy, and an ability to balance the Customer and the Customer Service associate experience with financial impact; it also offers broad exposure to various business and technical teams within Amazon.

The ideal candidate has an accomplished professional background, demonstrated proficiency in advanced mathematics and/or statistics, and experience as an analyst in a business environment. They are comfortable analyzing data from multiple sources to create strategic recommendations in a thoughtful, concise manner and obtaining organizational buy-in at senior levels. They are well-organized, can manage multiple analyses/projects simultaneously, and is intellectually curious. A strong business analytics candidate should have solid skills in SQL coding and report building in Tableau or advanced Excel.

The Business Analyst (BA) is a core member of the America's Customer Service Customer Experience (CSCX) program team, who proactively engages with key business stakeholders across Amazon.com to bring forward the voice of the customer to identify and deliver customer-impacting solutions. Areas of concentration for the CSCX BA could be the Prime Member experience, Amazon Fulfillment customer experience, Merchant Fulfillment customer experience, or opportunities within the Amazon Retail customer experience. There is no shortage of opportunity to relentlessly advocate on behalf of our customers and to drive measurable results.

Responsibilities include:
Developing intelligent, insightful reporting on the key drivers of our business
Interacting with internal stakeholders to deep-dive outlier events
Ad-hoc project work supporting the re-invention of how we manage our business
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Identify process and system improvement opportunities by monitoring existent metrics, analyzing data and partnering with internal teams
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics
4+ years of experience in analytics or operations
Proven analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses
Advanced SQL writing and experience in data mining (SQL, ETL, VBA, data warehouse, etc.) and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets
Experience with data visualization software, preferably Tableau
Strong verbal and written communication & data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams
Experience managing multiple competing priorities and projects in a fast-paced environment
Preferred Qualifications
5+ years of professional experience in business intelligence or data analysis
Strong knowledge of advanced statistics
Creative in finding new solutions, designing innovative methods, systems and processes
Extensive experience working on complex, cross-functional initiatives in a dynamic environment
Excellent organization skills to work across functions and upwards
Ability to use data to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analysis
Ability to take loosely defined business questions and translate them into clearly defined technical/data specifications

Do you want to be a leader in the team that takes Transportation and Retail models and products to the next generation? Do you have a solid analytical thinking, metrics driven decision making and want to solve problems with solutions that will meet the growing worldwide need? Then Transportation is the team for you. Company Overview
kACE is the product brand for the solutions provided by Fenics Software Limited. kACE was launched in July 2018 following the acquisition of Kalahari Limited by Fenics Software. The product range includes pricing, analytics, distribution and trading tools for a broad range of asset classes.
Both FENICS and Kalahari have over 30 years’ experience providing intuitive pre-trade analysis, risk management, automated client price distribution, post trade processing and innovative pricing solutions for the FX derivatives and financial markets. The extensive range of APIs facilitate connectivity to third parties and bespoke front end solutions.
Kalahari Limited is a subsidiary of Fenics Software Limited which is a subsidiary of BGC Partners, Inc. (NASDAQ:BGCP). BGC are a leading global brokerage company servicing the financial and real estate markets. kACE Pro FXO is licensed for use at over 350 client sites worldwide. The kACE brand is supported from offices in London, New York, Hong Kong, Singapore and Tokyo.
Responsibilities:
As a member of the kACE product development group, you will be part of a team implementing innovative and cutting-edge solutions designed to meet the needs of a rapidly changing market.
Own and drive forward the process of gathering business requirements and translating them into approved functional requirements.
Provide traceability between business and functional requirements.
Document requirements in a manner that allows for future reusability and ease of maintenance.
Produce required content for product documentation, e.g. release notes, user guides, and support guides.

Prepare comprehensive functional requirements for development projects based on business requirements, priorities and scope.
Create use cases and/or acceptance tests to clarify and supplement functional requirements.
Review and approve technical designs as being fit for purpose and in compliance with product requirements.
Review and approve comprehensive test plans for the project, assisting QA with formulating test design, cases, and environment setup.
Mediate between the various interested parties to interpret/clarify requirements and help resolve any differences that might arise as a result.
Proactively notify stakeholders when requirements are added or removed from scope.
Adhere to established best practices and SDLC processes.
Work cooperatively with project team members from the development and QA groups to ensure a successful outcome for the project.
Take on multiple projects simultaneously as needed.
Develop subject matter expertise in the business areas/functions covered by assigned projects.
Participate in periodic release activities.

Bachelor’s degree
3+ years of experience in business analysis is required.
Worked with the Waterfall Software Development Life Cycle or similar process.
Expertise in writing client facing documentation and specifications
Should have written requirements that can be traced from the business requirements through the functional requirements and use cases to the QA test cases.
Experience writing re-usable requirements.
Provided business analysis for software deployed at an external client site.
Experience working on a legacy software product.

Must be energetic, self-motivated, thorough, detail oriented and possess excellent analytic and communication skills.

Strong knowledge of foreign exchange market derivatives is desirable.
Experience with risk management, market data or e-trading is desirable.

Our Company
Insikt is a rapidly growing technology company that connects borrowers seeking loans with investors seeking better, stable returns. Our mission is to bring trust and transparency back to the world of lending and securitization while also helping underserved families and small businesses find responsible credit options. We are accomplishing this mission by enabling:

1. Lending: Our proprietary white-label lending platform (Lendify) allows any retail store, online brand, or distribution partner to make loans or provide purchase financing to its customers, in its own brand name, without any prior credit expertise and with minimal upfront investment.
2. Investing: Our proprietary investing platform allows accredited investors to buy into a variety of investment instruments backed by distinct loan portfolios underwritten in-house. Each investor has online access to all the same data as our Risk and Analytics teams, ensuring transparency into all investment instruments.

We have brought together the best and brightest from top-tier technology companies, leading financial service providers, and world-class investment firms. We are funded by some of the best investors and entrepreneurs in the world, including First Mark Capital, Revolution Ventures, Capital One, Continental Investors and Serengeti Asset Management.

Our Values
We are a tight-knit team of highly talented and motivated people from a diverse set of backgrounds and industries all tenaciously driven by our mission. We value creativity, courage, and collaboration and we believe in letting the best and most innovative ideas rise to the top. We are looking for the absolute best people who want work hard, play hard, and build a socially-minded, profitable, and enduring business in the process.

The job
We are looking for a Usability Analyst to help improve the experience of people applying for our loans and improving the number of applicants completing the process.

Responsibilities include:

Drive analytical insights through in-depth analysis of our data assets
Interview users that had issues to understand improvement opportunities
Interact with agents to gather feedback and identify where to focus the attention
Prepare improvements suggestions for our product managers and engineers
Communicate to agents and partners about new features and monitor the impact
Support new initiatives

Job Requirements

The ideal candidate will have:

Written and verbal fluency in English & Spanish
A true curiosity and passion for understanding the underlying aspects of every business challenge
Willingness to get your hands dirty—everyone, top to bottom, is an individual contributor
Desire to step outside of your comfort zone, wear multiple hats, and learn new things
Strong critical thinking skills and ability to weigh trade-offs quickly and empirically
Strong attention to detail with qualitative and analytical skills
An energetic, driven, fun, and generally awesome personality!
Passion for walking a mile in another’s shoes
Strong communication, organizational, interpersonal and listening skills

Compensation

Compensation is competitive and will be based on prior work experience
Insikt Options
401(k)
Complimentary snacks in the office
Onsite gym
Convenient location in Downtown San Francisco less than two blocks from BART
We offer equity packages that allow you to have ownership in this growing company.
Full medical, dental and vision coverage. Insikt pays 100% for employee premiums and 50% dependent premiums for medical, dental and vision benefits.
You can expect a collaborative environment, team building activities, dinners, and fun monthly gatherings, along with mentorship and career growth.
We believe in getting people to where they need to go. This value extends beyond our business principles into Insikt’s internal career development philosophy. As such, you will work closely with a highly-experienced management team to mentor you and help you achieve your personal career goals.

Job Description
The Fulfillment By Amazon - Customer Experience (FBA-CX) team is looking for an exceptional and experienced Business Analyst to drive data analysis and insights that will ensure products listed on Amazon meet the high product quality bar.

In this role you will leverage your advanced SQL skills to construct and implement data pipeline to collect data, clean/organize data to get it ready for analysis and perform structured analysis to glean insights that will identify areas of opportunity and in turn shape the product features and programs we roll out to continue to improve customer experience. You should be self-starter who is highly proficient in SQL, has an extremely high level of customer focus, has a passion for process improvement and is excited by mining large and complex datasets

As you further your career as a data analyst in FBA-CX, you will focus on instrumenting automation of metrics that measure customer experience and identify emerging trends teams need to focus on, analyze Customer and Seller data to identify the root cause of customer issues, and recommend solutions, backed by data, to address customer issues. We are focused on your success and want to build strong leaders. You can expect to leverage your data skills and have full ownership of the projects you work on.

Key Responsibilities Include:
Advanced SQL skills to extract, aggregate and load data from multiple data sources
Work with and synthesize large datasets from multiple data sources
Work with BI team to navigate through the data sources and introduce new metrics to audit performance and identify areas where customer experience is degrading
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Automate reporting with a combination of SQL, Excel, and BI tools like Looker
Deep-dive a variety of ad hoc questions on emerging customer experience trends
Manage and execute entire projects or components of large projects from start to finish including project management, data gathering and manipulation, synthesis and modeling, problem solving, and communication of insights and recommendations
Seek opportunities to inject advanced analytical techniques across the FBA Customer Experience organization

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Engineering or a related field
5+ years of professional experience in data analytics, business analysis or comparable analytics position
Advanced skills in data mining using SQL, ETL, data warehouse as well as Excel
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills and an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.
Ability to structure complex analysis and perform the analysis to drive insights
Proven problem solving skills, project management skills, attention to detail, and exceptional organizational skills
Ability to deal with ambiguity and competing objectives in a fast paced environment
Preferred Qualifications
Masters degree is preferred in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field.
Advanced SQL skills to extract, aggregate, and load data
5+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analysis role.
Experienced in data warehousing, data modeling concept and building new DW tables
Experience with building multi-dimensional data models to serve as a foundation for future analyses
Ability to deal with ambiguity
Understanding of predictive modeling
Understanding of R or Python/another scripting language

job_description:
Position Summary
This role provides focused business analysis functions necessary to help support the Product Management team and strategic and product planning efforts. Tasks include: working with product and portfolio owners to conduct market research and analysis, documenting and streamlining operations, and supporting product group initiatives or programs. This role requires research, data management, and analytical abilities, as well as the business insight to drive key projects at various stages—whether planning, implementing or evaluating.
Primary Responsibilities
You will lead market and competitive research and analysis, provide insights, and document results
Determine effective product positioning, correctly targeting the product in the market and shorten the time of sale for maximum sales effectiveness
Lead Market Requirement Documents based on market inputs (customer calls/visits, partners, trends, field feedback, services, win/loss analysis, competitive analysis, ROI, and other market opportunities)
Lead the creation of product roadmaps and product positioning based upon analysis of market dynamics
Build and deliver presentations to non-Exec audiences
Lead programs and streamline associated operations (EoS, EoL, etc. or as assigned)
Lead product group initiatives such as customer roundtables and programs
Craft methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Process-oriented, mindset of continual improvement; real passion for ingesting and analyzing data, documenting processes with the intent of driving progressive improvements and significant innovation
Ability to think strategically and see the big picture, analyzing a problem or project from a variety of angles, yet examining specific aspects in significant detail
Ability to learn quickly, build consensus and interact effectively with teams—Product Management, cross-functional or vendor
Knowledge of business process and change management methodology
Strong organizational skills, strong attention to detail and accuracy
Strong verbal and written communications skills
Must have strong data management and data analysis skills.
Knowledge or experience on any web based statistical tool is a plus
Knowledge of research methodology, survey techniques a plus
Duties may require being on call periodically and working outside normal working hours (evenings)
Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Finance, Economics, Statistics, or other appropriate field with 5+ years experience; or a Master's degree with 3+ years experience; or equivalent experience.
2+ years of technical, analytical work experience.

Part-timeDescription
Afni has a great opportunity for a part time Business Analyst who is responsible for assistance in analyzing Business Intelligence (BI) and reporting requirements, developing value-added BI solutions, and producing a variety of reports and dashboards. You will demonstrate a certain degree of creativity and latitude while performing a variety of tasks under general supervision. If you are analytical problem solver with an attention to detail and a flexible part time work schedule works for you, we want to hear from you!

What you will be doing:

Assist BI team members working with business users to analyze BI and reporting requirements, develop value-added BI solutions, and produce a variety of reports and dashboards.
Participate in requirements collection, analysis, definition, and documentation activities; assisting in defining and prioritizing content to be included in the Enterprise Data Warehouse.
Assist in first line support for reporting and portal related issues and enhancement requests.
Examine and review unusual variances. Make recommendations when applicable for process improvement.
Requirements
What you will need:

Associate's degree or higher in Information Technology, Mathematics, or related field preferred with at least one year of work experience in a process driven environment.
Proven experience in working in Business Intelligence and/or Data Warehouse environment preferred
Database (SQL) and BI tool (Tableau) experience preferred.
High level expertise in Excel required.
Familiar with standard concepts including statistical analysis methods, practices and procedures of management accounting.
Seeks collaborative solutions to address customer issues.
Exhibits clear written and verbal communication skills.
Builds cross functional relationships.
Can articulate thought process and rationale behind decision making.
Seeks out new tasks, training and coaching and assimilates feedback to improve performance.

At Signifyd we're creating a new market. We're constantly improving and expanding the technology that has changed what fraud protection for e-commerce looks like. So we don't have time for office politics. We understand that different people have different work styles and we thrive on variety while learning from each other. We're all Signifyers, so we know that what needs to get done will get done.

Signifyd is a place where no one is going to tell you how to do your job. If you want help, you'll get it — from all quarters. But we pretty much figure out what needs to be done, who's in the best position to do it and then let that person roll-up her or his sleeves and have at it.

We're protecting retailers from online fraud in a way that's never been done before and we could use your help if you're someone:


Who believes challenges are best overcome by thinking differently.
Who knows his or her role, but isn't confined by it.
Who's greatest satisfaction comes from helping customers succeed and achieve their dreams.
Who isn't afraid to disagree, convincingly, civilly and honestly.
Who will stop and hold the door for a colleague, even if you're running late.

Oh, and a few particulars for this role:
You'll join a new team and work cross-functionally with several organizations at Signifyd (including Data Science, Modeling, Engineering, Customer Success and Sales), with the primary objective of enabling leadership to make effective, analytically driven, and strategic operating decisions. This is a high-impact role that offers tremendous opportunities for growth, learning and leadership.

Job Description:

Use data to inform, influence and support business strategy and product short and long-term roadmaps
Generate and size opportunities to optimize performance, track and report key metrics
Develop in-depth analyses and build automated and scalable reporting tools (dashboards, reporting packs, etc.) to regularly assess the performance of the business, tell the story behind the numbers, and provide actionable insights to leadership
Lead ad hoc "consulting-style" projects to improve metrics, data quality, and reporting processes that will support Risk initiatives. This often involves starting with a fairly open-ended problem, identifying trends and issues, synthesizing and reporting the results, proposing and developing a solution, and driving implementation.
Collaborate with other teams and leadership to define business vision, goals and strategies & execution plans
Review high-volume data to identify issues with data quality and strengthen model performance
Be a subject matter expert & go-to person for knowledge-based data and measures essential to hitting to our company KPIs

Desired Skills & Experience


Excellent SQL skills (3+ years experience), with strong experience in building complex, custom SQL queries, using large data sets
Background on payment, fraud space, data science is required
Fluency with data analysis and visualization tools (Tableau is extra credit)
(highly desired) Familiarity with scripting
Outstanding written and presentation skills. Experience presenting technical content to audiences
Demonstrated problem solving and critical thinking, providing data-driven business insights and recommendations
Willingness to adapt to a constantly changing, customer-driven work environment
Ability to work on routine tasks both independently and with the team

Who is Blueprint?
Blueprint Consulting Services is a group of solution-minded thinkers changing the face of consulting in Bellevue, WA. We follow a Mission, Vision, and Core Values that allow us to function as a collaborative unit.

What are our Solutions?
Blueprint provides strategic and professional consulting services as well as technical delivery for companies of all sizes and market segments. We bridge the gap between the segments for a complete solution for our clients, allowing us to be a partner from idea to implementation.

Why you want to be a part of BPCS?
Working at Blueprint will change the way you think about the typical consulting job. We want you to be accountable and make decisions that positively impact the client. Our people are our solutions, we work together and collaborate to make sure our offerings and execution are always superior. We also have a great benefits package offering medical, dental, vision, 401k, PTO, and company events throughout the year.
