Other reporting and analysis tasks as assigned.

Builders and Fixers Wanted!

We are immediately seeing a mid-career product-focused technical Business Analyst to join our team in Irvine, California (Orange County).

Ephesoft is a global, fast-growing, profitable, private company looking to add great people to our team. After our recent (first-round of) funding, we are seeking urgently to fill positions worldwide.

Our industry-leading advanced capture solution classifies and extracts data from structured and unstructured documents faster and more accurately than any other technology not only to improve business processes and efficiency, but also uncovers “dark” data lurking in company intranets and file stores.

Ephesoft has been named to the Inc. 500 list of fastest growing privately-held companies in the US, and named one of the top companies to work for in Orange County. The company offers benefits, 401K and other perks. Ephesoft is headquartered in Irvine, California with offices in London, Frankfurt, Germany, Australia and India.

Job Description

Ideal candidates are product oriented analysts who are comfortable working directly with stakeholders evaluating the businesses workflow and leveraging our product to solve their business problems. The Business Analyst will gather information from the stakeholder, develop requirements, user stories and acceptance criteria and assist the Product Owners.

The Business Analyst will also be an essential part of the overall product team, contributing and ultimately part of constantly moving the product forward in the market.

Responsibilities

Create and document product features that provide true business value
Gathering and documenting requirements, user stories and acceptance criteria as a team member of an Agile scrum team
Engage with scrum teams during refinement, sprint planning and sprint reviews
Works with the product team to identify enhancements and customizations
Performs Use Case Scenario testing to ensure a quality outcome
Assists in evangelizing and outward communication of product features, timelines and product roadmap strategy
Must be willing to be hands-on and constantly learn
Qualifications - (Please read carefully)

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS or equivalent
Must have minimum 4 years of business analysis experience within software products or web application build-out. B2B Enterprise software experience strongly preferred.
Technical Business Analyst with hands on development team experience strongly preferred
Software Product experience preferred. SAAS product experience, especially proven experience transitioning from onPrem to SAAS is ideal.
Comfortable assessing the true business problem from stakeholders rather than solutioning
Experience working with Agile tools like Jira
Excellent communications skills – verbal, written and visual
Proven ability to be organized, efficient, and work independently while contributing to various teams
Attention to detail and deadline-focused
Additional Information

If it is not clear on your resume, please provide your current city/state location. exact address is not required or needed at this time.

This role reports to the VP, Product Management, and is located in Irvine, California. Remote work is not being considered for this role. Otherwise qualified candidates who are already located within the United States and have a right to work for any employer may be considered for relocation.

Job Description

Business Analyst will work with the Analytics and R&D departments to assist our team of developers and risk adjustment experts in creating, analyzing, maintaining, and quality assurance of system requirements documentation. The candidate will be working closely with senior and C-level decision makers, and collaborating with a cross-functional team of industry-leading individuals in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial-oriented environment.

Qualifications

The Business Analyst will be responsible for a number of functions including, but not limited to:
Documenting requirements and specifications throughout the requirements and design development cycle
Maintaining and updating requirements documentation as needed
Identifying, documenting and reporting discovered product anomalies and recommending options to increase software consistency
Serving as a resource for engineering and quality assurance; clarifying requirements and ensuring readability
Serving as a liaison between the business users and the development team to gather and communicate requirements which help define and verify product design
Creating visual modeling or diagramming of the current and proposed work flows
Collaborating with the development team, business users, team, product management, and upper management on various activities that will improve the product
Guiding stakeholders and end-users on devising effective and efficient approaches to achieving project objectives
Other duties as assigned
QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:
Skills, Knowledge, Abilities:
Proven ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure
Deep analytical capabilities
Excellent project management planning, documentation, organizational, and problem solving abilities required
High degree of professionalism, enthusiasm, autonomy and initiative on a daily basis
Self-driving and leadership
Ability to work within a team environment
Excellent listening, interpersonal, written and oral communication skills
Experience interfacing with both external and internal customers at all levels
Demonstrated ability to analyze problems and understand the necessary components of a solution through analysis, planning, evaluation of cost/benefit, testing and reporting
Training/Education:
Bachelors degree in related field of study is required
Advanced degree in related field of study is preferred
Experience:
Experience in health care insurance or health care is preferred, but those with relevant experience in other industries may be considered
Experience with business and technical requirements analysis
Experience overseeing the design, development, and implementation of software is preferred
Extensive experience in gathering requirements and focused understanding of complex solutions
Experience in Agile methodology a plus
Additional Information

Medical benefits, 401K, paid holidays, vacation, sick and personal days.Bonuses
Business casual dress environment
Friendly atmosphere and supportive learning environment
Monday-Friday

Business Analyst in Albany, NY

Overview:
Public Consulting Group, Inc. (PCG) is a leading public sector management consulting and operations improvement firm that partners with health, education, and human services agencies to improve lives. Founded in 1986 and headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, PCG has over 2,000 professionals in more than 50 offices across North America and in Europe. The firm has five designated practice areas with extensive experience in all 50 states, clients in six Canadian provinces, and a growing practice in Europe. Often combining resources from two or more practice areas, PCG offers clients a multidisciplinary approach to solve their challenges or pursue opportunities. To learn more, visit www.publicconsultinggroup.com.

Responsibilities:
Business Analysts are the entry-level position in PCG's consulting career ladder. They are expected to play a staff role in a wide range of work assignments that may include the following:

Supporting project managers across multiple projects and clients and working with various project teams.
Providing daily client and project support either onsite or via phone/email (as project experience and knowledge is gained).
Supporting financial analysis and funding assessments for various clients including cost allocation plans, cost reports, and setting rates for public services.
Learning PCG's web-based technologies and supporting the project team through the customization process, implementation, training, and ongoing operational efforts.
Supporting proposal development teams, including writing sections, coordinating efforts and preparing proposal submissions.
Developing presentations for and attending conferences/seminars.
Preparing and presenting written status reports. Supporting the team completing assessment documentation and recommendation reports for clients.
Conducting policy and other research to support the project team and assist in preparing information briefs for both internal and client-facing use.
Defining, documenting, and improving business processes.
Gathering and analyzing a variety of data, including both financial and written policy/procedure information.
Learning and performing tasks related to sales and marketing. Travel (25% - 50%) and work over 40 hours per week is required. This is a salaried position. This position will be located in our office in Albany, New York.
Qualifications

Required Skills:

Excellent organizational, oral presentation and written communication skills.
Strong analytical skills, including the ability to analyze and organize data.
Ability to work both in a team situation and autonomously.
Proficiency in Microsoft applications, in particular Excel & SharePoint.
Commitment to life long learning.
Flexibility and willingness to embrace change.
Differentiating Skills:

Understanding of professional business atmosphere.
Software development and/or coding.
Public Speaking.
Sales and/or marketing experience or internships.
Prior travel experience (domestic or abroad).
Health and human services programs and/or Medicaid knowledge.
Cost or government accounting.
Required Education and Prior Experience:

Bachelor's Degree.
1-2 plus years of relevant work experience in the fields of health care, government, or the consulting field

Marketing Statement


Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible
NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

Job Description


The Junior Clinical Business Analyst under varying levels of direction and expertise, is responsible for the on-going assessment, design, and development and implementation of corporate –wide clinical systems. Specifically, collect and transform large quantities of information into meaningful business requirements; develop and modify requirements documentation for the design and implementation of clinical information systems; critically evaluate information from various sources, distinguish user needs from actual business needs and partner with business users, project managers, programmers, consultants and IT leadership in optimizing the scope, benefits and risks of actual and proposed projects as well as assist in managing stakeholder expectations.
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Analyze and document business requirements and processes; communicate requirements to technical personnel through the construction of basic conceptual data, process models and flowcharts, and technical specifications.
Interview end users, stakeholders, and project sponsors in order to assess business and clinical needs; create business, functional and technical requirements documents based on captured data and in accordance with departmental protocol/standards.
Convert information gathered into details including data sources, data and user types, interface components, interface navigation needs, reporting needs, and administrative system needs.
Define external interfaces, constraints, quality issues and other non-functional requirements.
Provide project management team with identified risks, concerns, and ambiguities discovered during the gathering of requirements; assist team in developing solutions.
Partner with project managers to complete requirements documentation in accordance with project schedule.
Plan, organize, facilitate, and lead meetings and workgroups as well as oversee and execute follow-up activities.
Ensure software development team accounts for all defined requirements in coordination with quality assurance team. Ensure that all quality standards comply with internal policies and industry standards.
Document changes to baseline requirements through standard change control process. Document software test plans, technical requirements, release notes, user and training guidelines and other materials.
Plan, coordinate, and support unit acceptance testing and subsequent deployments in coordination with other team leaders.
Perform end user and application support functions including problem solving and resolution of application function defects. Provide systems and application training.
Develop and execute project presentations.
Participate in special projects as required.
Participate in the development of various departmental training initiatives.
Due to the responsibilities of your position, you will be required to work beyond your regularly scheduled hours.
Minimum Qualifications


1. A Baccalaureate Degree or clinical degree from an accredited college or university; or
2. An Associates Degree from an accredited college or university and two years of experience analyzing and transforming information into business, clinical, and/or functional requirements in clinical, allied health, non-allied health, behavioral health, information technology, information services, business, analytics or related area; or
3. A satisfactory combination of education, training, and experience.
4. Specialty certification(s) issued by a national commercially available program, state, professional society, academic or technical institution in an area(s) listed above, may be credited on a month-to-month basis toward the required work experience for a total of one year.

Department Preferences


Bachelor’s Degree in related field
A satisfactory combination of education, training, and experience.
Strong desktop skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio).
Participate in special projects as needed and perform other duties as assigned
Must be able to work independently as well as work as part of a fast moving team
How To Apply


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button or mail your resume, noting the above Job ID #, to:

NYC Health + Hospitals / Central Office
Human Resources Department
55 Water Street, 26th Floor
New York, NY 10041
Attn: Recruitment Unit
If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume.

JPMorgan is a global leader in both Equity Capital Markets (ECM) & Debt Capital Markets (DCM). The Capital Markets groups offer corporate, institutional investors and government clients a wide range of world leading services from superior Origination to exceptional Syndication. JPMorgan Syndicate Desks in both ECM and DCM play critical roles in the execution of primary transactions, offering maximum value for issuers who want to raise Equity or Debt capitals with exceptional distribution capabilities to a large base of institutional investors.

Working closely with the Syndicate Desks in both ECM & DCM globally, the Syndicate Technology team drives the strategy and delivery of technical solutions to this mission-critical business. With a wide user base in the Syndicate, Capital Markets, Sales and Marketing, Corporate Access and Research, the team’s responsibilities include delivering the technology platform for the bond issuance and IPO book building, marketing and roadshow, Primary Market trade settlements, risk management and client value realization.

Having launched several major initiatives, Syndicate Technology team is looking to recruit a Business Analyst/Project Manager based in New York City. The candidate will have business facing and technical experience in financial services industry; will be a true team player, keen to add value with can-do attitude, not afraid of taking on challenges and opportunities. The successful candidate will be able to deliver against tight deadlines in a high-paced environment.

Responsibilities in this role include
Support high-paced trading floor technology needs for the FI & EQ Sales and the Syndicate teams
Strong partnership with business and development teams to ensure the systems are operational at all times
Responsibility for driving requirements from a conceptual model through implementation and post – verification
Translate business requirements into IT application and business process impacts

Qualifications
Financial Industry knowledge and experience are required
IT experience and track record of applying technology to solve business problems are required
Strong communication skills are a MUST, both with developers and project stake holders
Track records of requirement analysis and application design
Requirement documentation & Specification writing
Experience in Agile methodology and ability to apply in different environments
Can-do attitude performing under pressure
Qualifications

Can-do attitude performing under pressure
Our Corporate & Investment Bank relies on innovators like you to build and maintain the technology that helps us safely service the world’s important corporations, governments and institutions. You’ll develop solutions for a bank entrusted with holding $18 trillion of assets and $393 billion in deposits. CIB provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk, and extends liquidity in markets spanning over 100 countries around the world.

When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000+ technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.

At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.

PayLease is hiring an entry-level Business Analyst I to fulfill the Product Owner role on an Agile development team to ensure the successful delivery of PayLease product initiatives. The Business Analyst (BA) is responsible for interfacing with business stakeholders and developers to help ensure the successful formulation, execution and rollout of product and operational development efforts. This position will communicate effectively with business constituents to help ensure product management has captured requirements and that product development team understands them. This position will also help the business team frame their thinking (in regards what is truly needed vs. nice to have, etc.) as well as ensuring that requirements are ‘actionable’. The BA will also be expected to support the creation and dissemination of product information/updates and assist with training needs as required from project definition and epic breakdown, to user story delivery and product launch.

Collaborate with clients, partners, business stakeholders, Product, and Engineering to elicit requirements.
Analyze and validate functional and non-functional stakeholder requirements against both business and technical domains.
Actively participate in technical design discussions with Engineering when defining the scope and system functionality of product initiatives.
Complete work breakdown of software projects/phases, including epic identification and user story breakdown.
Create supporting product design documentation as necessary, including diagrams (i.e. user workflows, DFDs, process swimlanes, etc.).
Act as a gatekeeper for requirements entering assigned Engineering Team’s product backlog.
Own and prioritize requirements aligned to assigned Engineering Team’s product backlog.
Meet with business stakeholders on a regular basis to ensure that their prioritization is well known and understood.
Advocate for the business community with regards to the high priority tickets/initiatives in the Agile delivery process.
Be prepared to make informed decisions to address Engineering and stakeholder concerns or clarifications on user stories.
Hold requirement review sessions with business stakeholders to ensure that desired functionality is well understood, comprehensively documented and considers numerous and varied use cases.
Support Quality Engineering in translating business requirements to test requirements, starting with the purposeful inclusion of acceptance criteria.
Own the creation and dissemination of all Product documentation when notifying stakeholders, clients, and partners of any functionality changes and improvements (i.e. Release Notes).
Execute product release notes, training, and stakeholder communication to ensure successful launch of product initiatives.
Use approved Product Management software tools to manage, track, augment with supporting product information, and comment on assigned work as initiatives progress through the PDLC as necessary.
Attend and actively participate in all appropriate Agile/Scrum ceremonies (Product Grooming, Sprint Planning, Sprint Review, etc.).
Coordinate with Product, Marketing, and business departments on the Go-To-Market plans for new features as needed.
Contribute to the Product Advisory Board (PAB) meetings as needed.
Take on projects with regards to market research, user feedback, competitive analysis, and any other elements of Product Management as assigned.
Use and continually develop leadership and product management skills.
Perform other related duties as assigned.
Proven track record of requirements elicitation and writing functional specifications (Requirement writing, Use Case analysis, User Stories, etc.).
Skilled in documenting and analyzing workflows, business processes, and operational systems.
Demonstrated ability to break down epic requirements into actionable user stories.
Demonstrated ability to identify requirement gaps and make improvements to product requirements.
Practical knowledge of Quality Assurance and experience with User Acceptance Testing.
Familiar with Agile (Scrum and Kanban) software delivery processes and techniques.
Successful track record fostering teamwork and positively influencing technical and non-technical stakeholders to achieve organizational or project goals.
Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong organizational and task management skills, including attention to detail and multitasking skills.
Results-oriented with a demonstrated sense of urgency and the ability to assess situations and make clear decisions in a fast-paced environment.
History of assessing and solving problem situations, gathering information and identifying causes, generating solutions, and making recommendations/decisions to resolve the problem.
Enjoy working in a team-oriented culture and able to work in a dynamic, fast-paced work environment.
Experience with property management and/or payment processing or resident billing not required, but desired.
Client/Partner-facing requirement gathering and training experience a plus.
Experience with MS Visio, MS Excel, G-Suite applications, Atlassian tools, Slack, and Trello required.
Product Management certifications a plus (i.e. CSM, CSPO, PMI-ACP).
Bachelor Degree in appropriate field of study or equivalent work experience.

Description:
Under general supervision, the Business Analyst is responsible for delivering mutually agreed upon functional requirements for the IT team. This position participates in all phases of the Software Development Life Cycle including both package and custom development, taking a business requirement through to implementation, and post-implementation. The Associate may interact with his or her supervisor several times a week to receive guidance and feedback. Many non-routine activities will require a supervisor’s advance approval.

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES*
Under the guidance of a senior business analyst, gather business case details for proposed projects.
Collect & manage business and functional requirements through implementation:
Create or revising any requirements documentation
Track changes, analyzing proposed changes for impact
Coordinate team & stakeholder communication for new and/or updated requirements
Identify and participate in the resolution of requirements conflicts involving scope, schedule, budget or quality.
Monitor and report on requirements metrics.
Ensure that all requirements are compliant with IT policies throughout the project.
Obtain stakeholder acceptance for all deliverables.
Manage requirement traceability matrix throughout project lifecycle.
Create, coordinate, and conduct user acceptance testing, including coordination of resources, documentation of issues found and follow up through resolution as required.
Design and maintain end user training and support team documentation.
Develop strong relationships with the supported business function by building subject matter expertise in their business processes and the systems that support those processes.
Coordinate project activities including scheduling meetings, publishing agendas and meeting minutes/action items where applicable, and follow up reports.
Develop subject matter expertise on the front-end and back-end data systems that support and interact with GameStop systems, and the flow of data between those systems.

RELATED COMPETENCIES
Building Partnerships – Identifies opportunities and takes action to build strategic relationships between one’s area and other areas, teams, departments, units, or organizations to help achieve business goals.
Operational Decision Making - Securing and comparing information from multiple sources to identify business issues; committing to an action after weighing alternative solutions against important decision criteria.
Planning and Organizing - Establishes courses of action for self and others to ensure that work is completed efficiently.
Technical/Professional Knowledge and Skills – Having achieved a satisfactory level of technical and professional skill or knowledge in position-related areas; keeps up with current developments and trends in areas of expertise.

BASIC AND PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS (EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE)
A Bachelor’s degree from an accredited program in Information Systems, Computer Science or other related field required
At least 2 years of Business Analyst, Information Systems or Quality Assurance experience required
Experience in implementation and delivery of software preferred

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS, JOB SKILLS, ABILITIES
Proficient knowledge of methodologies, processes and tools commonly used by Business Analysts
Possess willingness and ability to work with legacy technologies
Possess leadership skills as demonstrated by a disciplined approach to innovation and the capacity to create and embrace the vision for the end goal or project deliverable, including a determined commitment to project completion
Proficient ability to communicate effectively with others using written and spoken English including the ability to provide clear, constructive feedback to team members
Ability to work under demanding time constraints and production goals
Ability to spend time in the user environment as needed to analyze business operations and perform post-implementation support and validation
Proficient project planning skills, including the ability to organize, prioritize and control job responsibilities in order to meet deadlines in an environment with overlapping and potentially conflicting priorities
Possess proficient analytical, problem solving and decision making skills
Proficient knowledge of implementation and delivery of software
Working ability to remain effective under stress, and respond to pressure in a manner acceptable to others and to the organization
Demonstrated capacity for gathering and scrutinizing data to identify issues, opportunities, patterns, and sustainable business solutions
Knowledge of Retail Systems and processes preferred
Knowledge of Microsoft .Net Object Oriented technologies preferred
Participation in groups or affiliations concerned with the development and revision of the Body of Common Knowledge for BAs preferred
Consistently demonstrates a commitment to GameStop policies and procedures, including but not limited to, attendance, confidentiality, conflict of interest, and ethical responsibilities

Lime is a smart-mobility provider that offers cities an array of mobility products including Lime-E e-assist bicycles and Lime-S electric scooters. Lime aims to revolutionize mobility in cities and campuses by empowering residents with cleaner, more efficient, and affordable transportation options that improve urban sustainability.
We are looking for a Business Analyst to help us solve the most complex, yet critical questions in our business. In this role you will be working with large data sets, incomplete data, or no data at all in order to guide us into our next steps. This is a highly valued role that is important to Lime’s future.
Responsibilities
Build out and conduct reviews to measure KPI performance and business risk/opportunity across Lime
Help the Lime leadership team drive outcomes
Identify and help address cross-cutting issues that affect various groups within Lime
Own and understand company data to keep insights from being lost
Requirements
Excellent communication and writing skills
Logical thinker, with verbal and quantitative reasoning, and the ability to step back and see patterns
Can use data as a storytelling tool
Ability to collaborate, and be part of a team
Experience in helping companies identify improvements in processes, and in assisting with implementing those improvements
Great attention to detail
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics or similar degree preferred
Forecasting & modeling experience – prior consulting or investment banking experience a plus
Experience with SQL preferred
3+ year’s consulting/industry experience preferred
What We Offer
A position that offers many career and resume building experiences with the fastest growing startup of 2018
Scale with a fast-growing organization, with tons of opportunity for growth
Play a role in the transformation of urban mobility and sustainability
Work with a team of fun and motivated individuals
Competitive salary and benefits
We here at Lime strive to build a workforce comprised of individuals with diverse backgrounds, abilities, minds, and identities that will help us to grow, not only as a company, but also as individuals. Lime is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Description:
DXC Technology (NYSE: DXC) is the world’s leading independent, end-to-end IT services company, helping clients harness the power of innovation to thrive on change. Created by the merger of CSC and the Enterprise Services business of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, DXC Technology serves nearly 6,000 private and public-sector clients across 70 countries. The company’s technology independence, global talent and extensive partner alliance combine to deliver powerful next-generation IT services and solutions. DXC Technology is recognized among the best corporate citizens globally.

Summary
Supports the operations team in the research and assessment of business goals, objectives and needs to align information technology solutions with business initiatives. Serves as a liaison between technical personnel and business area. Completes work with a limited degree of supervision. Demonstrates specialized business skills acquired through job-related training and considerable on-the-job experience. May act as an informal resource for colleagues with less experience. Identifies key issues and patterns from partial/conflicting data. Takes a broad perspective to problems and spots new, less obvious solutions.

Essential Job Functions
Involved in day-to-day activities on creation and administration of project management models and tools with the purpose of tracking and reporting on resources, projects, project tasks, resource planning, collecting actuals, and reporting.
Involved in developing and implementing project plans.
Operations management duties including general reporting.
Engaged in reporting on project management activities.
Assists in planning and designing business processes; assists in formulating recommendations to improve and support business activities.
Conducts and summarizes complex data and business analyses to develop business plans.
Coordinates the metrics required to measure business performance, and compares actual data to forecasted values.
Works with cross-functional teams to facilitate the data collection and performance measurement process, and escalates issues as necessary. Makes contributions to research and analyses on priority projects within established guidelines.
Education and Experience Required:
Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline or equivalent experience and a minimum of 0-2 years of related experience.
May include highly experienced individuals performing entry-level equivalent work who are non-degreed or degreed in an unrelated field.
Knowledge and Skills:
0-2 years Medicaid experience.
Essential: requirements determination using structured techniques for documentation, analysis; decomposition of high-level information into details; abstracting low-level information; distinguishing requests vs. needs; classifying prioritizing requirements; requirements change management and traceability; building relationships and working collaboratively; effective verbal/written communication.
Other Qualifications
Good personal computer and business solutions software skills
Analytical and problem solving skills
Good interpersonal skills to interact with customers and team members
Good written and oral communication skills
Presentation skills to communicate with management and customers
Ability to work in a team environment
Work Environment
Office environment

Defines and documents customer business functions and processes.

Acts as a liaison between departmental end-users, technical analysts, information technology analysts, consultants and other governmental organizations in the analysis, design, configuration, testing and maintenance of case management systems to ensure optimal operational performance.

Consults with functional unit management and personnel to identify, define and document business needs and objectives, current operational procedures, problems, input and output requirements, and levels of systems access.

Reads and interprets case management systems and functional technical literature and translates in terms understandable to the end-users.

Tracks and fully documents changes for functional and business specifications; writes detailed universally understood procedures for permanent records and for use in training.

Analyzes the feasibility of, and develops requirements for, new systems and enhancements to existing systems; ensures the system design fits the needs of the users.

Identifies opportunities for improving business processes through information systems and/or non-system driver changes; assists in the preparation of proposals to develop new systems and/or operational changes.

job_description:
This position is responsible for the implementation, maintenance, and support of EDI processes and tools. Serves as a resource and subject matter expert to coordinate efforts across all stakeholders, including business users, IT, and third party vendors. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

GEOGRAPHIC REGION:

Please note applicants out of the geographic region for position applied will not be considered.

QUALIFICATIONS:
Required

Two (2) years of experience in business and/or systems analysis.
One (1) year of technical experience with EDI tools and processes.
Experience with EDI 943,944, 940, 945, 315, 214 856, 304, 300 and/or equivalent documents.
Knowledge of ANSI X12 EDI Standards (810, 830, 862 & 856) or equivalent.
Intermediate to advanced skills with MS Office suite, including Excel.
Ability to communicate (speak, read and write) in English and Spanish at an intermediate to advanced level.
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions.
Ability to think logically, follow procedures, instructions and make sound decisions.
Ability to exercise independent judgment within established systems and procedures.
Ability to work independently, with limited supervision, multitask and possess strong initiative.
Ability to prioritize work and meet deadlines.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with customers, vendors and fellow employees.
Ability to work extended hours, holidays, and/or weekends as needed.
Preferred

Industry related experience.
Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems or related field.


DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Primary

Provide functional knowledge and technical support to the business unit through developed and ad hoc analysis/reporting, as well as designing new processes/reports
Coordinate all EDI testing, implementations, and upgrades.
Monitor the EDI workflow to prevent any errors, in collaboration with key stakeholders, including management, development teams, end users, and unit leaders.
Analyze EDI processes, make recommendations for business and/or systems process improvements.
Maintain up to date documentation on each EDI customer contacts, specific rules for order exceptions, etc.
Maintain detailed documentation and process flow of all EDI processes
Participate in the development, and delivery of software applications training programs and individual classes.
Develops and maintains crosswalking and validation rules for file exchanges.
Applies in-depth knowledge of systems and business to the development of technical design for large complex processes and projects.
Secondary

Works on special projects, as required.
Additional duties as assigned.


PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
The employee is continuously required to sit and use his fingers.
The employee continuously required to talk and/or hear.
The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk.
The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.


SAFETY REQUIREMENTS:

Report safety hazards.
Immediately report incidents involving injury, illness, or property damage.
Wear protective PPE (Personal Protective Equipment) as instructed or necessary.
Comply with all company safety policies, procedures, and rules.
Refuse any unsafe task or operation.
Participate in safety meetings and training.
Be constantly aware of their personal safety and that of their coworkers.


SUPERVISION RECEIVED AND EXERCISED:
Reports directly to Business Systems Manager; does not exercise supervision over any other position.

CONDITIONS:
Indoors office environment most of the time where the exposure is a controlled temperature and office environment.
May be exposed to changes in temperature and humidity when supporting users in the warehouse.
The noise level in the work environment is usually busy with many phone conversations going on simultaneously.
When in the warehouse, the noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to noisy and will have some exposure to dust, fumes, and/or airborne particles.

Immediate opportunity! We are looking for an experienced Business Analyst with extensive Contracting Office experience to support the Administrative Office of the US Courts, the administrative arm of the Federal Judiciary.

Spectrum is seeking a qualified Business Analyst with contracting experience to support the Administrative Office of the US Courts (AOUSC) initiatives in program and acquisition excellence. This work will be on a Project by Project basis as-needed. We expect the duration of the first Project to be approximately 4 months of intermittent full-time and part-time work, with the possibility of follow on work later.

Job Responsibilities:
Project 1: Our Business Analyst will be a part of a team of experts who are developing a training program for AOUSC’s Procurement Management Division (PMD) acquisition workforce. Our Team will use a list of high level competencies and map these competencies to recommended training courses for development of employee knowledge. We will also research and identify the external and internal training sources for the recommended training courses. Our Team will also interview the acquisition workforce and draft a training model for AOUSC/PMD’s acquisition workforce employees to follow that includes strategies for implementation, communication and follow-up.

Required Experience and Knowledge:
Minimum 4 years of experience conducting business analyses and studies, needs assessments, requirements analysis/definition, and cost/benefit analyses
Experience analyzing trends, reporting regulations and business conditions
Develops and analyzes metrics, performance measurements, requirements, reports and recommendations.
Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in any combination of the following fields:accounting, business, finance, law, contracts, purchasing, economics, industrial management, marketing, quantitative methods or organization and management.

The ERP Business Analyst is responsible for assisting with the development and maintenance of the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system and business process, customizes and configures the applications, workflow and business process to allow the integration of applications to support the needs of the business. The role is also maintains the ERP system to ensure that it is meeting company needs, works on complex ERP projects, and develops efficient and effective processes and ensures client requirements are met. The incumbent is an effective Project Manager and Business Analyst in the performance of the role.
Five Key Accountabilities
Manage, develop and maintain the ERP system
Solution development working with line managers
Proactive planning for IT Roadmap ERP enhancement
Process focus
Trains the line managers and users on ERP functions
Duties and Responsibilities
 Manage, develop and maintain the ERP System
Is the subject matter expert on the ERP system functions, technology and how it supports a manufacturing/distribution process and Illume's process
Maintains relationships with the ERP vendor and vendor partners to stay current with needed and available functionality

 Solution development working with line managers

Establish a communication plan, including moderating internal meetings; stakeholder status updates; and other communications as required during the project
Manage and balance business stakeholders' and client expectations regarding schedule, cost, and scope
Articulate the pros and cons of alternative approaches to stakeholders with a focus on value
Proactive planning for IT Roadmap ERP enhancement

Build effective relationships between IT and the business to develop a "joint" vision in support of the systems

Job Description
Amazon is looking for a smart, driven, problem solver to provide support for our evolving HR tools and processes. In this role, you will develop deep expertise on the HR Services and People Technology solutions used by Amazon and will work with business owners, technologists, and HR partners to understand and document strategy, requirements and timelines. You will participate in cross-functional teams through the process and policy design, delivery, implementation, and support of new HR tools and services as well as contribute to change management.

What you'll do:
Deliver Solutions - Implement global technologies and services to meet long term HR and Payroll business needs; partner with development teams on system design and gap analysis, and prioritization of critical initiatives
Business Requirements – Facilitate global workshops to coordinate the collection of global business requirements including process deviations and localizations; prepare global process maps and documentation
Implementation - Support the rollout of new tools and systems to global teams including delivery of standard operating procedures, workflow diagrams, training materials and post-launch support resources
Operational Excellence - Drive global HR process optimization and standardization while balancing the business need for flexibility and appropriate localization
Subject Matter Expertise – develop deep knowledge of core hire-to-retire processes used by Amazon, advise the business on regional and global requirements and best practices for optimizing the use of Amazon People Technology
Basic Qualifications
3+ years of HR or related experience
Bachelor's degree in business, HR or related field
Experience implementing processes and providing support for core HR solutions
3+ years of work experience writing SQL, data modeling, data mining (SQL, ETL, data warehousing) and using databases in a business environment with complex datasets
Advanced Excel skills; experience with business intelligence tool
Preferred Qualifications
Works effectively as part of a global team, possessing strong analytical, organizational, and problem solving skills, can flourish handling multiple tasks, workload, changing priorities, and tight deadlines
Great organizational skills with exceptional follow through and attention to detail
Passion for customer/user experiences; uses technology to scale programs and improve efficiencies
Able to learn large scale complex systems quickly
Excellent written and verbal communications skills - able to interface with all levels of the organization, specific strength in influencing decision makers and managing expectations


Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer - Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

The Company
Integra Partners (Integra) is a leading, tech-enabled, healthcare benefit management company focused on community-based care. The company has grown into a leading healthcare network manager that connects Durable Medical Equipment (DME) and Orthotic and Prosthetic (O&P) providers with health plans and their patients. Leveraging the Integra network gives payers greater administrative efficiency, while patients receive greater choice in health care providers. Providers benefit from improved working capital through faster collection, as well as access to additional payers. We work with providers and health plans to facilitate care for hundreds of thousands of patients each year. We have experienced rapid growth with no slowdown in sight.
Our leadership team is amazing (www.accessintegra.com) with a focus on what really matters to our business – every employee, every experience, and every customer. With the right people, success is unbound. This is a truly unique opportunity to take a position with a great company, surrounded by an awesome team.
In 2015, Integra’s management and Tufts Health Plan of Massachusetts acquired the business. Tufts Health Plan is one of the country’s leading, 5-star, private health plans providing healthcare to individuals and employer groups. Integra now operates as a separate financial investment and subsidiary of Tufts Health Plan with a separate board of directors and governance structure. Integra is an innovative and exciting company, with an entrepreneurial culture focused on teamwork and everyday excellence.
Scope and Responsibility
We are, by our DNA and nature of our leadership, an analytically minded organization and look to add a highly skilled analytical team member to help us turbocharge our analytical capabilities and thinking. The Business Analyst role will report to the Data and Analytics Director to support the overall development and growth of Integra, playing a key role in our growth and driving our scalability. This role will provide validation and delivery of algorithms, statistical analysis and reporting tools all focused on improving current business process. The role will help drive projects and bring value through operations, including strategic operations analysis, identifying performance trends, interpreting data, and working cross-functionally with other departments. Additionally, the role will be a key driver in identifying opportunities for revenue growth through Sales Analytics. Over the longer term, the successful candidate will support the Data and Analytics leader in building a successful streamlined data organization including playing a key stakeholder role in development of enterprise wide data warehouse and data extraction and visualization software. The person occupying this position will have an exceptionally broad view of every aspect of Integra’s business and help drive the insights that allow leadership to make informed, thoughtful business decisions.
Personal Traits
Actively seeks out and supports collaborative thinking and problem-solving with others in the organization
A dynamic team member who regularly brings and seeks new ideas, insights and knowledge, and drives the organization to implement new programs and solutions
Problem solver with an analytical mindset and excellent organizational skills with an eye for detail
Creative and conceptual thinker who can play a critical role in business planning while working with executives to develop plans and influence long-term business strategy
Comfortable working in a fast moving, entrepreneurial environment combined with an ability to roll up their sleeves and comfortably operate with limited administrative support
Experience with the hypothesis-driven approach; equally able to think top down as well as bottom up
Fantastic anticipation of questions operational leaders will ask when presented with analyses and insights. A player will answer these questions in advance of being asked, accelerating abilities to make decisions
Intensive focus on scalability of the function and the business
Key Responsibilities and Essential Functions
Detailed knowledge of health care industry, particularly within the DMEPOS space (or a strong desire to learn)
Provide analytical support for business in the following areas: operations analysis, sales analysis, payor analytics and reporting
Partner with key stakeholders to translate data into analyses and insights that leaders can use to make business decisions
Review data to determine operational impacts and needed actions based on elevated issues, trends, and areas of growth and improvement opportunities
Extract, model, and reconcile large amounts of data across multiple system platforms and sources
Capture, process, analyze, and share data that has been pulled from multiple platforms
Perform data extraction, aggregation, and quality checks from multiple sources and tables in support of trend identification and root cause analysis
Familiarity with data extraction and visualization tools, SQL, SAS, R, Tableau and/or other data warehouse analytical tools
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in math, statistics, computer science, or health-related field, with 1-3 years of relevant experience.
Strong analytical background in statistics and mathematical optimization, forecasting and simulation.
Ability to interact with business leadership and make dynamic presentations.
Energetic, motivated with a strong work ethic, eager to take on challenging tasks.
Excellent communication skills including experience speaking to both technical and non-technical audiences; ability to bring actionable insights through effective communication.
Demonstrated passion for developing and overseeing strategic solution execution.
Demonstrated experience identifying solutions using standard analysis techniques such as business process and information modeling, root cause analysis, etc.
Refined project management skills and ability to manage multiple projects involving diverse stakeholders across leadership levels.
Ability to independently and quickly ramp up on new business and technical concepts.

POSITION SUMMARY:
This position serves as a liaison between the juvenile probation business partners and the technical team. The position participates in the planning and completion of all juvenile automation projects roll-out; including testing, training, and application support. This position also provides on-going application support and training for juvenile automation systems including the Juvenile On-Line Tracking System (JOLTSaz) Statewide Identifies (SWID) and Arizona Youth Assessment System (AZYAS). In addition, the Jr. Business Analyst is responsible for documenting business requirements for system fixes and enhancements, including gathering information from subject matter experts.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
The successful candidate must have a Bachelor’s degree in a Criminal Justice, Computer Science, InformationTechnology, Management Information Systems, Business Administration, Communications, or related field, and three years experience. Directly related experience may substitute for the degree requirement. Other requirements include: an understanding of business analyst role and the role of other team members; basic understanding of courts, probation, and/or dependency; strong analytical and problem solving skills; proven verbal/written communication skills to include facilitating meetings; excellent teamwork skills; strong organization skills with great attention to detail; excellent training skills, specifically in training of business partners; experience with the creation of training curriculum and materials, including understanding of web based training capabilities; and the ability to work well in a collaborative team environment. This position requires the ability to travel up to 25% of the time to rural probation departments during the rollout and implementation of JOLTSaz. A valid driver’s license is required.

Travel level: up to 25%

The Selection Process may include first and/or second round panel interviews. This is a Regular, Full-time, Exempt position.

job_description:
This Business Analyst will be responsible for facilitating business change management by documenting requirements and process flow diagrams, in addition to other appropriate standard analysis artifacts. The selected candidate will be involved in program/project implementations, as well as some business-level configuration of the SAP Transportation Management software. The Business Analyst will support the Distribution Vertical, specifically the Traffic customers and stakeholders, throughout the project lifecycle to define a set of business requirements that will translate into solid business solutions and technology systems.

The candidate will work closely with end users, business unit representatives, Information System resources and others in all stages of the project lifecycle including discovery, design, construction, transition, implementation, and support. Additionally, they may be asked to provide analysis, as well as leadership for small initiatives. The successful candidate will be responsible for working with the business management on the identification, prioritization and requirements of project backlog items. This individual should demonstrate the highest levels of customer service, communication, productivity and professionalism. In addition, the candidate will have the ability and aptitude for leadership, be self-motivated and possess strong analytical skills.

Tasks and responsibilities
Stakeholder and team interaction:
Determines stakeholder influence and relationship needs
Builds and manages stakeholder relationships including business partners, users, vendors, customers, project team members and management leaders
Interacts with technical team(s) to help translate functional specifications into technology solutions
Requirements management process:
Develops business analysis artifacts (use cases, business models, etc.) to document “as-is” and “to-be” requirements and change management plans as they pertain to specific projects and/or functional area
Identifies and communicates risks and issues that may require changes to plans or scope
Prioritizes requirements effectively based on appropriately identified factors and in conjunction with business stakeholders
Organizes and synthesizes large amounts of information provided by stakeholders
Ensures that all requirements support the delivery of business value, fulfills goals and objectives and meet stakeholder needs
Leads and participates in User Acceptance sessions for confirmation of requirements implementation prior to deployment.
Manages requirements approval and design sign-off from the business
Elicitation and communication:
Ensures appropriate stakeholders are involved and obtain required information for capturing and validating requirements and other artifacts
Effectively manages changes and conflicts during requirements gathering process
Manages requirements traceability and future reuse
Prepares artifacts in an understandable and presentable format
Implementation and product support
Possesses product knowledge and process improvement skills with a demonstrated ability to effectively provide solutions
Has proven experience in evaluating a business need and facilitating decision making to gain consensus and approval for the solution; validates the solution meets business need
Ability to assist the development team with the translation of business requirements into functional specifications
Performs business level configuration of SAP TM software
Assist in the training and support of the business post-implementation
Assists in other areas of the department and company as necessary


Required skills, abilities, and certifications
2+ years experience in Business and/or Functional analysis.
Deep understanding of business requirements elicitation for programs and projects.
Proficient in requirements elicitation, business modeling and project scoping.
Experience implementing packaged Transportation Management software (SAP TM preferred).
Experience working in Agile software delivery methodologies (ideally, in the Product Owner role)
Expertise in utilizing standard documentation tools/utilities.
Must possess excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to negotiate and effectively engage with individuals at all levels of the organization.
Must possess demonstrated strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple parallel work assignments.
Must demonstrate a strong work ethic, attention to detail and excellent time-management skills.
Must possess excellent analytical skills and ability to effectively troubleshoot and provide solutions.
Must be available for evening, weekend and holiday work, as needed, and on-call support.
Must be available to travel as needed in the US and CN, and participate in 24/7 rotational support.


Recommended skills, abilities and certifications
Business and/or IS experience in Distribution/Fulfillment/Traffic.
Data query and analysis experience.
Experience leading small initiatives.

General Summary:
Under the general supervision and direction of the Director of Application Development and the Business Analysis and Solutions Manager, and following prescribed department, office and firm procedures, the Business Analyst is responsible for ensuring the successful delivery of technology solutions to practice groups and administrative departments. The Business Analyst is expected to perform all responsibilities with a commitment to providing superior service to the firm’s attorneys, advisors and staff, and maintaining an atmosphere of teamwork and continuous improvement. Above all, the Business Analyst must fulfill the needs of the firm in a manner which is consistent with the Firm’s Core Values.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities (Duties are performed throughout every work day, as necessary):
Partner with practice groups and administrative departments to identify business problems and technology solutions to those problems.
Utilize project management protocols and standards to achieve specific goals.
Take the lead in defining, analyzing and documenting requirements, and manage requirements at the project level with internal IT, practice group teams and/or administrative departments.
Manage project scope to ensure timely delivery and to avoid surprises, and manage the change control process during the project.
Communicate with colleagues within the IT team to ensure understanding of the needs of the practice groups and administrative departments, and that teams are working together to deliver solutions in line with expectations.
Leverage new and existing solutions across groups where applicable.
Provide or coordinate primary technical support and ownership of practice applications and systems.
Foster a culture of innovation by sharing lessons learned with other Business Analysts and the IT team.
.Essential Knowledge, Skills and Competencies:
Ability to read, write and speak English
Understanding of systems engineering concepts
Ability to conduct cost/benefit analyses
Ability to develop and document business cases
Sound grasp of modeling techniques and methods
Demonstrated understanding of software development life cycle process
Demonstrated understanding of project management best practices and ability to create and use project plans to manage workload
Proven ability to manage multiple priorities and adjust to changing priorities in a professional manner
Proven ability to assume new tasks and responsibilities
Proven ability to maintain and update technical knowledge and skills
Ability to work well under pressure, facilitate solutions, and meet deadlines and milestones for projects assigned
Demonstrated ability to maintain high ethical standards and strict confidentiality of all information on the network
Excellent oral and written communication skills, including communicating with diplomacy, discretion and tact
Strong service orientation and an ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with peers, management and outside business partners
Commitment to teamwork
Strong analytical, creative problem solving and process improvement skills
Ability to read, comprehend and follow instructions
Commitment to the office and firm
Commitment to professional growth and development, including to attain and maintain expert competency in assigned areas of technology
Availability for occasional travel
Facility with SQL and Power BI are a plus
Educational Qualifications/Job Experience Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree required (Computer Science or equivalent preferred)
A minimum of five years of experience in a senior application support role
Prior experience in a law firm or other professional services firm preferred

Overview
Nashville, Tenn.-based Bridgestone Americas, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of Bridgestone Corporation, the world’s largest tire and rubber company.
Bridgestone Americas and its subsidiaries develop, manufacture and market a wide range of Bridgestone, Firestone and associate brand tires to address the needs of a broad range of customers, including consumers, automotive and commercial vehicle original equipment manufacturers, and those in the agricultural, forestry and mining industries.

The companies are also engaged in retreading operations throughout the Western Hemisphere and produce air springs, roofing materials, and industrial fibers and textiles. The Bridgestone Americas family of companies also operates the world’s largest chain of automotive tire and service centers.

Guided by its One Team, One Planet message, the company is dedicated to achieving a positive environmental impact in all of the communities it calls home.
Position Summary
As part of the Consumer Replacement Tire Sales Analytics Team, the Sales Analyst will support the Sales Organization in making data-driven decisions to drive improved business results through generating business insights with data. The Analyst will be responsible for the cleaning, integration and presentation of data from a multitude of sources (customers, internal, 3rd party), systems and formats. In addition to the data processing, the Analyst will be responsible both for reporting – static and dynamic – and generating the analysis and recommendations that support the broader business strategy.
Responsibilities
Data Integration: Identify critical data sources and collaborate with others across the organization to integrate data into a consistent and usable format. Will require advanced data querying skills utilizing tools such as Alteryx, SQL or similar.

Analysis: Utilize analytical and quantitative methods to understand, predict, and improve consumer replacement sales channels. Could include evaluating key business metrics such as profitability, ROI and market share.

Reporting: Design, build, and maintain reports, dashboards, and metrics to monitor business performance. To do this, Tableau Desktop will be used to develop dashboards and dynamics reports, after gathering business requirements and end-user objectives.

Complete special projects as needed

Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing or related field with 2-5 years of related experience.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (advanced)
Alteryx, SQL, SASS or related programming skills
Tableau Desktop or similar
Must show discretion as teammate will handle confidential information.
Strong analytical skills and familiarity working with financial measures
Candidate must adapt to a fast paced environment, with a close attention to detail
Strong communication skills both written and verbal, very organized, detail oriented, schedule minded with strong follow-up skills
Self-starter, team player who can independently manage time and projects wisely

Fusion was founded in 2006 and has since made waves in the Corrections and Public Health sectors of government. Recognized by INC magazine as one of the fastest growing private companies in the United States, Fusion is looking to expand its hand-picked team to include a candidate through this job placement. From a company culture perspective, we are a vibrant and diverse group who have come together to be leaders in healthcare IT and software for government agencies. Overview
The Business Analyst specializes in understanding the needs of the business owners and translating them into technical specifications. This position will act as an interface to the business owners and technology departments, as well as implementing and supporting the Customer and Marketing Applications Portfolio, including: Consumer Websites, Loyalty Programs, Marketing Offers and Promotions, Customer Relationship Management, etc.
The position involves analysis and presentation of information to business owners, including Marketing, Player Development, and Casino and Hospitality Operations. It requires proficiency with developing requirements documents, knowledge of the business and strong communication skills. The position will also be responsible for the QA of any new or changes to the applications before they are released and deployed into the Production environment.
These initiatives will be done in accordance with department policies, procedures, and standards to support information systems development and maintenance.
Responsibilities
Main Duties and Responsibilities:
Gather requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task, and workflow analysis.
Translate requirements into technical specifications to support development in both traditional (Waterfall) and Agile development methodologies.
Evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, decompose high-level information into details, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
Proactively communicate and collaborate with technical team and business owners to analyze information needs and functional requirements to deliver an effective solution.
Participate in the QA and release management of changes to or new applications through thorough testing, debugging and user acceptance before planning and executing deployment into Production.
Develop user documentation and conduct training as required.
Participate in small or complex applications rollout to single or multi-properties.
Provide post implementation support and troubleshooting.
Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Analyze problems and escalate issues in a timely manner for quick resolution. Responds to and assists with other problem tickets as required.
Be the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams.
Maintain and enhance technical skills through formal and on-the-job training.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Must adhere to the Seminole Tribe's Policies and Procedures.

Skills Requirements:
Solid proficiency in full Business Analysis skills (Analysis, Design, Testing, Process, and Documentation). Ability to translate business requirements to technical requirements to enable IT Technical teams.
Strong analytical skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into operational requirements.
Excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal skills, and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group in a dynamic work environment.
Collaboration and facilitation skills within IT and across business area users and management.
Highly personable and able to build strong relationship across business groups and with IT personnel.
Stakeholder management, including department leaders, vendors and consultants.
Autonomous: ability to work with little or no supervision
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree required. Hospitality, Information Management, or Computer Science preferred.
Hotel/casino gaming experience preferred.
Project Management/Coordination practices and techniques preferred.
5+ years’ experience as a business analyst or similar position. Business Analysts Certification preferred (either PMI-PBA or IIBA-CBAP).
3+ years’ experience with Customer/Marketing Applications; including Websites, Loyalty Systems, Customer Relationship Management, and/or Campaign Management.
Agile experience preferred.
Working knowledge of JIRA, Selenium, ServiceNow preferred.
Proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Visio, Excel, Outlook).

$55,000 - $70,000 a yearPOSITION SUMMARY
The Research & Planning section (R&P) supports the accomplishment of the Virginia Alcoholic Beverage Control Authority’s (ABC) mission and objectives through the successful fulfillment of projects in the areas of business research, data analysis, stakeholder surveys, strategic planning, policy & program analysis, fiscal impact analysis, revenue forecasting, and store network planning. R&P also handles Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) response and coordination, procedure development, performance measurement and the application of process improvement to Authority operations. R&P is currently seeking a business analyst with considerable knowledge of methodologies for improving organizational performance, analysis of retail and other operational data and principles of project management. Considerable skill in the use of a personal computer, utilizing spreadsheet, database, flowcharting, word processing, project management, and presentation software applications is required. The R&P business analyst should possess the demonstrated ability to define and lead work processes, communicate effectively (orally and in writing), analyze quantitative and qualitative data and draw conclusions.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Duties include researching and analyzing the effectiveness, application and impact of new technologies, systems, programs and management approaches to operational services. This position will not focus primarily on technology projects (i.e. new system requirements or new system implementation); yet will lead the evaluation of operational program areas and projects related to ABC’s policy and operational initiatives. This position will evaluate alternative ways to deliver ABC services, determine the effectiveness of advertising and marketing campaigns, assist with legislative studies, analyze sales and interpret trends by product, brand, category, price tier, geographic area, etc. This position will lead or assist with projects sponsored by operating division directors or a member of the senior executive team and will have access to subject matter experts as needed to meet research or project objectives. A strong background in data analysis (to include retail operations data), business intelligence tools, process improvement, business writing and stakeholder outreach is preferred. The R&P BA should effectively facilitate work teams, develop project and communication plans, provide team support, conduct training, etc. to see that the ABC Authority moves through research projects in a timely and efficient manner. The BA will ensure the timely distribution of reports and key findings, as well as work with Information Technology Services and other work units to identify efficient report distribution methods.
The R&P BA should effectively manage all phases of assignments including issue identification and scope, work planning, quantitative/qualitative analysis, documentation, and reporting. The BA should develop and maintain an effective system to formally document and track the status of all project activities and recommendations, and research deliverables should be free of substantial errors and omissions. The BA should display effective leadership skills and considerable independence and initiative in managing projects and actively involve stakeholders in research and/or project implementation. The BA should manage outside vendors and data sources as needed to complete research assignments.
The R&P BA should provide clear direction to team members by setting realistic goals, objectives, and measurements, effectively facilitate team consensus-building and decision-making processes, keep work teams organized and on track with project plans and task assignments, and produce documents and recommendations in a timely and accurate manner.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Graduate from college or university with course work in market research, economics, statistics, public or business administration required. Master’s Degree and/or certificate in project management or business analysis preferred. A minimum of 5 years of experience in business research, retail operations analysis, data analysis and project management is preferred. Project management certification through PMI/AMA or data analytics certification a plus.

For full consideration, all applicants must fully complete all sections of the online application. A resume will not substitute for an incomplete application.


The Virginia Alcoholic Beverage Control Authority does not provide sponsorship.


We are an equal opportunity employer without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, political affiliation, veteran status, or disability.


AmeriCorps, Peace Corps, and other national service alumni are encouraged to apply.


ABC will provide, if requested, reasonable accommodation to applicants in need of accommodation in order to provide access to the application and/or interview process.


Criminal history record checks are required prior to employment.

Business Analyst

The Business Analyst will work with the Vice President of Sales Operations and Sales Management Team to support sales planning & analysis. The team will look to the Business Analyst to help establish/streamline policies and procedures throughout the department, support best practices in sales forecasting, reporting, and communications. As the Business Analyst, your responsibilities would include data analysis, reporting, market research, competitive analysis, planning, and sales process optimization. Ideal candidates will have Business Analysis experience, excellent communication skills, and the ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced and fun environment.

The Basics
Track and analyze key metrics – pipeline growth, quota attainment.
Collect, consolidate and generate weekly sales forecasts (month and quarter focus) and roll up each week’s numbers to Sales Management.
Compile key pieces of information related to performance against sales objectives to be reviewed by Management and report approved plans to Finance for processing.
Proactively analyzes win-loss data and reports on key findings to sales leadership.
Develop presentations that analyze sales and marketing activities and achievements from SalesForce.com or similar SFA applications.
Reporting and analysis for the Sales and Marketing departments, including: executive reporting of sales and marketing results, key metrics and KPIs, campaign tracking and analysis, and ad hoc strategic analysis.
Implements and manages reports and dashboards in Salesforce.com ensuring sales reps and leaders have access to key data required to successfully manage the business.
Monitors the accuracy and efficient distribution of sales reports and external intelligence essential to the sales organization. Recommends revisions to existing reports, or assists in the development of new reporting tools as needed.
What You Bring
3-plus years in a Business Analyst or similar role; management.
Bachelor’s in Accounting, Finance, Business, Marketing or related degree (MBA preferred)
Strong quantitative and qualitative analytical abilities.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Ability to perform SalesForce.com administrative functions is a plus.
Excellent systems skills including Excel & PowerPoint are required.
What We Bring
Excellent benefits package including medical, dental, and vision, and a 401k with company matching so you can continue planning for robust financial wellness.
Employee discounts on things like, mobile products and services, gym memberships, and a variety of additional entertainment options.
Work Life Balance. We get that we all live busy lives, to the degree your role allows, we recognize the need and value of balance and seek to support our employees’ engagement in the pursuit of it.
