The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) is a partner-focused organization that prides itself in providing great service, in creating innovative solutions, and most importantly, in having amazing people. We value having an open, inclusive and collaborative culture, where Googlers feel supported and able to do their best work. In offices around the globe, we foster and celebrate an environment where all team members feel welcomed and respected. OPG partners with online publishers and app developers around the world to grow their businesses using our portfolio of products including the AdSense, AdMob, and Google Ad Manager platforms. We offer a solutions-based approach across advertising, analytics, and site or app design, and pride ourselves in finding new opportunities for our partners to better engage users and advertisers. Over a million web publishers and app developers rely on our solution globally, and ultimately, we're proud to enable Google to be one of the foremost funders of digital content in the world.
The Publisher Intelligence team is a business analyst team responsible for helping OPG make the best decisions possible using data. As an Analyst on the Publisher Intelligence team, you will be responsible for scoping, initiating and delivering on analytical projects, such as modeling publisher behavior, creating complex SQL workflows and evaluating the impact of projects and products via statistical methods. This requires not only deep analytical and modeling skills but also the ability to develop strategic recommendations based on analysis and communicate and operationalize them (often in conjunction with various other cross-functional stakeholders).
Your role is not about simply grinding out numbers; it is about building new business processes based on data and models to increase efficiency and improve customer satisfaction. You will work in a collaborative role working closely with the various teams within OPG and throughout Google to drive the business decisions that will make our partners more successful.
Google helps our partners find better ways to reach their audiences and manage their digital businesses. In return, our partners provide great content for our products, and they syndicate Google products to enhance their sites and apps. Global Partnerships team members expand and nurture these relationships by continually finding new opportunities and solving technical problems for our partners. The wider Global Partnerships team includes a variety of different organizations, including CorpDev, Emerging Business Development, Strategy and Operations, Google for Entrepreneurs, Area 120 and our Display Advertising Business.
Responsibilities
Initiate, analyze and socialize data projects in conjunction with various cross-functional stakeholders.
Manage and develop data infrastructure in order to bring order and insight to complex datasets.
Understand, analyze and interpret trends in the market that affect the display ads business.
Communicate findings from data and analyses to senior stakeholders, influencing them to make the best decisions possible.
Qualifications
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of work experience as a data analyst, business analyst, product analyst or consultant.
Experience managing and querying datasets using SQL or other languages.

Preferred qualifications:
Bachelor's degree of a quantitative nature (Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Finance, etc.).
Experience with scripting and data analysis languages, such as Python and R.
Organizational and project management skills.
Excellent presentation and verbal/written communication skills.

At Google, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. job_description:
Overview
Grow your career with The Adecco Group, the world’s leading provider of recruiting and career services.

The Service Center Business Analyst is responsible for acting as a liaison between the Information Technology (IT) organization and business stakeholders by planning, conducting, and directing the analysis of complex business problems to be solved with automated systems. Provides technical assistance in identifying, evaluating, and developing systems and procedures that are cost-effective and meeting business requirements. Responsibilties
GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES: Collaborates with business partners, stakeholders and clients to elicit high-level requirements and capture business needs and objectives. Clearly articulates and documents business requirements. Assesses the risks of various solutions and prioritizes competing business demands. Manages ongoing relationships with business partners, stakeholders and third-party solution providers to drive internal and external client satisfaction. Coordinates project delivery by participating in design reviews and walk-throughs to communicate systems designs and validate proposed solutions. Obtains key inputs from enterprise architecture teams and identifies solution interdependencies. Engages with end-users to incorporate usability and user interface needs when designing systems. Proactively resolves customer satisfaction issues. Manages third-party solution provider relationships and monitors vendor performance against Service Level Agreements (SLAs). Provides training to end-users, resolves questions, assesses user needs, and recommends changes. Prepares and communicates specifications for system changes. Develops system test plan components and test scripts; assists IT with managing testing lifecycle; and analyzes test results and communicates results to end-users as applicable. Acts as an internal consultant by using quality tools and process definition/improvement to re-engineer technical process for greater efficiencies. Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications

EDUCATION & JOB REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor’s degree in business, information systems or a related field with a minimum of three (3) years of experience gathering requirements, implanting systems and managing technical projects is required. Equivalent combination of seven (7) years of post-high school education and experience may be considered in lieu of a degree. Previous experience working within the staffing and contingent workforce solutions industry is highly desirable.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES: Highly skilled in communicating effectively verbally and in writing. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships. Ability to function effectively with or as part of a team. Ability to effectively manage projects that may vary in nature and scope. Knowledge of and the ability to utilize and develop concepts, practices, and procedures within the technology field. Knowledge of applicable computer software, applications, and operating systems. Ability to gather, assemble, consolidate and analyze facts, draw conclusions and devise solutions. Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with others at various levels within the organization. Ability to identify complex problems and review related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions. Ability to identify and/or document existing and new processes as well as evaluate their effectiveness, develop improvements and/or recommend changes or alternatives. Ability to develop, improve and streamline processes to meet established goals and objectives. Ability to convey technical information to technical and non‐technical users. Knowledge of training methodologies and the ability to develop and deliver technical/operational training to various levels of employees. Proficient with Microsoft Office products, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.

COMPANY OVERVIEW:
The Adecco Group through an impressive portfolio of staffing industry leading brands, including Accounting Principals, Adecco Staffing, Ajilon, Entegee, Lee Hecht Harrison, Modis, Paladin, Parker+Lynch, Pontoon, Special Counsel and Soliant is the world’s leading provider of Human Resources solutions.

We are the workforce experts delivering staffing and career service solutions to organizations and individuals across all industries. Collectively we harness the power of some of the greatest talent in the world. That talent and expertise allows us to do business globally and act locally with deep knowledge in niche areas.

Every day, we have more than 100,000 associates on assignment, 30,000 colleagues working internally to support more than 10,000 clients in the United States and Canada. Ensuring our business units are prepared to deliver outstanding service to our associates and clients, the Adecco Group North America team provides a strong infrastructure through our corporate and shared services team.

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

Temporary, InternshipJob Description

Program Overview:
In our OppenheimerFunds Technology Internship Program you will experience a 10-week role in our Technology & Global Operations organization. In the Project Manager/Business Analyst Track you will be placed in either Global Operations, Strategy & Innovation, Cyber Security, Investment Risk Technology, Marketing and Distribution Technology, Architecture, Data Science, Automation, Shared Services, or Infrastructure.
This experience will provide you with an understanding of the OppenheimerFunds business model, real-world, hands-on experience and an opportunity to work with your team, and to develop a project, which you will present to your team and other OFI Leadership.
Each Intern participant will be assigned a personal OFI advisor to help guide, coach, and provide support throughout the entirety of the program.
Program Journey Overview:
Participate in delivery of technology solutions end to end (or as much as you can complete during the program).
Learn the Oppenheimer business model and growth strategy (product, investment, sales, operations and corporate services)
Participate in cultural, technology and intern specific training
Collaborate with your personal OFI Advisor, and other relevant business and HR personnel

job_description:
Help us shape the future. Elevate is changing the way legal support services are delivered and we are looking for creative, innovative people who can help. If you are a client-focused professional who wants your creative and innovative ideas to make a difference, Elevate's team of legal service experts could be the right fit for you.
Elevate Legal Business Solutions practice is growing! As an Elevate Legal Operations Business Analyst, you will work with clients directly to improve AmLaw 200 law firms and Fortune 500 law departments through analysis, strategy, and implementation. You will support a variety of clients and will work to deliver solutions and directly impact ROI.
You might be the person we’re looking for if you...
Have supported strategic or operational improvements to a legal department or law firm.
Have developed and used metrics and analytics as part of your solutions.
Have worked with or implemented common legal technologies, including matter management, eBilling, and contract management systems.
Are capable of working on multiple assignments in a fast-paced environment.
Are interested in joining a growing company and the potential for a long-term career path.
Enjoy a culture of change that seeks out efficiencies, cost savings and ROI.
Specifically you will be…
Delivering strategic consulting and operational solutions to corporate law departments and law firms.
Using your analytic skills to identify strategic improvement opportunities.
Implementing solutions to improve department and firm operations and improve ROI.
Extending a client’s organization to provide subject matter expertise.
Skills for Success:
Prior experience as a business analyst, legal operations analyst, or similar role within an organization.
Prior roles as a consultant or in-house strategy.
Experience running reporting and metrics for a team or department.
Capable data skills, able to use a variety of methods to analyze data.
Flexibility and interest in learning the wide variety of solutions that Elevate delivers, including our industry leading Cael legal app suite.
Technical Skills:
Strong Excel and Microsoft Office skills.
Experience with leading legal systems (eBilling, Contract Management, and eSignature) a plus.
Experience with leading business intelligence and reporting tools a plus.
Experience:
1-3 years of experience as a business analyst or similar strategic operations role (corporate strategy, vendor management, analytics, strategic sourcing).
Prior consulting experience a plus.
Strong communicator, personable and collaborative.
Qualifications:
 Bachelor's degree required.
Advanced degree or J.D. a plus.
Elevate is the law company. We provide consulting, technology and services to law departments and law firms. Our global team of lawyers, engineers, consultants and business experts improve efficiency, quality and outcomes for customers worldwide. Elevate’s achievements and distinctions include:
Ranked on the Inc. 5000 list of Fastest-Growing Private Companies two years in a row.

Ranked as a top Global Services Provider by Chambers & Partners three years in a row.

Lead Partner of the FT Innovative Lawyers Awards.
At Elevate we live our core values:
We deliver - We are careful about the comments we make to our customers and to each other. We do what we say we will.
We innovate - We celebrate creativity. We challenge the status quo and continuously ask ourselves and each other how can we improve.
We care - We listen to our customers' needs and help them solve their business problems. Our work is a positive influence on our personal lives and the lives of our families.

PetFlow is a digital retailer that sells dog and cat food & supplies and has relationships with customers all over the country. Our values are simple - we believe in good foods and good deeds. We believe in cultivating a strong sense of compassion and karma by doing good deeds for pets across the country, and by providing pet parents with the best possible choices for their furry family members.
It’s an extremely exciting time to be joining the team, as we’ve recently migrated our headquarters from New York to Las Vegas. With that comes great growth potential and a great opportunity to learn. Our company holds among its principal values being a great place to work, and we do this by being transparent with one another from the top down, setting and achieving our goals, providing a great experience for our customers, and by having a ton of fun doing it! Anyone that is brought on board is expected to believe in and be fully committed to embracing these values.
About the Role
PetFlow is seeking an Analyst to join our operation and report to the General Manager. This unique position will leverage data and strong analytical skills to create intelligent business models and decisions, focusing on customer segmentation, margin profiles and overall operational excellence. This unique opportunity will provide invaluable exposure to the strategic components that enable an eCommerce company to run profitably at scale. This role is expected to help the team manage and complete a mix of daily core functions, routine analysis work and ad-hoc projects. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to have a real impact on our bottom line from day one.
Who We’re Looking For
Bachelor’s degree in business-related or analysis-heavy concentration -OR- strong experience in an analytical, startup or finance role.
Advanced knowledge of excel, SQL, and other data analysis tools
Experience using GA to surface site behavior insights, or eager to learn how!
Excited about solving problems, digging into complex data sets, and building sensitivity models
Attention to detail, and ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously
Ability to summarize analysis results and recommendations concisely and clearly
Bonus: Experience working in ecommerce, or a company with diverse user-profiles, large merchandise selection, marketed across multiple channels
Responsibilities
Assist all departments with regular data analysis, including
Customer cohort insights
Marketing channel performance
Site analytics (demographics, page performance, technology tendencies)
Product margin analysis & trends
Assist merchandising operation with developing and maintaining a pricing strategy
Model ROI templates and worksheets for strategic projects
Own our BI tool, RJ Metrics
Data imports
Report/dashboard building as required
Run ad-hoc reports and data requests as needed through SQL, RJ Metrics or other
Surface insights into customer behavior and tendencies to help drive product decisions
On-site activity
Order modification tendencies
Leverage data & insights to coordinate product development with our product managers
What You’ll Get
You'll be a core member of our team, with the ability to add creative input and drive change from day 1.
A bright and sunny office in the Southwest Vegas valley
Ping-pong loving and dog-friendly!
Spending time with great people is a value for us, and we think it’s a huge part of having fun at work. We strive to create an environment that thrives on intellect and encourages thought.
Competitive pay
Full time benefits plan, including medical/dental/vision/pet insurance and paid time off
Team outings, bagel Thursdays and ad-hoc catered lunches!

BUSINESS ANALYST (Daily, on-site position)

Job brief
High Cotton is recruiting for a Business Analyst who will provide support and ensure the successful completion of requirements gathering, executing, testing and deployment for both internal and client projects.

Job description

Business Analyst responsibilities include assistance on internal process changes, implementing process changes for current clients, and acting as support to Project Manager on new client implementations.

Business Analysts are skilled at recording critical details and communicating those to the project team. They thrive when planning projects and working with project teams.

Responsibilities

Assist in PM on new client implementation

Prepare for meetings, take meeting minutes, act as an internal back-up

Assist in testing

Execute process changes for current clients (Projects with reduced scope)

Create Process Change Plan, record requirements, coordinate with DP team, test, QA, with final approvals move to execute

Research & Implement Internal Process Changes

Once critical internal issue is identified research with necessary individuals/teams, if needed

Record requirements once identified through project stakeholders/research

Create a plan within approved resources

Track and execute providing regular updates

Deploy and debrief with stakeholders

Requirements

Systems Analysis or Quality Assurance experience

Demonstrated accuracy and attention to detail

Ability to problem solve independently

Proven experience in eliciting requirements and testing

Experience in analyzing data to draw business-relevant conclusions and in data visualization techniques and tools

Basic knowledge in generating process documentation

Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills

Business Analyst
Who we are
We are the largest woman-owned, full-service martech advertising agency of its kind. Guided by our I.P.Q. process, which combines patented marketing technology with hands-on experience, intuition and humanity, we rigorously apply data science and analytics to achieve the best possible outcomes for our clients across all marketing disciplines.
We are a diverse company focused on giving back and encouraging our employees to do great work so they can do good things. Our unique culture puts our employees first – from new graduates to seasoned professionals, and offers tremendous opportunities for learning and advancement as well as competitive salaries. We operate under the vision of a highly-respected CEO and leadership team who inspire team work, innovation and the ability to make a difference for the company. Our employees enjoy all the benefits of working for a Manhattan agency without the commute.

Who we need
Reporting to the VP, Analytics and Innovation, the Business Analyst will be the linchpin in the collaboration between client services, research, and analytics teams to provide our clients with crucial insights to assist in the development, execution, and analysis of their advertising and marketing campaigns.

The ideal candidate will have experience in manipulating large data sets and analyzing marketing data to explain not only what the data shows, but the “why”, the root cause behind it. This is a client-facing role where you must be able to clearly articulate insights, as well as any trends in terms that are relevant to the client and their industry. This is an innovation role, where creative thinking and new ways to look at data are critical.

What you will do:
Analyze data to understand cause and effect and be able to engage with Client Performance and Media to generate recommendations against that data.
Articulate insights and findings to the clients, both in-person and in writing.
Take ownership of analytical projects and work intra- and inter-teams to ensure execution
Provide recommendations for new visualizations, KPIs, and manners of data storytelling.
Prepare weekly and monthly analyses on client business performance, all marketing initiatives and results.
Engage with data science tools and team members to support predictive analytics, and statistical analysis tasks.
Manage large data sets for various campaigns and utilize analytical skills to uncover trends and improve performance.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications and Education Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Advertising, Communication, Business Analytics or related major
3+ years’ experience in data analysis, marketing, and/or visualizations
Strong Analytical Skills (navigate large data sets, proficient in Excel, Access, MarTech tools, research market trends and customer behavior patterns)
Experience in managing projects and people
Knowledge of martech and ad tech marketing and proficiency is a plus.
Passion for data, analytics and research

What we offer
With free drinks and healthy snacks, a game room where you can blow off some steam, a walking club, and weight loss programs; paid time off and Summer Fridays; a robust benefits package including health, dental, accident, life, and critical care insurance, health and dependent flexible spending accounts; a matched 401K; guest speakers, access to classes to earn certifications and master technology and marketing tools, an easy commute from NJ, NYC metro, or NE PA, and opportunities to volunteer for causes to help families and animals in need, Marketsmith could be your new professional home.
We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. To level the field, we’ll ask you to take a personality assessment test and agree to a background

Job Description
Do you love data? Do you get a thrill out of fixing complex problems? Do you like visualizing data to tell a story?

Join the Recruiting Analytics and Data (RAD) team to help us bring insights to teams the recruiting teams hiring across Amazon. Learn and use new computing AWS technologies Comprehend, QuickSight and Redshift. As Amazon continues to grow, our recruiting teams need access to real time data insights. RAD’s job is to equip these teams with the ability to measure their recruiting strategies to continually improve every touch point of the candidate journey.

RAD plays a critical role in shaping the future of reporting and analytics for our expanding global teams. As one of our new team of Business Analysts, you will help us migrate to Quicksight (a cutting edge new dashboard platform) and own our Monthly Business Reviews for senior leadership of HR. You will help us launch KPIs and standard process for every step of our recruiting process. You can shape the future data roadmap for all of our global recruiting teams. This isn’t easy – much of this work will be starting from scratch or attempting to tie together varied best practices across decentralized, global teams.

But you are joining at just the right time as we are beginning to transition to new innovative AWS products that make accessing and manipulating data so much easier. You will also be coming in right as we are beginning to launch research project for optimizing our efficiency. You will have an opportunity to learn from other research scientists and engineers working on unique projects across HR. You will present findings to senior leadership. You drive large scale standard and consistent process change by developing and publishing a data definition library. And you won’t be alone. Our RAD team includes other business intelligence and data engineers — all of whom will be partners for you in realizing our vision and enabling the growth at Amazon that’s critical for our customers. You’re just right for this role because you like diving into data, learning new tools and having a global impact!

Other Responsibilities:
Develop dashboard in AWS Quicksight focused on sourcing strategy
Collect and analyze data from large datasets from multiple sources
Develop Monthly Business Reviews for Senior Leadership
Build data definition and standard query library
Basic Qualifications
BA/BS degree in relevant field OR 5+ years of direct analytics experience, or equivalent combination of degree and experience
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel (e.g., complex statements, VBA, conditional formatting)
Familiarity with SQL/relational databases
Experience manipulating large sets of data from multiple systems
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, MicroStrategy, QuickSight, COGNOS
Project management experience
Preferred Qualifications
BA/BS degree in statistics, decision-making sciences, or related field AND 5+ years of professional experience with a heavy emphasis on data and analytics
Experience in analytical intensive roles within consulting, talent/HR, operational, or marketing environments
Proficiency in statistical analysis tool: R, SaS, SPSS, Stata
Proficiency with multiple statistical software packages (e.g. R, SAS, SPSS, AMOS, MPlus, STATA)
Business-relevant knowledge of AWS Big Data technologies, like RedShift, S3, Aurora, Data Pipeline, QuickSight, Kinesis etc.
Excellent written and verbal communication; high quality document and report preparation
High degree of accuracy and expertise in the use of leading edge tools for all data creation, research, and analyses
Excellent problem solving abilities.
Ability to create, maintain and disseminate information to stakeholders for multiple projects/work streams at one time
Ability to work independently, as well as an active member of both business and HR teams
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation

Work Locations
:
Hilton Reservations & Customer Care - Carrollton
2050 Chennault Dr.
 Carrollton 75006
Hilton Reservations and Customer Care (HRCC) is on a path to revolutionize human hospitality in a digital world, the same way we defined hospitality from its early beginnings. We strive to deliver personalized solutions that inspire a passion for travel, and our goal is to make a lasting impression with every Hilton guest with whom we interact.

What will I be doing?


Are you looking for an exciting career in a contact center manipulating data and impacting the business? The Business Analyst directly supports reporting and analysis for all business units in Hilton’s Reservations and Customer Care centers. You will have a specific focus on performance metrics in both sales and service branches of the organization. You will also utilize various Business Intelligence tools and advanced analytical skills to extract, organize and analyze large amounts of data. Your expertise in building and effectively communicating these insights to leadership will directly result driving strategic decisions.
In this engaging opportunity, you will handle the following duties:
Establish & maintain data integrity – 20%

Understand valuable metrics and report structure, establish report processes, and identify data discrepancies and errors
Test and evaluate data accuracy for different datasets both within Oracle and in external data sources
Capture & Organize data – 30%
Use Business Intelligence tool (Microstrategy, Alteryx) to query the data in Hilton’s Enterprise Data Warehouse accurately and deftly
Build and understand data relationships/architecture, working with the database team to ensure the integrity of the data structure and design
Analyze and interpret data – 30%
You will use BI tools, spreadsheets and database tools to manipulate massive quantities of data to create and combine insightful and automated reports to identify trends, relationships, and discover root causes of business outcomes (Microstrategy, Alteryx, Tableau, R)
Design and implement advanced analytical processes by combining BI tools (Microstrategy & Alteryx) with R to create predictive forecasting and target setting models
Use advanced analytical models to analyze unstructured data (text) to derive key insights based on text and sentiment analysis
Support Operations team by helping build frameworks and automation to analyze and understand forecasts, staffing and planning requirements to improve operational insights and efficiency
Communicate/Deliver insights effectively – 20%
Use BI tools to design and build dashboards, along with visualizations, to show trends, patterns, relationships and analyses with clarity to deliver impactful insight
Use verbal and written interpersonal skills to deliver analytical observations and recommendations to business owners and leadership. You will communicate your findings in a concise, yet informative manner, to provide a strong data-centric basis for strategic decision-making


What are we looking for?


The success in this role will demonstrate itself through the following attributes and skills:
Expertise with Microsoft Office Suite, with high proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Deep understanding of the fundamentals of Data structure, including data table relationships
To fulfill this role successfully, you must possess the following minimum qualifications and experience:
BA/BS Bachelor's Degree in mathematics, statistics, finance, business analytics or related field
One (1) year in related business analytics experience inclusive of work experience, internships, and volunteer experience
Travel <10% of the time
Must be eligible to work in the US; no sponsorships will be given for role
It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions:
MA/ MS Master’s Degree in mathematics, statistics, finance, business analytics or related field
Three (3) years of experience in related business analytics
Proficiency with Microsoft Access
Experience with and knowledge of SQL
Experience with building or maintaining databases or data warehouse
Knowledge of database architecture and data modelling principles and techniques
What will it be like to work for Hilton?


Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands . Our vision “to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality” unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!

What you'll do
As an Associate Business Analyst, you will work with senior staff members in order to review and understand the content, format and accuracy of key customer deliverables, evaluate their sufficiency and make recommendations to the project team to advance the implementation process. You will develop Billtrust product expertise as you work on expanding your skills necessary for documenting the functional requirements, technical specifications and document designs for our customers. You will ultimately be responsible for managing customer communication, managing requirements gathering and working as the key resource to review customer data,. You will gain experience and broad exposure to Billtrust’s products and begin the journey to becoming a technical and functional expert who ultimately provides our customer with direction and guidance on configuring the Billtrust platform to meet their business objectives.
Regularly communicate intake progress and alert Engagement Managers/Directors and stakeholders if client deliverables are still pending receipt after an agreed upon time period for delivery has lapsed in order to take action accordingly
Work closely with Business Analysts and Solution Architects to effectively write detailed technical and functional requirements to be reviewed by various stakeholders
Provide assistance to Business Analysts in fielding questions/concerns regarding requirements from the Application Support Team
Provide assistance to Business Analysts and Solution Architects while working with other Billtrust Teams in fielding questions/concerns as it relates to a client implementation and how to support approved in-scope requirements
Complete necessary tasks on projects in time when assigned to specific tasks designated by project plans
Ability to handle multiple tasks for various projects and clients at any given time
Consistently learning and keeping up to date on Billtrust products, capabilities and new features
The Associate Business Analyst may be expected to analyze the feasibility of presales and sales opportunities where necessary
Recommend, and make improvements to the Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) and Desk Top Procedures (DTP) documentation that is leveraged by the team for implementing clients
What you'll bring to the team
Experience with written and oral communication in gathering and documenting requirements, creating functional design specifications, business writing skills
Comfortable interacting and communicating effectively with technical and non-technical business partners at all levels of organizations both internally and externally
Experience and effective in problem solving, analytical and decision-making skills
Exposure to having the ability to decompose high-level information into details and applying creativity to solving or providing options to complex problems
Proven effectiveness with time management and self-prioritization of tasks
Looks at the global picture and thinks outside of the box by communicating creative and innovative thinking by bringing new ideas and improvements forward
Develops a well-defined, shared understanding of the project scope
Proven ability to work successfully in a team-oriented setting and across all levels of business hierarchies
What you'll get
Competitive salary, stock options and 401(k) with company match: We appreciate our employees and we make sure they know it.
Benefits: We offer full-time employees multiple healthcare packages, including free and low cost options.
Open PTO: Work-life balance is important. We believe in giving our employees time to truly relax and recharge.
Paid Parental Leave: To keep our employees and their families healthy.
A Lively Culture: Ping-pong, bean bag toss, hackathons- we enjoy friendly competition.
Casual Dress: Every day is “Casual Friday’, we want you to be comfortable when you come to work.
Minimal Bureaucracy: An entrepreneurial environment of ownership and accountability allows you to get work done.
Who we are
Billtrust is the best-in-class provider of Payment Cycle Management and accounts receivable solutions, helping businesses accelerate Invoice-to-Cash. We provide a flexible, automated, cloud-based product portfolio that meets diverse buyer requirements and speeds cash application through tailored invoice delivery, secure multi-channel payment enablement, and intelligent matching and payment posting. Our platforms process $15B+ annually and help companies like Kraft Foods, New Balance Athletics and Ferguson Enterprises get paid faster and more efficiently. For the past 17 years, we have achieved remarkable success with year-over-year growth and we attribute that growth to our people and culture - We encourage employees to have autonomy, think creatively, share ideas – even with our CEO – and to challenge the status quo every day without a lot of red tape.

Billtrust: Work Hard. Have Fun. Make History.

About Us:
Groundwork Coffee specializes in batch-roasted, certified organic coffees and artisanal teas. From our humble roots as a rare book store and cafe back in 1990, Groundwork would go on to become one of the first certified organic coffee roasters in Southern California, as well as the largest organic coffee roaster in Los Angeles. A truly local pioneer in fair trade and fairly traded coffee and tea sourcing, we remain committed to sustainable business practices, including maintaining direct relationships with growers and importers who promote responsible coffee and tea production. From the ground up, Groundwork is steadfast in its commitment to the values of quality, sustainability and community.

About You:
We are looking to hire an energetic, talented, and collaborative Business Analyst to hit the ground running and contribute vital insights to our growing team. Leveraging your strong critical thinking skills and in-depth knowledge of core reporting systems, you will analyze Groundwork’s financial performance to help with business decisions. A diligent and thoughtful problem-solver, you’ll take the lead in supporting the coordination and data maintenance of key financial systems, and aid with financial reporting, the budgeting/re-forecasting process, financial modeling, and sales analysis.

If you love a great a cup of coffee (or tea), embody a positive attitude, and are enthusiastic about business analytics, then please apply today!

What You’ll Do:
Responsible for the budgeting/re-forecasting process, including working with different departments to analyze variances

Partner with Executive team to create and maintain Financial and Operational Key Performance Indicators to manage the business

Analyze syndicated sales data to generate sales projections/forecasting

Analyze customer and product profitability to help management monitor customer pricing

Work with our Purchasing Manager to understand the Company's product costs

Work with Sales to manage profitability by Sales Channel for our Wholesale business units

Develop financial models to determine feasibility of opening new stores and project break-even dates

Work with our Real-Estate department to meet store opening budgets

Work with our Retail management to analyze the stores' profitability and recommend corrective measures

Present analyses to the Executive team and Board of Directors

Perform regular audits of our ERP and other supporting systems to assure data integrity

What It Takes To Rock This Role:
Requires a Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting or other related discipline

Requires a minimum of four (4) years of financial analysis experience

Understanding of accounting required

Proficiency with Microsoft Excel required

Ability to deliver on commitments while working on multiple projects concurrently

Ability to work well in a growing and changing environment

Strong customer service and communication skills (verbal and written) to effectively interact with different departments and external parties

Experience with SAP Business One or other ERP systems preferred

Previous experience in the beverage industry or similar business sector preferred

Some travel is required.

Why Groundwork:
We strive to be the best place our employees have ever worked, and to produce the best coffee our customers have ever sipped. As a part of our team, you’ll be working with people who are down-to-earth, friendly, and passionate in a casual, caffeinated, and fun office environment.

Groundwork Perks:

Benefits are offered to eligible employees and are subject to change.

Free Coffee to Take Home: 1 pound Bulk Coffee or ¼ Pound Loose Leaf Tea every week

Free Coffee in the Office: Nitro & Cold Brew on Tap, Espresso Machine, Brewed Batches, etc.

Employee Discount Program: Discounts on Food, Beverage, & Merchandise

Multiple Health Plan Options: Medical, Dental, Vision, Voluntary Life Insurance

Paid Time Off: Including Sick Hours, Vacation, and Holidays

Commuter Program: Substantially Subsidized Metro Pass

401(k): To Invest in Your Future!

Groundwork is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regards to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, present or past history of mental disability, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.

NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Data Business Analyst to join our team in New York, New York (US-NY), United States (US).

Position Summary: Serve as liaison between business end-users and technology teams by leading the research and analysis of business needs to be solved with integrated/automated systems. This individual will support data sourcing initiatives to meet the business requirements for the Consolidated Regulatory Reporting environment. This includes gathering and interpreting data requirements, research and analysis, business design, data mapping, partnering with technology to develop data sourcing solutions, and performing business testing. This position will be exposed to multiple data sources, Finance data consumers and Enterprise Data Management processes and will be aligned to a key strategic priority of the Enterprise to streamline and control data management processes.
The candidate must have strong relevant business acumen and financial analysis skills specifically with respect to analyzing very large datasets, identifying data quality issues and proposing remediation steps. Ideally, candidate should have at least intermediate SQL skills and have experience preparing source-to-target mapping documents and developing/executing test scripts. Candidate should be a motivated, self-starter that can operate with limited instruction with exceptional attention to detail. Strong communication and organization skills are a must.

FDS Data Analyst
Responsibilities include:
1. Partner with associates, contractors and consultants from various functional groups (technical, business stakeholders, project managers) to implement data sourcing from approved data sources (ADS) to the target environments (CRR, Profit, GFIR, etc)
2. Responsible for full project life cycle and completion of all applicable deliverables/documentation:
a. ability to interpret business definitions and then translate these into data sourcing requirements (ADS BRD and PDE)
b. prepare source-to-target mapping design documents (SLD)
c. creating and executing test scripts, identifying and remediating data quality defects (Test Plan, Test Case)
d. partnering with appropriate groups to deploy into Production (Data Quality checks)
3. Supporting both Waterfall (DAIC) and Agile project methodologies where applicable, and utilizing appropriate tools (Quality Center, Microsoft Project, Rally, etc)
4. Appropriately manage time commitments to handle multiple initiatives with competing priorities

Required Skills
Bachelor's Degree (Accounting, Finance, Information Systems Management & Technology, Computer Science etc.)5+ years in Financial Services industry with knowledge of database structures, data sourcing, data warehousing finance and accounting concepts.Intermediate/Advanced SQL experience and understanding of relational databases.Advanced Microsoft Office suite software skills (Excel, Access, Word, SharePoint, One Note, Project)Significant experience in data/risk assessments and remediation efforts.Builds Partnerships - broad-based business relationships across the enterprise. Positively and skillfully influences peers, colleagues, leaders and business partners to collaborate and deliver consistent quality results.Strong organizational ability, project management skills, and extremely detail orientedExcellent written and oral communication skills at all levels (i.e. colleagues to senior management) and situations (i.e. one-on-one to presentations).

Experience with Data Management, data warehousing and large data concepts and toolsExperience with Oracle, SQL Server, Teradata, DB2, Netezza, Hadoop, SAP eLedger, Rally, Visio, ETL tools and Data Management toolsKnowledge of Global Technology, Enterprise Data Management & Enterprise Data Architecture programs, strategies and standardsExposure to Agile & Waterfall change management conceptsRegulatory Reporting KnowledgeBanking Product Knowledge

About Scoop

Scoop brings co-workers and neighbors together to enjoy a smooth carpooling experience—unlocking new opportunities to create friendships, improve their well-being, and make the most of their valuable time.

Business Analytics @ Scoop
Carpooling has been around for decades, but its impact has been difficult to measure and understand. At Scoop, we have a unique opportunity to use analytics to understand and showcase the impact of our carpooling community. As a Business Analyst at Scoop, you will be responsible for helping answer fundamental strategic questions that influence how we sell, market, and expand. You will partner cross-functionally with Product, Sales, Customer Success and Finance teams to provide visibility into our data, make strategic recommendations and drive the successful growth of Scoop. Every piece of data at Scoop is tied to real human connection that happens between commuters nationwide, and every insight you discover helps us connect more and more people together.
In this role, you will:
Actively generate insights and recommendations that influence business strategy at all stages: Sales, Launch, and Growth.
Partner with business function leads in building market health and customer management dashboards and reports that drive and expedite data-backed decisions.
Deep dive into customer performance to identify opportunities to grow the Scoop program.
Partner with Data Engineering to create scalable data processes and help evolve our internal analytics products.
Act like an owner - constantly strive to develop domain expertise and share it with others.
You should have:
An undergraduate degree in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or a similar quantitative field (or have equivalent additional work experience)
2+ years of work experience analyzing quantitative data.
Solid working knowledge of SQL and comfort querying large datasets.
Experience with at least one scripting language used for data analysis (e.g., R, Python).
Intellectual curiosity and aptitude to pick up new technical skills.
The ability to clearly explain complicated analyses to non-technical audiences and tell compelling, concise stories with data.
Experience managing objectives and expectations with multiple stakeholders.
Expert ability to balance pressure for statistical rigor with timely business decision-making.
You might also have:
Experience working closely with Sales, Customer Success and/or Finance teams.
Familiarity with using data visualization tools like Periscope or Tableau to display business trends and performance.
Predictive modeling experience using R or Python.
Life @ Scoop

Some easy math: what do you get when you take a few Bay Area commuters, a few cute office dogs, and the idea of carpooling? You get Scoop, the company that bring commuters together in carpools they love by partnering with their employers. Scoop unlocks new opportunities to make friendships, improve your well-being, and make the most of your valuable time.

Our team mixes technology and elbow grease every day, with one statistic in our crosshairs: 80% of Americans drive alone to work, wasting valuable minutes every morning. A big problem? Sure, but we know we can crack it through our talents, partnerships, and the Scoop Community that’s already exploding.

Our culture is open and honest, but considerate and respectful. We lead with positive energy and bet on ourselves and Scoop every day. We’re defined by the moments we share: show-and-tells, company camping, and eating way too many cookies. We come from many backgrounds: successful start-ups, big tech companies, and premier consulting firms. But whether we walked into Scoop with a tie or a t-shirt, we’re all united by a dream to change the way people get to work.

Tala is looking for an inquisitive, self-directed Business Analyst to manage data integrity, analysis, and metrics for our global Customer Experience team. Tala ( http://www.tala.co/ ) is a world leader in providing direct loans and financial services in emerging markets. We are a global team with diverse backgrounds who are singularly focused on using technology, data, and a customer-centric approach to meet the financial needs of the 2+ billion people of the emerging global middle class.

The Business Analyst will work within the Global Customer Experience department, reporting to the Manager of Customer Experience. You'll work closely with other CX analysts and a distributed operations team to understand our data flows, using these datasets to create insightful, objective analyses that drive actionable staffing, process, and technology recommendations. Successful candidates will have a strong quantitative and analytical background; experience investigating unstructured problems and answering questions with data; and a history of creating dynamic reporting and data visualizations for technical and non-technical audiences. This role will work closely with Data Analytics, Credit, and Data Science to utilize additional application and customer datasets. Finally, you'll train, guide, and develop best practices for in-country Customer Experience analysts.

Responsibilities:

Create and maintain data pipelines to business intelligence tools used by the CX team to make key business decisions
Identify anomalous performance, research root cause and propose solutions to optimize team performance
Evaluate current data sources/systems/quality and make recommendations (maintain, adjust, migrate, replace)
Create globally consistent, accurate, dynamic manager-level dashboards for key Collections & Customer Service metrics
Assist leadership team in establishing team- and individual-level targets using historical, market, and partner team data
Primary liaison between CX department and Data Analytics
Develop roadmap for CX data/reporting projects
Analyze and present recommendations/process changes/new initiatives to management using insights derived from operational data

Requirements:

BA/BS in quantitative field (statistics, economics, mathematics, data science, engineering, etc.)
3+ years in a data-intensive/quantitative role
Strong analytical skills demonstrated through projects answering business questions with data
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and at least one programming language (e.g. R or Python)
Experience with Looker, Tableau or similar business intelligence tools
Experience working across technical and non-technical teams

Preferred Skills & Experience:

Experience using GitHub, Jenkins
Experience working in financial services/lending
Experience working with an international, distributed team

We strongly believe that inclusion fosters innovation and we're proud to have a diverse team with a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences. We focus on hiring talented people regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

About Tala

Tala ( http://tala.co/ ) is a mission-driven mobile technology and data science company that's opening up financial access for underserved people globally. Tala's smartphone app uses alternative data to deliver instant credit and help customers build their financial identities. Unlike traditional credit scoring, Tala's proprietary underwriting models draw on thousands of mobile data points including network diversity, social connectedness, geographic patterns, and financial transactions to score customers in real time, without a need for formal credit history. Tala is headquartered in Santa Monica with additional offices in Nairobi and Manila.

Tala, formerly known as InVenture, is backed by IVP, Ribbit Capital, Lowercase Capital, Data Collective, Collaborative Fund and other leading venture and impact investors. In 2016, Fast Company ranked Tala as one of its top 10 companies in Money, and Forbes named Tala as one of the top 50 FinTech companies in the world. Additionally, Tala's work has been highlighted by Forbes, the New York Times, the Financial Times, the Wall Street Journal, TED, and Wired, among others. Tala is headquartered in Los Angeles with additional offices in Nairobi and Manila.

AXS is a company whose core values reflect a culture that celebrates individual differences, collective achievements, and respect of one another. We start small and are never afraid to try (Be The Spark). We believe open, honest, and proactive communication builds trust and empowers us to be our best (Make it Personal). We handle our problems constructively and together (Be Real). We go above and beyond to build something truly special and lasting (Bring Your ‘A’ Game). Most importantly, we celebrate and communicate our success by recognizing each other across all teams and levels of our organization (Pat The Back).

Our culture is a representation of who we are now, and whom we aspire to be in the future. If you are looking for a fast-paced environment where collaboration, accountability and visibility enable you to make a difference every day, then AXS may be a perfect match.

AXS is looking for a talented and highly motivated professional to join our technology team as Business Analyst. In this role, you will provide internal/external user support for our custom-built enterprise ticketing platform. You'll also be responsible for investigating root cause of software issues to figure out the best solution. If you share our passion for building great internet products, want to take on significant responsibility that will directly grow our business, and are able to work well both individually and as a team player, we want to hear from you!

What you’ll be doing:

Eliciting, compiling, and delivering detailed product requirements to all internal functional groups required to produce a working product.
Responsible for discovering, synthesizing, and analyzing information from a variety of sources to ensure product requirements align with overall company priorities.
Identifying and managing solutions for systemic software bugs and discrepancies.
Drive segmentation and A/B test features to maximize user satisfaction and performance.
Analytics and more analytics….you will be responsible to review, analyze, and make recommendations based on data analytics.
Performing user acceptance testing.
Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.
Serving as a liaison between business stakeholders and the technology team.
Skills and experience we’re seeking:

Bachelor of degree in business, or related field or and MBA.
Minimum 4 years of experience in business analysis, product management, applications/software development, or ERP systems support
Proven success in building products that are scalable and flexible.
Excellence in problem solving, troubleshooting, and critical thinking.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Knowledge of iterative software development frameworks.
Ability to stay organized in a highly demanding environment.
Excellent documentation skills.
Experience with using ticketing systems such as JIRA, Trello, etc.
Experience in drafting requirements and delivering software solutions
Exemplary customer service skills across various levels of an organization
Ability to travel as needed.
And you’ll really get our attention if you have:

Ticketing / sports and live entertainment experience.
Experience synthesizing key learnings from research, user data and competitive benchmarks
Direct web development coding experience
Advance technical skills.
Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, AXS is a leading ticketing, data, and marketing solutions provider in the US, UK and Europe. The company and its solutions empower more than 200 clients –

teams, arenas, theaters, clubs and colleges – to turn data into action, maximize the value of all their events and create joy for fans. AXS is an enterprise event technology platform that services venues, promoters and sports teams; providing fans the opportunity to purchase tickets directly from their favorite venues via a user-friendly ticketing interface. AXS serves all phases of the event life-cycle beyond just ticketing, through its consumer facing website, AXS.com and the AXS App. To learn more about the company and our employment opportunities, please visit us at www.axs.com

You’ll work in our Risk practice in New York. This global practice supports clients in many different industries facing challenges of developing and implementing tailored concepts for risk recognition, measurement, and control.
What You'll Do
You’ll work in teams of typically 3 – 5 consultants, playing an active role in all aspects of client engagement.

At Aqua, we know that water is a precious resource – one that plays a critical role in sustaining life. That’s why we take seriously our mission: protecting and providing Earth’s most essential resource. At Aqua, we are guided by a set of principles that embody the character of our company and inspire our work together. They are embedded within our business practices and our behavior. Aqua uses science, technology, capital investments, and amazing talent to provide communities with clean, safe drinking water and responsibly return wastewater to our rivers and streams. This position is responsible for extracting, formatting, and analyzing all relevant business metric data connected to all Aqua Customer Operations (ACO) departments, including the Customer Advocacy Center, Billing, Cash, & Collections, and the Call Center to ensure these departments are meeting the established objectives and providing excellent internal and external customer service.

$47,600 - $79,699 a yearThe Division of Pediatric Critical Care in the Department of Pediatrics, University of Utah School of Medicine has an immediate opening for a Business Analyst. Provides leadership and oversight of state support for the National Emergency Medical Services (EMS) Information System (NEMSIS) Technical Assistance Center (TAC) activities and operations. Interprets results using a variety of techniques, ranging from simple data aggregation via statistical analysis to complex data mining. Designs, develops, implements and maintains business solutions. Works directly with clients and project and business leaders to identify analytical requirements. This position will report to the NEMSIS Program Director.
Responsibilities
NEMSIS TAC Leadership:
1. Coordinate with the Principal Investigator and Director while working with State and Territory EMS Offices towards the development of state, regional, and local EMS data system implementations to populate the national EMS database.
2. Provide recommendations regarding the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) Office of EMS Cooperative Agreement with the University of Utah, School of Medicine to meet the needs of the EMS community.
3. Coordinate the development and implementation of the NHTSA / NEMSIS Version 3 data standard with involvement from multiple State and local EMS stakeholders.

4. Work with EMS stakeholders to determine the best codes and descriptors for the pre-hospital environment using healthcare standards used in the NHTSA / NEMSIS Version 3 standard (e.g., ICD-10, RxNorm, and SNOMED CT for EMS procedures performed).
5. Identify and coordinate the development, maintenance, and community outreach in the use of the NEMSIS Public and State Reporting Tools and their ongoing development and improvement through education and feedback.

State and Vendor Technical Assistance:
1. Act as resource person and coordinator for States and Territories attempting to define or restructure an electronic EMS data collection system based on the NHTSA / NEMSIS Standards (Version 2 and the transition to Version 3).

2. Provide technical assistance to States and Territories, EMS software development companies, local EMS agencies by phone, email, webinars, site visits, conferences, etc. to help with EMS data system development, State EMS data submission to populate the NEMSIS national database, and national EMS dataset compliance.
3. Help states and territories investigate and resolve data issues by analyzing, cleaning, tracking, and reporting data.

4. Speak at state conference (or state meetings), via webinar or in person, providing education and overview regarding the NHTSA / NEMSIS Version 3. Conferences include: NASEMSO Conferences, State Work Group or Special Interest Groups, and State EMS Conferences

National Activities:
1. Participate in monthly NASEMSO conference calls, and other meetings as needed.

Research Activities:
1. Provide clinical expertise and quality assurance review of research conducted by outside investigators, State officials and NEMSIS investigators.
2. Assist State and Territory EMS personnel in analysis of State or Territory level data within NEMSIS using NEMSIS Reporting Tools and databases.
3. Assist in the annual research dataset internal analysis prior to publication.
Minimum Qualifications
Requires a bachelor’s degree in related area (2 years related work experience may be substituted for 1 year of education). Two to four years of experience in the field or in a related area. Familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field.

Minimum 5 yrs practical experience working within a team(s) or projects

About Finicity:

Finicity started out as one of the first 'fintech' pioneers, providing individuals and families data-driven insights to make smarter financial decisions. Our mission and leadership position hasn't changed as we've evolved into a major digital transformation partner for some of the largest financial institutions and other fintech organizations. Through our real-time data aggregation and intelligent insights platform we're fueling the digital experiences our customers need to improve efficiency, drive profitability and deepen customer loyalty.

Whether we're working with major financial institutions on improving data access for their customers, or fueling a fully digital lending process, we're fortunate to spend our days improving people's financial lives and organization's financial decisions. Come help us and be part of one of American Banker’s Best Fintechs to Work For and one of the Salt Lake Tribune’s Top Workplaces.

Learn more about who we work with: to transform mortgage lending with major GSEs like Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to mortgage lending platform providers Black Knight and Ellie Mae; to transform the user experience for data sharing with USAA, JPMorgan Chase, and Wells Fargo. Or see how we have been recognized recently: Housingwire Tech 100, Benzinga FinTech Awards, CFSI Financial Health Leader.

iHeartMedia
Job Summary:
With over a quarter of a billion monthly listeners in the U.S., iHeartMedia has the largest reach of any radio or television outlet in America. The company owns and operates 858 broadcast radio stations, serving more than 150 markets throughout the U.S. Plus, iHeartRadio - a free, industry-leading, digital music service - gives users instant access to more than 2,000 live radio stations and allows them to create custom stations inspired by favorite artists or songs, anywhere they are.


The Business Analyst will be tasked with supporting analytics for programs/projects within our innovative solutions development team. This role will be key in ensuring we achieve organization around requirements gathering to both vet out the business case for financial investment and ensure that stakeholder requirements are captured, agreed upon and measured. This person will work with stakeholders from within the entire iHeartMedia organization, ensuring understanding and representation of strategy and goals within product development. The ideal candidate will quickly develop a deep understanding of our business and be comfortable engaging, interacting and communicating with business leaders and team members. When encountering a problem this position requires demonstrated creativity in solutioning, weighing the trade offs and efforts, identifying the best path forward, and exercising good judgment to drive ahead.
As the Business Analyst – Business Value, you will:
Elicit requirements from stakeholders and subject matter experts using interviews, documenting analysis, conducting requirements workshops, creating storyboards, surveys, business process analysis, use cases or user stories, scenarios, event lists, competitive product analysis, task and workflow analysis.
Work with the product manager or project sponsor to document the project’s business requirements and support efforts throughout development cycle, from requirements gathering, testing and UAT.
Deliver business requirements documentation and associated artifacts to garner appropriate sign offs and confirmation these meet objectives defined.
Elicit information from stakeholders to define and document holistic end-to end processes that incorporate various enterprise business units.
Write requirements specifications according to standard templates, using natural language simply, clearly, unambiguously, and concisely.
Represent requirements using alternative views, such as visual analysis models (diagrams), prototypes, or simulations, where appropriate.
Interact with internal and external clients to extract, interpret and communicate data.
Draw out key business insights and provide actionable recommendations.
Lead requirements analysis and verification, ensuring that requirement statements are complete, consistent, concise, comprehensible, traceable, feasible, unambiguous, and verifiable, and that they conform to standards.

JOB SUMMARY

The purpose of this position is to provide analytical support through research, data collection and data management of information for the organization.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Responsible for data collection, data input and/or aggregation and data auditing to support accurate key metric reporting and analysis performed by the organization.

Reviews accuracy of information provided and responds to requests from management and vendors.

Assists in generating Business As Usual (BAU) reports. Supports ad-hoc presentation/analysis development and responds to information requests from management.

Other duties may be assigned.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from 4-year college or university. Master's degree preferred. 0-2 years of related experience.

CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES

None.

COMMUNICATION SKILLS

Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.

FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE

Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis.

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to understand and carry out general instructions in standard situations. Ability to solve problems in standard situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.

OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES

Experience in the use of Microsoft applications with emphasis on Excel and PowerPoint.

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY

Decisions made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

At Abbott, we're committed to helping people live their best possible life through the power of health. For more than 125 years, we've brought new products and technologies to the world - in nutrition, diagnostics, medical devices and branded generic pharmaceuticals - that create more possibilities for more people at all stages of life. Today, 99,000 of us are working to help people live not just longer, but better, in the more than 150 countries we serve.
Core Responsibilities
Deliver actionable, data-driven business insights to management, senior leadership and Field Sales Account Managers.
Use data to tell a story.
Perform financial and/or statistical analysis in Excel, SAS, R, Python, and/or other programs to support ongoing business needs.
Create and update dashboards in Excel, Cognos and/or Tableau.
Create and update leadership with executive decks in PowerPoint.
Primary Function/Goals/Objectives
This position will deliver a balanced understanding of data and business dynamics that helps to provide a clear point of view and recommendations to drive business decision-making. Insights will be delivered to audiences within the department and across the wider business unit. In addition to strong technical and analytical skills, this position is responsible for helping to provide support to cross-functional partners.

Accounts assigned will be major national scope GPOs (Group Purchasing Organizations) and Food Service Management Companies that represent a significant portion of institutional sales and have far-reaching implications due to impact on AN sales and share.

This role will support multiple processes critical to running the business, including updating and supporting the use of the downstream model, tracking downstream pull-through, updating the hospital matrix, monitoring contractual compliance, and mining e-commerce data.

The Business Analyst creates customer-facing tools utilized by the Field Sales Account Managers during the deal negotiation process that clearly and distinctly define AN’s contract offer to enable the Field Sales Force to efficiently close the deal. They are also responsible for Terms and Conditions, price exhibits and any other documents for customer proposals.

Education
Bachelor’s degree in statistics, economics, business, natural sciences, social sciences, or a related field, or equivalent experience, is required.
Master’s degree in statistics, economics, business, natural sciences, social sciences, or a related field is preferred.
Background
Excellent analytical skills, including strong data interpretation skills and the ability to tell clear, accurate, and compelling stories that synthesize trends across multiple reports or data sources to drive decision-making.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong work ethic, self-motivated, and internally driven.
Strong skills in MS Office, particularly Excel and PowerPoint.
Intermediate or better skills in at least two of R, Python, SAS, SQL, and WPS. May substitute experience with a computer-programming language for one of these.
Exposure to SQL Server and/or Teradata is a plus.
Accountability/Scope
This position directly supports the institutional contracting organization with regular sharing of key insights on performance and changing market conditions. The result of this work will be to drive the successful performance of the Therapeutic Nutrition business throughout ANPD.

The Business Analyst will be responsible for drawing conclusions and making recommendations to management on an appropriate course of action by analyzing sales data, census data, competitive information, scan data, pricing figures, industry data (such as Adams or Impact) and any other applicable sources of information. Analyses may include sales forecasting, opportunity identification and evaluation of program performance. Role also entails the development of sales templates as needed.
Responsibilities
Prepares materials for supplier-planning meetings by aggregating and reviewing Focus Marketing data, internal sales data, spend data, important demographic and socioeconomic developments and pricing and category trends. Attends and contributes to meetings as appropriate by providing any commentary on analyses or pulling relevant data during the meeting as necessary.
Evaluates the potential impact of pricing modifications or prospective programming elements by reviewing pertinent sales data, research and comparable examples to forecast sales.
Uncovers market and brand opportunities by developing an understanding of category, customer and market dynamics and using this knowledge to assess brand performance.
Measures risk to sales plan (gap analysis) by comparing the plan to historical sales data, current trend information and marketplace developments; reports potential shortfalls to management.
Develops sales templates; collaborates with Business Managers, Division Manager or General Sales Manager to identify business needs and designs appropriate, replicable reports. Trains administrative staff on process to recreate/run templates.
Package data for sales materials by working with Business Manager/Marketing Director to ascertain needed information and converting data into concise facts and visuals that can be easily incorporated into sell sheets, concept sells or presentations.
Uncovers drivers for important changes in sales performance by reviewing appropriate competitive and internal data.
Measures ROI on selected programming by working with Business Managers and Marketing Director to determine evaluation criteria.
Develops business review content by working with the Supplier, Business Manager and Sales Management to analyze sales performance, develop business case, and incorporate data into templates.
Completes all necessary training programs by attending, participating, and passing all required tests as defined by management. (e.g. FOCUS MARKETING, ANALYTICAL TRAINING).
Maintains customer and supplier confidence by keeping appropriate information confidential.
Maintains a safe and clean working environment by complying with procedures, rules and regulations.
Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Qualifications
High School diploma or equivalent required.
Ability to hold a Solicitor’s Permit required.
Financial, marketing or business analysis experience; consumer packaged goods or data provider (e.g. IRI, Nielsen) background a plus.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bi-lingual a plus, but not required
Bachelor’s degree preferred and/or equivalent training and work experience
Thinks outside the box; searches for innovative solutions
KNOWLEDGE / SKILLS
Highly fluent in Excel and relational database programs. Strong knowledge of Power Point.
Must be a result oriented professional with excellent verbal/written communication skills using diplomacy and discretion as well as strong customer service skills.
Ability to multi-task, works independently and/or within a team, pays attention to detail and meet deadlines.
