MORE ABOUT THIS JOB
GLOBAL INVESTMENT RESEARCH
From macroeconomic forecasts to individual stock analysis, our team develops tools and insights to help shape investment strategies for clients and the firm. Our analysts work on client-focused research in the equity, fixed-income, currency, and commodities markets, mining big data that enters markets around the world each day to identify game-changing insights. You’ll be part of a team that is intellectually curious, creative, analytical, and passionate about performing market research.
RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS
Global Investment Research
Global Investment Research (GIR) produces original, fundamental research and analysis of industries, companies and economies. Our research teams continually identify and analyze financial information, strategic issues and trends that affect companies, industries and markets on a regional and global scale. Our clients use these insights and investment ideas to develop their strategies.

Our Team
The Macro Research team focuses on the intersection between economics and financial markets across a wide class of assets including equities, rates, FX, credit, mortgages and commodities. The FX & EM Strategy team analyzes the economic and political drivers of exchange rates, local interest rates, and hard currency sovereign credit, and provides investment advice to the firm’s institutional and corporate clients.

Summary of Responsibilities
We are seeking a New York-based strategist for the FX &EM Strategy team.

Key responsibilities include:
Publishing timely and innovative research on macroeconomic and political trends and their impact on exchange rate markets
Presenting our market views to internal stakeholders and external clients
Contributing quantitative research and other analytical support to team members
Collaborating with the broader global Macro Strategy team as well as our regional economists
Preferred Qualifications & Skillset
1-3 years’ experience working in macroeconomic and/or markets research in financial services industry or policy institution
Ideal candidate would have background analyzing foreign exchange markets and/or international macroeconomic issues
Advanced degree in economics, finance, or closely related fields
Excellent English language verbal and written communication skills; other language skills a plus
Strong quantitative skills and experience using statistical analysis software
Deep curiosity, and a passion for the intersection between macroeconomics and markets
Desire to work in team-centric environment
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS
The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.

Seeking a Information Business Systems Analyst to partner with business departments to analyze the processes and information needs; identify and document project requirements for technology solutions.

General Description
 Understand and document current business procedures and identify areas for improvement. A thorough understanding of the current state of the organization is necessary prior to recommending changes related to implementing a new business solution.
The business analyst uses modeling tools to document the current state of business processes as well as the desired future state. Responsible for the knowledge transfer of business implications to the application/database developers and project managers.
Responsibilities
Performs feasibility analysis, scopes projects, and works with the project management team to prioritizes deliverables, and negotiate on product functionalities.
Creates detailed Business Requirement Document (BRD) and translate it into functional specifications.
Provides analytic support by coordinating data extraction from various databases and data interpretation.
Partners with development and analytic teams to provide reporting on software solutions.

Who is Taco Bell?

Taco Bell Corp., a subsidiary of Yum! Brands, Inc. (NYSE: YUM), is the nation's leading Mexican-inspired quick service restaurant (QSR) brand. From breakfast to late night, Taco Bell serves made-to-order and customizable tacos and burritos, among other craveable choices, and is the first QSR restaurant to offer American Vegetarian Association (AVA)-certified menu items. Taco Bell and its more than 350 franchise organizations proudly serve over 42 million customers each week through nearly 7,000 restaurants across the nation, as well as through its mobile, desktop and delivery ordering services.

Overseas, Taco Bell has over 400 restaurants, with plans to add 2,000 more restaurants internationally within the next decade. The brand encourages its fans to "Live Más" and connects with them through sports, gaming and new music via its Feed The Beat® music program. Taco Bell also provides education opportunities and serves the community through its nonprofit organization, the Taco Bell® Foundation™, and connects fans with their passions through programs such as the Live Más Scholarship program. In 2016, Taco Bell was named as one of Fast Company's Top 10 Most Innovative Companies in the World.

About the Job:
Taco Bell is excited to offer a highly qualified candidate with a tremendous opportunity to help shape our consumer digital experiences and drive innovation and new features on our kiosk application being placed in all our restaurants. We are looking for a strong candidate to be a business analyst on the kiosk team. In this role, you will be responsible for gathering and writing requirements for new features and enhancements, defects, and future roadmap items. You will also work closely with our development and QA teams to assist in providing additional testing and documenting processes. This role integrates with many other areas of the business including operations, ecommerce, data management, and security as many of the kiosk functions touch these departments from either a functional or data flow perspective.

Equally important to the job role and responsibilities is making sure all qualified candidates are a good fit to the amazing Live Mas! culture that is Taco Bell! At Taco Bell, we embrace breakthrough thinking and innovative ideas that continue to differentiate us from our competitors. We have a maniacal focus on our customers, never follow, and always celebrate the accomplishments of our people. If you are that diamond in the rough, we would love to meet with you.

The Day-to-Day:

Gather requirements and help build document specifications for development
Communicate with business users, gather information and independently research business processes.
Map out the business process and write analysis documents describing the process and critical milestones for large initiatives within the kiosk
Research and understand kiosk system functionality and other system touchpoints
Write functional requirement documentation for system modifications
Engage in daily stand-up meetings with QA and developers on release progress
Engage in sprint planning and backlog grooming efforts
Work closely with the project manager to address overall project timelines
Work closely with menu and data management team to ensure that the kiosks are prepared for any new menu experiences or menu updates
Ensure that all JIRA tickets are written in completion for developers/QA to understand
Write requirements for any new system integrations to the kiosk

Minimum 3 years of experience as a business analyst

Strong knowledge working with Android mobile applications

Ability to translate the business process to specific system activities
Solid understanding of the practical application of agile methodologies
A team player who can easily adapt in a rapidly changing environment
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to clearly articulate technical solutions for execution

Atlassian Suite (JIRA, Confluence)

With a small team of smart people who like working hard and have fun too, we released the most disruptive enterprise management software in the world: Odoo. Its online offer is 3 times more affordable than traditional competitors like SAP and Microsoft.
You think it's too good to be true? See for yourself. Preview our 1-click demo and read what people say about Odoo on Twitter.
Start a career with us. We offer you an extraordinary chance to learn and grow. Be involved with a very exciting product and a great team behind it.

Responsibilities
Business Analysts advise Odoo's clients on ways to effectively leverage Odoo's software for maximum operational efficiency.

Support the sales team during pre-sale.

You have a passion for software

Executive Summary:
The Sales Forecasting and Business Analysis position is responsible for all forecasting activities associated with customers and products. The Sales Forecasting Business Analyst creates and maintains forecast models for their customers (i.e. Sales, Finance, Supply Chain, & Manufacturing), incorporating business intelligence and forecast information gathered from Customers, Sales, Marketing, and Finance.

The Sales Forecasting Business Analyst is the integration point into the sales and commercial organization. Basic forecast modelling and Rough Cut Capacity Planning is the responsibility of this position. This position leads the dialogue during the month in the Sales and Operations (S&OP) Meeting for their respective customers and products with key counterparts in Supply Chain and Operations.
Basic Functions:
Develop demand forecasts at multiple levels of aggregation for multiple time horizons as part of a demand planning function.
Review historical sales trends, research demand drivers, cleanse and prepare forecast data, develop statistical forecast models, and evaluate forecast results.
Coordinate cross-functional research activities to reconcile significant variances and refine the forecast model to reflect updated sales and marketing assumptions.
Interact with Sales, Marketing, and Customer Service to understand demand forecast drivers.
Utilize a collaborative and consensus approach by working with Sales, Marketing and Customer Service to obtain and ensure that current and accurate information is used for demand forecasts.
Use and maintain the forecasting software.
Provide input to the Supply Chain organization in developing inventory strategies on existing items, new products, and product phase-outs.
Closely coordinate and communicate customer action plans with affected departments as it relates to capacity and supply planning.

Job Functions:
Gather, analyze and validate historical demand data through T-SQL queries.
Load resulting demand data into forecasting software to create statistical forecast.
Review statistical forecast model and apply error analysis techniques to improve forecasting.
Review sales plans, customer supplied forecasts, and/or latest estimates and demand drivers provided to Sales and Customer Service. Make override decisions to the statistical forecast based on these inputs.
Achieve consensus for operational demand forecasts by facilitating a collaborative planning process with sales, marketing and finance personnel.
Maintain demand planning system and software including the entry and modification of data, product hierarchy, monitoring trends in forecast error, and identifying relevant market related data and competitive intelligence.
Prepare and maintain relevant reports pertaining to demand planning process.
Key Results:
A demand forecast which incorporates current and accurate market information that allows the company to better react to Marketplace requirements and provide its supply chain with the appropriate information necessary to meet Market demand.
Improved synergy amongst Supply Chain, Sales, Marketing and Finance, which will lead to a better coordinated, well informed, and robust forecast to better guide the company. Refined systems and methods to continually improve forecasts so that the company can better anticipate Market requirements.
Review Supply plan monthly during the S&OP process to expose Supply Planners to the opportunities and risks associated with current production plan as it relates to specific Customer requirements.
Position Requirements:
2+ years’ experience in an analyst role in a business environment. Experience providing financial or analytical support to Sales and Customer Service departments.
Experience with ETL/Data Cleansing.
Experience creating basic and customized reports utilizing T-SQL, Excel Power Query, Power Pivot, Lookups, etc.
Demonstrated proficiency in statistics, forecasting and forecasting methods with an understanding of their financial and operational impacts.
Strong analytical, organizational, decision making, and presentation skills.
Strong interpersonal communication skills are also essential to effectively interact with all teams, areas and levels of business affecting the forecast process. Good facilitation skills are required along with the ability to present clearly to key stakeholders.

Preferred:
ForecastPro Application experience.
Enterprise ERP experience. Dynamics 365/Dynamics AX preferred.
Workflow & Process Documentation.
Power BI experience.
PowerApps & Microsoft Flow experience.
Education/Training:
BA/BS college degree in Business, Finance, Statistics, or related field. Equivalent experience accepted. MBA preferred.
Licenses/Certificates:
APICS or other forecasting Certification preferred.
Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
The person in this position must be capable of sitting for an 8-hour period; read the computer screen and various paper documents; perform data entry on a computer keyboard; use standard office equipment such as a computer keyboard, calculator, copier, fax machine, scanner, stapler, telephone, and mail machine.

Work Environment The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Welcome to Allscripts! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world-class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Allscripts is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.

The primary purpose of this role is to be responsible for creating the business and/or functional requirements necessary for technology solutions that meet customer needs, expected delivery dates, and exceptional quality standards.

Work under the direction of the Manager to provide application solutions for assigned business areas.
Possess functional knowledge of assigned application technology.
Interact with business users to understand new business requirements and enhancement requests
Serve liaison role between application technology vendors, internal IS groups, and business users.
Translate business requirements into product-specific designs and configuration, detailed requirement specifications and use cases.
Assist in developing functional specifications, design documents, business process workflow and related documentation for new development projects and/or enhancement and modification requests to be used by Systems Analyst.
Interact with Systems Analysts during the software build and/or configuration process and testing process.
Perform functional application configuration and configure /run reports at user request.
Assist in designing and execution of functional, integration, and regression test plans for new application functionality, product releases and enhancement and regulatory modifications using business scenarios and use cases.
Ensure programs meet business specifications.
Demonstrate new functionality to business users seeking inputs on future direction.
Review vendor provided documentation and user manuals needed to support the product.
Directly interface with business users by responding to support calls escalated by the Service Desk.
Participate in user focus groups and requirements workshops, vendor training and demonstrations.

Assist in supporting activations and rollouts.
Consistent efforts to deliver quality solutions as per agreed scope.
Customer focus and close alignment with the customers’ business objectives.
Ensure efforts to continually improve domain knowledge.
Ensure the quality of the deliverables as per the defined defects standards
Document issues with resolutions and share with team members to improve team productivity.
Provide data to generate team performance metrics.
Knowledge transfer with other team members to improve overall team education level
Take complete ownership for the assigned task and timely inform the progress of the project / task to all stakeholders.
Adherence to the defined standards.
Take initiative and drives to bring to logical conclusion; proactive approach.
Provide accurate and timely information and escalates when there are issues.
Actively participate in meetings and make valuable contribution.
Qualifications
Academic and Professional Qualifications:
 BA or BS degree preferred or other relevant combination of training and experience.

Experience:
Up to 2 years entry level to moderate experience in providing support and maintenance in assigned product preferred
Working knowledge of MS SQL Database structure and methodology.

Travel Requirements:
 May require local travel
 May require other travel for business needs

Working Arrangements:
May require after hours on call support
Work is performed in a standard office environment with minimal exposure to health or safety hazards

At Allscripts, our greatest strength comes from bringing together talented people with diverse perspectives to support the technology needs of 180,000 physicians, 1,500 hospitals and 10,000 post-acute organizations across the globe. Allscripts offers a competitive total rewards package, including holidays, vacation, and medical, disability and life insurance.

Allscripts’ policy is to provide equal employment opportunity and affirmative action in all of its employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category. About Trilogy:
Powered by big dreams and small egos, Trilogy is re-imagining how skills-based learning can close the gap between the skills of today's workforce and the needs of tomorrow's jobs. We work with experienced instructors, innovative employers, and top universities to create boot camps that prepare students for careers in the Digital Economy. Although we've successfully graduated hundreds of students, this is truly Day 1 for us. Driven by a one-team mentality, we're looking for those with the hunger, talent, and passion to ride this wave with us.

Our Values:
1. We put students first

We put students first because they deserve nothing less - and our university and employer partners expect nothing less. Every aspect of Trilogy's success depends on this.

2. We never stop improving

We believe that continuous improvement is the source of innovation. We lend an ear to both our fans and our critics in an effort to deliver better programs, better service, better communication, and better value.

3. We bring a "can do" attitude

We are a team of entrepreneurs who confront challenges head-on and figure things out. We value action, effort, commitment, and learning.

4. We succeed only as a team

Teamwork is critical to our success, and we place a tremendous value on how we work together in our immediate teams, between our business units, and across the entire company.

Job Description:
This Business Analyst position will help lead or assist in conducting requirements sessions with end users and central operations. Responsibilities include documenting, designing and testing system implementations and launch support of solutions in Salesforce.com environment. As a Business Analyst, you will interface with business to ensure timely and effective delivery of Salesforce solutions for the business requirements. The ideal candidate is a diligent, hardworking individual who is able to learn new functions and processes rapidly, can work with little supervision and is capable of delivering outstanding work at all times.

Responsibilities:

Leads requirements gathering sessions, proactively drawing out requirements from stakeholders.
Performs gap analysis to identify opportunities for process improvement or management control of work flow.
Creates requirements definition documentation, including use cases, and functional specifications to capture business needs and for validation with the customer and shared with project stakeholders.
Creates workflow diagrams to document current and future business environment.
Identifies and resolves problems which may impact projects by monitoring progress and project status. Escalates important issues to the attention of Management so that decisions can be made promptly.
Responds and communicates efficiently between the business, tech and QA team on projects and to facilitate resolution of user issues as and when necessary.
Communicates in written, oral and presentation formats to best represent and express user and organizational requirements to audiences up to mid-level management.
Forms productive relationships with internal customers by listening, clarifying, and responding effectively.
Assists the business in defining scope and priorities for system initiatives (new projects and ongoing maintenance)

Basic Qualifications


Exceptional communication skills – written, presentation skills, etc.
Exceptional client handling skills – able to work with all levels within the client portfolio
Demonstrated ability to deliver business-oriented solutions, across a portfolio of projects
Able to successfully manage a varied workload with minimal intervention from Management
Thorough understanding of the AGILE development lifecycle
Ability to conceptualize current requirements against future plans
Possesses the aptitude to quickly understand work processes and flows in various business units and recognize those that could benefit from technology
Proven ability to support Business Process Re-engineering (BPR) and Change Management
Possesses an understanding of current business analysis and project management methodologies, tools and techniques
Established project management skills including familiarity with project scheduling and tracking documents
2+ years in Business Analysis
Salesforce Knowledge is desired

Overview
The Finance Transformation team within EXL Consulting practice is a world class, global professional services group dedicated to helping CFO’s develop and execute winning strategies and to drive improvements in effectiveness across the Finance organization.

We are hiring Jr. Associates in the Greater New York City area with a focus on Business Analysis reporting to the Engagement Manager. The Jr. Associate Business Analysts will be a part of the service delivery team for medium to large teams engaged in finance transformation projects for global clients.
Responsibilities
The Jr. Associate Business Analysts on the EXL Finance Transformation Consulting team will be at client locations onsite / offsite and will be responsible for the following areas:
Identify, assess, and document business needs and requirements. Must be able to quickly establish credibility while working in new subject areas.
Drive toward on-time, quality deliverables in a complex and dynamic business environment, while actively managing stakeholder expectations.
Articulate requirements to technical and business groups in a variety of ways, including via Functional & Technical specifications documentation, BRDs, logical diagrams, use cases, and data samples
Analyze client processes and conduct requirements reviews to improve the quality of deliverables
Develop specs for application rules that will auto-trigger specific reports based on business needs
Analyze process data quickly and ability to determine sources for the data flowing into various custom reports to be developed within application

The Operations Business Analyst is responsible for business intelligence and requirement gathering for the Data Center teams to effectively deploy software solutions. This position will support teams including: Facilities, Site Services, BreakFix, and Logistics.
You are well versed in Data Center operations and have an aptitude for seeing the ‘big picture’ while being able to granualize the data points. Dynamic, smart people and inspiring, innovative technologies are the norm here. Will you join us in crafting solutions that do not yet exist?
Description
You are part of the Infrastructure Software Development organization supporting the Operations teams. Translating non-technical requirements into technical requirements and vice-versa is essential for this positions success. You will identify ‘gaps’ in the current tools sets and craft a clear path for success in various disciplines.
The ability to work well with Sponsors, Stakeholders, PMs, and SMEs is imperative for this position to succeed. Knowing how to drive projects with teams in different timezones around the world is key. You will be the ‘face’ of the development team in many cases.

Interviews to identify operational gaps
Setting up user meeting to verify and capture requirements
Aligning projects and priorities to the overall strategy

Deploying and running UAT cycles for new software
Generating proof-of-concepts with tools like Tableau and excel

Degree in Business Analytics or similar. Technical background in engineering, software design, database structure a plus.

Business Analysts understand the business and user goals of a project and provide clear requirements for the development and testing team. Working with key stakeholders, Business Analysts clarify and communicate business needs, contribute to the definition and design of solutions, and ensure the alignment of business solutions and business needs. Business Analysts perform activities including business process analysis, needs assessments, requirements gathering and solution definition throughout the systems development lifecycle. Business Analysts helps develop processes and methodologies to manage requirements for all stakeholders. As a Business Analyst, you have experience gathering and documenting product requirements. You have worked in a variety of systems environments and have at least a general understanding of the technology considerations. You are comfortable leading workshops, working meetings and presentations. You communicate in an empathetic, positive and friendly manner with a focus on clarifying business needs and customer service. Working with contractors, vendors and multiple processes and methodologies to manage requirements for all stakeholders.For this role, we are seeking someone with significant experience working with tech, project and account management (delivery) and Clients to partner on the technical aspects of projects and client work, from concept to preparing the team for successful implementation. As the focus will be on a large scale, globalized consumer facing desktop and mobile platform, your knowledge around world-facing platforms is critical to success. Experience designing and building web-based applications is a must.

Mission
BUSINESS ANALYST

Who We Are
Founded and continuously led by inventor and entrepreneur Tony Aquila, Solera is a global leader in digital technologies that connect and secure life's most important assets: our cars, homes and identities. Since its inception in 2005 as a garage-based startup, Solera has grown aggressively with over 50 acquisitions across its platforms. The company's current product solutions include Audatex, Autodata, AutoPoint, CAP/HPI, Colimbra, Digidentity, Enservio, Explore Data, Hollander, Identifix, Inpart, LYNX and TitleTec, as well as the company's flagship Digital Garage application. Today, Solera processes over 300 million transactions annually for approximately 235,000 partners and customers in over 80 countries. Unified by a strong culture that values uncommon entrepreneurial thinking and continuous "do-it-different" innovation, Solera's global workforce of 6,700+ associates come from diverse forward-thinking industries that include automotive technology, artificial intelligence, software development, data sciences, cybersecurity, cognitive design, and digital identity protection. For more information, please visit solera.com.

Audatex Canada ULC, is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Solera Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: SLH). The Audatex brand is active today across six continents, providing world-class claims solutions that help customers automate their processes; managing millions of claims each year efficiently and effectively, and resolving billions of dollars in claims settlements.

The Solera Way
Solera’s uncommon culture is based on three simple principles: Think 80/20 (Focus), Act 30/30 (Efficiency), and Live 90/10 (Accountability). We define our mindset using Our 3H’s: Humility, a Hunger to succeed, and a desire to Hunt for opportunities to win. We train our volunteers to engage with each other modulating between their intellect (IQ) and emotional intelligence (EQ) using our 3Fs: Facts, Finesse, and Force. Solera has become a global technology leader that is constantly growing in the double digits. The principles, drills, and values associated with the Solera Way have been fundamental to Solera’s success and our ability to grow, continuously change, and innovate.

Are You Uncommon?
We’re on the hunt for an experienced Business Analyst who ranks in the top quartile among their peers. Someone who has a highly competitive and entrepreneurial mindset that is wired with a team-first attitude, has no problem rolling up their sleeves to execute their missions, and can modulate between leading and following as needed. You will serve as the Business Analyst.
Position 80s
What You’ll Be Doing
At Solera, we believe in providing clarity and focus to what our volunteers are responsible for – their mission. The 80’s, as we call them at Solera, are the employee’s priorities associated with their role or mission. The mission 80’s for this role, are:
Consult with clients, Professional Services team and business partners to analyze and identify business needs, document requirements & workflows to optimize the implementation of Audatex solutions
Review use cases and other technical documents with clients and Audatex stakeholders to ensure business requirements are adequately reflected in technical requirements documents.
Design organizational structures and customize solutions for next generation solutions by analyzing requirements, constructing workflow charts and diagrams, studying system capabilities and writing specifications
Additional responsibilities of the role include:
Implement solution approved by the client in the test environment and, working with the Professional Services and Sales teams, secure client sign-off to promote solution to production.
Deploy solution to production and, working with working with the Professional Services and Sales teams, secures client final sign-off
Create EAI Statements of Work and assist in their implementation
Prepare and deliver custom reports and reporting solutions to our clients
Perform additional duties as required
Assist Business Operations, Professional Services and Technical Support teams in the support of deployed solutions
Track and analyze business/client trends and make appropriate recommendations that will positively impact the business
Perform additional duties as required
It is impossible to list every requirement for, or responsibility of, any position. Similarly, we cannot identify all the skills a position may require since job responsibilities and the Company’s needs may change over time. Therefore, the above job description is not comprehensive or exhaustive. The Company reserves the right to adjust, add to or eliminate any aspect of the above description. The Company also retains the right to require all employees to undertake additional or different job responsibilities when necessary to meet business needs.
Qualifications
Are You Qualified?
Experienced preparing documentation on gap analysis, cross-functional processes, workflows, functional requirements and organization structures
Strong quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills
Proficient at manipulating large datasets, relational database tools and technologies (e.g.; SQL, Oracle), MS Visio and the MS office suite of products
Proven ability to work in a team environment to support multiple projects and manage client expectations
Bilingual in French and English is preferred but not required

Our Space
We believe that offices should be destinations where people want to be… places where people want to work, play and, collaborate. That is why we spend a lot of time on enhancing our workspaces. Solera’s work environments are intersections of the old and the new… of the past, present, and future. They are spaces designed to stimulate creative thinking, innovation, and cross-functional collaboration.

We also embrace wellness. Whether it is our onsite or offsite workout centers, nutritional meals and beverages, or endless snacks for focus and energy. This wellness plan is our commitment to healthy living, which spans across our office environments.

Montefiore Information Technology (MIT) is looking for a Business Analyst with a focus on the Finance areas of Planning and Budgeting, Financial Consolidation and Close, Account Reconciliation and Enterprise Performance Reporting. This candidate will play a key role in the implementation and support of a new ERP suite including the Finance, Supply Chain, HR and Asset Management functions on a single ERP system across all business partners. This strategic position will be part of a strong team that will play a pivotal role in the health system’s ERP technology transformation program and evolve to a shared services model across Montefiore Medicine.

The ideal candidate must possess strong business analytical skills and will work with the business process owners to evaluate requirements, recommend process improvements and configure the ERP solution. This Business Analyst role has responsibilities within each phase of the ERP Transformation project life cycle including user meetings, requirements gathering, development, testing, implementation, and go-live.

The Business Analyst provides outstanding client service and contributes to the organization’s mission of utilizing information technology to improve patient care.

Role and Responsibilities
Influence and support the overall roadmap for the ERP Product portfolio of Montefiore Medicine with a focus on Financial Enterprise Performance Management business processes.
Stay current with trends and developments in ERP / EPM technologies and formulate strategic courses of action.
Be a catalyst for innovation and growth within business operations.
Work effectively within and across ERP/Finance/HR business operations and IT teams to execute projects and roadmap items.
Act as a trusted advisor to Montefiore Medicine business process owners and business operations to ensure alignment with business drivers, and then integrate these requirements into the strategy as it is developed.
Prioritize related initiatives and coordinate the evaluation, deployment and implementation of current and future ERP functionality.
Use stakeholder feedback to recommend improvements and adjustments to ERP functionality.
Provide guidance during the detailed design, build, test and deploy phases.
Monitor application performance, service delivery performance metrics, change management, ticketing and resolution of incidents, resolution of identified problems.
Lead business analysis efforts for new Finance and EPM functionality.

Qualifications and Education Requirements
Proficient in understanding the application design, configuration / module setup and the creation of functional documents.
Expertise with cloud based ERP modules - Planning and Budgeting, Financial Consolidation and Close, Account Reconciliation and Enterprise Performance Reporting.
Understanding of Workflow Management Systems.
Experience upgrading ERP applications with an understanding of the functional changes between versions.
Knowledge and experience with open interfaces and application programming interfaces (APIs).
Understanding of flex fields, workflow, setup and profile options.
Understanding of shared services / multi-organization functionality.
Working knowledge of SQL query tools.
Bachelor’s degree in Finance/Economics/Accounting, Business Process Management or related discipline, or equivalent experience. MBA or other relevant graduate degree is a plus.
Ability to troubleshoot issues and assist with support.
Excellent written and verbal communication/presentation skills.
Self-motivated with the ability to work consistently and efficiently to achieve overall team as well as personal goals.
Excellent ability to multi-task and manage simultaneous projects and initiatives.
Strong planning, organization, critical thinking, decision-making skills and problem-solving aptitude.
High degree of confidentiality, maturity, tactfulness and business ethics.
Experience with large-scale ERP implementations in a heavily regulated, compliance-driven enterprise environment and a strong track record of delivering complex projects across multiple departments.
Experience in an academic medical center is highly desirable.

The Business Analyst will be responsible for assisting in the continued support and implementation associated with the functionality, operation and maintenance of the MSRB’s web-based MARIS (Massachusetts Retirement Information System) pension application and work directly with MSRB and vendor staff.

Getting together with real people in real life makes powerful things happen. Side hustles become careers, ideas become movements, and chance encounters become lifelong connections. Meetup brings people together to create thriving communities. Show up. Change lives.

Thousands of businesses currently organize Meetups and ask how they can use Meetup to connect further with their fans and followers in real life. Meetup Pro answers these questions by making it easy for organizations to connect with communities in real life. We have signed up hundreds of customers (including Google, Salesforce, Wordpress, and MongoDB), and are adding more every day.

The Pro team is looking for a Business Analyst to join the Business Operations and Strategy team, a small, high-impacting team with the core focus of improving the financial and operational decision-making for Meetup Pro, proactively identifying and executing business and operations efficiencies, and developing sustainable business infrastructure as we more than double in scale.

As Business Analyst, you will help the team achieve success by:


Proactively identify opportunities for growth, improved user experience, and operating efficiency through data analytics
Develop and maintain sales forecasting models, including key performance indicators, to anticipate results and help the Sales team track team productivity
Manage data integrity in CRM and proprietary systems with Data Science team
Own reporting activities including stakeholder dashboards and ongoing monthly reporting routines
Execute surveys and customer interviews to monitor satisfaction, and explore growth opportunities
Assist in the analysis to support immediate and long-term business decisions related to monetization and go to market strategies for future product line extensions
Assist in product analytics including, but not limited to, usage data and development impact forecasting
Support all ad hoc requests from both internal and external partners
Collaborate cross-functionally across multiple stakeholders on Finance, Marketing, Sales, Client Success, and Leadership teams

You might be a good fit if you have:

BA/BS degree in a quantitative or business-oriented field, or equivalent practical experience
4-5 years working in analytical roles in growth/marketing, strategy, operations or business intelligence
Sales operations and forecasting experience
Proven ability to use data to optimize performance and inform future strategies
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and drive initiatives in a cross-functional environment
Ability to influence and motivate team members at all levels
Experience working in a fast-paced, high-growth environment
An entrepreneurial mindset and a make-it-work attitude
Experience with G-Suite, Microsoft Suite, Salesforce / CRM, and SQL required (test included as part of the interview)

Our team is bold, supportive, and passionate about bringing people together in real life to create community for everyone. We care about moving fast, real-world change, and building diverse, dynamic teams. You in?

The CRM Business Analyst will support the government Product Owner in collaboration with business stakeholders to develop product solution business requirements for Agile Scrum development teams. As such, they must develop an in-depth understanding of the customer’s business processes, user profiles, solution objectives, expectations, and priorities and be able to articulate and effectively communicate those topics to the development teams in the form of both use cases and user stories. The successful candidate will have experience in eliciting requirements, translating requirements to user stories, elaborating processes into use cases and assist in mapping business functionality to system technical requirements as well as writing a variety of associated design and requirements documentation. Excellent written and verbal communication and collaboration skills are essential to this role.

Key Responsibilities
Collaborate with client stakeholders to understand business needs and processes and elicit clear, concise user requirements supporting the business case
Define “as-is” and “to-be” business processes; conduct and document gap analyses
Requirements management and analysis using specified IBM Rational tools
Translate user requirements, into simplified, well-organized user stories accompanied by clearly defined acceptance criteria
Collaborate with an Agile team to facilitate development and testing in support of user requirements
Use business requirements to drive the design or review of test cases, process change requests, and help manage project scope, product acceptance, installation and production deployment

Required Qualifications
5 years of relevant experience
Bachelor's Degree (Degree in Engineering, or a related scientific or technical discipline is required)
8 years of additional relevant experience may be substituted for education
Experience working with customers, users and project leads in analyzing, designing, implementing and supporting IT business applications and systems
Knowledge in testing functionality, matching to requirements, and in having primary responsibility for individual projects and systems

Candidates who do not meet the required qualifications will not be considered.

Additional Minimum Qualifications
Demonstrated success in eliciting business requirements and process flows
Demonstrated experience managing requirements documentation in a tool such as IBM Rational Tool Suite
Experience working in an Agile scrum solution development and testing environment
1+ years of experience analyzing requirements for custom MS Dynamics CRM 2015/2016 applications
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Must be able to pass a background check to obtain a VA Public Trust (High-Risk) clearance

Preferred Qualifications
Experience working in the Federal Government, Veteran’s Administration (VA) experience a plus
Experience performing business analysis and requirements elicitation/elaboration at Department of Veterans Affairs
2+ years experience with either VA Veteran-focused Integration Project (VIP) or CRM or VBMS
Experience working in a geographically dispersed project team environment
Active VA Public Trust (High-Risk) clearance

3-6 Month Contract with a Potential Permanent Opportunity

Edge Consulting LLC is a boutique consulting firm that specializes in helping private clients with their growth strategies.

We are looking for an expert in Last Mile Logistics. You will have significant experience in the industry with 10+ Years of direct experience and have detailed insight into customer needs Logistics. Specific knowledge of Heavy package deliveries would be ideal, especially as it relates to the major retail sector. You will have excellent understanding and insight into the current major operators, including UPS and FedEx as well as detailed knowledge of regional providers and their service attributes.

You will join a team of highly skilled consultants engaged with a large US logistics company. We are focused on a new line of business that will transform last mile logistics for retail and business customers.

You will be directly engaged with the client, developing a detailed execution plan which will include establishing a sophisticated understanding of local market competitive landscape and current asset capability which will inform the commercialization and new product service process.

Ideal candidates should be technically relevant and will have strong communication, written / presentation, analytical and statistical skills.

Some of the activities you would be focused on include;


Developing a primary research strategy and execution plan for a new Last Mile service
Leading a team of Analysts and Researchers focused on building comprehensive product intelligence.
Analyze product delivery and supply chain processes
Perform Primary market research directly talking to local businesses
Create experience Storyboards based on real market tests
Analyze route activity including invoicing, electronic bills, and shipment tracing
Collect data on consumers, competitors and market place and consolidate information into actionable items, reports and presentations
Understand business objectives and design surveys to discover prospective customers preferences
Compile and analyze statistical data using modern and traditional methods to collect it
Perform valid and reliable market research SWOT analysis
Interpret data, formulate reports and make recommendations
Use online market research and catalogue findings to databases
Provide competitive analysis on various companies market offerings, identify market trends, pricing/business models, sales and methods of operation
Evaluate program methodology and key data to ensure that data on the releases are accurate and the angle of the release is correct
Remain fully informed on market trends, other parties researches and implement best practices

Bonus Experience:
Prior direct experience / knowledge in procurement or managing last mile logistics for any of the following:

Overstock, Wayfair, Costco, Amazon, Ashley, Target, Walmart, Ups, FedEx

Requirements:
Education: Bachelor's degree in business, logistics, management information systems or a related field. Masters Degree Preferred.

Location: Dallas, TX, St Louis, MO or Remote / Work From Home (Some Travel)

$18 an hourTemporary, InternshipOverview

We are committed to provide our Employees a stable work environment with equal opportunity for learning and personal growth. Creativity and innovation are encouraged for improving the effectiveness of Southwest Airlines. Above all, Employees will be provided the same concern, respect, and caring attitude within the organization that they are expected to share externally with every Southwest Customer.
Responsibilities
The Technology Department at Southwest Airlines reports to SWA’s Chief Information Officer (CIO). They work hand in hand to manage the Company delivery plan, execute projects and programs, develop and integrate new products and technologies, and develop methodologies while ensuring the appropriate architecture, quality standards, service management procedures, and security measures are in place.

Technology plays a key role in guiding the strategic future of Southwest Airlines through initiatives that touch every aspect of our business and operation. It empowers and equips Southwest’s Employees with the solutions they need to be successful while providing Southwest’s Customers with the tools they need to have a positive travel experience. Technology Teams have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful work that delivers value to the airline through innovation, modernization, problem solving, strategic planning and more.

The Intern will work full-time as a Business Analyst within Technology utilizing their education and experience to solve problems and while working closely with stakeholders and other team members to provide solutions.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Work with business customers to conduct needs analysis relative to systems and business processes in order to create quality technical solutions.

Ensure solutions are aligned with business strategies and comply with departmental standards.

Manage timeframes for designing, coding, testing, and implementing to ensure solutions are delivered ontime and within budget.

Serve as a resource to ensure effective communications between business and Technology Teams.

Participate in systems and acceptance testing.

Scope of work varies depending on the Team assignment.
Qualifications
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

High School Diploma, GED or equivalent education required.

Must be at least 18 years of age.

Must have authorization to work in the United States as defined by the Immigration Reform Act of 1986.

EDUCATION:

Progress toward undergraduate or graduate degree in MIS, Business, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems or Information Technology, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering or Business related degree required.

Minimum level accepted: Junior

Must be currently enrolled as a full-time student (minimum 12 credit hours).

Maintained 3.0 or above cumulative GPA.

Coursework in computer science fundamentals, programming languages, and related technical studies is preferred.

Skills/Abilities/Knowledge/Work Style:

Experience with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) required.

Basic knowledge of business analysis, process modeling and redesign is preferred.

Basic knowledge of technical environment required.

Exposure to Agile methodologies preferred.

Fundamental understanding of project management techniques with familiarity or experience with Microsoft Project preferred.

Problem solving ability and strong written/verbal communications skills required.

Ability to stay organized and manage multiple and concurrent assignments under tight deadlines.

Previous analyst internship experience within the past 12 months preferred.

Experience solving business problems in a capstone or case competition preferred.

Works well in a culture that is open, direct, respectful, courteous and compassionate.

Quick learner, self-motivated, team oriented, with a sense of humor.

PLEASE BE PREPARED TO PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION (IF REQUESTED):

Resume.

Unofficial transcript.

“Why Southwest Airlines” essay (Length determined by author).

Letters of Recommendation.

Full-time/40 hours per week

PAY:

$18.00 per hour + flight privileges

This internship position is located in Dallas, TX at Southwest Airlines Headquarters.

ContractJob Summary
The Business Analyst is responsible for documenting process and technology changes in an organization and advising and guiding clients during identification, prioritization, analysis, and resolution of challenges adversely impacting operating performance, with emphasis on the financial close process and financial & management reporting. In this role, the Business Analyst adds value by applying their understanding of the client’s business, financial analysis, process improvement, and information technology. Success is achieved by helping clients create innovative solutions that maximize operating performance, including the deployment and configuration of Business Process Management (BPM) solutions. The Business Analyst continuously enhances interactions between end users, sponsors, and internal team members by actively facilitating communication, assisting with project management, including PMO reporting and status activities.
Job Responsibilities
PMO Projects / Identification & prioritization of client initiatives: The Business Analyst will proactively work with clients to identify significant operating challenges affecting the performance of a client’s business. During engagements, the Senior Associate Business Analyst will:
Earn the trust needed to be invited to client planning meeting, facilitation sessions, management meetings, etc. where new projects to improve operating performance are identified and discussed.
Introduce the project methodology to help clients adopt a disciplined approach to organizing, quantifying, and evaluating the merits of potential improvement projects.
Actively work with clients to accelerate the progress of high value project by eliminating low-value projects.
Process Assessments: – the Business Analyst will use the project methodology to help clients develop a structured approach to creating solutions with sustainable benefits. The Senior Consultant Business Analyst will apply the following techniques:
Client interviews
Requirements gathering
Process flow diagramming, particularly focusing on the financial close process
Gap analysis & ROI
Deliverable documentation
Change management
BPM Deployment Projects: – the Business Analyst will facilitate and coordinate the necessary resources from client operations to conceptualize, design, develop and implement BPM solutions needed to solve the business challenge adversely affecting a client’s business. The Business Analyst will be also responsible for constantly improving existing methodologies and/or developing new approaches to help clients be successful. The Senior Associate Business Analyst will provide:
Client teams with status updates about client projects by entering them into the project methodology dashboard.
Clients with system selection guidance during the evaluation and acquisition of commercially available Business Process Management software. This will include development of requests for information (RFI), request for proposals (RFP), vendor selection, and contract negotiations.
Clients project management resources needed to facilitate the design, development, and/or implementation of BPM solutions.
Develop training materials and educate/train and supervise client personnel and/or Associates in the proper use of methodologies developed or deployed solutions.
Follow or develop standardize data collection, analysis, and documentation procedures to support current and future knowledge management capabilities.
Research new technologies and techniques being used in finance operations and across industries that could be adapted to help solve client challenges.
Overall guidance and supervision to associate resources or other client personnel who may be acting in a support role.
Clients access to subject matter experts within the team during the project assessment and conceptualization of possible solutions.
Required Competencies and Characteristics
One to five years of experience
Excellent written and oral interpersonal skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet deadlines
Keen attention to detail
Proven analytical, evaluative and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
Extensive experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree
Project management certificate a plus, PMP ideal.
Strong business acumen and experience with 2-7 years business experience.
Consulting background a plus
Experience in Consulting or Business Analyst on medium to large scale systems implementations, process re engineering, or other project-oriented work
Experience in managing and improving performance of operational and financial processes in a back-office environment
ERP or related BPM deployment experience preferred.

$26.00 - $30.75 an hourPosition

The University of Southern California's Thornton School of Music is seeking a Budget/Business Analyst to join its Business Office team. This position will report directly to the Senior Business Officer and will play a vital role in facilitating business, financial, and budgeting functions within the Thornton School.

Combining the benefits of a world-class conservatory and a leading research university, the USC Thornton School of Music offers students the opportunity to pursue a rigorous music education in a real-world context. We offer a full range of musical disciplines across a demanding and innovative curriculum, and the opportunity to work with a faculty of national and international renown. For more information, please visit us at http://music.usc.edu/.

Hiring range: $26.00 - $30.75 per hour.

Duties

Principal duties will include:
Resource for staff and faculty in the use of university financial systems, including Kuali, eMarket, and Cognos, as well as compliance with financial policies and procedures.
Assist faculty and staff in processing financial transactions including purchase of equipment and supplies, processing reimbursements, and onboarding of new vendors.
Administer assigned budgets and maintain financial records. Support monthly account reconciliation activities and internal controls. Process journal vouchers, new accounts, and procurement card reallocations.
Facilitate staff training on financial transaction processing. Responsible for keeping informed of changes in financial systems, procedures, and business processes and communication of this information to those Thornton staff with fiscal responsibilities. Will also provide training and support for transition to upcoming rollout of Workday Financial System.
Troubleshoot problems, including necessary research and interaction with appropriate University offices to achieve resolution.
Assist in planning of short and long-term budgets by compiling and organizing data for use in forecasts.
Analyze financial activity and provide ad hoc financial reports as needed.
Provide support to payroll and salary administration functions, as needed and assigned.
May be assigned other duties or short-term projects, as needed and assigned.
Qualifications

Preferred Experience: Previous experience with USC financial systems, including Kuali, eMarket, Cognos, and Workday, as well as knowledge of USC financial policies and procedures, strongly preferred. Appreciation for the mission and operational needs of a highly-regarded, conservatory-based music school is preferred.

Résumé
Do not send other supporting materials unless requested.

Minimum Field of Expertise: Business administration, accounting or related degree and budget experience including knowledge of government and fund accounting. Strong computer skills with use of automated spreadsheets.

JOB TITLE: Business Analyst
DEPARTMENT: Solutions and Innovation
REPORTS TO: EVP of Solutions and Innovation

PRIMARY OBJECTIVE:
The Business Analyst (BA) is a key member of the Product team that works with subject matter experts and stakeholders to innovate ideas and identify essential product features and functionality for development. By collaborating with subject matter experts, examining requirements from a variety of perspectives, and documenting information clearly, the BA is a leader in ensuring solutions are brought to life expediently, accurately, and efficiently. BA’s are key in managing scope and maintaining alignment between stakeholders, as well as staying organized. Through the creation of requirements documents, traceability matrices, statements of work, and internal specification documents, the BA ensures all understand what they need to understand to achieve the vision.

The Business Analyst works with clients, Operations, Technology, Product, and Project Management to ensure the highest level of accuracy and planning in meeting goals. This role reports to the Executive Vice President, Solutions and Innovation.

Essential Functions

BUSINESS OBJECTIVES
Ensure stakeholders have appropriate clarity to be successful.Facilitate effective use of resources.Develop technical solutions.Improve product performance and value.Increase operational efficiency and collaboration.Enable Cloudbreak to win new business and retain existing business.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Requirements Gathering
o Use multiple channels to draw forth needs, vision and stimulate discussion.
o Conduct interviews, hold focus groups, participate in discovery meetings, analyze and discuss use cases.
o Document needs
o Produce customary project artifacts such as business requirement documents, summaries, traceability matrices, flow charts, and diagrams.
Planning
o Discuss scope of projects with stakeholders.
o Ensure sign off.
o Assist in resource allocation.
o Map out timelines with project managers.
o Help manage expectations.
Project Management
o Monitor adherence to requirements.
o Identify scope creep.
o Elevate changes for discussion and resolution.
o Document change orders.
Testing
o Work with business experts to define acceptance criteria.
o Outline and assist in management of User Acceptance Testing process.
o Document exceptions.
o Facilitate resolution of exceptions with project manager.

Education and Qualifications

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree required.3 years Business Analyst experience required.Project Management experience preferredTelemedicine experience preferred.Proficiency with MS Office and Visio.Online Product Development applications experienceDetailed analytical abilities.Advanced technical writing experience.

SUCCESS CRITERIA
Highly organized and complex problem-solving strategist.Strong communications and writing skillsSystems engineering concepts experienceBusiness Case development experienceCuriosity and interest in both technology and healthcare.Autonomous, self-directedAbility to multi-task and follow through on projects.

Overview
National Interstate is a member of Great American Insurance Group. As one of the leading commercial transportation insurers in the nation, we offer risk financing solutions in all 50 states tailored to meet the needs of a wide variety of transportation classes. Our offerings include traditional insurance and innovative alternative risk transfer (ART) programs, including more than a dozen group captive programs catering to niche wheels markets. We are proud to be a multiple Northcoast 99 winner and Cleveland Plain Dealer Top Workplace in Northeast Ohio. It is because of our talented and dedicated team that we are able to live out our company values of integrity, transparency, fairness, accountability, empowerment and collaboration with each transaction we make. If you are ready to join an engaging and driven team such as ours, we would love to hear from you!

Analyzes, identifies and writes detailed description of user requirements, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer programs.

Good knowledge of business information data sources and business data rules.

designing, coding, testing and/or maintaining application software in a business setting.

job_description:
As a Junior Business Analyst on the Business Intelligence team, you will have a unique opportunity to work closely with and impact every team at Getaround, including Marketing, Sales, Operations, Product, Finance, and our Leadership team. It is our goal to ensure that everyone in the business has access to accurate information and enable data-informed decision making.

Our ideal candidate has a strong analytical, technical, and business background with a motivation to influence the future of mobility.
What you’ll be doing:
Working closely with business owners to understand and identify key business questions, challenges, and KPIs to increase cars and renters on the Getaround platform and guide outstanding decision making
Empowering teams at Getaround to track business success on a weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis through the building and maintaining of dashboards and other tools
Interpreting large data sets, preparing recommendations, and presenting to senior members of the team to influence the strategic direction of the company
Troubleshooting data issues, validating result sets, and recommending/implementing process improvements
Requirements:
Academic background in finance, economics, math, computer science, or related quantitative field
2-4 years experience in an analytics role in a fast-paced environment like tech, consulting, investment banking, etc.
Expertise manipulating large data sets and building models in Excel/Google Sheets
Expertise with LookML or other SQL languages
Experience with a Business Intelligence tool like Looker, Tableau, GoodData, Pentaho, etc.
Results driven“get it done” personality; able to balance multiple projects as second nature
Strong verbal and written communication skills; able to produce high quality and concise deliverables
Experience managing project ambiguity, complexity, and interdependencies in a methodical and structured way
Nice to haves:
Expertise with Google App Script or another programming language like Javascript, Python, or R
Exposure to operations research methodologies
Experience designing and building custom software tools.

Funko Overview

Welcome to the Funko-verse, a world built on pure imagination, a land governed by the philosophy that stories matter, a universe comprised of characters from countless fandoms, a galaxy of once upon a times and happily ever afters.

But what does Funko do?

Funko is a purveyor of pop culture, making and selling license-focused collectibles. We’re based in Everett, WA where we have a store that delights kids of all ages (kids at heart included). We currently hold hundreds of licenses for franchises ranging from Marvel to Harry Potter, giving us the rights to create tens of thousands of characters—one of the largest portfolios in the pop culture and collectibles industry. We take your favorite characters and turn them into adorable, or sometimes scary, collectible figures. Our most famous line, Pop! Vinyl, has millions of fans around the world.

The team is growing, we are adding several new roles which will be embedded into the functional organizations they support to identify business intelligence, reporting, and data analysis needs. You will work closely with clients and IT teams to turn data into actionable intelligence to aid and inform business decisions. You will provide data and reporting that is accurate, relevant and reliable, and ensure the information is easily available to users for direct consumption or integration with other systems.

Ideal candidates are effective business partners, get excited to build reports (prefer Power BI) and provide visualizations/insights with deep working knowledge in at least one of the following functional areas: Finance, Sales or Operations.

At this time, we cannot provide visa support for these roles.
Your Superpowers in Action
Engage directly with internal and external clients to determine and document KPIs and Business Intelligence requirements
Partner with cross-functional teams to build user stories, prioritize competing objectives in a methodical fashion working with all stakeholders
Translate business needs into functional and technical requirements, document using JIRA or similar collaboration tools
Design reports and models using Excel or Visualization tools and through an agile, iterative process
Develop needed training content, educate and train users to drive usage of reports
Identify and drive conversations about process improvement opportunities
Be a champion for clean data and identify opportunities for improving data quality
Must-Have Superhero Gadgetry
2 + years hands on experience with mastery using PowerBI, or other visualization tools.
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or equivalent
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; strong work ethics and organizational skills
Advanced user of Excel including Pivot Tables, Power Queries, Solver and other modeling techniques
Ability to work with large, varied datasets and draw meaningful conclusions through analysis; ability to clearly articulate analytic methods and conclusions
Experience with an ERP/CRM system, Dynamics NAV/Dynamics 365 preferred
Experience working in a CPG retail industry
Ability to query databases
Preferred some experience using any Statistical tool such R, Python, SAS etc. to perform basic data exploration, correlation, regression etc

Job Description:
Income Research + Management seeks a team-oriented individual with experience in Business Analysis and with, the project delivery lifecycle. This is a key position which is highly interactive across the technology team and with the Business.

The successful candidate will have worked within an IT organization within the Financial industry, performing business analysis on multiple projects using both waterfall and nimbler methodologies. A percentage of time will be allocated to triaging enhancements to production systems, identifying opportunities for leaning and optimizing delivery, and working with the business to improve processes.

This highly visible role will report directly to the Head of Business Integration.

Business Analysis, including business process improvements, application and data requirements, for all phases of the development lifecycle.

Documentation of required project artifacts, as well as current production systems in collaboration with the development and support teams
Education and training of peers and users on impacts of design decisions
Define and perform QA testing, coordinate UAT testing, and optimize and lean of current processes

Experience in Fixed Income
Experience with trading platforms such as Charles River or Latent Zero (Fidessa) is a plus

Exceptional communication skills – verbal and written; teamwork and high adaptability; ability to render visual communications
Must be a self-starter, self motivated, with solid soft skills, able to work independently and understand when to ask for help
Technical writing, project management, data analysis is a plus
Solid analytical capabilities, strong problem solving, and documentation skills

Bachelor’s degree or work equivalent

The Business Analyst is a key position in ZypMedia that helps drive revenue and strategy for the company. A multi-faceted role, the ideal candidate will embrace working in a fast paced environment and thrive at thinking analytically about ways to solve problems as ZypMedia scales up. The analyst will interface with sales, engineering and product teams to improve the existing product. The role is highly visible throughout the organization and will give ideal candidates a great platform to grow and be heard amongst leaders in the organization. ZypMedia, a leader in local digital advertising solutions for small and midsize businesses, is seeking an Business Analyst to join its team. ZypMedia has built a leading programmatic advertising platform that connects small and midsize businesses with digital advertising opportunities across more than 50,000 desktop, mobile and connected TVs websites and apps. ZypMedia's proprietary technology and dedicated service organization were built from the ground up to handle the unique requirements of local digital adverting campaigns. ZypMedia partners with TV station groups to offer the ZypMedia product as part of a comprehensive digital advertising solution to their advertising clients.

Drive and gather business requirements, assessments, solutions especially in the areas of data analysis, data extraction/delivery, source/target mappings and reporting.
Create Excel & Tableau dashboards & analyses that provide visibility into KPIs, marketing and product effectiveness, and business trends/drivers
Work closely with Business Operations, Product, Marketing & Sales, Finance and Engineering teams to solve problems, identify trends, and define key metrics.
Able to quickly understand the business process and needs, and translate them into business requirements
Detail oriented and be able to think of all the scenarios for functional and non-functional requirements
Skills:
1-3 years of analytical experience in an analytics-based consulting role, exploring large data sets in order to answer strategic questions for customers (either as an internal analyst or external consultant)
BS/ BA in an analytical field (science, math, engineering, finance, etc.)
Strong analytical skills and ability to make fast decisions with limited and noisy data
Strong knowledge of the overall ad tech landscape (RTB and DSP experience preferred)
High level of proficiency with MS Excel (pivot tables, complex functions; VBA preferred)
Familiarity with SQL

This position will require extensive use of our student information systems, web-based survey collection and reporting systems, and learning management systems, in addition to reporting and analytics tools. The Regional Operations Analyst (ROA) will use these systems to develop and execute business and evaluation reports to help field staff and management manage their operations, identify issues and analyze business trends. Regularly evaluate data quality and enforce data quality standards; identify and resolve data quality issues (integrity, timeliness, accuracy and completion).

Provide coaching and training (written and verbal) in formal and informal settings to supervisors and field staff regarding the collection, management, reporting and application of business and program data.
Establish and maintain relationships with external and internal district partners in order to develop strong data sharing partnerships; support partner contractual agreements including reporting and auditing processes.
Maintain awareness and compliance with program requirements in addition to communicate changes to data collection, calculation and reporting to stakeholders as required.

Ability to work cooperatively and collaboratively with staff to accomplish work in a timely fashion

job_description:
Conduent is the world's largest provider of diversified business process services with leading capabilities in transaction processing, automation, analytics and constituent experience. We work with both government and commercial customers in assisting them to deliver quality services to the people they serve.

We manage interactions with patients and the insured for a significant portion of the U.S. healthcare industry. We are the customer interface for large segments of the technology industry and the operational and processing partner of choice for public transportation systems around the world.

Whether it's digital payments, claims processing, benefit administration, automated tolling, customer care or distributed learning - Conduent manages and modernizes these interactions to create value for both our clients and their constituents. Learn more at www.conduent.com.

Responsible for managing and controlling the activities that provide operational support for a business segment or group. Advises business groups by providing strategic direction to initiative prioritization, integration and resource application. Leads process improvement initiatives through use of measurements, accountability, analysis and consideration of process alternatives in order to arrive at best practices.

General:
Uses best practices and knowledge of internal or external business issues to improve products or servicesActs as a resource for colleagues with less experienceRequires in-depth knowledge and experienceDecisions guided by policies, procedures and business planGenerally domestic scope/accountability

Develop and document policies and procedures, and project requirements.
Develop productive relationships with client, and with co-workers, both on-site and remote.
Identify problems in operation, analyze and make recommendations.
Identify opportunities to improve procedures and processes.
