Position/Job Summary
The Project Manager / Business Analyst position is responsible for the direction, coordination, implementation, risk management and completion of multiple projects simultaneously and the overall management of the Information Technology Project portfolio. This will be achieved through collaboration with business and technical staff to gather and translate business requirements into technical definitions which will be used for implementing a solution that aligns with the College’s overall strategic objectives. In addition, this position will perform system, application and data analysis and solution research that where appropriate will result in opportunities to increase efficiencies and enhance the environment across functional boundaries.

Position/Job Responsibilities
1. Lead projects and cross-functional project teams to ensure projects are conceived, designed, planned, tested and executed effectively. This will include tracking, managing and efficiently communicating projects throughout their life cycle while managing risk to ensure that project objectives are met within time, budget, and quality targets.

2. Collaborate with business and technical staff to clarify and document project requirements and objectives, acquire resources, manage third party contractors and control project scope. Assist in the collection and documentation of project objectives, manage stakeholder and project team member expectations and where appropriate identify opportunities that may cross functional and technical boundaries.

3. Analyze, define and document requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, interfaces with other systems, internal and external checks and controls, and reporting. Working with Information Technology staff to ensure that application security meets the business needs and security requirements. Document the business and technical requirements in a consistent manner along with obtaining sign off from business areas. As appropriate, review and suggest business process improvements as part of the project implementation.

4. Work with the Director for Engagement and Client Technologies to implement project management and business analysis best practices, standards, processes and tools within the Information Technology department. Maintain an in-depth knowledge of project management and business analysis methodologies and tools and make recommendations for improvements. Maintain awareness of new and emerging project management and business analysis technologies and their potential application to client projects and requirements.

5. Working with stakeholders, IT management, and Ithaca College legal counsel, review IT related vendor contracts to ensure they accurately reflect project scope and seek optimal value in vendor service to include ROI metrics, performance monitoring, favorable termination criteria, and renewal / annual monetary terms.

6. Develop and demonstrate a multicultural awareness and contribute to cultivating an inclusive, diverse and respectful College community. Demonstrate civil and inclusive behavior when interacting with staff, faculty, students and visitors to the College. Promote a flexible, collaborative and inclusive work and living environment and engage in educational opportunities to increase awareness and understanding of diversity and inclusion.

Position/Job Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a business or Information Technology and a minimum of two years of project management and business analysis experience with projects of various sizes and complexity, or the equivalent combination of education and experience; solid understanding of project management and business analysis skills, tools, techniques, and formal project methodologies; thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements; demonstrated excellent interpersonal and communication skills focusing on consensus building, facilitating collaboration between IT, the business units and the vendors, conflict management and change management, ability to effectively work and interact professionally within a diverse and inclusive environment; ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of managers and subject matter experts and the proven capacity to function independently and as part of a service oriented team are required. PMI-PMP, CCBA, PMI-PBA or other related certification, and experience working in a higher education environment are preferred.

EEO Statement
Ithaca College is committed to building a diverse academic community and encourages members of underrepresented groups to apply. Experience that contributes to the diversity of the college is appreciated.

Instructions for submitting your application:
Interested applicants must apply online at http://ithaca.edu/jobs/ and attach a resume and cover letter. Questions about online application should be directed to the Office of Human Resources at (607) 274-8000. Screening of applications will begin immediately.

Work authorization (select one): Visa sponsorship is not provided for this position

Department description


College Description
At Ithaca College, a comprehensive residential campus community of 6,500 students, we strive to be at the forefront of the higher education landscape. We offer a distinct integrative learning experience that makes students ready for the personal, professional, and global challenges of our age.

We seek candidates who embrace integrative learning and want to be a part of this exciting time in Ithaca College history. We encourage creative collaboration and innovation in our faculty and staff, providing support and resources for them to grow in their fields and lead students to their own innovative ideas and achievements.

We welcome different ways of thinking and look for candidates with unique points of view and life experiences. We are inclusive of individuals with a wide range of cultural, personal, and professional backgrounds, talents, and skills. Our campus is a vibrant and rewarding community where diverse minds can learn, succeed, and excel.

When reviewing candidates, we are looking for indicators of a number of core competencies. Prospective candidates must be adaptable, collaborative, inclusive, respectful, responsive, results driven, and sustainable. They must communicate effectively, demonstrate leadership, exhibit professional integrity and ethics, take initiative, value personal and professional development, and show that they will engage in the college.

Nestled in the heart of New York State’s scenic Finger Lakes region, Ithaca College sits atop South Hill overlooking picturesque Cayuga Lake and is just minutes away from the city center. Combining small town warmth and charm with the vibrancy of a college community, the thriving and culturally diverse city of Ithaca has been rated by Kiplinger’s as one of the top 10 places to live in the United States.

To learn more about Ithaca College, visit us at http://ithaca.edu

Job Description
Customer service is the heart of Amazon. We’ve built a reputation for excellence with recent examples of being named #1 in customer service, and #1 most trusted.

"Our vision is to be earth's most customer-centric company; to build a place where people can come to find and discover anything they might want to buy online."

Amazon is looking for a smart, motivated, and driven Business Analyst to focus on improving the customer experience. You will pull and analyze multiple types of data to discover and solve real world problems. This position requires high judgment, focus on speed and accuracy, and an ability to balance customer and associate experience with financial impact. It also offers broad exposure to various business and technical teams within Amazon.

This position will be located at our customer service center in Huntington West Virginia.

Responsibilities include:
Developing intuitive, insightful reporting on the key drivers of our business
Interacting with internal stakeholders to deep-dive outlier events
Ad-hoc project work supporting the re-invention of how we manage our business
Enabling effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources, compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Identifying process and system improvement opportunities by monitoring existing metrics, analyzing data, and partnering with internal teams

Successful candidates will demonstrate the ability to:
Translate technical concepts into business requirements and present findings and recommendations to stakeholders both in written and verbal format.
Work in a rapidly changing and complex environment.
Learn new technologies, processes and tools in an effort to complete task and responsibilities.
Independently identify and set priorities in an ambiguous environment.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Engineering or any related field from an accredited institution
3+ years’ experience as a Business Analyst or equivalent Amazon experience
Proficient with the following programming languages and statistical software: SQL, Excel, Minitab, R and Python
Experience working with complex data sets in data warehouse environments
A proven record of taking ownership and driving resolution
Highly skilled verbal, written communication, and data presentation
Effective communication with both business and technical teams
Ability to take loosely defined business questions and translate them into clearly defined technical/data specifications
Passion for operational excellence with a commitment to delighting customers
Preferred Qualifications
Masters degree in Statistics, Engineering, or Economics
Advance experience with Tableau, Micro strategy, or equivalent data visualization solutions
Experience applying advanced statistical methodologies
Experience with Lean Six Sigma methodologies

The Yukon-Kuskokwim Health Corporation (YKHC) is located in the Southwestern Alaska town of Bethel, with a total of approximately 6,000 people. YKHC supports 1500 employees, providing the health services to a primarily Yup'ik Eskimo Native population for an area the size of Oregon. Services are provided through a Bethel located hospital and 50 clinics throughout the YK Delta.
Position Summary:
The Business Analyst - Junior position requires and individual to develop and implement system planning, designing, upgrading, and maintaining efficient operations of finance systems. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical problem solving, systems knowledge, and critical thinking to resolve systematic and operational issues in order to optimize efficiencies and minimize cost. This individual will mentor and train business systems specialist.
Key Responsibilities/Essential Functions:
Facilitate system integrity through regular maintenance of Revenue Cycle applications, installation and testing of new software versions with quality assurance measured and reported on.
Develop and deliver corporate reports in a timely manner, ensuring data integrity and validation through all reporting measures.
Provide corporate and departmental training on mandated concepts on systems, applications, Revenue Cycle operations, and other concepts as needed. Documentation and thorough understanding of concepts required.
Supervises and coordinates junior analysts work efforts to maximize department and division priority efficiency.
All other duties, as assigned.
Position Qualifications:
Minimum Education: Associate’s degree in a Business, Accounting, or Technology field. A combination of education and experience may be substituted for Associate’s Degree.
Minimum Experience: Three years’ experience in a Healthcare Revenue Cycle with two years experience on pertinent systems. Significant experience with large (2000+ records with more than 10 variables) databases required.
Licensing/Certification: HFMA certification at time of hire or within one (1) year of start date.
Equipment/Tools: Computer proficiency with various software and database systems, calculator, multi-line phone, fax/copy machine.
Specialized Knowledge and Skills:
Knowledge of pertinent healthcare applications, tables, dependencies, workflows and outlays.
Working knowledge of healthcare information systems Siemens Medseries 4 or Cerner preferred.
Ability to perform “drill down” techniques to get to the root cause of barriers to efficient process.
Understanding of claim billing and reimbursement processes. OR Account and auditing principles, accounts payable, budgeting, and general ledger.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Keen attention to detail.
Proven analytical and creative problem-solving abilities.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Run queries as needed
Special projects as assigned.
Benefits Include:
Generous PTO – beginning at 4.5 weeks
Ten paid holidays
Comprehensive healthcare coverage
Life and Disability Insurance
Flexible Spending Account
Retirement plans
Employee Wellness Center

Work as multiple role in multiple projects such as tester.

Looking for a Business Analyst who’s not ordinary.

1. Coming up with creative ideas to the company's problems — Our Business Analysts should understand that creativity on its own, without implementation (innovation) will not get our business to where it needs to be. You should be able to communicate best practice and improve a process.
2. Acting as Change Agents — Our business Analysts act as change agents when they ensure that any planned change is viable. Elicit business requirements by interviewing our people and make the workflow better.
3. Linking opportunities for innovation to business value —Crafting requirements that do not curb the ability of designers or developers to innovate. Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, and distinguish user requests from underlying true needs


Facilitating brainstorming sessions that help stakeholders identify opportunities for innovation. communicate and collaborate with stakeholders, business units, technical teams and support teams to define concepts and analyze information needs and functional requirements
Encouraging stakeholders to “think outside the box” and embrace opportunities for innovation.

Skills Necessary to Support Innovation

Our Business Analyst can be compared to a Swiss army knife.

Do you know what brought the Swiss army knife to life and subsequently to market

Its innovative nature.

A combination of different skills is needed to support the process of innovation. This includes creativity, communication, influencing, and negotiation skills.

Innovation, no matter how big or small, can make a big difference to the business. You don’t have to suggest a mammoth project that will deliver gargantuan benefits. Just look for minor improvement opportunities around you, no matter how small they are. Ideas can come when discussing with stakeholders when you personally experience a process that can be improved or when you receive a complaint email. Ideas can come from anywhere. The important thing is to look out for opportunities so that you do not miss out on making a difference, no matter how big or small.

And the rest of the Skills:
Possess strong writing skills, leadership abilities, and documentation acumen

Strong analytical and project management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements

Agile Scrum experience a plus but not required

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience

Three years’ work experience in a professional environment

Working knowledge of Microsoft Office with focus on Outlook, Word, and Excel

Really good Pay with great benefits plus Bonuses, 401k matching, Stock options, BC/BS Health Ins.

Located in Homewood Alabama

COMPANY OVERVIEW
For over a century, Neiman Marcus Group has served the unique needs of our discerning customers by staying true to the principles of our founders: to be the premier omni-channel retailer of luxury and fashion merchandise dedicated to providing superior service and a distinctive shopping experience in our stores and on our websites. Neiman Marcus Group is comprised of the Specialty Retail Stores division, which includes Neiman Marcus and Bergdorf Goodman, and our international brand, mytheresa.com. Our portfolio of brands offers the finest luxury and fashion apparel, accessories, jewelry, beauty, and home décor. The Company operates more than 40 Neiman Marcus full-line stores in the most affluent markets across the United States, including U.S. gateway cities that draw an international clientele. In addition, we operate 2 Bergdorf Goodman stores in landmark locations on Fifth Avenue in New York City. We also operate more than 40 Last Call by Neiman Marcus off-price stores that cater to a value oriented, yet fashion minded customer. Our upscale eCommerce and direct-to-consumer division includes NeimanMarcus.com, BergdorfGoodman.com Horchow.com, LastCall.com, and CUSP.com. Every day each of our 15,000 NMG associates works towards the goal of enabling our customer to shop any of our brands "anytime, anywhere, and on any device." Whether the merchandise we sell, the customer service we offer, or our investments in technology, everything we do is to enhance the customer experience across all channels and brands.

DESCRIPTION

This resource manages the requirements development process through the elicitation, analysis, specification and verification of multiple levels of requirements from an end-to-end perspective and supports the ongoing management of the requirements for ecommerce product strategies. The Business Analyst will also coordinate and manage the implementation and/or integration of products and new features for NMG websites.
 Develop a firm understanding from product owners and other business stakeholders of internal and external customer problems

 Performs other duties as assigned

$59,000 - $75,000 a year (Indeed Est.) POSITION PURPOSE

Enhances the quality of life for our members and team peers by meeting or exceeding their service expectations. Ensures that financial and business objectives support the overall growth and strategic goals of the Credit Union.

QUALIFICATIONS

EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION:
Equivalent to a bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, computer information system, economics or a related field.

Technical knowledge of accounting concepts, financial modeling practices and understanding of SQL and various data models as well as in-depth knowledge of Microsoft Excel.

EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
One year to five years of previous experience in financial/business planning and analysis, data analytics or a similar role, in the financial service industry.

SKILLS/ABILITIES:

Excellent communication and presentation skills are crucial. Position requires retrieving information from a variety of sources, such as core system, MCIF, lending data warehouse, websites, emails, calls with key contacts, or face-to-face interactions. Work entails information provided is up-to-date and accurate to prevent conflicts. Work requires analytical ability, judgment, and ingenuity. Positions may require a significant degree of creativity. Problem solving requires analysis of a wide variety of data, including weighing the desirability and/or probability of possible outcomes in relationship to each other.

Nextdoor is looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join our revenue team and be the primary owner of revenue metrics and business insights for the real estate revenue team. This team will work cross-functionally with Sales, Product, Operations and Data Science. We are a collaborative team obsessed with client success and problem solving.

Positive, can-do attitude and appetite to learn more

Strong analytical skills with the ability to clearly and effectively synthesize ideas and reports into actionable recommendations for internal teams and external partners

Job Description:

This individual will have responsibility for the analysis and support of the University’s implementation of a new student information system (SIS), Workday Student. The Business Analyst will play a key role in Stevens’ planned implementation of Workday Student to replace its current legacy student information system, which will include process analysis, planning, re-engineering, validation and testing as well as assistance with data-related tasks. The Business Analyst will provide technical and analytical skills in recommending the most effective business processes in the implementation of Workday Student for the Division of Enrollment Management and Student Affairs. The Business Analyst will also be responsible for managing the daily operations of the implementation working closely with the Functional Leads in the Offices of Financial Aid and Student Accounts, Information Technology, key functional stakeholders in Academics, Registrar’s Office, Student Accounts and Financial Aid, and the vendor, Workday, on the successful implementation of this project. This individual will be expected to work collaboratively with these constituencies and others throughout the university to analyze processes and functional requirements for the new system as well as managing key tasks to ensure the project stays on track. This role will be 100% dedicated to the new SIS system implementation and will provide functional back-up support on legacy SIS operations.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Performing analyses to identify functional requirements of Workday Student as it relates to current business processes
Identifying issues as they relate to the integration, management, and interoperability of administrative systems
Analyzing user requirements and procedures to support automated processing and to improve existing business flows
Supporting studies and analyses pertaining to the development of new processes to meet current and projected needs of the university
Documenting processes and procedures, utilizing both process diagrams and flow charts, as well as user-oriented diagrams
Creating and documenting data specifications to assist with data cleansing, validation, migration, and warehousing efforts
Contributing to the definition of changes in methodologies, system functionalities, reporting capabilities, and practices and organization that would improve the operations
Working with users, other IT staff members, and vendors to coordinate and schedule application changes; develop impact statements of proposed application system changes
Developing and supporting functional test procedures for systems implementations and upgrades
Providing training for end users prior to go-live as well as continuous training support and communication of new functionality when implemented.
Other responsibilities as assigned.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree with a major in Business Technology, Computer Science, Information Systems or other major directly related to the responsibilities of the position required
Prior experience in higher education strongly preferred, with strong understanding of higher education systems and business processes, specifically student financial aid and student account services.
Preferred experience with systems implementations and business and functional requirement documentations
Ability to recognize and implement new opportunities for optimal system utilization and operational efficiencies
Excellent interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills and the ability to communicate effectively with both highly technical and non-technical audiences
Strong self-initiation and the ability to work independently when necessary, while simultaneously being a strong team player and highly collaborative
Strong organizational, prioritization, and time management skills
Demonstrated strong analytical, systems thinking, and problem-solving skills
Ability to flourish in a highly dynamic and fast-paced environment with multiple priorities.

Financial Aid

Job Description
Are you looking for a new opportunity to use your technical and analytical skills in a blended role? If so, this position may be perfect for you! We are seeking to hire 2 exceptional Technical Business Analysts who will report to the Operations Manager of the Data Center. The ideal candidates will be multi-talented, hands-on contributor who will provide implementation and support services of automated processes for the Episys (Credit Union) clients. Candidates will be the main point of contact for these clients, ensuring success of day to day processing, research, testing and documentation of Episys batch jobs, as well as, setup and support of automation tools such as OpCon and MoveIT. This is not your typical BA position, but a role with emphasis on providing solutions and then implementing through hands-on experience with the system.
About this Team:
The Outlink Credit Union Episys Support Team assist the data center that host the core database (Episys) for clients. This team is made up of 16 employees with the main data center located in Lenexa, KS with additional support staff in Allen, TX, San Diego, CA as well as numerous remote staff throughout the US. Candidates will be required to work on an on-call rotation schedule of one time per quarter.
This role can be worked out of the following locations: San Diego, CA, Allen, TX, Lenexa, KS or 100% Remote.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum 18 months of experience in one of the following prior roles;
IT or Application Support
Technical Analyst
Must be available for scheduled after-hours on-call level 2 support. After-hours on-call shift is from 5pm PT – 4am PT for a 2 week period.
Must be available to work 1 mandatory weekend a year for failover event.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree Preferred.
Data processing or IT experience at a credit union a huge plus.
Knowledge Episys, OpCon or MoveIT a big plus.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Performs needs analysis to develop automation specifications for projects. Defines the system and functional requirements. Performs requirements gathering and project scoping.
Implements and monitors automation projects from initiation through delivery.
Ensures that automation projects are completed on schedule.
Provides assistance with running automated tests and training on automation to other teams as requested.
Maintains effective communication with customer to project completion.
May provide assistance in the areas of training, staff meetings and periodic written documentation.
Assist in developing documentation of process life-cycle, encompassing all areas of automation which include the MOVEit task, OpCon scheduling and related Episys jobfiles.
Contributes to process and product improvements.
Research processes currently setup in MOVEit, OpCon and Episys.
Process adjustments to existing setup in MOVEit, OpCon and Episys.
Implement new processes in MOVEit, OpCon and Episys.

Have you ever tried to hire a plumber? How about a house cleaner? If you have, chances are it took you way longer than it should. In the era of instant-everything, it's crazy that you still have to waste an entire afternoon researching, calling and vetting local service professionals whenever you need one. The market for hiring them is huge — $700B in the US alone — but the process is inefficient and largely offline.

Thumbtack is transforming this experience end-to-end, building a marketplace that matches millions of people with local pros for almost any project. In making these connections, not only do our customers get more done every day, our pros are able to grow their businesses and make a living doing what they're great at.

---------------------------------
About the Business Analytics Team
---------------------------------

The Business Analytics team's mission is to unlock strategic opportunities and enable Thumbtack to achieve its full business potential. To accomplish this mission, we focus on:


Strategic insights: Analytics to uncover insights that will be game-changers for our business, and that inform company strategy and team execution.
Business intelligence: Metrics, dashboards, and forums that help us measure progress towards our goals and foster deep understanding of our business.
Telling Thumbtack's story: Using metrics and data visualization to tell Thumbtack's story to investors, board members, our team, and the world.
Building a world-class team: hiring the best, and investing in coaching, learning, and team building.

We are a tight-knit group that is passionate about driving business impact through analytics.

--------------
About the Role
--------------

As a Business Analytics team member, you'll drive insights and action across the breadth of the marketplace. You'll be a steward of key company metrics and dashboards, and dive deep on analytical questions that are critical to Thumbtack's success (such as 'what makes a market healthy?' or 'what drives customers to return to Thumbtack?'). You'll partner with our leadership team to develop company strategy and goals, share updates with the Board, and work with teams across the business to drive actionable insights and business impact.

---------
About you
---------

You'll be a great fit for the team if:

You're extremely data-driven -- you love learning from data to make decisions, and always seem to have data at your fingertips
You geek out on metrics and dashboards -- you enjoy tracking trends, and have a driving curiosity to understand what's driving them
You enjoy answering big questions with analysis, and diving deep to reveal insightful and actionable insights
You're passionate about measuring business impact, and drawing the connection between what teams are building and how it impacts company metrics
You enjoy roles that enable you to understand the breadth of the business (vs. focusing on one specific area) and partner with people across the company
You appreciate the power that analytics has to enable the company to reach its full potential

----------------
Responsibilities
----------------


Define, measure, and track the key metrics that measure Thumbtack's success
Design and build key company data tables, dashboards, and insights tools that power decisions across the company
Participate in weekly and monthly business metrics reviews that illuminate areas of focus for the company
Conduct in-depth analysis to answer key questions that are critical to Thumbtack's strategy
Partner effectively with teams across the company, including Product, Engineering, Marketing, Operations, Finance, and the leadership team
Contribute to our team and company data culture through peer collaboration, training, coaching, and more

------------------------
Must-Have Qualifications
------------------------


BA/BS degree, preferably in Economics, Business, Math, Statistics, or Computer Science
2+ years of experience in a highly analytical role, e.g. technology, finance, or consulting
Proficiency using SQL to analyze large data sets, or excellent excel skills and enthusiasm to learn and use SQL
Exemplary analytical problem solving skills, including strong business judgment and the ability to identify and synthesize insights from analysis
Ability to work with company executives to understand the company's business needs and strategy
Strong communicator, attentive listener, and compelling explainer

---------------------------
Nice-to-Have Qualifications
---------------------------


Prior work experience at a marketplace
Statistics knowledge / experience
Experience with R or Python

More About Us

Thumbtack is a local services marketplace – one of the largest in the U.S. – that helps millions of people hire local professionals. With hundreds of unique service categories, customers can find a Thumbtack pro for almost anything: landscapers, DJs, personal trainers, even piano teachers. And in making these connections, we empower local pros too. Helping them get new customers and make a living doing what they're great at.

Founded in 2008 and headquartered in San Francisco, Thumbtack is backed by over $250 million in investment from Sequoia Capital, CapitalG, Tiger Global Management, Javelin Investment Partners and Baillie Gifford.

Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet

Life here at Dun & Bradstreet is changing – for the better. With almost two centuries of experience and a new modern vibe, work at D&B has never been more exhilarating. Our purpose is to grow the most valuable relationships in business by uncovering truth and meaning in data. We’re wildly passionate about our purpose, and it has us evolving everything we do – from how we engage with our customers to how we energize one another. So if you thrive in a fluid, agile culture but want the solidity of a storied and commanding brand, come join us!


Job Description
Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet
Life here at Dun & Bradstreet might surprise you! Each day, we are taking steps to transform our culture into one that activates the very best in our people. At the heart of our work you’ll find our core values: to be data inspired, relentlessly curious and inherently generous. These values inform how we engage with our customers and how we energize one another. Step inside and you'll feel that energy in our hallways and product labs, client meetings and whiteboard sessions, hashtags and annual reports. We're also exploring what needs to change to accelerate creativity and innovation.

For example:
We eliminate traditional performance reviews in favor of a more continuous dialog between team members and their managers.
We flattened the structure of our organization so that our leaders are accessible and more in tune with our people.
And, we changed our dress policy: 'Dress for Your Day' simply means wear what you want.

Our purpose is to grow the most valuable relationships in business by uncovering truth and meaning in data. We’re wildly passionate about our purpose, and it has us evolving everything we do – from how we engage with our customers to how we energize one another. So if you thrive in a fluid, agile culture but want the solidity of a storied and commanding brand, come join us!

COMPANY BACKGROUND
Elior North America is a contract food service company created in 2008 as TrustHouse Services Group with the acquisition of three food service companies. The company has continued to grow organically and through acquisition. In April 2013, a majority stake in the company was sold to Elior, a French based contract caterer. Elior launched an IPO on the French stock exchange in June 2014 and is now publicly traded.

In 2015 Elior North America implemented a strategy to centralize certain accounting functions in a Shared Services department located in Jackson, MS. Payroll currently processes weekly payroll checks for approximately 8,000 employees across eight companies. Conversion projects to centralize processing for additional companies are scheduled through 2018 and will add an additional 2,000 employees. However, Elior North America continues to evaluate acquisition opportunities meaning that future conversions are likely.

Elior North America Shared Services operates in a dynamic environment delivering Accounts Payable, General Accounting, Payroll, Revenue Recognition and Treasury services. We endeavor to serve our internal and external customers through the application of technology and proven best practices mixed with innovative thinking.

POSITION SUMMARY
The Business Analyst will be responsible for supporting the conversion of acquired companies to centralized accounting systems and functions. The Business Analyst will review and analyze data and processes from various accounting platforms and source materials to determine an efficient way to integrate converting companies into standard systems and process. The Business Analyst will coordinate with shared services teams to ensure test data and processes and in some cases, may conduct testing directly. The Business Analyst will work with team members to train / transition incoming work during a transition phase and assist with issue resolution post conversion for a period of time.

The Business Analyst will also help with training, unit alignment, process improvement projects and other duties as assigned.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS

Education/Experience:
A Bachelor’s degree in business, accounting, finance, computer science, or related field or equivalent combination of education and experience. Two (2) years related experience required. Must have experience in Microsoft Office programs including but not limited to Word and Excel. Must have experience with system conversions.
Competencies: (The following competencies describe the knowledge, skills, abilities and attributes that lead to a successful employee in this position.)
Must understand Accounting / Payroll processes to a depth needed to perform essential functions and problem solve
Must have the ability to analyze data and determine a strategy to meet business requirements
Must have advanced knowledge and experience using Microsoft Excel Office Suite
Must have the ability to effectively research and resolve accounting and process issues
Must have experience with accounting and/or payroll system conversions
Must have ability to design, write, test and document efficient testing solutions to meet business needs including end to end test cases
Must have strong project management skills to manage multiple projects and adapt to changing priorities
Must create and maintain project tracking documents and lead stakeholder meetings to keep interested parties up to date on progress
Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills to interact with all levels of management, employees and clients
Must have the ability to make judgments concerning the interpretation of policies and procedures
Must be self-motivated and possess the ability to lead or influence others in a positive manner

ENVIRONMENTAL AND WORKING CONDITIONS
Environment is an office building with security system. Interacts with employees daily. Works flexible hours as needed. Up to 25% travel for discovery work, training and other possible duties.

POSITION RELATIONSHIPS
The Business Analyst directly reports to the Director / Assistant Controller of their respective area and has no supervisory responsibility.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS / STANDARDS OF PERFORMANCE
The position functions and duties described below may not be the only requirements of the position. It may be necessary to follow other instructions or perform other related duties required by Elior North America Shared Services.

Conducts data gathering to analyze and understand business strategy requirements
Translates business requirements into process requirements
Develops, writes and communicates process design documentation and conducts training as needed
Creates end to end test scripts and participates in the testing process as needed
Analyze strengths and weakness of processes/systems for opportunities and improvements
Document systems or processes modifications and maintain documentation throughout projects
Assists shared services staff with processing solutions and recommendations on projects
Report common sources of technical issues and make recommendations to correct / improve
Liaise with System Analyst and Developers to effectively communicate requirements needed to accomplish tasks
Be an advocate for process improvement and initiate or contribute to ongoing efforts

PHYSICAL AND MENTAL EFFORTS

Physical: Physical demand level is light with 15 pounds being demanded occasionally. Intermittent sitting and standing with wide freedom of movement. Occasional lifting, bending, stooping, pushing and pulling. Ability to sit at a desk and enter information on a computer and use a calculator. Ability to clearly see computer screens and detailed reports. Ability to travel by vehicle and air, including overnight stays, to job sites and other locations as needed.

Mental: Works with minimal supervision. Exercises independent judgement. Concentrates for long periods of time. Attends to detail. Requires independent action and decision making. Handles the demands of various deadline situations. Uses discretion and maintains confidentiality when providing information about employees, clients, customers, and vendors.

Brand: Elior North America
Address: 775 Woodlands Parkway Ridgeland, MS - 39157
Property Description: Elior - ENA Corporate
Property Number: ENACORP

Assists managers and the business in defining scope and priorities for system initiatives (new projects and ongoing maintenance)

SUMMARY
The Business Analyst provides the link between the business need and the subsequent technical deliverables to lead IT projects throughout their life cycle. This is accomplished by working closely with business managers and end users to identify, document, and translate business requirements to the development team while managing the project as it flows from initiation through to implementation and closing.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Interview business process managers and subject matter experts to proactively understand business need and establish requirements for system enhancements
Translate user requirements to development team and negotiate technical deliverables
Lead assigned projects from initiation through closing by forming team, establishing schedule, organizing meetings, monitoring and controlling tasks, and documenting lessons learned
Act as advocate for users and stakeholders by ensuring delivered functionality matches agreed upon specifications
Assist with quality testing of major project deliverables
Prepare and communicate detailed project status information for communication throughout corporate management structure
Assist with implementation of solutions by coordinating virtual roll outs of new functionality or facilitating on-site training
Review submitted project or enhancement requests for prioritization and alignment to company vision
Interact regularly with project team and key stakeholders ranging from stake holders to senior management and from customers to external vendors
Develop and document functional design specifications as necessary
Identify and implement continual improvement initiatives to enhance the performance of the position, team, and company.
Be or become the core knowledge base in assigned area.



QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business, Engineering or related discipline with focus on IT.
5 Years’ experience of business analysis experience supporting business areas
Prefer 2+ Years of project management experience in a functional organization
Strong leadership, motivation, negotiation, conflict management skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
A strong focus on customer service
Candidates with experience in the above listed business areas will be given higher consideration.
Bi-lingual (English/Spanish) candidates will be given higher consideration
Must be willing to travel as needed.


EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
Bachelor's degree (B.A.) from four-year college or university; or one to two years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
LANGUAGE SKILLS
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community. Ability to write speeches and articles for publication that conform to prescribed style and format. Ability to effectively present information to top management, public groups, and/or boards of directors.
A Business Analyst must possess superlative technical writing skills in order to draft, review, and edit requirements, specifications, business processes, and recommendations related to proposed solution. This requires an excellent command of English grammar, usage, and punctuation.
Expert-level skill in desktop word processing and diagramming tools (e.g., Microsoft Word, Microsoft Visio).
MATHEMATICAL SKILLS
Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.

REASONING ABILITY
Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.
OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIES

A writing sample will be requested of all applicants for the position. Applicants may also be required to demonstrate proficiency in desktop word processing and diagramming tools.
Should be knowledgeable about the industry and, ideally, ProTrans International and our primary business processes.
Must be able to develop functional specifications and system design specifications for in-house development, enhancement, and software procurement projects.
Must possess good interviewing (interpersonal) skills.
Must be able to work as a member of a project team.
Must be able to work independently to produce project deliverables and meet deadlines.
Not required to be an expert in information technology.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to walk, and sit, use hands to type, handle or feel, and talk. Employees must be able to hear in order to perform their essential job functions.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Job Purpose
ICE Data Services, a division of Intercontinental Exchange, provides data, analytics and technology solutions to the financial markets across a wide range of business segments and assets classes. ICE Data Services offers a suite of desktop and mobile applications to deliver the content and capabilities on which our customers rely to navigate the markets. As a Business Analyst of Product Management for Oil and Refined Products Desktop Solutions, you will define the product strategy for the desktop and mobile offering. You will be responsible for defining and overseeing the implementation of the content and functionality requirements for customers in the oil and refined products markets. You will work closely with the sales team and directly with customers to understand their needs and to prioritize the product road map to maximize new sales opportunities and retain existing customers. You will also work closely with the technical product management team to ensure that the application is built to meet the specific needs of these customers.

Duties and Responsibilities
Work with sales, customers and the development team to define and manage the long-term vision for oil and refined products desktop and mobile offering.
Gather and create documentation that details the content and functionality as required by these users.
Work with the project team and stakeholders to fully define use-cases and functional requirements of platform.
Assist project management with prioritization and tracking of the implementation of platform requirements.

Knowledge and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Engineering, or Finance
Experience using or managing financial software products
Experience as a trader or analyst in the oil and/or refined products markets
Exceptional written, verbal and presentation skills
Proven organizational skills with strong commitment to product delivery
Detail-oriented with demonstrated ability to write unambiguous requirements
Must be results oriented and self-motivated
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, sometimes stressful environment
Ability to effectively facilitate requirements gathering and review sessions involving multiple stakeholders
Occasional travel

Core Competencies

Competencies are the skills and behaviors that are critical both to your personal performance and to ICE’s continued success. The core competencies apply to every member of staff working for ICE.

Teamwork
Offers time and/or assistance to colleagues; is widely regarded and respected as someone to go to for help
Fosters friendly and cooperative relationships with others; colleagues enjoy working with the
employee
Shares knowledge and mentors staff; works to develop others’ knowledge as well as own
Gives and shares credit as appropriate
Contributes to recruiting and training efforts of others, including candidate referrals, job interviews and mentoring
Attends and participates in company and department level functions inside and outside of the office

Problem-Solving & Decision-Making
Demonstrates an understanding of the urgent nature of our business and the need to proactively find and fix problems quickly and effectively takes ownership and follows through on decisions; doesn’t minimize or forget about problems
Determines and fixes root causes rather than just treating symptoms
Applies novel techniques to solve problems that are more ambiguous; challenges long-held beliefs when necessary
Quickly and effectively identifies alternative solutions and the pros/cons of each; confirms that a proposed solution has no unintended consequences
Takes steps to mitigate risk
Consults with colleagues and recommends solutions based on the best interests of customers and shareholders, even when the opinion is unpopular

Communication
Actively listens and speaks to, not over, others
Uses clear and constructive language orally and in writing
Communicates important developments to the relevant and appropriate audiences in a timely and consistent manner
Asks follow-up questions to ensure all points are understood
Takes time to objectively listen to all viewpoints before forming an opinion
Builds consensus among differing views

Professionalism & Integrity
Makes a positive impression; represents the company well on the phone and in person, including maintaining attire and appearance that is consistent with company image and appropriate for employee’s role
Models a ‘can-do’ attitude and takes initiative as a self-starter; inspires and motivates others to do the same
Embraces, rather than resists, additional responsibilities
Refrains from office gossip; settles rather than creates conflict with and between others
Exhibits desired work habits including regular office hours and extra hours when necessary while minimizing breaks and non-work related activities
Adheres to all corporate policies; makes prudent use of company resources

Summary:

Crum & Forster provides specialty and standard commercial lines insurance products through our admitted and surplus lines insurance companies. Operating out of our corporate offices in Morristown, New Jersey, and ten regional offices, we distribute our products through approximately 1,500 authorized retail and wholesale brokers across the United States.

We are looking for innovative, talented, and self-motivated individuals who are interested in working with a cross-functional team and growing in one’s career with the company.

ABOUT THE POSITION

The C&F IT Organization leverages Agile software development principles to achieve success in its support of the business. IT resources are assigned to teams that have specific missions. Each team consists of a cross-functional set of team members from the various disciplines that are needed to complete the mission. The basic roles include Scrum Master, Business Analyst, Developer, and Tester.

Business Analysts working for Crum & Forster:

Elicit business needs and describe them in the form of User Stories and Acceptance Criteria.
Assist the business identify opportunities for improvements in its processes and products.
Organize and document supporting detailed requirements
Ensure stakeholders, including other squad members, have a clear understanding of the business’ need and requirements
Provide thorough analysis of issues & solutions
Follow Agile and/or Kanban Practices
Work to continuously to improve team performance
Build a close working relationship with business partners to ensure ultimate success.
The Business Analyst works very closely with all stakeholders including business customers, vendors, and internal resources in order to facilitate team communication and achieve the team’s mission.

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU

Work within an IT Department that has the unique mix of being part of a strong family of companies (Fairfax Financial) and is continuously improving an already innovative Agile culture
Support from ALL levels of leadership for our Agile culture (our people are expected to be autonomous, empowered and self-managing)
Be part of a global network of nineteen companies that you can work with, network with and learn from
Work for a highly respectable, 194 year old company in the insurance industry, which operates across the entire United States
You will play a critical role in our highly visible and important underwriting and policy administration solutions.
Work with business units and executives in defining and delivering on underwriting and other business-related projects
Work with a team that values the importance of sharing, collaborating, taking responsibility and being supportive of each other.
Be a key member in helping define best practices especially around Agile SDLC methodologies and with Atlassian products (e.g., JIRA, Confluence) and third-party / custom add-ins.
Responsibilities:

Work closely with Business to identify their needs in the form of User Stories and Acceptance Criteria
Work with Business to ensure that User Stories are adding value
Participate in daily scrum, sprint planning, sprint demo and retrospective meetings.
Continuously improve efficiency on assigned tasks without sacrificing quality.
Identify and mitigate risk factors.
Support and improve Agile processes
Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree and/or 5+ years of equivalent experience related to Commercial P&C Insurance
Demonstrate leadership qualities
A passion for technology in the insurance industry
An enthusiastic and positive attitude
An entrepreneurial spirit and strategic thinker
Ability to be creative and “think outside of the box”
Strong verbal and written communications skills
Customer Service oriented
Ability to take ownership and see tasks through to completion
Good understanding of underwriting, policy administration and policy administration systems
Business analysis experience preferred
Experience/understanding of claims, compliance, financials, and reporting applications is a plus, but not required
Will abide by departmental policies and procedures, including authority levels, to comply with C&F’s risk management controls.

Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets.
As a Business Analyst, you will apply your quantitative skill set to create insights which directly influence product design and player experience. This internship will be part of analytics team for subscription, service and player network, based in Redwood City, CA. In this role, you will have the opportunity to:

Influence development decisions and marketing strategies through fact-based data-driven insights and analysis
Perform advanced statistical/machine learning analyses using all available sources of information (internal consumer data, consumer insights, research data, industry sources)
Identify important user segments and help design personalized experience
Communicate and present actionable results and findings derived from data throughout the organization in a clear, concise way
Build visualizations and tools to help the studio and teams make rapid, informed decisions
Gain hands-on experience extracting, cleaning, transforming, and analyzing massive amounts of raw telemetry data across several different platforms
Serve as an analysis point of knowledge for product initiatives and empowering the business partners in framing their future initiatives
Desired Skills and Experience

Pursuing undergraduate or graduate degree in in a quantitative related field, such as: Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Marketing (with a quantitative focus)
Exceptional analytical, problem-solving, and strategic thinking skills
Ability to communicate insights using PowerPoint, Word and Excel to technical and non-technical audience
Experience with or a strong desire to learn SQL to extract and clean data for analysis
Familiarity with R (preferred), Python, SAS, or similar tools used to do data visualization, analysis, prediction and modelling
Knowledge of probability, statistics, and descriptive and predictive modeling techniques preferred
Experience with data visualization tools or packages, such as: Tableau, Dundas, Qlikview, ggplot

 Incentive plans and performance analysis that allows branch employees to align effort to where it is most impactful for our clients and firm

The Business Analysis Associate is a key contributor to the team who will focus primarily on modeling, development of forecasts, and assessing the effectiveness of programs. In addition, this candidate also plays a critical role in aggregating data as well as field information to develop Executive Management presentations. The role requires collaboration with finance partners and other LOBs.
We are looking for an intellectually curious candidate who can grow with the role and contribute to the overall effectiveness of the team. The candidate should be a broad thinker who applies his/her analytic acumen to business objectives and makes impactful recommendations. As they obtain more experience, the candidate may represent/support the team on a variety of projects.

Job Description
Conduct detailed analysis, modeling and financial forecasting to support retail incentive plans for various branch roles, including Personal Bankers, Relationship Bankers, Private Client Bankers, and Tellers. Responsibilities include designing detailed analytics to determine incentive and participant impact when creating new incentive plans, changing plan drivers, adding/removing products, and/or changing branch roles.
Interpret results of various analysis, and clearly and concisely convey the story into presentations for Executive Management.
Actively participate in discussion and review of analysis/presentations
When appropriate represent the team on initiatives such as testing concepts thru branch pilots, introducing new products, etc.
Leverage analytic skills and critical thinking to support broader National Support goals.
3+ years of proven business/financial analysis experience.
Strong quantitative and analytical skills. Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills are essential. (Microsoft Access a strong plus)
Ability to develop clear, concise, senior management-level PowerPoint presentations
Strong project management, interpersonal, and influencing skills.
Comfort working in a deadline driven environment while maintaining accuracy and excellence in output.
Well organized with an ability to execute on multiple fronts at the same time.
A team player with a high level of motivation, dependability, and intelligence.
An understanding of branch banking would be helpful.
A Bachelor's or Master’s degree

Overview
Combine your exceptional attention to detail with technical aptitude in a fast-paced environment at LiveOps, a provider of virtual call center solutions. As the ambassador between our internal business units and our clients, you will spearhead client implementations and day to day requests on the LiveOps proprietary platform.

As a Professional Services Business Analyst, you will be part of a dedicated team within the Professional Services organization supporting client operations, work internally with a variety of cross-functional groups, and develop technical solutions for business problems.

Your primary mission as a Business Analyst, will be to help define, analyze, and manage implementation projects for LiveOps clients. Managing your projects through the entire lifecycle, you will handle business analysis, defining requirements, and architecting solutions. You will become an expert on the use of LiveOps technology to creatively solve client needs. Your prior experience in a client facing customer support, business analyst, or professional services role will allow you to hit the ground running.

Solid organizational and communication skills, with the ability to effectively multitask multiple client requests daily is key to success.
Responsibilities
Translate client business needs into clear technical requirements.
Fully own and multitask the execution of multiple client programs, including troubleshooting and debugging.
Identify internal inefficiencies and drive process improvement and innovation.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to continuously improve LiveOps service delivery and performance.
Respond to client requests for operational support, and troubleshoot issues.
Monitor Processes, investigate discrepancies, and conceptualize improvements.
Qualifications
Strong communication skills (written and oral)
Strong organizational skills
Ability to multitask and juggle multiple programs and clients simultaneously
Integrating Systems and understanding data transfer technology.
Data analysis experience is beneficial
Problem solving and project management skills
Ability to work autonomously and make decisions while maintaining a team-focused atmosphere
Ability to read and understand technical documents, such as xml input/outputs
BS/BA from an accredited 4-year university
Proficient in the Microsoft Office suite of applications
Workers in this position will be in a general office environment and required to sit, stand, walk, bend, stoop and lift up to 50 pounds while operating office equipment and conducting daily duties.

About Liveops
Liveops delivers an on-demand skilled workforce of onshore virtual agents for customer service and sales. With no call center, overhead or wasted idle time, our pay-per-use model scales to meet seasonal or time of day spikes in demand.

More than 400 organizations across service industries including retail, health care, insurance and telecom trust Liveops to deliver an enterprise-grade workforce, with faster program readiness, increased revenue, and greater customer satisfaction scores than traditional call centers.

LiveOps offers a culture of teamwork, passion and fun! We offer outstanding benefits including insurance, 401k match, and a generous PTO plan.

S3 prides itself on being an international IT Staffing and Solutions company with 20 years experience recruiting and managing exceptional IT and Business consultants for customers in the Financial, Energy, Public Sector and Retail Distribution industries. We are a full service IT firm, with 25 major market locations and is a privately held, financially strong, woman owned company.

To apply for this job send your resume to info@cognixautomation.

Who we are

iTrellis is a new kind of technology consulting firm that puts its employees first and is breaking the mold with our approach to custom software development!

Through frequent and regular feedback, interesting projects, and mentorship you are given a wealth of opportunities to define your own career path. We encourage our consultants to act autonomously so they can make the right choices for our clients without needing to navigate miles of red tape.

About the job

We’re looking to bring on a Business Analyst with experience working across different business platforms, such as marketing, engineering, and sales.

We are developing highly scalable solutions for our clients, and our BA consultants are pivotal in the development process of our custom software solutions. You'll need to be able to speak fluently about business needs and have some understanding of technology.

Your role with us

You will be working closely with IT and marketing on various job functions, including managing offers, developing audits and reports, and identifying opportunities to improve current processes. You'll get to work with senior management to provide insight and direction on certain projects. Our BAs own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing reports and analyses within our projects too.

Some tools you'll be using are Tableau, Power BI, and SQL. Experience in these areas is very helpful. We'd love to have someone with program/process management experience as well.

Things you have done, or know

Around 2 years as a BA or in a similar role
Define scope and drive the delivery of features for custom and commercial software solutions
Experience with using CRM tools
Financial background a plus
Effectively communicate project information to key stakeholders, facilitate communication between teams adhering to an Agile/Scrum framework


Tools you have used:

Microsoft Office
Tableau, Power BI, etc. for data visualization


The benefits:

iTrellis provides an outstanding environment to enhance your career and thrive. We offer a very strong benefit package that includes the following:

We offer a comprehensive health care plan, with Medical, Dental and Vision coverage. Our company pays 100% of the premiums for you, and 50% for any eligible dependents, and there are low deductibles.
We offer a Safe Harbor 401(k) retirement plan to all employees, with 100% company matching on the first 3% of your contributions, and match 50% of your contributions up to 5% of your gross pay. All Company match amounts vest immediately.

Overview
The Business Analyst facilitates the coordination and completion of projects and tasks designed to support Seneca's mission, including development and enhancement of agency processes and funding sources. The Analyst ensures efficiency and effectiveness of regional operations in support of a welcoming and responsive child-serving culture. Working in close collaboration with regional agency leadership, the Business Analyst works to implement, evaluate, and improve operational practices while maintaining compliance with local statutes, state and federal laws, and arrangements made with individual funders or stakeholders.
Responsibilities
Oversee the implementation of operational activities and participate in the ongoing development and refinement of operational practices to support regional growth

B.A required
Excellent writing and communication skills.

Travel required

Overview

The Programmatic Analyst is an integral member of the global team developing the programmatic offering for the world's largest English language newspaper website, DailyMail.com. This is a unique opportunity to work in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment, with wide exposure to the programmatic sell-side eco-system. The Programmatic Analyst will maximize programmatic ad yield across display, mobile and video while creating a best-in-class data strategy.

This individual will have a genuine passion for digital media, data and emerging technology.

DailyMail.com is a division of UK-based DMGT, an international portfolio of digital, information, media and events businesses, which employs over 12,000 people and is listed on the London Stock Exchange (LSE: DMGT.L).

Key Responsibilities:

Generate comprehensive, in-depth analytics and reporting to identify meaningful business trends that inform the business's monetization practices across display, mobile and video
Develop and maintain data and reporting infrastructure, ensuring data quality, and accuracy
Build and maintain data visualizations dashboards to allow data access to all necessary stakeholders
Provide detailed weekly revenue forecasts to senior management
Execute deep-dive analyses addressing key business issues and present findings to stakeholders
Evaluate the configuration and performance of the programmatic ad stack against key indicators
Continuously monitor yield across platforms and offer innovative recommendations to indirect partners and sales teams to boost performance and generate upsell opportunities
Develop optimization hypothesis for A/B test across different exchanges
Analyze data to find actionable insights that lead to great business decisions and new opportunities
Collaborate with key stakeholders to translate business questions into verifiable hypotheses using complex, multi-source data
Demonstrate great judgment in quickly forming actionable, data-driven conclusions in the face of uncertainty
Proactively make recommendations for new tests and initiatives to improve key metrics and customer outcomes
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Work cross-functionally with teams including Operations, Sales, Marketing, Finance and Analytics to provide excellent customer service in support of DailyMail.com clients and revenue goals

Desired Experience and Skills


B.A. Or B.S. in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Business, or related discipline
1-2 years of relevant experience in a business analyst, data analyst, or statistical analysis role
Programmatic digital media experience, a plus
Publisher side (sell side) experience, a plus
Experience Google Ad Manager, AdSense, STAQ, Rubicon, AppNexus (Xandr) and other platforms
Familiarity with DMP, DSP and SSP platform architecture as well as an understanding of buy side behavioral/user/environment targeting strategies
Proven analytical and quantitative skills with a creative problem-solving mindset
High proficiency in Excel/SQL/Tableau/AWS with the ability to analyze, summarize and manipulate large volumes of data
Strong project management skills. High attention to detail with the ability to organize concepts and data into top line information suitable for C-level presentations. Thrive in a fun, fast-paced environment with the ability to maintain focus on KPI achievement and meeting deadlines in the midst of rapid market change.

IMPAQ International, a growing and dynamic social science research firm, provides high-quality research and impact evaluation services, policy analysis, survey research, technology solutions, organizational development, technical assistance and consulting services to U.S. and international government agencies, foundations, and the private sector.

IMPAQ’s mission is to bring together exceptional people to develop innovative and rigorous approaches to evaluate the real-world impact of social policies and programs. IMPAQ offers five locations: our Corporate Headquarters in Columbia, Maryland, rated one of America’s Best Small Cities; Downtown Washington, D.C., Boston, Massachusetts, a Bay Area office in Oakland, California and Seattle, Washington. IMPAQ has a diverse and collegial work environment.

Job Summary:
The Business Analyst (BA) works with all Meta business units and related third parties to complete analysis of business processes or applications. The BA translates and documents the business needs into requirements for software development. The BA is responsible for verifying with user representatives/stakeholders that the use cases and process models accurately portray specific business needs.

Essential Job Functions:
Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis.
Facilitate communication and collaboration with internal and external customers as a Scrum Product Owner.
Evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, and decompose high-level information into detailed requirements.
Conduct and communicate gap analysis between the “as-is” and “to-be” business processes to identify opportunities
Ensure enough prioritized work (product backlog) always exists in a software development team’s product backlog.
Address conflicting priorities between multiple stakeholders so that the software development team has a single prioritized list of work to follow.
Accept finished work on behalf of the business stakeholders as it is completed by the software development team.
Assist the team with the appropriate narrative & context required to demonstrate finished work to stakeholders.
Prioritize Technical Debt and other Architectural work against Business Requests.
Ensure that the business stakeholder’s Product Vision is clear to the software development teams undertaking the corresponding work.
Assemble and present business user stories and various other required project artifacts.
Perform analysis for incoming business initiatives and provide recommendations.
Liaise between the business, software development and support teams.
Ability to handle multiple projects and tasks simultaneously.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Job Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree (BA/BS) in related field from an accredited institution preferred.
1-3 years of experience working with financial services/banking regulations and operations procedures preferred.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers and subject matter experts.
Experience in Agile Software Development preferred.
Strong analytical and organizational skills; detail-oriented.
Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint and Outlook).

Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Allscripts is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.

The primary purpose of this role is responsibility for creating the business and/or functional requirements necessary for technology solutions that meet customer needs, expected delivery dates, and exceptional quality standards. This includes writing reports in SQL for client needs.
Responsibilities
Leads clinical requirements development
Applies clinical knowledge to integrate clinical practice and technology into clinical workflows that support safe and efficient patient care.

Interact with business users to understand new business requirements and enhancement requests

Translate business requirements into product-specific designs and configuration, detailed requirement specifications and use cases.

Interact with Systems Analysts during the software build and/or configuration process and testing process.
Perform functional application configuration and configure /run reports at user request.
Design and execute functional, integration, and regression test plans for new application functionality, product releases and enhancement and regulatory modifications using clinical scenarios and use cases.
Ensure programs meet clinical specifications.
Demonstrate new functionality toclinical users seeking inputs on future direction.
Review vendor provided documentation and user manuals needed to support the product.
Directly interface with business users by responding to support calls escalated by the Service Desk.
Participate in user focus groups and requirements workshops, vendor training and demonstrations.

These are consistent accountabilities for all staff.
Assist in supporting activations and rollouts.
Consistent efforts to deliver quality solutions as per agreed scope.
Customer focus and close alignment with the customers’ business objectives.

Related Companies is the most prominent privately owned real estate firm in the United States. Formed over 40 years ago, Related is a fully integrated, highly diversified industry leader with experience in virtually every aspect of development, acquisitions, management, finance, marketing and sales.

Headquartered in New York City, Related has offices and major developments in Boston, Chicago, Los Angeles, San Francisco, South Florida, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi, London, and Shanghai and boasts a team of over 3,500 professionals. The Company’s portfolio of over $50 billion in real estate assets owned or under development is made up of best-in-class mixed-use, residential, retail, office and affordable properties in premier high-barrier-to-entry markets. Related has developed preeminent mixed-use projects such as Time Warner Center in New York and CityPlace in West Palm Beach and is currently developing the 28-acre Hudson Yards project on Manhattan’s West Side. Related also manages approximately $4 billion of equity capital on behalf of sovereign wealth funds, public pension plans, multi-managers, endowments, and family offices. Related was recently named to Fast Company Magazine’s list of the 50 Most Innovative Companies in the World.

Related also owns Equinox® Fitness Clubs and SoulCycle further expanding the company's capabilities into the health and fitness arena and enhancing the value of its properties through an exclusive, branded amenity and lifestyle offering. Related is a partner in CORE, a boutique residential brokerage.
