Amcor is looking to drive strong growth in its business group through organic and inorganic opportunities. The SG&A and Organizational Design Analyst will work closely with the corporate team and the business and functional leaders of the Flexibles business groups to support the integration and synergy delivery across headcount and expense related items with acquired companies, and the M&A process.

Amcor is the global leader in packaging with over US$9B in annual revenue and nearly 35,000 employees across more than 40 countries. Amcor Flexibles has three business groups – Americas, EMEA, and Asia-Pacific.


2. Job Dimensions


This position is an individual contributor role reporting to VP of Integration (who, in turn, is a direct report of the SVP of corporate operations).

As the Business Analyst you will primarily focus on analysing the synergy potential of acquisitions (post-deal close) and prepare our business groups to capture synergies on headcount and employee expense reductions after close. You will also be required to help conduct workshops and data analysis in our relevant business regions for the acquisition(s). The primary responsibility will be people-related cost reduction and org design support, with as-needed focus on other areas such as operational synergies

You will also support mergers and acquisition work at the global Amcor level, which will require you to work with a range of stakeholders including the business unit, Amcor Strategic Development Group, external advisors, and the owners/leadership of the acquired companies


3. Principal Accountabilities


Help collect and analyze data on current baselines both on organizational cost
Breakdown synergy capture potential by lever and region for SG&A (headcount and expenses), while improving organizational effectiveness and readiness for growth
Support synergy target setting process (top-down and bottom-up)
Create fact base for organizational strategies (e.g., shared services vs. decentralized service models) with Amcor’s capabilities and acquired portfolios
Prepare workshop documents for synergy summits with regional leaders to prepare for execution
Provide follow-up support for synergy delivery where needed (e.g., cost-benefit financial modeling)
Deep-dive into functional topics where needed (e.g., location analysis, 3rd party contractor analysis, travel budgeting)


4. Major challenges & complexities


Analytics
Problem solving
Working with ambiguity
Applying practical 80/20 thinking
Stakeholder influencing
Navigate and align multiple stakeholders with disparate interests
Influence without authority
Thinking like a business leader


5. Relationships

Internal
External

BG/BU VP of Finance
Integration Management Office
Functional VPs (HR, Operations, Sales, etc)
Regional integration leaders
Strategy & Development Group

Consultants
Counterparts at merging companies (as legally permitted before close)

6. Qualifications/Requirements

6.1 Formal Qualifications and Experience


Knowledge and Experience
Strategic analysis
Financial modelling
Risk analysis and due diligence techniques
Corporate Finance

Education and Certifications
Bachelors required
Masters preferred
Prior work experience in comparable job functions required

6.2 Knowledge/Skills/Abilities/Behaviours


Job Specific skills and abilities
Strong analytical skills
Relationship management skills
Well-rounded commercial and economic awareness
Business communication
Project management

Amcor Leadership Framework competencies

The 3 Leadership competencies which will apply to all AFA co-workers:
Driving for Results
Customer Focus
Influencing Others

The Leadership competencies which will apply to OHSE:

Why work at Amcor?
We value safety, integrity, collaboration, accountability and results and out performance
Amcor is a growing company which means career opportunities both locally and internationally
The environment is better off because of our leadership and products
We offer world class benefits including annual bonus opportunities; including various retirement savings/voluntary pension plans (vary depending on country).
We value diversity. With sites in over 40 countries around the world, you have the unique opportunity to work and grow with a multi-cultural team.

Keywords: M&A, Integration, Organizational Development, Packaging, Analysis, Process Improvement, Optimization, Cost Reduction, Efficiency.

Application process


To apply to this offer, please apply directly on our website at www.amcor.com, or for any inquiries, please email fbuf.buffalogrovejobs@amcor.com


About Amcor

Amcor (ASX: AMC; www.amcor.com) is a global leader in developing and producing high-quality, responsible packaging for a variety of food, beverage, pharmaceutical, medical-device, home- and personal-care and other products. Amcor works with leading companies around the world to protect their products and the people who rely on them, differentiate brands, and improve supply chains, through a broad range of flexible packaging, containers, cartons, closures and services. The company's 35,000 people generate more than US$9billion in sales from operations that span 200-plus locations in more than 40 countries.

AFA Overview

With 16 plants in the Americas operating in 6 countries, Amcor Flexibles Americas (AFA), a business group of Amcor, is a market leader and the world's largest supplier of flexible packaging. We deliver innovative packaging solutions and provide enhanced quality products for the medical, pharma, personal care, and food markets. Its award winning approach towards sustainability makes Amcor the preferred partner for customers looking for responsible packaging solutions. For more information visit www.amcor.com.

Montefiore Information Technology (MIT) is looking for a Business Analyst with a focus on Human Resources. This candidate will play a key role in the implementation and support of a new ERP suite including the Finance, Supply Chain, HR and Asset Management functions on a single ERP system across all business partners. This strategic position will be part of a strong team that will play a pivotal role in the health system’s ERP technology transformation program and evolve to a shared services model across Montefiore Medicine.

The ideal candidate must possess strong business analytical skills and will work with the business process owners to evaluate requirements, recommend process improvements and configure the ERP solution. This Business Analyst role has responsibilities within each phase of the ERP Transformation project life cycle including user meetings, requirements gathering, development, testing, implementation, and go-live.

The Business Analyst provides outstanding client service and contributes to the organization’s mission of utilizing information technology to improve patient care.

Role and Responsibilities
Influence and support the overall roadmap for the ERP Product portfolio of Montefiore Medicine with a focus on HR business processes.
Stay current with trends and developments in HCM technologies and formulate strategic courses of action.
Be a catalyst for innovation and growth within business operations.
Work effectively within and across ERP/Finance/HR business operations and IT teams to execute projects and roadmap items.
Act as a trusted advisor to Montefiore Medicine business process owners and business operations to ensure alignment with business drivers, and then integrate these requirements into the strategy as it is developed.
Prioritize related initiatives and coordinate the evaluation, deployment and implementation of current and future ERP functionality.
Use stakeholder feedback to recommend improvements and adjustments to ERP functionality.
Provide guidance during the detailed design, build, test and deploy phases.
Monitor application performance, service delivery performance metrics, change management, ticketing and resolution of incidents, resolution of identified problems.
Lead business analysis efforts for new HCM functionality.

Qualifications and Education Requirements
Proficient in understanding the application design, configuration / module setup and the creation of functional documents.
Expertise with cloud based ERP modules- HR, Organization Management, Personnel Administration and Employee and Manager Self-Service.
Understanding of Workflow Management Systems.
Experience upgrading ERP / HR applications with an understanding of the functional changes between versions.
Knowledge and experience with open interfaces and application programming interfaces (APIs).
Understanding of flex fields, workflow, setup and profile options.
Understanding of shared services / multi-organization functionality.
Working knowledge of SQL query tools.
Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Business Process Management or related discipline, or equivalent experience. MBA or other relevant graduate degree is a plus.
Ability to troubleshoot issues and assist with support.
Excellent written and verbal communication/presentation skills.
Self-motivated with the ability to work consistently and efficiently to achieve overall team as well as personal goals.
Excellent ability to multi-task and manage simultaneous projects and initiatives.
Strong planning, organization, critical thinking, decision-making skills and problem-solving aptitude.
High degree of confidentiality, maturity, tactfulness and business ethics.
Experience with large-scale ERP implementations in a heavily regulated, compliance-driven enterprise environment and a strong track record of delivering complex projects across multiple departments.
Experience in an academic medical center is highly desirable.

If so, keep reading! The Job – a hybrid role that combines the art of being a killer business analyst and an effective executive assistant. This is a unique opportunity to partner with the CEO and to have a “peek behind the curtain”, to learn the nuances of operating a business, and to have direct impact on all aspects of the business.You will…be partnering with our CEO, an ambitious, demanding, results-focused, no-nonsense woman. Seriously, you’ll need to get to the point – quickly – or she will have moved on.document what is said in meetings and turn ideas into action items.manage the CEO’s promises and possibilities log – a document that tracks what she owes to whom, by when and vice versa.need to anticipate questions or problems and give solutions & alternative solutions – before the question is even asked.keep us all in line by documenting SOP’s all throughout the company.work with the CEO and other stakeholders in defining, capturing, and documenting business needs.craft requirements specification documentation based on discussionshelp ensure solutions align with defined requirementswhatever else is needed to help Ver-Tex achieve its Mission while also leveraging the effectiveness of the CEO.All of this may sound like a piece of cake if you are organized, but this is a whole cut above being organized. This requires a level of communication most people haven’t been trained in. Are you open to be a beginner and learn new distinctions? We are willing to train you in these communication distinctions but only if you’re truly open to learning and revealing your blind spots. Our CEO has been on this development journey herself for five years now and she says, “Trust me when I say it isn’t easy but it’s an adventure and it’s been the most fulfilling pursuit I’ve been on in my life.”What next?If you’re still reading this and would swipe right on us on a dating app, then apply! Include a cover letter explaining why you’re the right fit for this job, this company, and this tough but tender (she loves cats [and people]!) CEO. Also, she won’t consider your application without a personal cover letter. Bonus points if you take this test and let us know your results: https://www.123test.com/disc-personality-test/.The Fine Print: Ver-Tex is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace humans of every background, appearance, race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, and disability status. However, we don’t employ jerks, even really smart ones.Job Type: Full-time

Please Note: This recruitment is for two project positions with an anticipated end date of June 30, 2019.

Here at the Employment Security Department (ESD), we believe in the Power to Help when people need it most. We provide economic security to the people of Washington every day and in every corner of the state. We help people find jobs, bridge gaps in employment and soon we'll be providing paid family medical leave.

Our Workforce Information & Technology Services (WITS) Division improves our business by providing innovative IT support and services. We are in need of two project Senior Business Analysts (ITS4) to serve as members of our UTAB team within WITS. The UTAB team is responsible for maintaining and developing enhancements of the Unemployment Insurance (UI) benefits application. Your role will be critical in designing and documenting technical solutions that best meet our business needs and enable timely payments of unemployment insurance benefits.

We need someone that can gather requirements for the system enhancements that are needed in this project. Your ability to research and determine whether problems identified are data, interface or user process issues will be instrumental in reducing the likelihood of these issues occurring again. If this sounds like the right opportunity for you, we invite you to apply now and join our team of IT professionals in implementing innovative technology and services for our customers!
Duties
In this role, you will translate business and functional requirements and specifications into technical requirements. You'll also collaborate between business stakeholders and technical staff to define business requirements.

Some of what you'll enjoy doing:
Preparing requirement and specification documentation.
Translating requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria.
Converting requirements into various types of models or diagrams using the BABOK techniques (process mapping, decision tables, value streams and data flows).
Working with product and usability specialists in developing user interface designs.
Analyzing current and requested system functionality to identify risks and gaps; providing alternative solutions and making recommendations.
Reviewing business rules, user stories and use cases to determine the size, complexity and dependencies of changes.
Analyzing system data inputs and outputs using Microsoft SQL to advise with troubleshooting system anomalies.
Analyzing current and future states by mapping sequential flow of work.
Providing root cause analysis for system malfunctions and failures.
Qualifications
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a closely related field.
Two (2) years of IT experience in:
Leading customers in the elicitation and management of requirements.
Documenting technical and functional requirements, software specifications and system diagrams.
OR
A combination of education/and or experience.
Desired Qualifications:
Professional certifications in business analysis.
Experience with Microsoft SQL.
Experience applying the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABOK) techniques.
Supplemental Information

Please attach a resume and letter of interest to your on-line application (through the Add Attachment(s) field).
Applications with comments such as "see attachments" in the supplemental question responses will be considered incomplete.
Other Information
This recruitment may be used to establish a qualified pool of ITS4 candidates for agency-wide vacancies in the next six months.

Description

Position Objective
The Business Analyst II (BA) position is responsible for serving as the expert of Guardian Anytime features and processes. The primary responsibilities include identification and documentation of business needs, the ability to effectively communicate with all levels of Guardian (leadership, front line staff, internal business partners) -in both oral and written form - while serving as a liaison across business areas and between business and technical teams and representing customer needs to drive process and/or system improvements that support the strategies of e-Business /Digital and the Group Profit Center.

Key responsibilities include the following:
Support the business through identifying, analyzing and driving process and/or system improvement projects that align with department strategies having focus on our customers.
Using business analysis skills, capture business requirements by creating user stories, business workflows, or simple diagrams and data flows to illustrate functional, business outcomes.
Represent e-Business teams in business requirement elicitation sessions for Strategic Projects (approx. 40 per year across organization).
Facilitate the rigorous identification and documentation of business requirements for Discretionary Initiatives within the e-Business Team by leading business resources through a variety of activities including:
Proactively elicit information through interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, business analysis and workflow analysis.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish business user requests from the underlying business needs.
Translate business needs into business and functional requirements in a complete, correct and clearly understood format to be shared with both business and technical stakeholders.
Coordinate and perform the prioritization, transition and ongoing management of business requirements.
Coordinate validation of requirements.
 Lead product and process changes for e-Business/Digital initiated projects.
Lead product and process changes for e-Business/Digital initiated projects.
Operate as the subject matter expert (SME) within the Group Profit Center for Guardian Anytime functionality and features and work with all areas of Guardian to help broaden the knowledge and expertise.
Support strategic planning and the definition and prioritization of initiatives and project opportunities. This role will advocate customer needs for e-Business/Digital, especially at it relates to Guardian Anytime.
Plan, gather and structure information from a variety of stakeholders and sources to understand and analyze business needs.
Identify, describe and communicate business needs as business requirements.
Assist in translation of business requirements into detailed functional requirements that describe a capability of an end solution.
Coordinate and perform the prioritization, transition and ongoing management of business requirements.
Coordinate validation of requirements.
Proficiency with various devices (computers, touchscreens, tablets, smartphones).
Create, write, review test plans and scripts for UAT

Develop and maintain relationships that enhance personal and department productivity.
Develop strong relationships with key business, technical and project management resources
Maintain strong relationships with all stakeholders in order to gather information, understand stakeholder interests and business needs, and manage their expectations throughout the project life cycle.
Work closely with Project Managers during the preparation and maintenance of the project plans and teams
Ongoing development of industry expertise by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications, establishing personal networks, benchmarking state-of-the-art practices, participating in professional societies, and applying this knowledge to the job.


Qualifications

Skills and Knowledge
Skills

Excellent communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with all levels of the organization. This includes written and verbal communications as well as visualizations.
Plan and facilitate workshops, brainstorming sessions and large group meetings that cut across multiple business and functional areas.
Ability to influence others to move toward consensus.
Well developed analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills, leveraging both logic and creativity.
Strong supervisory, interpersonal, coaching and mentoring skills.
Ability to quickly assimilate and corelate complex and conflicting information.
Strong ability to prioritize work and meet deadlines while delivering high-quality outcomes.
High level of proficiency in the Microsoft Office tool set, especially Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word and Visio.
Knowledge

Understanding of Customer needs, Group Profit Center operations and Sales organization in relation to the Guardian Anytime processes.
Working knowledge of Group Products and/or associated procedures.

Education

Understanding of agile/SCRUM methodologies and/or project management desired.

Experience

Demonstrated experience working with end user and leadership to gather and assess business needs.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, Microsoft Project and PowerPoint required.

None

job_description:
ABOUT THE ROLE:
Farmer’s Fridge is entering a period of rapid growth, and we are looking for a Business Analyst to help drive the understanding, growth, and success of Farmer’s Fridge.
The data team builds and maintains a centralized data platform for analytics, reporting, predictive modeling, and data exploration. The Business Analyst will work cross-functionally with other teams to provide visibility into our data, craft narratives, find insights, and provide recommendations - allowing the company to make better decisions, faster.
WHAT KIND OF PERSON ARE WE LOOKING FOR:
You love digging through data to find a story that will drive decision making across the company
You strive for optimization and automation, knowing that what is currently being done can always be improved.
You are creative, flexible, and supremely detail-oriented without losing sight of the big picture or ultimate goal. It would never occur to you to say, “that’s not my job”.
You believe learning should be fun and seek to empower every employee with the skills and information they need to be independently successful in their role.
You are comfortable in an environment of high-growth and ambiguity
You love fresh food and are demonstrably passionate about our mission to improve people’s lives through 24/7 access to food you can trust!
IN A TYPICAL WEEK, YOU WILL…
Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Automate analysis and performance reporting processes
Support demand/inventory planning, sales and location forecasts, and production planning
Work with partner teams to define KPIs and provide ongoing metrics for improving existing features and new releases
Interface with key stakeholders at all levels throughout the company to support their data and analytics needs
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
A Bachelors degree in a relevant field (STEM preferred)
Experience in programming languages, preferably R or Python
Experience in SQL
Experience in data visualization
Intermediate to excellent Excel capabilities (pivot, vlookup, VBA, etc.)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing data
Strong prioritization and communication skills
BENEFITS:
Traditional Benefits – Health, Dental, Vision, Life, Short Term Disability, LTD
10 Paid Holidays and Paid Time Off
Daily Fridge credits – enjoy these flat rate credits at any Fridge
Monthly cellphone bill credit
Professional development opportunities
Yoga, mixers, volunteer opportunities, sports leagues, family events and other spontaneous events with a phenomenal team of individuals that are constantly pushing the market boundaries to make healthy food accessible 24/7
ABOUT FARMERS FRIDGE:
At Farmer’s Fridge, we believe it should be easy for everyone to get delicious, nutritious food in a hurry. We source the best ingredients we can find and bring them to our kitchen in Chicago’s Fulton Market. Every day we chop, roast, mix, and shred everything by hand, creating tasty salads, meals, and snacks that we deliver daily to our growing network of citywide Fridges. Chances are good there’s a Fridge near you right now, stocked full of good stuff, waiting to serve you something tasty with a few taps of a touchscreen. If you’re passionate about our mission we’d love to hear from you!

View our disclosures related to External Agencies and Applicants below.
https://www.farmersfridge.com/careerdisclosures

Software Business Analysis at Redflex are part of a community that design and create leading edge solutions that make our cities and our lives more green, safer and smarter.
We take a whole team approach to software quality, following Agile principles, working in a mix of Scrum, Kanban and anything else that works for us. We collaborate, we help each other, and we jump in on any task that needs doing. Our Business Analysis are a true part of our community, helping to bridge the gap between the team and their stakeholders. Setting priorities and grooming our backlog, writing high-level customer needs and acceptance criteria, not the “analyst team” off in a corner.
The “advancement” you get on our team is the chance to continually learn, experiment, try new techniques, collaborate to solve business and technical problems.
You’ll work with a variety of solutions targeting Traffic Safety, Intelligent Traffic Management, Ticketless Parking and CCTV. Using technologies including Java, PEGA, C++, Web Frameworks, and Databases, supported by tests in JUnit, Cucumber, Capybara, SoapUI, Junit and Silk Test Meter.
Ours is a diverse domain to learn, but we work closely to understand what is needed and find the simplest ways to deliver that.
If you are passionate about developing the best possible quality software product working test-first, in small increments, getting quick feedback from automated regression tests and from stakeholders, you’ll enjoy working here.
Please no solicitation from recruitment agencies, contractors or employees of contractors. This position does not sponsor H1B visa's
EOE
Requirements
To become a software Business Analysis at Redflex, you will need to be a master at:

Experienced with gathering requirements by managing relationships with stakeholders and facilitating those conversations.
Capability in providing guidance on what to build when to release as much value as possible as early as possible.
Strong technical capability to be able to dive into application components to assist in building acceptance criteria and scenarios.
Can ensure the work done by the team aligns with the wider business strategy.
Applied experience in helping the team to plan and improve their ways of working through retrospectives.
To collaborate with a variety of people in our company to make sure our software works for our customers.
Some experience with databases, data modeling, and SQL & PL/SQL.
To show a commitment to ongoing professional development through self-learning, professional training, participation in open source projects, attending conferences etc.

If the above description accurately describes your experience and approach to software analysis, please send your resume

Business Analyst | Sales

Vendavo | Remote, US
Vendavo Overview:
Vendavo powers the shift to digital business for the world’s most demanding B2B companies, unlocking value, growing margin and accelerating revenue. With the Vendavo Commercial Excellence platform, companies develop dynamic customer insights and optimal pricing strategies that maximize margin, boost sales effectiveness and improve customer experience. With an annual margin improvement totaling more than $2.5 billion across companies in chemicals, distribution, high-tech and manufacturing, Vendavo delivers cutting-edge analytics and deep industry expertise that help companies stay one step ahead. As we continue to change the way business gets done, we’re looking for energetic, experienced, and talented professionals to join our team. If you are driven to make a global impact, thrive in an innovative culture, and enjoy work on challenging and engaging projects, join our team at Vendavo!
Position Overview:
As Vendavo expands into new product and market segments, we are looking for a highly skilled Business Analyst with acombination of pricing knowledge & experience (e.g. Pricing Director/Manager, Product Manager, etc.), strong technology skills, and confidence in leading discussions and meetings with our existing and prospective clients. The Business Analyst is instrumental in every stage of the customer interaction. Working alongside the Account Executive and Business Consultant, the Business Analyst supports the Business Consulting team to assess customers' pricing processes, recommend improvements, develop a business case, and deliver a solution vision and proposal.
Business Analysts facilitate structured discovery processes, analyze and shape client needs, build compelling value cases (detailed business cases for the NPV/ROI of our projects), demonstrate software/solution capabilities, inject best practice advice to maximize and ensure client value realization.
The location is flexible, and this role can be home-office based. This role will involve frequent customer and partner interaction, and the ability to explain technical concepts and designs to both commercial (business) and IT clients. This role requires frequent travel in the form of short-duration trips, averaging 50% over the year, but varies week-to-week.

As a Business Analyst, you will: Evaluate customer business requirements by performing opportunity assessments and pricing process, tools, and capability assessments Support the Business Consulting team in preparing, among other things, presentations, demonstrations, and RFP responses. Communicate/demonstrate a client-specific value proposition and gain the confidence of client senior operating executives Develop selling proposition, sales presentation content, and develop/articulate requirements for client-specific custom demonstrations Assist in development of business case (ROI) analysis for proposed software and services project Analyze post go-live benefits and fulfillment of value proposition Develop and maintain content around pricing best practices including industry-specific pricing best practices, in the form of public presentations, webinars, blog articles, internal documents and demo/presentation scripts.

What you need to be successful in this role:
 5+ years prior experience in a position responsible for aspects of Pricing, or comparable experience in Management Consulting. Exposure and comfort with areas such as statistics, operations research, data analysis, and optimization is a strong plus. MBA, Industrial Engineering or Operations Research degree highly desirable Excellent communication and presentation skills, in particular the ability to present complex concepts in an organized, accessible and articulate manner to both commercial and technical audiences Analytical in approach with the ability to map customer requirements into solution vision and application demonstration scenarios The discipline to work alone as well as the ability to work collaboratively as part of a high performance team Prior experience in technical sales or sales engineer role a plus
What an Ideal Candidate looks like: You are customer-focused You have the desire and ability to innovate and inspire innovation in others You take accountability for the results we need to achieve individually and collectively You make courageous decisions and act with integrity You execute with a sense of urgency through thoughtful planning and disciplined execution. You operate with responsible transparency with direct, respectful and open dialogue amongst your peers.
Why you will like working at Vendavo:
Nothing’s more exciting than working at a dynamic, high potential, and growing organization
Working with a team of highly skilled and driven people with a desire to innovate and have a material impact
Super collaborative environment, where every individual matters
Our drive to constantly innovate attracts the best and brightest talent
Opportunity to make a difference, excels personally and professionally, and have fun!

Under the direction of the VP of Revenue Cycle, this position will drive business value by supporting Revenue Cycle management in the analysis of Revenue Cycle data, as well as proactive identification and implementation process improvement opportunities by applying analytical and critical thinking to generate innovative and practical solutions that drive organizational results through increasing revenues and efficiencies. This position will be able to function as the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for Revenue Cycle operations for strategic project implementations. Additionally, the Business Analyst will serve as the liaison and point of contact between teams and departments to ensure the initiatives and requirements are being met.

#LI-SV1

1. Bachelors degree in Business, Finance, Business Analytics, Healthcare Administration or other healthcare related profession.

3. Proficient in business software applications

Company
At Odessa, we’re committed to bringing innovation, creativity and customer-centricity to enterprise applications for the leasing industry. Since 1998, we’ve been working hard to push the established technology norms and are serious about what we do. But we also like to have fun – in fact, we run our company with that principle in mind every day. One of our core values is ‘enjoyment’.

Role
Located in Odessa's Philadelphia office, the Business Analyst will primarily serve as a product subject matter expert. The position is responsible for collating client requirements; producing detailed system requirements and design documentation by describing and demonstrating processes within the software application; as well as testing the delivered application to ensure the product meets the outlined requirements.

Core Responsibilities:
Assists in the facilitation of user/process discussions
Accurately diagram a process based on user descriptions and/or documentation
Formulate possible solutions to a given business or application challenge
Conceptualize and document multiple design solutions to meet a requirement, with the ability to describe the impacts of each solution on the end-user
Design changes and enhancements to company's products to meet client business-models
Independently create and follow system test cases when testing the application

Job Overview: Each Business Analyst works closely with Division program personnel and system owners to identify user business needs that must be accommodated in the Medicaid Management Information System (MMIS) modular system design. This position needs to work with Division program personnel to solicit accurate and complete business and functional requirements and identify opportunities to improve and automate business processes.

Major Duties or Responsibilities:

Medicaid Program and Computer Business System Analysis

Analyzes system needs and communicates design components
Reviews and analyzes characteristics of existing MMIS and related systems to determine functional limitations and identify needed upgrades and improvements. Meets with system owners and end users to define business, financial, and operational requirements and goals for new system. Interviews or surveys users, observes job function and/or performs the job in order to determine what information is processed and how it is processed.
Performs requirements analysis with a focus on adding value to the business by providing detailed project objectives, identifying specific business needs, and considering trade off analysis, requirements, feasibility, risk analysis, and cost benefit analysis.
Determines the essential activities and needs of the system by identifying patterns, gaps and inconsistencies while defining the characteristics of acceptable solutions.
Identifies, supports, and promotes design of innovative system solutions that meet the business requirements and provide a benefit to the Medicaid program.
Coordinates and participates in design sessions for prototyping the new system. Supports the drawing together and integration of design components to produce the overall system.
Researches Medicaid rules and regulations to support effective system design and coordination of complex business processes between divisions.
Consults with project managers, management, users, and other stakeholders to ensure agreement on system capabilities and functions.
Assesses contractor work product
Reviews and validates system components proposed or produced by the contractor, in collaboration with division stakeholders and vendors, to identify areas where improvements could be made to ensure needs of the division participating in the Medicaid program will be met. Identifies gaps between the requirement and the proposed solution and promotes and supports development of a more comprehensive solution.
Uses analytical skills and techniques to ensure the new system will improve efficiency and satisfy future business needs and improve work flow.
Testing and Implementation Support
Coordinates and performs in-depth tests on the developed system components. Designs and documents user acceptance test plans and scenarios and conducts reviews with end-users to insure system functionality meets requirements. Provides feedback on test results to project managers and vendors.
Provides input to the contractor in the design of end user training.
Provides post-implementation support to staff and users and assist in solving computer related problems.
Research, Writing, and Planning
Researches federal and state Medicaid regulations to ensure system operations are in compliance.
Independently produces project planning, reporting, and regulatory documents, as required.
Writes Advance Planning Documents to satisfy federal participation requirements for system development and implementation.
Other Duties as assigned

Physical and Environmental Demands: A majority of the work is done in an office environment. This position requires occasional meetings in other locations in the Helena area to meet with program staff.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (Behaviors):

Required for the first day of work:
Knowledge of Medicaid business processes.
Thorough knowledge of healthcare claims management, reimbursement methodology, and service delivery.
Knowledge of principles and practices of information systems analysis, design, development, implementation, maintenance and security related functions; administrative procedures of state government; state and federal laws pertaining to information systems development and procurement of contracted services; and the organizational structure of DPHHS.
Strong conceptual, analytical and problem solving ability.
Ability to evaluate program requirements relative to the proposed solution; conduct research; exercise sound judgement in solving programs and making decisions where few precedents exist.
Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing and maintain effective working relationships with division employees, contracted staff, and other state and federal agencies.
Must have the ability to exercise sound technical, interpersonal, and organizational judgement when appraising evaluation and solving complex problems.
Demonstrated ability to manage varying deadlines and multiple projects responding positively to changes in direction, priorities, responsibilities, or assignments.
Ability to exhibit a commitment to the department mission.
Ability to build working relationships with peers based on trust and credibility.
Ability to take a reasonable and common sense approach to solving problems.
Ability to exhibit personal accountability and ownership.
Ability to work in a team environment to achieve objectives.
Ability to take the initiative to learn on an ongoing basis; actively seeks continuous learning opportunities.

Qualifications:

Required Minimum Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Healthcare Management, Business Administration, Information Technology, Computer Science or related field is preferred.***
Three or more years of job-related work experience.
Knowledge of Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK) is preferred.
Experience with MS Project and/or other project management tools is preferred.

***(Four years of relevant work experience may substitute for the bachelor’s degree. Other equivalent combinations of education and experience will be considered on a case-by-case basis.)

Training Assignment: This agency may use a training assignment. Employees in training assignments may be paid below the base pay established by the agency pay rules. Conditions of the training assignment will be stated in writing at the time of hire.

Reports to: Senior Product Manager

Location: Denver, CO

Help shape the future of how people experience the digital world. You'll be at the forefront of an exciting shift in how digital identity authentication allows companies and consumers to transact with trust in the digital world.

We’re actively looking to add exceptional people to our team who align with how we envision ourselves culturally and professionally. As a lens to how outsiders see Payfone, you will represent a team of people who love what they do and who they work with.

POSITION SUMMARY

As an Associate Business Analyst, you play an integral part in helping the Product team measure, interpret and experiment with new data sources and product features. You will own creating and updating coverage maps and other reports that help us to understand the coverage, data quality and holes in our products as well as the data of our partners. You will also assist in the data analysis needs for the Product Management team which entails troubleshooting transactions related to data input or output, analyzing new data integrations and data gaps. This is an entry-level position and no previous experience is required.

RESPONSIBILITIES

As a member of the Product team, the Associate Business Analyst is expected to:


Design and conduct experiments to understand our data coverage and gaps.
Analyze and organize large volumes of data.
Analyze the results produced to make inferences about sample sets.
Make recommendations to Product Managers based on results.
Work with the development to understand data to be used in product enhancements.
Assist the quality assurance and support teams in troubleshooting data processing.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE


Bachelors degree or equivalent experience in a technical or business discipline.
Experience in data analysis, testing or experimental design is a plus.
Proficiency in one or more programming languages such as Python or Java is a plus.
Excellent analytical skills, especially synthesizing, dissecting and interpreting big data.
Clear oral and written communication skills.

COMPENSATION

A compensation package composed of a base salary and equity component will be structured to attract a uniquely qualified candidate. Excellent health benefits are included.

ABOUT PAYFONE

Payfone is the leading digital identity authentication network for the connected world. Our real-time, passive identity authentication solutions enable consumers and the world’s largest banks, insurers, brokerages and technology companies to thwart digital identity theft and transact with trust. Learn more at http://www.payfone.com and https://www.linkedin.com/company/payfone.

This position description should not be considered the final description of the position. It should be assumed that we would, to some extent, structure responsibilities in accordance with the successful candidate’s capabilities and changing business conditions.

Payfone is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people regardless of race, color, religion, gender or sexual orientation, age, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, veteran status or other personal characteristics.

No employment sponsorship will be provided.

Job Description

Program Overview:
In our OppenheimerFunds Technology Associate Program (OTAP) you will experience a 2-year rotational program. The first two months will be classroom-based training and a case study, followed by independent 6-9 month rotations onto different teams within technology at the organization. At the end of the 2-year period, you will roll off into a full-time position within the organization. This full-time role will be determined through a collaborative conversation involving you, the OTAP sponsor, your advisor, and relevant business and HR personnel.
The first two months of your experience will consist of a boot camp providing opportunity to travel between our Denver and New York City locations. This experience will provide you with an understanding of the OppenheimerFunds business model, opportunity to attend training on your track (Developer or Business Analyst/Project Management) and work with your team to develop a case study, which you will present to OFI Leadership.
Following the initial 8-week program, participants will commence skill rotations; ongoing fixed assignments for technical, leadership and management training. You will be pushed outside of your comfort zone with technical project work. Participants give input on which team they would like to rotate to, and bring what they learn to the OTAP Summit. These face to face summits will occur prior to each rotation and are comprised of unique networking and career development opportunities. Each OTAP participant will be assigned a personal OFI advisor to help guide, coach, and provide support throughout the entirety of the program.
Program Journey Overview:
You will complete the required 8-week training and case study program
Participate in delivery of technology solutions end to end. Build one or more of the following core capabilities (business analysis, project management, application development, web development, cyber security, enterprise architecture, quality assurance)
Learn the end to end Oppenheimer business model and growth strategy (product, investment, sales, operations and corporate services)
6-9 month rotations within the technology organization over two-year program
Participate in cultural, technology and management training
Collaborate with the OTAP Sponsor(s), personal OFI Advisor, and other relevant business and HR personnel

Qualifications

Business Analyst / Project Management Track - Skills/Qualifications:
Course work and relevant internship work, or work experience, or personal project experience demonstrating aptitude and skills to translate technical and business requirements, drive projects through collaboration, and provide technical solutions
Ability to communicate and work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Resilient and Innovative mindset; ability to challenge the status quo with new solutions
Be willing to challenge the definition of a well-rounded technologist
Strive for success beyond title and status; go beyond manager’s expectations
Collaborate with multiple departments and effectively influence positive change and ideas.
Additional Information

We are a dynamic firm that values teamwork and collaboration, and true to our history, we encourage independent thinking and provide ample opportunities for our people to stand out and make a difference. With offices in New York, Denver, Rochester and Dallas, we work hard to turn our unconventional wisdom into value for investors and pursue excellent results for ourselves and our firm. Learn more about the culture and opportunities at OppenheimerFunds here: https://careers.oppenheimerfunds.com

About The Company

Company:
FLEETCOR (NYSE: FLT) is a leading global provider of workforce payment products and programs including fuel cards, fleet cards, food cards, corporate lodging discount cards, and other specialized payment services for businesses throughout the world. FLEETCOR’s payment programs enable businesses to better manage and control employee spending and provide card-accepting merchants with a high volume customer base that can increase their sales and customer loyalty.

Founded in 2000 and headquartered in Peachtree Corners, Georgia, FLEETCOR generates more than $2.25 billion in revenue through brands such as Fuelman and Comdata. We employ more than 7,800 valued associates worldwide. In 2016, FORBES listed FLEETCOR as the 14th most innovative company in the world, and FORTUNE listed FLEETCOR as the 74th fastest growing company! FLEETCOR is now a member of the S&P 500!

In 2017, FLEETCOR made its debut on the Fortune 1000 national ranking at #988 for the first time since FLEETCOR’s 2010 initial public offering.

FLEETCOR has a culture founded on integrity, collaboration, innovation, execution, and people. About You:
We are looking for an experienced Project Manager/Business analyst for our growing business who will be integral in working with both Clients and internal development teams. The role provides the direction of the assigned work components for a product, platform or project and by interacting with clients, technical architects and engineering determines scope and budget of work helping to both draft the statement of work and execute upon it. Through the management of the project this person also builds and maintains client relationships while looking to expand the account relationship when opportunities present themselves.

The Project Manager/Business Analyst is accountable for timely project delivery, project management, cost control and customer satisfaction and this successful candidate must be able to work effectively in a team environment and will interface closely with Finance, Sales, Engineering, and Operations divisions.

The desired individual is someone who will bring knowledge and creativity to the position as well as have the discipline to drive results, follow established fundamental processes, and help improve processes. Candidate will be measured on all levels of responsibility including profitability and business development (through renewals and upsells).

Job Description & Responsibilities:
The Role will be responsible for delivering top quality products to our clients through the participation and/or management of the statement of work, the project plan, daily or weekly meetings with the client and internal team, weekly reporting to the client and internally, and final internal approval that the product creation matches the client’s vision and the applicable statement of work.

To accomplish these tasks, this role organizes and directs project team members for multiple projects while taking care of plans, execution, and reports an implementation completion within the specific goals of building and delivering that particular product, or project(s). Ensures the customer is satisfied with the plan, scope, schedule, cost and quality of the product, or project(s).

This person will take ownership of each assigned project’s profitability to measure performance against the original scope. Responsible for identifying any changes to scope, highlighting time & cost impact to client, and drafting project change requests as necessary.

Customers across North America depend on ID Technology to design, build, and install the most effective labeling, coding, and marking systems for their product lines. Extract data and gather information from various sources to perfrom analysis and create reports for senior management based on results.

BORN is a multi-channel content and commerce solutions company operating in the USA (NYC, SFO, Montreal), Europe (London) and Asia (Singapore, HK, India). You will get to work on a variety of projects with varying levels of complexity including: new site enhancements, application development, new technologies, and performance optimization. You'll collaborate in a dynamic environment with REI’s Experience business, architects and Software Engineers, and others to guide the creation of interactive features that deliver exceptional customer experiences. You will have the flexibility to grow your skills and explore new technical challenges on the journey towards making REI’s digital experience world class. In this role you are:

Requirements Management: Manages the business requirements process for small technology projects and enhancements by facilitating, eliciting, gathering, documenting, validating, prioritizing and establishing baseline business requirements. Ensures testability / traceability of requirements. Expresses business requirements using multiple techniques. Documents requirements in accordance with REI methodology. Manages changes to the requirements baseline. Provides deployment support. Contributes to financial and business value analysis. Participates in peer reviews of requirements deliverables.
Systems knowledge: Understands business functionality, interfaces, data flow, and functional architecture of systems supported. Is knowledgeable in use of solutions supported, and has an in-depth understanding of how technologies supported work. Able to troubleshoot system problems from a functionality perspective, especially when supporting end-user testing and training.
Work Coordination: Represents the business division for small technology projects and enhancements. Coordinates controls and communicates decisions related to the business solution. Defines business requirements and successfully completes organizational changes. Participates in small project and enhancement planning. Understands, formulates, prioritizes and validates business requirements for use by the small project and enhancement. Confirms that results meet stated business requirements. Keeps stakeholders up to date on work status and project progress.
Process: Documents and analyzes existing or ‘as-is’ business processes. Designs new or ‘to-be’ business processes. Maps “as is” and “to be” business processes, understands gaps, and develops transition plans. Advances the Business Analyst practice in terms of methodology, processes and procedures. Educates other business stakeholders on the project management / product development processes and their roles.
Planning: Contributes to corporate and divisional strategic planning process by helping identify business initiatives. Identifies cross-divisional dependencies and impacts. Helps develop and maintain business initiative roadmaps. Contributes to financial and business value analysis. Helps define the total portfolio of programs and projects which support strategic plan.
Bring your passion and expertise
Previous experience in a multi-channel retail environment.
3+ years of related work experience.
Learning both business and IT processes.
Learning to identify and prioritize business needs for technology projects.
Learning to collect, express and manage requirements (use cases, data modeling, process modeling, context diagrams, systems diagrams, etc.)
Learning financial and business value analysis.
Demonstrated ability to manage and resolve conflict.
Demonstrated ability to understand and explain issues from both a technical and a business functional point of view.
Ability to conceptualize and recommend solutions to business problems.
Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent work experience.
Actively participates and collaborates with others on one's own team and across REI for the achievement of business goals.
Flexibility in one's viewpoints and positions in order to support the direction taken by others at REI.
Use of business knowledge, innovative thinking, and sound judgment in the solution of problems or the pursuit of business opportunities.
Consolidates information from various sources including feedback from others to reach sound decisions.
Considers the ultimate impact of decisions and actions on internal and external customers.
Works smart by setting effective work goals, establishing priorities, and planning well in order to produce quality work.
Executes effectively by using resources efficiently, meeting deadlines, and keeping others informed of work plans and progress toward goals.
Clearly conveys and accurately receives information by a variety of methods and in various situations.
Builds rapport with all kinds of people inside and outside the organization.
Acts upon opportunities and involves and influences others in the accomplishment of worthwhile organizational goals.
Challenges the status quo, champions change and influences others to change.
Why you'll love it here
REI Information Technology is a team of creative and smart technologists who work in a collaborative environment to build business value through technology. And, we have the support of a great company to tackle some dynamic challenges that will keep REI relevant for years to come. If you have a passion for the outdoors and want to be a part of innovating retail technology, this job is for you.

Company Overview:

Newport Group is a leading provider of retirement plans, insurance, and consulting services. We help companies offer their employees a more secure financial future by offering comprehensive plan solutions and consulting expertise to plan sponsors and the advisors who serve them.

Job Description:

Junior New Business Analyst will coordinate insurance case processing among agents, consultants, internal departments, insurance carriers, and clients to facilitate insurance placement from initial case submission through and into in-force status in a timely manner and serve as an advisor to other Newport Group staff regarding the New Business Process.

You are the right person for this role if:

You will have a Bachelor’s degree in a business related field or combination of education and industry experience.
You have solid written and oral communication skills.
You are proficient using Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Adobe.
You have strong analytical, problem solving and organizational skills.
You have a demonstrated track record of consistently meeting and/or exceeding performance expectations.
You have the ability to work under pressure in a very fast paced environment.
You have excellent organizational skills and ability to process and retain large volumes of information.
Preferred Experience:

Experience with case implementation, underwriting, life insurance or project management.
Have the ability to read financial illustrations to obtain information required in new business insurance paperwork package.
The Junior New Business Analyst will:

Determine correct consent forms, carrier master or individual applications, Carrier supplemental forms and other miscellaneous forms and age requirements based on the case perimeters.
Responsible for managing multiple escalated and high profile cases while simultaneously meeting deadlines.
Communicate case requirements/processes to internal and external stakeholders and maintain efficient processes and procedures required to meet client expectations.
Proactively communicate status updates and manage project for successful client implementation of insurance.
Review the efficiency of the new business placement process and proactively make suggestions to enhance efficiencies.


Newport group offers for employment are conditioned upon satisfactory completion of our employment screening process (including, but not limited to, a review of past employment and education records, background investigation, and/or credit check).

The Role
We are seeking a highly motivated finance professional to help execute and enhance the P&L analytics for our numerous product lines. This analysis is the base for numerous operational decisions across the company, with a variety of key consumers with varying objectives. Because the role will focus on the P&L, it is a unique opportunity to be exposed to and analyze every element of the P&L. There is a need for the creation of new analytics and heavy business partnering to drive understanding and forecast accuracy. This position works closely with the various Finance teams around the world, to consolidate and develop executive presentations. This is a highly visible role for an energetic individual who can function in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and who has excellent communication skills. This position reports to the Sr. Director, Corporate FP&A.

Responsibilities

Prepare executive-level financial reporting, summarizing findings, risks, opportunities and recommendations.
Clearly communicate results and recommendations to senior and executive management.
Consolidate, analyze and interpret the Product Line P&Ls, which is the baseline for upstream processes such as HW transfer price setting.
Design and development of automated reporting, visualization and planning tools for the Product Line P&Ls.
Provide financial planning & management of operating expenses, capital, headcount and project spending for the Global Pricing Team organization.
Participate in other finance special projects as needed.

Creative problem-solving skills, ability to prioritize and work independently.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, high volume, deadline-driven environment.
Comfortable with ambiguous problems and independently developing solutions.
Business acumen with understanding of functional linkages and ability to build strong professional relationships with business partners in both operational and financial roles.
Strong overall communications, presentation skills.
Expert with Microsoft Office (including Excel and PowerPoint) and Think Cell charting software.
Expert with Business Intelligence and visualization tools, i.e. Microsoft Power BI, Oracle Analytics and Reporting Integrated Enterprise System (ARIES).
Data Modeling and Analytics.
